text:
So far I'm not at all satisfied. I'm in downtown Nashville.  I called my roadside assistance who dispatched twenty four-7.  twenty four-7 says it will be 44 minutes.  They are in a town 31 miles away.  Huh?  There's no one in downtown nashville who can help me change a flat??

1 hour later and still not here. GPS showed the truck as 39 minutes away an hour ago and 15 minutes ago I called twenty four-7 and they said he'd be here in 16 minutes AND they'd have him call me 5-10 minutes out.

Worst service ever I ordered a two for six and got charged for a whopper meal and then the three piece tenders that I ordered I total I was charged $6.89 whopper meal (only got the whopper) and then $3.99 for my tenders that should have both cost me six dollars... 
I should have checked the receipt before I left I know but when I went back the manager wanted to "void" out the previous bill and "recharge" me for the correct amount... I didn't trust her shady a** ain't getting me twice! 
She acted like it was my fault for ordering something off the menu even when the guy who took my order was telling her it was an honest mistake she threw shade at me... not cool Ashleigh...
Also the fries where cold...

We went to Sake Hana's tonight.  The food was very good.   The service was absolutely terrible.  It took 30 minutes to get our drinks, 15 more to get our appetizers.  We finally recieved our food an hour and forty minutes after we sat down.   Also, carrying  a martini with your hands wrapped around the top was also a turn off, I am hardly a germ freak, but drinking from a glass that had someones hands around it is a bit disgusting.  

We will think twice about going back.

I gave them 1 star because their Paneer Tikka App had Artificial coloring(Red/Saffron Color) which i absolutely hate! 

Unfortunately, Taj India didn't live up to my standards in terms of quality of food! Sorry for disappointing folks!

Went in for a first time consultation. Be prepared for sticker shock. The price for a 12 week program is outrageous. Once I realized this was out of my price range,  I was looked at like I had three heads when I mentioned I could not afford the weight loss program they offered for me. I quickly became uncomfortable and left the appointment. A little while later, I received inappropriate text messages from the consultant asking what is wrong. I definitely do not recommend this place of business. I cannot speak if this place helps you lose weight but I can say that their sales tactics seem questionable. I will lose weight by exercising and watching my diet and will save money in doing so. All others, be warned.

Visiting from Dallas and wanted it to be so much better. Let's start with the positive. We received very good service at the bar and it's a nice environment.  Sadly, the food is mediocre at best and for the price just not good. The wedge salad and the Mac and cheese are very good. The steak, oysters and baked potato no better than what you'd get at Outback. The spinach, or cheese with green stuff mixed in, is truly awful.  I'd say go to the bar for drinks but avoid the food.  Somehow 2 of us managed to spend $265, including tip, for a $75 meal. Sadly, not going back.

Most disgusting place I've been to! Very very dirty! The container the coffee creamer was in was so dirty inside! The coffee cup was also dirty inside! Food came cold & the chicken salad sandwich was sour!! The walls, ceiling & all the vents in the restaurant are caked with decades of dust & dirt! I can only imagine what the kitchen looks like! Gross! The owner should take pride in his/her business & clean thing up! If this place is voted best in New Orleans, than were in trouble!!
Not a museum, more like an indoor playground, very misleading, and 15 dollars for adults.
An insult to Louisiana cuisine. Small portions and overpriced. Everything I got looked like it came out of a TV dinner or prepackaged grocery store food. Bleh!

Got a to-go order on a very cold Sunday afternoon in March. I ordered a Hot N Sour Soup, a 4pc Crab Rangoon, and the House Special (Beef, Pork, Chicken, & Shrimp) Lo Mein. The Hot N Sour Soup and the Crab Rangoon were both adequate and typical of any strip mall carryout Chinese place. The Lo Mein was probably the worst I've ever had. The noodles were overcooked and tasteless. The beef was stringy. The pork appeared to be reddish in an alarmingly undercooked way. I took literally two bites of this and threw it away. I would never go back.

I was excited to see another food place open in IV but it was super disappointing...
We went the first day it opened when they were giving out buy one get one free coupons outside. I forgot to show the cashier my coupon and asked him if he could give us a free grilled cheese since it's buy one get one. He said no because the purchase already went through but told us we can use it next time. I thought okay that's fine we'll probably come back! 
When our grilled cheese with added bacon came out it was SUPER dry and TINY... there were about 2 pieces of dry bacon in there cut into tiny strips of four to fit the equally tiny sandwich. Tater tots were good, but not worth the price.
I won't be going back to use that coupon :(
Rather eat McDonald's or Burger King  not a place to go for lunch or dinner it's an embarrassing service

Zero Stars!!!!  We We went at 11:00 on 4/28/2018.  There were only two  tables occupied and we sat down.  The blond waitress continually walked by our table without so much as an acknowledgment.  I thought, ok, she is there by herself so give her a break.  After a half hour two ladies came in and sat down.  Within five minutes, she walked over there to take their order - 40 minutes and not a word to us...  NEVER AGAIN!!! We walked out.  Not bad service..NO SERVICE!!!!!!

If it was possible to give -1 stars, thats what Sundance, their promotion giveaway and the customer service is. Beyond words on how furious I am with all the time I've wasted following the rules of the promotion vacation.

"Based on availability" is crap . Why make me submit a deposit and wait til 30 days til before the first date I chose to tell me its unavailable? I submitted the dates way ahead of time, and my money. Thats ridiculous. And on top of that to wait on the phone for close to an hour and a half? Yes, Im well aware its a third party agency , but apparently they suck at their job too. Its not that hard to reserve and book dates and make sure the plans allign. Sorry not actually sorry, but this has to be said: I really don't appreciate my time being wasted like that.

Because in the end the dates and the flights didnt work out and Im ON HOLD FOR A REFUND.

went in and what was weird is it smelled like cigarette smoke. they must let workers smoke in the back and it comes through. i am very sensitive and allergic and will not be buying a couch from this establishment. i got a creepy vibe inside as well.
Overcrowded, overpriced with typical raunchy people rubbing far closer than most would prefer. Should be called the Body Odor Festival

Suiting from LA, came to eat here. Service and ambience was good. The Oysters Rockefeller were burned and a long curly hair was nestled in the spinach. Gross. My shrimp creole was mediocre. Nothing to rave back home about.
Don't buy flooring from here. It took me talking to three guys before I could actually get the info I needed for the male sales clerk. Too much of an ordeal for me to repeat that again.

For whatever reason I gave this pharmacy a second chance. No more. I went in 3 weeks ago transferred all my prescriptions. I get texted they are ready go into store and they say nothing is there. Today the text says they are sending it back because I don't pick up. So I call and the most obnoxious rude woman informs me my prescriptions all went to other pharmacy. Apparently it's all my fault because they did not transfer as requested. Same nonsense different day. I dont want to go somewhere that I am treated like this. No thank you. They need a better staff in this store.

Not going to be a favorite for me.  Pretty food but not good. Very pricey, slow service. The place is beautiful but loud.  We have traveled throughout the states and other countries. Until last night we had never been charged for bread!
Of course it didn't help that the valet couldn't find our car keys.

Really disappointed with my experience at this location today 7-30-18 2:30pm.
My family and I were on a tight schedule and we called in our order in great detail to get it going in advance of arrival.  We were going to do a take out.  When we arrived about 30 minutes later, the order was only partially done.  We waited an additional 20 minutes and when we got out to the car, the order was wrong, and we had to go back in and wait another 10 minutes.  

It was a terrible waste of time.  The staff was a black eye on a reputable chain.

So what happened to this Nordstrom? Customer service is terrible, the floor (at least upstairs) is way under staffed and the staff that is on the floor is not super helpful. 
For instance I was looking for a shirt for family pictures, I wanted a navy or red wine colored shirt. When I asked the lady (from whichever section NYDJ is sold) if they had any good navy or red wine colored shirts she said "oh I'm sure there are some around, let me know if you find something and need a room". Hmmm that's not what I was hoping for. 
Then there was an older lady in the shoe dept that had no knowledge of shoes and a super attitude! It was bizarre. 
The staff that used to be there, like 4 years ago was awesome! Now it's sub-par. 
I hate to be like this but are the employees at Nordstrom aware they are there to help/serve us the customers? 
So for the time being I will be ordering my (and family's) stuff Nordstrom online and will dread the days I have to make returns. 

November 2018
I just don't understand this place. The majority of the people that work here have the worst attitude. The only ones I have encountered that don't seem to hate their job are the ones in the men's department and a few in the shoes. 
The ladies upstairs in tbd and bp are just down right pissed off at the world. I walked around with my hands full of stuff I wanted to try on for over 10 minutes, then I had to ask for a room and a lady said "yeah they are right there" pointed me in the direction-didn't grab the stuff, or help in any way. I was so annoyed at the whole situation I scanned what I wanted and ordered it online just so no one got commission from me. 
Nordstrom are you listening? This store needs some leadership and culture training.
Not worth it at all and it's to pricey. Crab legs were very dry all the food was very blah

This is more of an "I'm in shock" review than anything else. We love Fork, we eat here every few months. But today after brunch, we brought home a cinnamon roll for my daughter who couldn't come along with us. I snuck a bite and THERE WAS A BUTTON in the dough! 

We called the restaurant and after being put on hold for a good amount of time, the acting manager came on the line and was less than sympathetic. His response to the situation was super awkward and borderline rude. He noted that the chef was wearing the same coat as he was yesterday when making the rolls and no button was missing (ok, ew - why no clean coat?!) but that they'd "look into it" and someone would call me tomorrow. (I had to ask him if he needed my phone number to call me back so not sure about the sincerity of that statement. )

We were polite and definitely are not looking for a handout, freebie, etc., just thought the restaurant should know that a customer bit into a button. Why not just take responsibility and apologize? Super disappointed with the way the situation was handled, and now feeling like the kitchen is less clean/sanitary than we thought. Thumbs down, Fork. Photo of button for the manager who seemed to believe that a lost button in the cinnamon roll was impossible.

So I am here to warn you about this company! 

DO NOT PURCHASE FROM THEM!!!
We purchased our sectional from them July 15th and it was delivered that same night. The crew brought it into the house unboxed the couch and put it together half way. Then hands me the clipboard and says sign for furniture. So I did and crew left. My husband and I put the furniture the rest of the way together and I noticed that the middle piece of the sectional was sagging in the back. So of course this place of business was closed to call anyone so we said we would call first thing in the morning on Monday. So I called and the gentleman I spoke to told me that there was nothing they were going to do because we shouldn't have signed for the furniture and asked if we purchased the warranty which we did and told us we needed to go through them to get the sectional replaced. I told the gentleman that I was floored that I would receive damaged furniture and have to make a warranty claim already. He said that how do they know that we didn't break the furniture over night I didn't even have the energy to fight with this gentleman. So my husband called the warranty company the next day and started a claim, the lady that was helping him said she was going to get into contact with the furniture store because if they delivered it damaged they needed to bring out a new piece. So after couple days of back and forth the furniture store said we were sol and warranty would have to cover it. Husband got back in contact with the lady that was helping him and she told him that they weren't going to replace it because the gentleman that she was dealing with at the furniture store admitted to her that the furniture was indeed BROKEN when it left the warehouse July 15th in the evening!!! So now we are stuck with a broken couch and no one to help replace or fix the couch.

Honestly I was so disappointed. I'm from up north so I don't have high hopes for Florida bagels but I tried them out. Cream cheese was good but it was seriously the most expensive worst whitefish spread I've ever had. It was actually disgusting I'm so disappointed if my food wasn't to go I would have complained. Not worth it unless you want a cheap bagel with cream cheese. I'm so sad I wasted $10

The location of this gym gets 5 stars. The dirty locker rooms that never have paper towels, or even toilet paper, are disgusting. It is hotter than heck in here all of the time. Treadmills have salt on them from people wearing their shoes in. I love to people watch here, but while I love to lift weights, those are a mess too! Either we need to require members to pick up after themselves, or get a cleaning crew on staff. Come on, planet fitness does better than this!

Initially when we moved it in seemed great, till move in day. Cheap paint, cheap everything. Floor is peeling up by their fake wood, which they will most likely try to charge us for even though it was like that the day we moved in. But that little compared to other issues.

Since day one my wife and I experienced humidity levels in the 75-80% range. I told management a total of 3 times, which they never did anything about, because why would they do their job? The result of the humidity was MOLD starting to grow on decorations we have, which we ended up throwing out. The response I got from the complex was "buy a dehumidifier" or "change the ac unit". The ac units in the building are oversized ptac units which result in little to no dehumidification because they only sense dry bulb temps. Mix that with the cheap windows (I feel the draft coming in, plus a consistency of spiders I find in my apartment). Management said they would "check on the humidity issue" which they never have. And to management, the issue is fine now BECAUSE it's winter and there's a lack of humidity in the air. So that you for your "concern". But this will become an issue again in the summer. If you like to sleep comfortable do not live here. I can only imagine mold growing inside the walls this summer and us getting charged for it. 

Next issue,

My wife had been contacting the lady in the management office (I call her out because I don't know her name and she is the only one my wife has contacted) for our utility bill because we like to pay our bills on time. 2 months later it took a negative yelp review from her (which she took down because she is nice and the other lady who comments on these yelp reviews asked her to in exchange to waive the previous months utility bills we were waiting on). They finally sent us a bill, which was not waived, and as my wife fulfilled her end the manager who said she would waive it did not. We have all this communication in writing, and I might take this to court just for principle, because my wife also emailed her 4 times for verification the utility has been waived, but my wife has been ignored ever since she removed her yelp review (which is why I am doing one now). 

I have also been waiting for a parking pass for almost 2 months. The only reason that vehicle hasn't been towed is because security now knows my work vehicle. 

If possible this would be zero star rating for this "complex". But because I can't, I guess the positive star goes to the front desk staff and security because they're always friendly and ACTUALLY DO THEIR JOB. Maintenance as well, they always do their job well. 

This is not all the issues I have just some of them. I would not recommend to move into this place. We are almost sure we will not be renewing our lease due to the multiple failures of management, and "upper management". 

To the lady who comments on the yelp reviews and lied to my wife, you can be sure this review will not be edited or removed. Y'all have lied to us entirely too much for you to be trusted. And I have all your communication with my wife in writing too, which I may use as evidence. But for the time being, we are just going to pay our bills on time. And management stop giving my wife dirty looks or ignoring her because she called you out. 

Do not be fooled by the mimosas and smiles when you come in and look. The leasing office didn't even know the place takes money orders for rent payment (because paying online they just steal more money from you).

If it's not the usps not delivering, how about this one. Package was supposed to be delivered yesterday to our home. No door tag on my door. My girlfriend made arrangements to leave work so she could be home at the delivery time of 10:30 am today. When I left for work at 10:00 am, there was a door tag on the door ACROSS from my door!!! So not only did my gf race home for nothin there was no delivery!!! No door tag on my door, no package. Get this, they stated we need an adult signature which is why we needed to be home. But last time we got this delivery it was left in a secure pickup box similar to an amazon storage self pick up. Why do we need a signature this time beats the hell outta me. 
WTF!!! Good one FedEx

Normally my experience here is amazing; however today it was horrible. We were told that our wait would be 20 mins but it was a lot longer. My husband decided to walk to grab champagne. He wasn't gone long at all, but they kept putting people in front of us because he wasn't here. I was here and we told her he was leaving, that was her opportunity to tell us that the entire party had to be here to be seated. When I addressed it she was rude and condescending. I hope that the managers will take time to teach their staff customer service. This was a bad experience and I'm highly disappointed because I love Sabrina's.

Great Food, TERRIBLE Service. 

23

Yes, 23. That's how many servers passed me in the 7 minutes after being seated before one came to my table (of course, some of them were actually serving).  That put the experience off to a bad start, what with my low blood sugar and all. I was about to walk out, feeling snuffed and ignored, more so when the table next to me was immediately greeted upon seating.  

When the server finally arrived to take my drink order, things began to look up. The Wisconsin Cheddar Bites arrived and were excellent!  Hot. Crispy. Tasty. Not quite worth the wait (because the wait was so long) but still delicious, with a tasty, chunky Marinara.  

But then another 23 minutes of waiting for my main course and then they got it wrong. Once they finally got it straight, the manager brought it out herself, IT WAS GOOD!  Tasty. Fresh. And Generous. The Baby Backs were fall-off-the-bone good (but still had the silver skin on) and the BBQ Chicken was done just right. Their Honey BBQ Sauce is very good, but you'll want to ask for extra. 

Vicky, the Manager on Duty, checked on things and seemed to care, but still the Service left so much to be desired. Unfortunately, I didn't have a Penny to leave for a tip.

My husband and I went there for the 2nd time last night.  First time I would have given 4 stars so we went back there last night.  We asked to be seated outside since it was such a beautiful night.  Very small patio area, but nice - had plenty of TVs and, like I said, beautiful night.  When we were seated an employee had to be asked to get up so we could sit at the open table.  (He was there smoking and watching the cards game).  The employee then went to a large table with only 2 people sitting there and asked if he could sit there - they said yes.  Throughout my meal I could see this was the employee hangout, not the nice patio seating I would have enjoyed.  Even our waiter would come out and first talk with the group of employees before coming over to help us.   There were even people (I assume were employees) that would enter the patio from the parking lot and start joking around with the now over flowing, standing room only, table of employees - the couple that was sitting there had now left.  There were three other tables on the patio that were slowly emptying.  This meant that now the diners from inside could now come out to the patio for a smoke break.  I understand that the diners on the patio could smoke, but was a little frustrated that now there was a stream of people coming out to just smoke while we were trying to enjoy our meal and drinks.  I don't have a problem with other people smoking if they were there on the patio with us enjoying their meal, but the place turned into a literal smoke break patio.  
We would have continued to stay and had drinks had it not been more of a "smoke break" area.  Even employees would come out on their break (assumedly) and have a cigarette.  We had gotten there around 8pm and left shortly after 9pm.  So, this also wasn't  really late.  Glad I did not have my children with me, because the employees also had mouths on them that would not have been appreciated if my children were with me.  Bottom line - if you are a smoker and don't have a problem with a ton of people smoking around you while eating?  Sit on the patio.  If you're not - stick with inside.
Food?  Meh.  I ordered the pasta con broccoli without mushrooms.  Pasta was dry with absolutely no flavor.  Looked like it came out of a box.  There were maybe 5 pieces of broccoli in it.  And pasta still had a few pieces of mushrooms - glad I'm not allergic.  Visit before that I got the steak salad - salad was great, but basically had to pick all the steak out - fatty and tough.  For the price?  Not worth it.  Husband got the unsmoked fish sandwich both times and liked it.  Fries were soggy and had barely any on the plate.

If you like the taste of wet rag, then this place is for you! The staff members touch the straws at the top after wiping the counter with a wet rag all while letting your tea flavors drip down their hands while making your drink. Yumm.

Giving this hotel or should I say MOTEL 0 stars!!!!  Only put 1 star because it wouldn't let me submit review without choosing a star.
 
My family was due to stay at this Super 8 Reno location from June 29th through July 3rd with a group of our baseball team.  But before we arrived to check in, the team and coaches were very disgusted with the state of their rooms/facilities.  They were filthy and bugs were present inside the rooms, which is unacceptable for any human.  NOT a great atmosphere for our families to be around.  So I called while we were on the road to Reno and canceled our reservation.  Was told by Kayla, that I would still be charged for one night since I was canceling the day of check in.  Which mind you, I wouldn't be cancelling if your hotel was inhabitable!!!   Your cancellation policy should be waved, since the rooms were inhabitable to most human standards!!!!!   The boys even said there were prostitutes hanging around/staying!!!

I was charged $85.87 for our none stay night.  Contacting their corporate office for a refund, we'll see how that goes???   

This hotel needs some corporate attention (I beat they wouldn't even stay) and Wyndham should be ashamed to put their name on this hotel.

Ordered food from here twice. Been disappointed both times. The food doesn't taste authentic, the owner or I believe is the owner treat the employees as if they are nothing( from the time I've been there). If you want the food to have that Middle Eastern touch, at least train your cooks to perfected. The falafel tasted so bland, the wrap had an old taste,  as if it had been left outside for a very long time. Fries were too greasy for my liking. All in all it was a great disappointment. I tried to give them another opportunity to be disappointed again.

Couldn't go last year and luckily had time this year to attend. Came by with two other friends who likes avocados and although I'm warned it is a small festival, it was a bit larger than I imagined. However, I still think it's just an average festival.
 
With the main selling point as an avocado festival, I imagined all the stands or vendors would have at least one avocado themed food. Several of them did not. This was off-putting to see since I would imagine the festival is just finding vendors to fill up spots and grow while not staying to the purpose of the festival. Aside from that, the avocado theme things I tried were the avocado beer, avocado tri tip sandwich, holy-guacamole with salted chips, avocado ice cream, and sampled the avocado cream pie. Kind of wanted to try the deep fried avocado, but I saw someone carrying it and decided that it wasn't worth it for that price. As a sum, the food is pretty much basic festival food. The only creative ones I liked trying were the beer, ice cream, and cream pie. The beer is IPA based and not overly hoppy - an easy to drink beer. Although, the cream pie and ice cream are overpriced for the amount given. I definitely wouldn't consider getting them another try due to the price point. The tri-tip was nice to have and enticing due to the smell, but it was just plain store-bought guacamole instead of freshly made guacamole. The holy-guacamole was severely overpriced for what it's worth. Other items such as elote (in a cup as well), hot dogs, tacos, fish tacos, and etc were sold as well. Avocado brownies were sold out unfortunately.
 
There were two avocado sellers and they were severely overpriced. If you are fanatical about it, go for it, but I rather buy them elsewhere at more normal prices. 

There were goods vendors on site as well as a ferris wheel. There were several stages for live music and the festival itself spans 2-3 blocks. At the non-beach end of the festival, there was an educational booth about avocados where I thought should have been the main attraction instead of the food vendors. I enjoyed seeing all the different varieties of avocados and reading up some history.
 
All in all, if you like avocados, you'll still come to check it out. Be ready for overpriced food and not enough seating of course. I definitely think 1-2 hour at most - depending on how large your group is and how willing you are to spend money to buy the food. I can't wholly recommend it as a popular attraction, but if you are close or visiting the area, it's worth a check. I wouldn't plan a trip with this solely in mind.

The hostess did not have a system of seating patrons.  Totally not organized. 
The waiter totally screwd up my order, the portions of sauces were piled on top of lettuce to minimize the portions, never checked on me, waited for ever for my check.  They werent even busy 4pm.  
Not a good experience.

We are visiting from another state and my husband made us a reservation about a month ago to this supposedly 4 star restaurant. Well, tonight they we way off. It started out ok . We had amazing service until Randy the lead waiter took over. He was way off for sure . Foreshadowing, he almost tipped over my wine glass. Thank goodness for Nick , he was amazing and made sure we had water and anything else we needed. Then captain Randy shows up. Don't most steak houses have you cut into your steak before you eat it? Well, that didn't happen here. Fast forward to dessert . When Randy asked what we would like for dessert, my daughter asked for the cookie cake, he left and came back and said well sorry. We ran out of That last night. Weird , don't you make your food fresh each day??? Ten minutes later, he says that he was mistaken , they DO have the cookie cake. Ok , so we get our dessert and have that and then we have been finished for quite sometime before Randy graces us with his presence again. When he does show up and all the dishes have been cleared, he reaches over and spills water all over my husband . No apologies. My daughter and I are handing him napkins and the awesome guy who brought us coffee and water helped get it all cleaned up. He is the one who actually apologized!!! We said. Well you didn't do it. Such a nice guy. Randy came back with our check though and still nothing mentioned about his crappy service. We were done by then. Way too many cool restaurants to go back to this one . Just no!

All the hype this place gets... I was excepting to be blown away. The decor was great and very country. The service was not good at all. It was the end of breakfast and they were all getting ready for lunch. The servers were at a table by the kitchen and all on their phones. They were looking at dresses as I past to go to the restroom.  I am a server and we are not even allowed to have our phones on us ( but we do and hide them) let alone on the floor for the customers to see. Ok on to the food. It was mediocre. I ordered the Benedict with biscuits sausage and gravy it said fried eggs instead of poached so I asked mine for scrambled. When it came the scrambled eggs look like it came out of the carton and not fluffy like real eggs and the taste was bland. I had to add hot sauce and pepper for some taste. The potatoes were good with the bbq sauce on it. The sausage was dry and my cousin did like like his always he said his was very dry..Not sure I will ever go back. If I do it would have to be a different location.

I would give them a 0 if I could. My fiancé scheduled our AC to be tuned up, freon added, and dryer ducts to be cleaned. I did not originally know what all he was suppose to be doing as it was my fiancé who was planning to be there for the service. Shay said he would be there at 6pm so my fiancé would be home from work. He showed up over an hour early and I just happened to have gotten off work early. He tinkered around with the air handler in the garage for about 15 minutes before saying he was done and leaving (not before trying to sell me a $400 mold prevention). Upon my fiancé getting home shortly after Shay left, is when I learned he was suppose to add freon to the air conditioner on the side of the house (behind our gate) and clean the dryer duct. 

My fiancé spoke to Shay on the phone who claimed he had done both of those things. I informed him Shay never went on the roof or went into the laundry room where the dryer was so he could not have possibly clean our the duct. He actually refused to go inside even after I offered to lock up the dogs for him. He also never went inside the gate where the air conditioner is located. When my fiancé called him out on lying he claimed our dryer doesn't exist (not that he would know since he refused to go inside). He also proceeded to say it was my fiancé's fault because he wasn't home over an hour before the scheduled appointment.

Do not hire this company because you will get ripped off. We paid money prior to the service so now we are out our money and still have to call an AC company out to add freon and clean the dryer duct for our "non-existent" dryer.

Staff appear to hate life and are unable to answer simple questions.  There is no delight to serve and every request feels like you are ruining their day.  Food is ok, restaurant cleanliness is not the best, but the service is just sub-par and unacceptable.

I was visiting my girlfriend in Philadelphia and she made a reservation at Scarpetta because it was near her apartment and had availability on a Friday night. What was expected to be a pleasant Friday evening turned into an infuriating dining experience.
 
To start, we were seated behind a pillar and no one attended to us for the first 15 minutes. I noticed four Caucasian girls were seated behind us after us and were immediately greeted with menus and glasses of water. Our designated waiter realized we were waiting without menus after flirting with the four girls for a good 5 minutes. (Fred C.) had a look of -oh shit- written across his face. He finally came by with menus and asked what type of water we wanted.
 
After taking our order, we still did not receive our water and two Caucasian girls were seated next to us. We finally received our water after they served us our drinks. Then, we noticed the girls next to us received their bread basket, and yet again, our table did not. Our appetizers came and still our bread never came. We had to bring it to the waiter's attention and THEN he immediately brought our bread basket over.
 
It was becoming difficult to feel like this was not an act of discrimination. We brought it to the attention of the manager and he responded with "Sorry, it is really busy. We will give you an extra dessert." I am not sure why he thought dessert would fix everything and he completely ignored the fact that we felt neglected throughout the entire dining experience thus far. It felt like he wanted the dessert to shut us up and it would make up for all the mistreatment at a dinner I am paying for with my time and money. It seems obvious a restaurant would be busy on a Friday night, and so why was that an excuse? Did he want a pity party? Did he want us to sympathize with him and manage the restaurant for him? I've been to busier restaurants with impeccable service despite the crowds. (Honestly, it wasn't even that busy for a Friday night.)
 
Finally, the bill came and instead of charging my girlfriend and I for the glass of wine we ordered, he charged us each for a bottle. I was livid and done with the entire experience at that point. I probably should have walked out the first 15 minutes. Safe to say I will not come back just to pay to be treated with negligence for an hour of my life I will never get back.

This is without question the worst website and service I have ever delt with. I recievied a gift card from my corp office for $250 worth of meals due to being out for surgury. When we tried to use the gift card, The site required us to put in another credit card for charging . When we put in the gift card number it kicked us out and started over again the entire process. You must select all your meals before they begin to process, and this restarted each time. Aproximately 5 times over a three week period. If you order more than three weeks, they will charge your card regardless of gift card or not.
I called and talked to Kelsey who was willing to help. but could do nothing but have us redo the process from scratch each time, and it was rejected each time. 16 emails later I still do not have an order I can get. Her supervisor got on and could not see or do our order either. They will not refund the gift card .
Th exective sales director finally got involved and had me write a list of the foods I wanted in Word and email it to him outside of the website system. So, from the email they sent out the selection. They required my second week selections prior to recieving the first foods. Foods were, ok ; very institutional tasting.   No more for us.

This restaurant was highly recommended to us by many, many people. We were very excited to try it out one day while we were at Indie flea market. It was very crowded but that seems to be the norm. We were seated after about 20 minutes and from there the experience worsened. We have to say this may be one of the worst dining experiences we've ever had. We had extremely long wait times in between our server stopping at the table. There were employees everywhere but it still seemed to be slower than ever. Our food took over 35 minutes to get to us and we had only ordered two sandwiches and a cup of soup. When our food came, we asked for ketchup. The server said she would go and get some, however, she never came back. We waited about 20 minutes and held off on the fries, ha ha, and finally asked a staff member that walked by for some ketchup. That person said they would go get some. But again they never returned... So over 30 minutes later we asked our server for a second time for some ketchup. It came to us about five minutes later. It confused us because all of the sandwiches were served with fries, yet they did not have ketchup anywhere handy. They had to go back into the kitchen to get the little cup of ketchup. After our plates had been taken away when we were done with our food, we had to wait over 30 minutes for our waitress to come back to give us the check. we never were even offered drink refills. Not even for water. we saw our waitress standing off to the side talking with another employee and giving us a weird look. We didn't really know what that was all about because we hadn't made any complaints. Finally , we waved someone down who got our waitress to give us the check. She was very rude and just dropped the check on the table and walked away. We really don't know what was going on the day that we went. It seems like they were staffed appropriately. We do not intend on going back here, as there are many other options in the area that we would rather go to that have nicer / more attentive employees.

The service was great and the food came rather quickly. I ordered the carne asada burrito. The burrito was huge but half way into it I was starting to believe I had ordered a rice and bean burrito and that a couple pieces of meat fell into it in the process. They need to put carne asada in their carne asada burrito.

We've had good and bad experiences with Olive Garden. It's becoming less of a value as their menu prices seem to be increasing more frequently. 

Last night my family and I had dinner. Kris was our server. She was off from the start; seemed confused or something. I think every step of the way she made mistakes, not just with our table, but the party of 8 adjacent to us. The manager comped some of their food, but I guess word of the poor service we experienced didn't make its way to the manager's attention. I decided it just wasn't worth it.

We finished our meals and asked for (2) to-go containers. Kris brought back 7 of them! She then watched as I combined two entrees into a single container and when I looked up, she was shaking her head and said they weren't going to fit. Well, they fit and I had plenty of room left over. Now, what was I going to do with the extra to-go containers? And, why the hell did she bring so many in the first place?

When we were finished, Kris asked if we paid our bill already. I told her no. How could we? Upon leaving, I paid our bill while Kris hovered over me watching me getting ready to apply the tip at the table kiosk. I looked up at her with a quizzical look and then she explained how the slider looked. I told her I was very familiar with it. 

The total price of our bill, including tip, was around $51. I mistakenly left without a receipt. On the drive home I calculated our three entrees and my daughter's milk. It came to ~$43 with tax and tip. It didn't add up. I'm thinking now we paid someone else's bill.

The funniest thing was when Kris brought a tray to clear some of our dishes, she left in right in front of my wife's chair, not allowing her to get up. Kris walked away and my wife squirmed out of her seat.

We went to this place because of its great reviews and historical location. The atmosphere is great. Subdued lighting, chandeliers, and tasteful decor. The food is another story. The food is mediocre at best and the portions are too small for even women with small appetites. I ordered the butternut squash pasta, which consisted of 3 noodles (no exaggeration), this greasy sour cream tasting butter sauce, shavings of kale, and 5 tiny pieces of squash ($17 and barely a side dish; rating 3/10). Their beer seems reasonably priced ($5-6) but is served in a half pint glass, which they fail to mention. I realize that this place is going for the fancy upscale vibe, but at least call it what it is....small plates, so people realize they will have to buy at least 2 to make a meal. Of note, my sister said her pasta, some pesto and pork thing, was "okay" so maybe some of their dishes are mediocre. However, I wouldn't pay $17 for 3 mediocre noodles. I gave them 2 stars for the nice atmosphere and staff.

Since my favourite pasta place in Edmonton closed, I've been looking for a new go-to pasta place that serves fresh pasta. I tried the gnocchi and the rotini dishes and was slightly disappointed. The rotini was essentially pasta that I could have bought at the grocery store. The gnocchi was homemade and very fluffy but the sauce just didn't wow me. The cheese also just came in a pile shredded on top. 

The restaurant didn't open till 5, so we called and made a reservation on their answering machine. When we came in, we were told that they do not take reservations over the phone even though on their website it says they take reservations for parties of 6+. The waitress was friendly and patient with our larger group and we got good service.

We usually don't eat at Wing Stop, but I was craving some wings on this particular day -- sometime last week. We ended up with the meal deal of 25 wings with 3 different flavors and one of each sauce.

We ordered online and I went to go pick it up. When I was called up to the cash register the girl asked for my name and then began to read me what I had ordered. I confirmed that that was my order and she grabs the bag from behind her, puts it down and starts to rummage through it. I thought, well maybe she's now going to just verify they got everything. Finally, she starts pulling out these sauce containers -- about 6 of them, two of each flavor. She then wrinkles up the bag closed and pushes it toward me. I go, "well, what about those?"
Her: "Well, you got one of each sauce, right? That's what your receipt says. So, those are just extra"
Me: *starts looking back in the bag* "well, there's just 3 containers in here..."
Her: "Yup!" *and starts walking away.

Maybe for 25 wings, customers are only allotted 3 containers (1 for each flavor), but even if that's the case, you clearly knew that there were "extras" in there -- maybe a staff keeps making that 'mistake' or whatever the case may be that led you to open my bag of food -- but why do I HAVE to pay the price of your grimy hands, that has just touched the register/money/ect., in MY FOOD to pull out measly sauce containers that apparently shouldn't have been in there in the first place!? If there's extra in there, then let it be and train your staff better!

So disgusted by not only this lack of consideration, but also the blatant rude response to my inquiry and the obliviousness of her gross conduct.

Also, the wings did NOT cure the craving; I would have rather had McDonalds chicken nuggets.

One word.....bad!  My wife was so frustrated by the treatment she walked out. No attention to detail. Horrible milk shake and I stress milk. I doubt there was much ice cream in the shake. Employees complained about having to work there. Just passing through but a warning to all. Don't go here!!

I rented a full-size car for a week.  I drove the car for four days when the transmission started slipping, and then would not shift above second gear.  I called Roadside and they dispatched a tow truck to a city about 150 miles from me, and called wondering where I was.  They sent a tow truck to my house - very easy, pleasant person.  

Then the vehicle was towed to the airport location.  

They never closed the ticket, so I called Gold Cust service, they told me to call Roadside, I tried the local branch, they told me to call Roadside.  I called Roadside, they told me to call the rental location.  Then they said I had to call where it was towed (which no one answers the phone).  I finally called Gold Service again, and they said I had to call the airport location.  I refused.

If Hertz tows my car away for mechanical failure 3 days before I was to turn it in, and can't even bother to close the ticket, well, Enterprise here I come.

Call ahead of time to make sure they're open! I've come twice to this restaurant once on a Monday night & another on a Wednesday afternoon & both times they've been closed!!!  When they're hours of operations say they're open

How it has 4 stars is an absolute mystery. I, along with many people, was looking forward to a new casual spot in the village- and seafood to boot! For some reason a good, casual (or otherwise) restaurant is an obvious gap on a street 3 blocks from the ocean. Frankland's absolutely blew a golden opportunity. My first meal there I ordered local crab. Not much meat in there and no proper tools to appropriately extract the overpriced, poorly seasoned, crabmeat. Really, disappointing on all fronts. It was an utter mess. I grew up on the water  I know how it's done and this isn't it. It's as if they thought people (maybe because it's Montecito and people on vacation) would just roll over and pay the price. Fool me once... And almost twice. I went in this evening after a couple of months of driving by and seeing few, if no, people eating there, because I just really wanted to treat myself to  some crab legs but didn't want to drive the extra few minutes to the pier or East Beach. Lucky's, Honor Bar and others are packed, Frankland's is empty. I walk in and see Alaska crab legs 70-something dollars (20 less elsewhere) and not a soul to be seen in the kitchen or front register. If your struggling, make it easier, not harder for people to choose you. I waited a full minute, that's a long time when no one is in the restaurant. Last straw. I wanted to support them, I wanted them to succeed but you have to earn it with food and service, Frankland's has succeeded at neither.

I was able to try this food truck at the Tampa grilled cheese fest. I'm so disappointed in the service I received. To start i walked around and caught interest in this food truck being the line was not as long as the others and some of the menu items seemed as if they would be good. I understand that there's a lot of people so wait time would be a issue so I waited about 20 minuets to place my order then about 20 minuets to get my order. But in that time the lady in the truck kept yelling out and messing up the names to orders as well as informing everyone there running low on stuff. I'm upset to see the price jump in the menu being what was posted very recently in a review compared to what's posted for this festival. The prices just don't make sense for the product there putting out. I had got the gambino grilled cheese and the Eliot's untouchable fries. The grilled cheese was so small for $7. The fries where such a small portion and barley coated with there seasoning and as far as "hand cut" goes the fries where just frozen fries out of a bag. I was looking forward to trying the secret homemade fry sauce the most with my meal and I'm disappointed that the fries come with a small cup on the side maybe .5 oz container all for $3 bucks. After spending $11 on a meal and still starving I sadly won't be returning here in the future.

So sorry I didn't read reviews before I went. I should have backed out when I saw the estimate and gone somewhere else. Outrageous price for bloodwork and Xrays, and learned nothing. After $775, told to go Banfield for fluid analysis and ultrasound, which they dont do there. Don't get conned. DO NOT GO THERE!!

I'm honest especially when it comes to food. I'm surprised this pizza was voted number 1 , Bella's right down the street has a pie alot better. The people are nice but  I ordered a calzone, I'm not so sure they are even certain what that is because it had no ricotta cheese in it, I ordered steak and cheese and got sliced roast beef instead. (Sliced roast beef with the shiny color similar to our like the roast beef you get when u order a sub) first time I've got a calzone not in a box but wrapped in foil too. Had high hopes for this place,but if u want great food try Bella's up the street. You'll see there's a world of a difference

REAL BIG price for a bowl of cold noodles with a few sprinkled cold meat bitz - loaded with FAT & meager bean sprouts - not worth it!
It was rather unappetizing - my dining partner dumped chili sauce to give it some flavor.

Found out you CANNOT get pho  'dry'  in the restaurant,  but they'll 
give it to you if you drive thru!
That's just dumb & not happening!
Get with the program and cater to your customer!
Every other Vietnamese restaurant will offer 'dry' .  (broth on the side)

I ordered 'charbroiled' pork over rice. 
The price was astronomical for 1 oz of slivered pork, 1 cup half-warmed rice, two cucumber slivers, two twigs of ancient cilantro, dried carrot shreds, and ultra salty dipping sauce - this was lunch hour - you'd think at least the rice would be steamy. 
Who needs it?

Way too hyped up.server was too worried about getting closing work done and left her tables waiting forever .also with a kitchen that's open for everyone to see, maybe they shouldn't touch all the food with their bare hands .

Let's be honest, anyone in the Philly area has a passionate hate for the PPA and their tickets. However, remember when you visit the Filbert St. office those workers aren't the ones writing you tickets. They just have to deal with all the cranky people who got them from other people. 

I came into renew my parking permit & had all my paperwork ready to go... not everyone else who comes in does. Once I actually made it to the front of the line it only took me about 2 minutes to get my new permit. So, quick take away- have your paperwork ready, so then everyone else who does can get on with their day, the people working in the PPA can be helpful or they can take forever to process your stuff, be nice so they'll be more helpful.

Beware! This hotel commits fraud and I wish I would have seen the review where someone's credit cards were stolen. It was reported that our room smelled of pot and they found 2 blunts. We are licensed foster parents and took our kiddos to the museum. Therefore such accusations are impossible. After getting no where with the hotel, and working with our credit card they still denied us. I will never stay with Wyndham again.
Order online at Don Tequila no one in the restaurant knew about the order had to call the boss who was off site still didn't get my 40 bucks back they suck

One of the worst experiences I've ever had at a Panera. My Mac n cheese was barely full compared to the SAME SIZE my cousin and friend got ~ I asked them to please add a little more and they refused because it is prepackaged. I also asked for NO TOMATOES in my salad and yet , I still found one. This is extremely dangerous for people with food allergies: the manager was compliant and understanding and in turn gave me my money back ~ but it is still a danger.

Horrible service and rude staff. My husband and I were one of the only tables there and the service was slow and unattentive. Bussers were visibly just standing around when water glasses were empty and plates needed clearing
I've tried to call this post Office for 3 days and apparently their phone is out and they don't know it?????

Not a fan of eating in my car and I loath and despise their moronic commercials !!!!!  Service at night is extremely slow to the point where twice I literally drove away and went to the McDonalds across the street!

Honestly I think I would frequent this franchise more than once every three years if their commercials were not so damn idiotic !!!

Reserved car a week before and still had to wait in line for 30 minutes to get the paperwork signed. Went to pick up my car and there did not have any cars in lot but one full size SUV which they would not give me. Waited over an hour for my car in the cold with an 19 month old. No apologies, the service guy named Bill at the Nashville airport was extremely rude. 6 other people showed up after us and they had to wait as well. After an hour, they pull up with the car and 3 employees hop out of the car. Why they need 3 employees to deliver 1 car is beyond my comprehension. I asked to speak to the manager and the old man Bill would not call the manager. The manager knew that people were upset and refused to come speak to us and instead waddled in the other direction to avoid the customers. Called customer service line 3 times only to be hung up on and then put on hold 20 minutes. STAY AWAY FROM THRIFTY!

I don't know why we eat here. There's no consistency, it's not clean, it's run by kids. I wonder if they wash their hands. Tonight the salsa was empty, the trash cans were overflowing, the air conditioning barely cooled the place. Over the last 5 years, sometimes we've had good meals and other times I've been grossed out so we don't return for a long time between visits. I think I'm finally calling it quits.

About as ordinary as you can get. Went to the men's room and one of the kitchen staff came out of a toilet stall and headed back to the kitchen without even rinsing his hands, let alone washing them. Who knows, maybe he used a sink in the kitchen to wash up.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE experience.  The boat was old, dirty, crappy and dangerous. No doors on the pontoon boat which with young kids was not safe.  Storage seats/benches were broken which made it very hard to open/close and we were constantly afraid the lid was going to take off a finger when closing.  I would NEVER rent here again.

Clusterf*c! Would be a great name for the restaurant. We went there on Sunday, at 3:45, sat down and waited until 4 when the kitchen opened. Had a beer and Moscow Mule, which was good.

The waiter took our order for a cheese tray and came back after 15 minutes saying that they were out of one cheese, so we chose another. Waited another 30 min, they came out with a tray and said "we are just so busy today, here's what we have in the back". First of all, there was maybe 12 people there including us, second of all the tray had nothing we had ordered. We asked for the manager and napkins. The manager was too busy talking to his friends to come over and the waiter walked by our table with clean glasses probably 3 times and never brought us napkins. We asked for the bill, which took another 15 minutes. The manager never came even though the waiter told him we were very dissatisfied.

I would not recommend this place, horrible service, manager doesn't care about anyone but his friends and the waiter only knows how to walk around with clean cups. We never did get napkins, plates, or silverware. Luckily I had napkins from Panera in the glove box....

Carmelita's was my favorite Mexican restaurant in pinellas county. I actually liked every other location. This is my third time trying Carmelita's in NPR and I am not going to give them any more chances. I spent $30 on uber eats delivery for cheese enchiladas and sides/hot sauces. The cheese on top was melted and everything actually looked pretty good, but then I cut into them. The cheese in the enchiladas is literally cold shredded cheese. Not melted, not even warm. Why is it so hard for this location to make food of the same caliber as every other location? They probably would have just had to cook my enchiladas for another 2-3 minutes. What a joke.

I had a appointment at 5:00 pm on 6/27/18 with Renee. I have been coming here for almost 4 years and each time I visit my experience gets worse and worse. While Renee did the best she could, she was late taking me back (5:10) and I want a deep tissue and it wasn't close to that in touch and pressure. Moreover, she used a vibration machine and a tens unit more than her actual hands. The receptionist was also not very warm upon check in and check out. I'm saddened because I use to love this place but I'm going to have to go somewhere else because $50 is a lot for massages that are subpar and a checkin that is not friendly.

Ok we went to take my mother in law the server he never said his name when we finish was 173.00 that ok the problem is when he bring the change he just wait 4 min and come back and take the money from the table he don't ask nothing just take the money and I said hey noo and I give in $10 dollar he count the money y through in table and said no you can keep lol that suck because he's attitude no deserve nothing he supposed wait we left and see if we leave a tip. 
And he staring said how's the service how's was a bad experience. Obviously if he don't put his hand in our money we left considering tips but his action no deserves nothing. So that the first time and last in this location

I brought my Honda Civic in for inspection in November 2017. While my car passed inspection, I was strongly encouraged to get rear brakes ASAP. When I told the Service person I needed to think about it (as it was very costly), he aggressively put on the sales pressure, showing me graphics and telling me about hot spots. The "Service Specialist" made me feel that I was making a grave mistake for not getting my brakes done that day. I declined the service, mostly because I resented being spoken to like I was a child. Fast forward 8 months, I brought my car to another garage to look at the brakes. The mechanic said, "While I would love to take your money, you don't need rear breaks right now. I would put my wife and children in your car, and feel safe."  While I bought my car at Scott, I will NEVER return there to service my vehicle. It's clean and slick there, but not worth the extra money and aggressive/deceptive/condescending sales for unnecessary service.

I had really high hopes for this place and altered my route down to Baltimore to come here, but I was disappointed in the meal.

The barbecue itself was my main problem with the place.  I got the brisket meal and added on the ribs for $5.  The brisket was actually really dry and mealy.  Instead of being neatly sliced, it was this mound of brisket that sort of fell apart, but not in that tender delicious barbecue way.  There wasn't really much smoke flavor at all.  The ribs were also really dry.  They were cooked to the point of being closer to jerky than the "one-bite-and-clean-off-the-bone" texture that ribs strive for.  These ribs actually took some doing to get the meat off the bone.  Part of the problem was that the silver skin was never removed off the ribs before smoking.  So it was a really tough skin to chew through and get meat off of.  I don't think I've ever been to a barbecue place that failed to remove the silver skin.  Aside from that, there wasn't much smoke flavor and there didn't seem to be any seasoning except for the dry rub sprinkled on after smoking.

The lobster mac and cheese was decent, although a bit too thin of a cheese sauce for me.  I was surprised at how much lobster meat went into it.  They actually included quite a few pieces of lobster tail meat and only a small portion of the claw, which is great since the claw is often that spongy texture stuff that tastes sort of strange.  The mac and cheese itself didn't have much lobster flavor, so it was more like lobster put into normal mac and cheese.

I did like the German potato salad.  The potato was fried to perfection.  It was piping hot, crispy, and well-seasoned.  The sliced onions in this helped freshen it up.

With Yelp check in, you get a free smashade, which is a lemonade with real fruit to flavor it.  I tried the NJ peach and the blueberry+ginger.  The peach one was pretty good.  The blueberry and ginger one should have been strained to remove some of the blueberry and ginger skins.  I felt the lemonade itself wasn't lemony enough and the tartness didnt' come through.

The best part of this place is that they sell all  of Boylan Bottling Company's offerings, including the flavored seltzers and even the shirley temple.

I obtained high pain in my left leg, in the thigh and knee area. It wasn't severe enough to go to the hospital but enough to get in the way of moving around easily. I decided to use Lyft to go to Walgreens and come back home but I didn't want to run the risk of having my Lyft driver leave so I called the customer service number for Walgreens. I asked the representative/employee if it was possible for someone to bring a specific product that I wanted from the floor/shelf to the cashier counter so that when I get there, I could just pay for it and leave without spending much time in the store. She then connected me to someone in the store. I asked the same question and she then put me on what I thought was a hold. Instead, she  hung up the phone. Thinking that it was a mistake, I requested the Lyft and went to Walgreens. I limped my way in there and found an employee who wasn't doing much of anything and asked if this product was at the cashiers counter and instead of checking the counters, she just said that she didn't know what I was talking about and suggested that I talked to someone in the photo section. THE PHOTO SECTION. The lady in the photo section was already helping someone else didn't know what I was talking about so she called for someone to assist me. I stood there for at least five minutes. I became nervous of my Lyft driving possibly leaving me soon so I decided to limp my way around the store to find a knee brace. I found it and told the lady in the photo section to not call for someone else for the third time (she called for assistance a second time while I was looking for a brace) because I already found one. Luckily, the employee that I spoke to after entering the store rung up a previous customer and so checkout wasn't long. Overall, I would have rather someone tell me that I couldn't have someone bring a product from the floor to the cashier counter over the phone or the employee that I originally spoke to take a FEW minutes to check the counters than to not have no assistance at all. BAD customer service.

Run, run fast.  Ordered the jumbo fried shrimp.  If you are weak stomach; stop reading.  I put one in my mouth only to find a finger sheath from a rubber glove attached and wound around/in  the shrimp batter .  I told the talll Skinny manager male only for him to laugh.  That set me off. Then he comes back offering 50% off my ticket.  You have to be kidding me.  And $20 coupon at toasted monkey who I assume is associated with this place.  I told him this was not acceptable and that I should not have to pay for any of this and that everyone listening around our table agreed.  Unacceptable behavior and service.

The drink selection is decent, but avoid the food at all cost. I've visited them twice, and both times gotten a different entree to give them a chance to redeem themselves. The burger was small and burnt, the fish tasted like it has been in the freezer for months, and the $4 up-charge for fries so hard they could double nails was ridiculous. 2 stars because they have ~15 beers on tap and I don't think the bartenders deserve a 1 star review. Trust me, eat beforehand!!

I am a CEO of a Corp in ST Louis. Brought in 15 people. Spent over 1000 dollars. The food was good. Not great but the service was deplorable. My entire party left me as I waited to get a bill. When I inquired the person didn't say sorry for the wait she instead she acted as though I insulted her by asking. 1600 employees will receive my review. So sorry because it came highly recommended

Okay I normally don't do this but now I'm frustrated.

Long story short, I know makeup. I've done makeup for weddings, proms, models, etc. My specialty is skin/complexion, so I KNOW the difference between warm/cool/neutral foundations. With that said, I went in today because I had a coupon and wanted to get some more foundations.

Again, I know my undertones. So I began talking to the NARS rep and decided to purchase the sheer glow foundation-one of my favorites. I told him I wanted one shade just slightly darker than my skin because I get spray tans but that I still wanted it to be in the warm/golden family-I then pointed at the shade Punjab because I've owned it before and know it's my perfect shade. He then questioned me and said "um you mean something with a rosy/cool undertone then? Because Punjab is rosy and a warmer shade will be too yellow for you." This was after I told him I do makeup, so it came across a bit demeaning-as if I don't really know what I'm talking about. I kind of just nodded my head and said "sure" because I didn't want to come across mean, but I was confused. He then put Punjab on me and just like I said, it matched me perfectly. I ended up purchasing Punjab and their concealer in the shade cannelle. He kept referring to them as "rosy"

When I got home, I immediately googled the two shades on NARS site to make sure I wasn't going crazy, and they are described as "golden" and "peachy" (see attached photos).

So why am I writing this? 1. Because although the NARS rep was nice, I didn't like his comments 2. If you're going to have a NARS rep at your store, he/she should at least be able to properly tell the difference between undertones and not improperly refer to shades as being something they are not.

All in all, my experiences at this location have been way too hit or miss for me to definitively give them more than 2 stars. Sorry Ulta, but until you get your act together I'm officially done visiting your Elmwood location.

Recently picked up a bag of Abbott's Plain Caramels.  They were big, and wrapped in paper like a good homemade style caramel should be.   Unfortunately, they were terrible; maybe the worst I've ever had.  They were more like nougat filling from a Milky Way candy bar:  not chewy or gooey, just kind of a yucky corn syrup like texture.  

Hopefully their other stuff is better.

I was here recently and I ordered a Tito's and club soda and a few beers. The bartender proceeded to poor two mixed drinks, one with no Tito's. I asked her why, and she became belligerent. She sent over, I guess, her manager who knocked over the actual drink I had, and said "I guess it's not your lucky day."

"dewey's is way better" 

is the first thing that left my mouth after taking one bite of their pizza. this pizza is extremely hyped up- since it's average with small portions and a pretty overpriced tag. it's not bad, but you can definitely find way better (and bigger) pizza. 

had a side of their mac & cheese which was also good, but still slightly underwhelming. odd cheese flavor and was a small bowl even though it was full sized to share. just not the best place around.

I would leave 0 stars but apparently that is not allowed.  Scam and shady define this company.  My son in law parked in a condo complex for less than 30 minutes while unloading stuff to move into a condo and they hooked up his car and refused to release it.  Their website says $50 for a 10 mile tow - but they charged $185.  Seems obvious they are in bed with someone and paying kickbacks.  Maybe the IRS needs to investigate - I bet someone isn't claiming the income.
Like vultures on roadkill.

Much better pizza choices in the area.  The bear bites were doughy and lacking in flavor.  The pizza crust is tough and tastes like the yeast didn't rise...really bad.  Do yourself a favor and pass on the pizza and go for the beer.

DO NOT PURCHASE THE INSURANCE, IT IS A SHAM. I purchased a love seat and sleeper, I Insured it, however, after a couple months the mechanism of the sleeper started to malfunction, then I call Bob's furniture to resolve the issue, they send a technician to fix the problem, he never came back ( didn't fix the problem) and I called Bob's furniture, they told me wait which I did, and after a month waiting Bob's furniture said that the insurance does not going to cover the damage because it passed 30 days. Now a put a formal complain with NJ Banking and insurance Department to resolve the issue.
Bad service.  Not what I thought was their standards.   Forgot part of the order.   Asked if I wanted ketchup and still didn't get it.  Smh.

Do not come here for glasses. It's taken multiple visits to get lenses, glasses, repairs. And to get someone to listen when you say that your prescription is off. There are plenty of other places to go I suggest you pick any of the others in the valley.

BOYCOTT PEGS OVER GLORIFIED FOOD AND PRICES!!
disgusted and sad. My daughter and I are picking up an order for a delivery service I sometimes work for and a  gentleman steps up to pay the owner/cashier of Pegs OVER Glorified Ham and Eggs on Sierra St.  and he asks about any Military / Veterans  discount for Veterans Day?This beatch had enough nerve to say to tell him that he's not in dress. So she DID NOT give him any discount!? 

So disgusted!!!!!!!!! Pissed!!!!!!!!! Angry!!!!! 
Had I had any extra I would have paid for his meal! 
To think that she has this opportunity because of our men and women that give their lives  for people like her, ugh!!  I'm just passed words!!!!

Just moved here from Cali and needed a price for a water line to the refrigerator. Found these folks on Home Advisor and made an appointment for an estimate at one o'clock. The plumber showed up at 3:45 and I was talking to my painting contractor. He grunted something and I asked him to repeat himself. He said how do you want me to do this? I said I didn't know, that's why I called a plumber! I asked my husband to speak with him after he was done talking to the painter. The plumber chose to wave his hands and say, I'm outta here! He just walked out! So, I work for an HVAC company in Cali.....if one of my techs did that, they would be history. What a jerk.

This company can't hire a competent install or repair team.  House was built a year ago and had to call them out to fix heat, ac, leak in pipes, and faulty wiring.  Even though it's under warranty, I hired another company who found even more issues and fixed them in one trip.  Free was costing me comfort, and piece of mind.

DON'T RISK TAKING YOUR CAR HERE. After Paying almost $80.00 for an oil change I got home to find the car leaking a ridiculous amount of oil. Determined they used some type of universal closure for my oil pan and didn't even close it right. I then had to remove the oil to put in a proper drain plug, that is when I realized the oil was dirty and nasty and they had not even changed it. If I would have continued to drive my car would have been ruined. I called and complained and they said all that they could do is give me a free  oil change next time, like I am ever going to let them touch my car again.

From the outside I was super excited to try this place. The exterior looks like a typical Mexican adobe structure, decorated with with Latin flair. The restaurant had a live Spanish singer & the entertainment was greatly appreciated while we waited for our entrees. The menu was full of choices. I ordered the Arroz Con Pollo & my friend ordered a Macho Burrito. We both disliked our food. My rice was way over cooked & super mushy. My black beans were cold although they did have a decent flavor. Due to the temperature not even being warm I didn't eat them for fear of food poisoning.  The worst part of my meal was the chicken. The sauce had no flavor and was super thick. It's almost like they added too much cornstarch or flour to thicken it & then tried to fix the mistake with extra water. It was nasty. The chicken also lacked flavor. They definitely didn't season the chicken prior to cooking. My chicken was bland & chewy. Maybe it was boiled...who knows. Whatever they did it was totally not eatable.

My friends burrito was another disappointment. The meat had a weird taste to it, almost sweet. They also used really low quality beef because there was a ton of grease. Their rice was also over cooked & mushy. The refried beans literally had hard clumps. It looked as it the beans had big burnt chunks of refried beans that were mixed it to good beans. And worst of all the burrito wasn't even warm in the center. This restaurant needs to really work on food temperature or they could seriously make someone ill. 

We both only took small bites of our food & certainly did NOT ask for to go boxes. It's sad paying 12.75 & 10.29 for 2 dishes to be 95% thrown away. We certainly will never go back.  It's sad to say it but Taco Bell would have been better.

We visited Lulu's last month and thought it was good enough for a revisit. Folks, this is just an average place. Nothing is going to make you go "Wow". After going round and round the parking lot for 10 minutes on a Friday night, looking for a parking spot, we spotted a family leaving and had to block traffic so we could get the spot.
We had to wait for a table so we found 2 seats at the bar at the very end where the servers pick up drinks for the customers. The servers are mostly very young and very friendly. But, they all could use some training. When drinks were ordered, the fruit garnish is handled by their unsanitary hands. One male server actually held a wedge of lime for a few minutes before his drink order was made. Gross.
We ordered  a beer and a fuzzy navel. The heavyset barmaid did not look like she was in a good mood. Her tattoos and dyed black her were not an inviting outfit for the beach crowd. She made us a hairy navel (added vodka) instead of a fuzzy navel and did not even add a garnish to the drink. Luckily, I reached over in to the garnishes and added a dried out wedge of orange.
We paid out bar tab and were seated. The table and chairs were dirty. I had to wipe the crumbs off of the chair. When we came in, I was in the mood for raw oysters, but after seeing trays of pre-shucked oysters on display when we walked in, i changed my mind. While using pre-shucked oysters for cooked oysters dishes is ok, raw oyster enthusiasts long for the nectar of the fresh shucked mollusk. Seeing dozens of shucked oysters on display in the open air without being covered (Dept of Health regulation) and knowing that the melted ice could contaminate and alter the taste was a total letdown. If you are calling yourself an oyster bar, be an oyster bar!
Ok, so I did not order raw oysters. I opted for the fried grouper cheeks, which were not. They appeared like fried grouper bites. For $15, the portion was extremely small. What a ripoff! Even, my side of grilled vegetable were not grilled. They were soggy batons of sautéed squash that tasted like they were sitting in a steam table for too long. Yikes!
Now for the dessert, since it was the special, we order the key lime pie. Oh well, we were told that that was not any left. OMG!
The highlight of the meal was my partners fried chicken, sweet potato fries and poppy coleslaw. All tasted very good!
As a former chef and restaurant owner my opinion is that unfortunately, the average person does not possess enough culinary aptitude to know what is good and what is average. Lulu's could be so much better if the focus was on quality, not quantity. Apparently, the kitchen needs a passionate owner and leader who has adequate culinary training or needs to hire a real chef who can teach the proper culinary techniques to the kitchen staff.
I hope for the best for Lulu's. Spring break is over and the snow birds are leaving. How will you survive off-season? I will never return. Good luck!

As far as Wheelhouse as a Club goes, it's awful.
You'll pay a cover fee to get in and listen to a really horrible DJ. The music is sporadic and just terrible to dance to. Although, everyone stands around awkwardly on the "dance floor" anyways.
The bartenders seem to make up prices as they go and no one knows how much their bill is going to be at the end of the night. I ordered a whiskey sour and got a whiskey water.
This pricing variability was consistent from my two times there, with a group of 5.

Although looking at these reviews I'm really excited to go there during the day to try the food.

Stayed here over a yr. Maintenance would turn off water without notice. They never fixed anything outside. Lights were broken and after the Irma storm they never cleaned up the branches and trees behind the building were balconies are. The fitness center equipment is old, worn or broken, they never clean in the fitness center. Dust is inches thick on machines. They have 3 pools at least one will be closed on major warm holiday. When you move they expect 2 months...60 days notices who knows that? Which out for rent increase at lease renewals. Just be aware

This place is ok. Th location is amazing and the ambiance is amazing! They have good drinks as well. I only gave two stars because I've gone three times and each time most of stalls were closed. Some ran out of food. And  options for food choices were few for vegetarians like myself. Also they ran out of water and hand washing places.

I had brunch at V Street on Sunday, March 26, 2018.
My daughter has been a vegan for many years.
I have frequented many vegan restaurants across the country, as well as prepared them. I do think it is a healthier choice as well as saving the animals.
With that said, I found V Street to be very uneventful and have crossed it off my list.
With so few menu options, you would think that the ones they do offer, would be over-the-top, not so.
The 'Tofu Scramble' would be the only acceptable item on the menu. Other than that, nothing was of interest.
I was there with a party over a dozen, I saw and tasted all items.
The presentation was not inviting, unless you like bare minimalism. The food was too spicy to a fault, and I like spicy food. Even the Bloody Mary was followed by water.
It was just overall bad.
Would rather have ordered from 'Whiz Kids' that adjoined the restaurant, but wasn't allowed. 
This is the first review that I have ever given such a poor review, I'm sorry, but I'd rather eat anywhere else Vegan, than V Street.

I know this is a fast food chain and you can only expect so little, but really?
I come in through the drive through, and the person on the speaker sounded young and very inexperienced. They charged me for potatoes, which usually are never charged for vegetarians.. she had a poor attitude and kept laughing at me for no reason.. I also asked for extra potatoes since they usually only put a few in my burrito, and I wanted to make sure I had plenty.
Next, I roll up to the window, and pay with 5 dollars. My total was 4.76, and I only received 2 dimes as change.. not too bothered by it, but come on! I can hear rap music in the back and it was LOUD. It smelled like smoke. Like cigarette smoke.
