I couldn't believe my nose, but trust me, it was 10:02pm, and I smelled pungent smoke from inside with teenagers in there. I asked for a manager but no one was on duty.
When I got my food, my burrito looked tiny. I felt around and only felt potatoes on 1/3 of the burrito only on one side, and I felt the rest of soft. When I ate it, I was completely right. Next, the nachos were a mess. It looked like someone sneezed all over it! It was all over the bag, the container, it really showed how much they cared.
I would've taken my $5 and put it to better use at the McDonalds across the street. I hope to get something in return for such poor service.

UPDATE 1/7/18
Went in at 10:15 for just chips and cheese. The guy over the intercom kept asking if I wanted anything else, and after saying "no" about 5 times, he started laughing and told me to go to the next window. I come up and he starts laughing his butt off with his friend. I open up the cheese to see it all extremely chunky. I find that the chunks are some sort of powder and even some beef. My mother ordered these, she couldn't eat them because she is vegetarian. Cheap food, but a waste of my time even driving out here. Try McDonald's across the street for a snack, always fresh and accurate with good customer service.

Not the place to go for gourmet burgers. Not worth the price. None of the ingredients were fresh. The bun was cheap quality and crumbled as soon as you held the burger. The truffle fries were very greasy. It was your regular cheap burger joint with magnified prices.

I bought my car used.  On the last day of the factory warranty a bolt came loose and did damage to a rear boot around the axle and differential.  Two people from Autohaus told me that since my warranty expired the day before I called them for service I was out of luck and they could put me through to a manager whom I left a voicemail for.  24 hours later and he had not returned my call.  I called Plaza Motors.  The service associate spoke with the service manager and was given approval to cover 100% of the repair.  The car only had 20k miles on it.  They fixed it in 48 hours with no out of pocket costs.  I will not buy my next car from Autohaus or recommend the dealership to anyone. 
 
My factory warranty expired 12 hours before I called them and they would not honor it.  I guess since I didn't buy my car there my warranty was treated as second class.  Don't count on Amanda Suraci in the service department if your warranty is even one minute past the expiration.
Fish curry is battered catfish in a tomato sauce with no flavor. Place is filthy with almost no staff and a tv with music way too loud.

How are these people still in business?!  If you own a property, please go with a different property management company as I don't see how these people have even lasted this long. 

With impeccable credit and more than sufficient income, they were requesting a co-signer AND twice the deposit amount. When I told them I would not be doing that - I would find a different property to rent and to please cancel my application and move on to the next person, the office personnel got extremely mean and even harassing (as if I had been in the wrong). They first agreed to refund the application fee (before I asked them to move on to the next applicant), then backed down stating that they feel I should have expected it to happen. 

The fee really wasn't worth it for me to pursue. Getting anyone in the office to return a call was like pulling teeth, and dealing with their rude behaviors was even worse.

If I were you I wouldn't "go in with an open mind" or believe that "only people with negative comments write reviews" (look at the amount of positive comments that other places have). Steer clear at ALL costs!

My experience at Trolley Car Cafe was sub-standard. When I arrived with my party, it was unclear where we were expected to wait for a staff member to seat us - it turned out, the waiting area was the tiny entryway. There were very few diners in the restaurant, which made our standing in the doorway so apparent that another guest found a server to inform him that there were people waiting to be seated. The sparse decor was bizarre, to say the least. In the small areas where there was decor, it was crudely hung and very cheap looking. I ordered a burger, which was not cooked properly. It was well-done, but I ordered it medium. Additionally, the burger that I ordered was named specifically after a type of cheese that it featured. I was deeply disappointed that the cheese was cold on top of the burger - a clear indication that the cheese was an afterthought in the kitchen. The patty itself was far too small for the bun that it was served on. The poorly cooked and bland burger was something I was willing to look past, but I simply cannot understand why my burger was inexplicably served with a few plain tortilla chips. I took the chips home to eat with some salsa from my fridge and tried to ignore that I paid $13 for a sloppily made, over-cooked, bland burger with a side of tortilla chips.

We are originally from St Louis, and come back during the holidays to visit family and friends. Over the past decade, STL has been making headway in the culinary scene, therefore we go out for dinner frequently when back in town. 

We were in the neighborhood Christmas Eve, and with most restaurants closed on the 24th, we figured we would give this place a shot. To keep this review concise, come for the drinks, and do yourself a favor by forgoing the food. This was unequivocally the most poorly executed meal (and over-priced dining experience) I have had over the past 15 years of experiencing cultures through food in 15+ countries and 20+ US states. For example, the $40 scallop risotto was literally inedible-- scallops were extremely chewy, which means either overcooked and/or not fresh; dish was dry, when it should be a creamy consistency; extremely bland flavor. Given it was Christmas Eve, we opted not to say anything to the waitress or manager to keep things festive and lighthearted. 

To conclude, takeaways of this review:

-Exuberantly over-priced food relative to what it is 
-Poorly executed dishes
-If you visit at all, I would recommend only the drinks

I took my 2 dogs here for a check up and yearly shots. My dogs are healthy and in good shape so I thought since we just moved to Churchville we would find a vet nearby.  Everything was fine until I got the bill. Both dogs got the rub down, I guess she was feeling for lumps. She looked at their teeth and paws. Check up was done for both dogs in less then 5 minutes.  Each of my dogs got 2 shots. Decided to buy her heartgard medicine and nextgard my bill was over $850.00.  We waited 40 minutes to get into room to see vet and in less then 20 minutes we were done and hit with an outrageous bill.  My dogs had operations that cost less then a yearly checkup and some meds. I only bought 2 boxes of meds not even enough to cover 6 months for both dogs. Why so expensive???? Cause your in Richboro??? Really????? Won't ever go back here.  Also when I got home I looked up the meds I bought online to compare prices.  To my surprise (lol not really) they cost $50-$75 more per box then I could of got online.  There is something to be said for jacking up the prices of meds after the exam was also so inflated.  Find another vet these people are thieves!!!!!!!!

Atmosphere is very nice that's why they got one star service sucks, the lady was ridiculously rude and short with me because I told her I just wanted to get my polish changing no manicure. My polish was already chipping in less than a week. My nails are broken and she did the worst possible job at filing my nails I would never go back here again.

No payment for 45 days.  Unfortunately will have to take legal action, but after authorizing repairs, the claim to have sent payment, then they hang up when questioned.  Supervisors promised payment twice and never call back.  They transfer us to finance, we leave messages. no calls.

Waited over 2 hours for doctor to see me!! Terrible! They kept telling me he'll be right with you which was a lie. Find it so disrespectful of my time! If he needs longer apt windows so people don't have to wait as long then he should do that! So ridiculous. Waited so long in office and no one cared. Apt at noon and didn't get seen until after 2pm.

This is the second time ordering from this Zoës and I'm Very disappointed in the service and quality of the food I received. My wife and I ordered 3 meals and 2 of the 3 orders came back incorrect. There were chucks of potato in my Greek salad when I didn't even order potato salad or grilled potato as a side. The pita bread was cold and tough as if it was just taken out of the freezer. Ordered the cauliflower rice bowl and instead got a pita sandwich. To add insult when we told the cashier that the orders were incorrect she did not even respond us. There wasn't even a long line of customers waiting either so I can't even understand all these errors. I have never received such poor service from any other Zoës location and zoes is and has been one of my go-to spots for a quick lunch/dinner.

Fusco's The Spot claims their filter, which is rated at 3,000 CFM (cubic feet per minute) cleans the air in the entire facility every 7.7 seconds. Their math is off slightly. A pool room 15x15x15 foot area the size of a family room in a home but enough for a bar table is 3,375 cubic feet. It would take their $22,000 filter more than a minute to filter all the air in that small space. That means customers are exposed to carcinogens, which is a cancer causing agent. Smart folks would avoid this place.

Second try here both times disappointing. First time service was awful waking 30 minutes for food and not receiving sushi till done with our entrees, drinks never refilled. When we talked to the manager, he was rude and curt. He informed us that they were busy and then whipped the sushi off the table. Wow! We went this past weekend for my sons birthday and once again service was sketchy. My husband never received his miso soup or rice with his meal and I never was served my soup either. I asked for another drink which I never received. When I spoke with the server she was very apologetic and said she she would take the rice and soups off the bill which she did not due. They were not that busy but seemed understaffed. I'll not be back. There was a time when finding good sushi and Japanese food was difficult to find in the area but not anymore. Not worth the trip unless you don't mind shoddy service and nor receiving all your food.

DO NOT GO HERE (FAIRLESS HILLS LOCATION)!!!

I have been trying to cancel my membership for over 4 months now.  I have made numerous phone calls, emails and went in person and keep getting told a different story.  

When I signed up I was told I could CANCEL at ANY time as it was a month to month membership and I did not want to be locked into a contract that I had to pay money to get out of etc.  

The URGE salesman re-assured me that there was no payment penalty to cancel the contract.  I was told I could cancel at ANY time no questions asked.  

When I tried to cancel ViA phone, email and via fax......I always told that I had to go somewhere else....I had to speak with or deal with someone else, which I have been doing and trying to do for the last 4 months.  Today I had it as I keep getting billed even through I have proof I have been trying to cancel this since November as I had to have major neck surgery and would not be able to do anything at the gym.

Today I went into the Fairless Hills location and spoke to one of the managers WILL CARPENTER, who was the most arrogant unprofessional person I have ever dealt with.  As he was explaining to me in a condescending tone we got into a yelling match with one another both using profanity.  He had a smug look on his face and asked me to get the "F*#%" out and started snapping his fingers at me and the front desk to have me escorted out. (Mind you I am still in a neck brace, from my neck surgery two weeks ago and brought all my medical documentation to prove it with ZERO cooperation from him at all and I felt threatened that he was going to get physical with me.)

The is a beat em and cheat em Gym, they are just like used car salesmen and omit important information to get you sign up.  They just try to suck all the money out of you.  The place is always empty and I have never seen the same staff there as the turn over with their staff is constant.

Bottom line go somewhere else.......I have never written a bad review on anything ever but I hope this will help someone else....STAY AWAY.....there are many other gyms out there that I have never had an issue with....and when I am better Ill be going else where.
The store was listed at open on the web site however I went today at 1pm and the store was closed.

This place WAS ALMOST a good time for my friends 21st birthday , however after we arrived our experience was cut short because of the what I believe to be the store manager or store owner he came up to me very rudely and told me and everyone I was with that we had to leave because we had been told repeatedly not to take photos and not only have we never been told but it was my first time seeing this man, I replied to him very respectfully and told him that in the future he should speak to people more respectfully and carry himself and his establishment more professionally and maybe tell people entering about the photography policy upon entering the building, he repeatedly cut me off and then the other store manager waved his hand at me as of to shoo away myself and my friends I told him that this was completely unnecessary and childish behavior for someone who is supposed to be running a business.... I proceeded to mention to the door man that It would be a good idea to mention to patrons said policy and I didn't yell I wasn't cursing I spoke to him respectfully as I would have like to be treated and they then threatened to call the police I warn you these people will not treat you like you Matter or like you are human at all I will never be back for this very reason .

We are long time clients and i dont want to be treated differently because of a complaint, so i am writing under my boyfriend's Yelp acct...
I really do LOVE the care that my pets receive, Dr Garcia and Dixon are amazing!!  I also cant help but notice the changes you are attempting to make in staffing at the front desk which i can only assume is due to the rude attitude of, well, usually, and especially Samantha. Today  my boyfriend called and spoke w/ her with some questions before we wanted to make the appt. I just got to his apt and he vented to me about her once AGAIN attitude, we almost called it quits. Im not sure why we always seem to get her on the phone, but her condescending manner is unacceptable. 

She isn't just rude and standoffish on the phone, but my God does she treat you like you're below poverty if you question your bill or mention loyalty card stamps(and didn't pay enough that day to get any stamps that day!!??) We are not rich by any means, but we surely arent poor, and even if we were, noone deserves to be treated that way. She embarrassed me the last time i was there infront of the people checking out next to me.(that said, we saw some new faces and i can only hope they are a replacement!)  So, now...we will stick around to see what happens.  One can only hope things get better. 
I am not trying to put anyone out of a job, but the phone and front desk is the FACE of your establishment. And you NEED to know she is ruining your reputation.  I just don't think working with people is her forte by any means. 

But that's just our opinion(and my parents as well, but I won't get into that lol, they are Italian and very opinionated lol)

Came in for the usual pasta (tutto mare, Cajun chicken). Both pastas were a watery mess.  This isn't the first time and it's becoming a frequent thing now. We are regulars and even though the salad was good, what a waste of 80$. Do yourself a favor and make sure Antwon is working in the kitchen, otherwise the quality isn't consistent. There were literally 3 shrimp in my Cajun chicken pasta.

Wow.  I've been in the restaurant business for 15 years, and I've honestly never seen a more unprofessional, rude, nasty manager/owner (whatever the title may be.  The middle aged guy who is "in charge" here).  He was even nasty to the 3 and 5 year old I came in with.  He acted like he was looking for a fight.  Extremely bizarre.  I've come here many times and the food is always a solid C-, but this man has ensured I'll never dream of going back.

Buyer beware! The taxi stand guy at the airport told me that the ride from TPA to the Doubletree Hotel would be $3. When the driver (cab 320) saw my $20, he told me the ride would cost $20. It's about a 4-mile ride.

Overpriced.  Unhelpful, unhappy staff.

Called for lunch today.  "Do you recommend tuna melt or brisket cheeseburger?"  "I don't eat red meat." Aka things did not start helpful and voice tone came across judgmental and uninterested.  

Ordered tuna melt.  It took 25mins to make.  Guess it's not surprising how long it took considering how burnt it was.  (Photo added to restaurant photos on Yelp.)

Called back to let them know it was burned.  "I can have the manager call you back when she's less busy."  Wouldn't want to interrupt her busy day with a customer!!  Unbelievable.

Traveling with young children is always complicated because they need their own space but are too young for certain setups. For this reason, we opted to stay here during our seven day trip.

There is only one good thing about this hotel and that is the parking staff. The parking staff is amazing; I was sad to say goodbye to them. Other than that, our stay at the hotel wasn't very impressive. First of all, they charged extra during the holiday (which is to be expected) but had VERY minimal staff. Which means we paid extra but did not get the same level of service. The maid, while she was there, didn't clean the rooms she only gave clean towels. Though I don't celebrate Christmas, I can understand other people wanting to be with their families so that would not have been a problem. But why have her there for normal work hours and then just have her going around handing out towels? Makes no sense.

The breakfast area was very inefficient and understaffed as well. The staff was so overworked, one of the servers walked by with the coffee dispenser and hit my 3 year old son in the head. Who does that? I spoke to the manager and he barely seemed phased by this happening. They did end up giving us the regular rate instead of the holiday rate, but I don't really feel like that's sufficient. She hit him so hard he just stood there stunned. I ended up having to bring him back upstairs because clearly it's not a safe environment for children.

Another thing that threw me off is the fact that the hotel allows dogs. I'm not even one that dislikes dogs, but I really would rather not hear them bark all day long. While the hotel was easily accessible to the beach, I probably will stay elsewhere.

This place is horrible. First off, I've been to many threading salons and Dimple did a horrible job on my eyebrows-specifically missing several baby hairs. Every 2 seconds she would say, are you okay? Are you okay? Which became annoying...lastly, this place is OVERPRICED!!! I've been to threading salons where they only charge half her price, who do a great job! Save your money and go to the many other threading salons near the area which do a better job

This was a terrible experience, party of 8, prepared 7 of 8 meals , 30 min later they bought the 8th meal and it was wrong, used to frequent, tried again, will not return , strongly suggest you go elsewhere

Worst Pho I have ever experienced.  Served with NO jalepeno, NO, cilantro or culantro, barely any sprouts- no takeout sauces.  And when I called to ask about it I was told "it is normal".  This is shameful.
Don't eat here.

They miss a lot of stuff. I have a decent car -- not a Lamborghini or anything, but nice enough that I cannot trust Mister Car Wash to get my car perfect. Don't expect door jambs to come out clean and don't expect anything close to a detail job on your interior. At best, use them for an exterior wash to help bridge gaps between hand washing yourself.

We came in hopes of being able to jump in a nicer facility and while it was nice the staff was honrendous. They nit-pick at every detail and make the time spent there miserable. I couldn't hold my 1 year old in the "lil air" designated area for toddlers or simply sit with him on the trampoline. The staff are on their cellular devices the entire time and, might I add, are children. Save your money. Don't even buy the Groupon.

Tried again. Sadly it was just the same as our two past experiences. We want to like it because trivia is fun; however, there's always a "mess up with the order." This time they were out of 4 of their local beers and no burger of the month. 3 strikes and you're out Boulevard.

Beware, they tried to fix things on my truck that were not broken and wanted to charge me 
Four time the true cost. I will never go there again.
The people are very rude. The man with the white beard kept staring at us and judging us. He also yelled at my family for using the kid lanes. Awful service and rude people.

If I could give this place a zero I would. From the moment we arrived we could already hear other guest complaining about the wait for food. Still, as we work in this business we decided to wait. It took a little to get greeted and sat, but we got our drinks quickly enough and our server did warn us about the kitchen running a little behind. Cut to an hour and a half later, our server hadn't come back to the table even once since we got our drinks and we had heard multiple arguments from the kitchen staff in which cursing was involved. To make matters worse, there were children around. The whole restaurant went quiet at one particular moment when a served screamed the F/bomb in search of his food. Meanwhile the manager has been in the kitchen this whole time letting this go on. We finally asked for our check and left without ever getting our food. There were three of us and, again we all work in this field. It was absolutely inexcusable, and I would never recommend this location to anyone.

I shop at this Winn Dixie almost daily. I really don't understand working at a place that you don't enjoy, if you don't want to work, stay your ass at home. I don't need your attitude. The cashier (Jeolisa) spoke twice to me, to ask for my plenty card & to tell me how much my total was, that's it! This is the first time I have had a cashier or any employee for that matter, to be impolite & NO I'm not bagging my own groceries this time, you can do that, that's NOT MY JOB!!! Maybe she had a bad day, we all have them, but you will never know I'm having a bad day at MY job. So do your job properly or QUIT!!!

Had a really bad experience with them. My puppy's toenail was bleeding while I picked her up. I told them that she only needs a little cut with the nails as her nails haven't been cut for a while. If you cut too much she will bleed. They didn't care. While I took her back all they said was that's normal, didn't even say sorry. Some of the nails were chipped at the edge, so I guess the tool was not even sharp enough. While I was there, the lady was shut at one of the dog because it was barking. Imagining she was talking to my dog like that. Maybe other groomers are worse, I dont know. Truth is no one cares about your dog the way you do. So if you can do it yourself, why let other people torture your little puppy.
If you want to call 3 times and wait more than a half hour for pick up at TPA, then be my guest and use this parking company.
These guys have an outrageous dealer fee. $899. This is way out of line for a used car. I told them to stick it and they claimed they had the lowest dealer fee around. Look around. It's a crock!

I suggested this place to my family as we were coming back from Clearwater.  This beachside restaurant is great, our waiter Mike was super awesome and diligent with our requests.  The front desk staff...a less than desirable greet, no smiles, just blah.  Come on, chins up and smile!  

It was a hot day,  and we noticed that they had umbrella to shield from the sun.  My husband tried to put ours up, as there were no staff around.  A waitress slowly walks over and said that a staff member must put the umbrellas up, no problem.  So as he was already letting go of the umbrella, Jenae "the manager" comes over, swiftly and super RUDELY. She's yelling "STOP TOUCHING THAT RIGHT NOW, over and over".  Without accessing the situation at all.  I said that we were already informed of your procedures.  She continued to speak loudly with an awkward grin on her face, then walked away.  All of the tables around us were saying, someone already said something. That whole scene could have been handled with much better customer service skills.  The food was good though!

This dealer was very dishonest. The pulled a bait and switch on us, we got our deposit back and ran for the door. Our salesman mark was pushy and didnt even know they sold the camper we put a deposit on (out from under us) they were not willing to negotiate at all and the supposed manager, me starkey, was a joke.  We were equally unimpressed with the owner, bob who did absolutely nothing to make it right. Byerly RV says thanks for the business Midwest ....

I had my under 21 wristband inside out from fist pumping too hard and security came up and grabbed my wrist while fist pumping and ripped it off of me and told me to leave I don't understand the problem or why I had to leave ? I'm 5'2 and he used the fact that he could look down on me to intimidate me the only reason I'm giving this place 1 star is because I can't put a 0

i could not find ANYONE to help me or single person to check me out and i was walking around for 20 minutes with no assistance and that is not okay. i couldn't even tell who was an employee because they were just standing around talking. and the store is like a maze. i might as well not make a purchase since i can't find anyone to check me out.

Took my kittens here to get checked and they put down all of them. They do not care about animals, they just want to kill them all. I just want to tell you, GC animal shelter, that you are sucky human beings. Why don't you get another job that doesn't involve animals since you hate them so much? We get all of our pets from Camden County animal shelter, they are soooo much better :)

This place is going downhill. Teriyaki beef was tasteless other than being salty. Spicy tuna roll had a weird flavour in it, which makes me wonder if the tuna was fresh. The only good thing left was mango tango. 

Service was extremely slow and no greetings from the sushi bar to any of the customers while we were there. The did not even give out candies when they brought the bill. Not that candies are important, but this lack of detail brings down the service impression.

Menu is very confusing and they make things up to charge more than they should. I've never heard of a Chile relleno with no sauce and if requested you are charged for it. Also I had the green tamale and i do not recommend it at all. Taquitos do not look good at all. The green salsa is more of a hollandes sauce and has no flavor at all. Plus thing is that the Cadillac margarita was decent though.

On a recent evening we went to Brown Butter.  We live in the neighborhood and had been meaning to check it out.  We came away perplexed.  This place lists itself as "Southern."  In New Orleans we kinda know what "Southern" means.  This was not it.  On entering we were greeted with Hip Hop music.  With children in the room the word "fuck" was heard repeatedly on the radio station they were playing.  Not a good start and not a good choice.  The music one plays in a restaurant does matter.  

The room gives one the impression of a "Southern" motif if some old windows and signs suffice.  The room is pleasant enough.  But the menu is where perplexing really makes itself known. Yes, grits did appear and there was evidence of Pimento cheese.  But "Korean" bowls and burgers?  Really?  Nothing against Korean but this was supposed to be Southern.  

My companion ordered the brisket, not usually considered Southern, and found the slices cut too thick and the meat tough and dry.  He found the cole slaw had potential but was way, way too salty.  He didn't eat it.  The beans appeared dried out though they did have an intriguing taste.  I ordered the short ribs.  The meat was tender enough to use a fork but the whole thing was served in a bowl with tasteless grits and a (I presume) Korean sauce with greens on the top.  Odd.  I got rather tired of it before I was finished. 

The plain truth is that there are plenty of places to go for "Southern," in New Orleans and this is not one of them.  We walked out not only perplexed but wondering why we bothered.

Terribly company and would not ever recommend. I would give them a zero if I could. 
Consistently misses my recycle pickup.  Every time I call they give me a different reason and give me the run around.
They sell used products and pawn them as as new.  This is the second experience with this and will not do business with them again.

Terrible!Been to many places in FL and never had this situation with fruit flies.Even while waiting for the manager to come to our table my wife was taking photos of the flies landing on the napkins.Sad sad sad.We weren't even near the main entrance.Maybe if we had been by the bar where a better possibility of contact of flies may occur being near the door and and sweet tasting liquids,but we were on the other side of the building.A memorable moment for all the wrong reasons

The food is pretty decent, but the customer service is terrible. 

The hours of operation state 11am-10pm. Really, the staff gets in the door at 11am and start answering phones at 11:30.

I ordered three large pies for my office. Two pepperoni, one plain. I received one plain, and two sausage with bacon. One slice looks like it was bitten by a mouse. The other pie has a hole in the middle. How is this even acceptable? 

I called to inquire about our order, and I was told by Dave, "We're making your pizzas now. I didn't have pepperoni." 

If you don't have pepperoni, you should tell your customers you don't have pepperoni, and offer a substitute. Don't just assume that sending over a different pizza is acceptable. "My truck didn't show up, and we were busy," is not an appropriate response. That's an excuse. 

I used to work in the food service industry, and I realize mistakes happen. However, this could have easily been avoided had the truth been told. Don't make excuses or pass the buck. Own up when you make a mistake. 

I have given Amy's Pizzeria the benefit of the doubt many times. Each time, the order is not quite right, but this most recent experience is unforgivable. I won't order from here again.

We had been looking for a reason to stop and try this place, so we were stoked when we finally got to stop in about 7 on a Tuesday evening. 
There was only 1 other family of 4 in the dining area. We settled on two simple pepperoni's, an Athenian, and a Five Star, and made combos of 3 of those. Two people solemnly greeted us at the pizza station. They both appeared as though they either disliked their jobs, or life in general. We ordered one at a time, and it was a painfully slow process. 
We stopped for drinks, and what a mess! It made me stop and look around and the multiple dirty tables, nasty floor, and overall unclean surroundings. It made me wonder why two people were making pizza, and not one person was cleaning up. But, hey...on to the food. 
The pizza was so-so. The crust was good, but it really had minimal toppings, and the Athenian was missing a few all together. Even the salads was limp and small. For the cost, it really wasn't worth it. 
We all figured we'd hit the head before the long ride home, which was also an eye-opener. The bathrooms were just as dirty as the dining area.
Perhaps another location would be better, but this location is not one we'd return to for sure. I think we'll see what the one opening in the Boro is like next time, before we give up hope.

Charged us 4.95 for 1 egg for my son.....asked about it and they said that was the price for 1 egg. We have eaten there tons of time but this will be the last. Sad as this used to be one of our favorite spots for diner type food.

First and last time dining here. The food was not edible. My friend and I ordered a few things to try. The 504 omelet which was sitting in what looked like a bowl of bacon grease. I didn't even taste it because it looked disgusting which my friend confirmed. The biscuits and gravy had 3 different types of sausage, one being hot sausage. It was horrible. The pancakes were pancakes, whatever... we left without eating and went to get breakfast somewhere else. $40 down the drain.  Biggest disappointment meal ever. It was my friends last meal before going to the airport to leave NOLA. The one good star is because the people were nice. Although the lady that took our order saw we were leaving without eating and didn't bother to ask if something was wrong.

New move creates chaos in the kitchen. From salads to entrees to desserts... all very ordinary. My favourite place is no longer... chef should execute simple dishes and not try to become overly "creative". Because it's not working... salads with fried potatoes and pickled carrots with a buttermilk dressing... hmmm only a truly gifted chef could pull this off!  By the way, the space is fabulous with a cool bar on the first floor

I should have left this review 3+ months ago but never got around to it. Great location for me since it's 2 minutes from work/home. Decor is nice and service is very friendly. I had one of my favorite signature Vietnamese dishes, the Bun bo Hue. I can not say I liked it at all. The broth was nothing to write home about and around 10-15 slices of bo chin. It was very difficult to finish it all...it's nice to have more meat than noodles (lol) but maybe some homemade cha, oxtail or pig feet. 

Otherwise, nothing out of the ordinary for a Vietnamese restaurant on their menu. Their coffee was very large but wayy too much condensed milk. It's nice for Americans since we love our large coffees but Vietnamese coffee is an exception. Smaller cups, less condensed milk please. :)

I may come by again but I have a lot of other options (why I moved here) both in Camden county and in Philla. Hope to see some new pictures of a new an improved Bun bo Hue and perhaps some dishes. I'd love to see a well made bun rieu or bun mam.

Came here for brunch one Sunday. Food menu is mediocre. Kids menu is only chicken fingers and what not, no breakfast. Ordered a California Omlet, just okay. Ordered the bottomless peach mimosa for 10$. We were here about 2 hours, and were only barely able to get 4 because of the poor service. It took about 30 mins after ordering each drink to get one. You would think for a brunch menu a "bottomless" item would be plentiful or at least more accessible. The time to receive food, or drink or anything in between was very disappointing! Do not recommend for brunch.

Terrible, even for fast food. The chicken was rubbery, the fries barely room temp. The side of gravy looked curdled, so I changed to the buffalo sauce, which was average. No greeting or thanking from the cashier. Never again.

We bought 2 Reese 'La-Z-Time Full Reclining Sofas' ( over $1000 each) 4 years ago with the RENEW 'leather-like' upholstery and the material is already failing and flaking off the base material, both in the sections that are sat on and on sections that are never touched (top and back of vertical cushions).  Very disappointed in the quality as I consider La-Z Boy furniture to be premium priced. Management at the store were unhelpful.
We do not have pets or smoke.

Resorts always fool you by showing updated rooms all over their listings and then - surprise!Youve been transported back in time. My room was so outdated that I'm positive people who stayed in it are dead now. Worn baby pink carpet, dim lighting, and a 1994 TV is just the start. The wall paper is floral and the artwork is old western themed. In the sink area there are  fake flowers on the wall and gaudy gold hardware. I feel like I'm sleeping over at my Grandma's in the 70s. The faucet gurgled and spit water aggressively when I turned it on. The towels are rough and scratchy. There's an old telephone hanging by the toilet. Everything is reminiscent of a horror movie. It looks like this place was considered upscale a few decades back - but I've stayed in remodeled MGM resorts in Vegas for $100 a night. The only thing that helped my disappointment was that I got a good laugh at the room when I first walked in.

Stay far away from this attorney. He cost my family thousands of dollars and never finished a simple divorce case after two years. He would not answer phone calls for weeks at a time and pushed the case off onto less competent attorneys out of other offices. At times, he did not even show up to court and we would have to reschedule. I made it clear we wanted the divorce to be over quickly, and after two years and thousands of dollars I finally fired him. My next attorney had it finished in a month. The opposing attorney had been waiting on Rue the entire time. He forgot to file motions ending spousal support which ended up costing an arm and a leg. Rue and associates are nothing more than scam artists that milk their clients over time.

I would like to highlight that the specialist David, was magnificent and filled with joy to assist me the first time I came. 

Second visit, the same day looking to exchange my speedy 30 for a 35 that I thought I purchased: As I stand in the store this review is being created. This is legitimately the rudest high end store I've been to. I walk in and spoke to the guard who just starred and didn't respond. . . I then head to the counter to exchange a bag and the specialist didn't acknowledge my presence to let me know that they would be with me momentarily. I felt like a waiting idiot after standing there over 20 minutes.

Overpriced and horrible staff. I've already contacted them but the experience I had was bad and literally ruined my night and the anniversary I was celebrating with my boyfriend. 

Waited over 10 minutes for a reservation (what's the point of a reservation if you can't seat us for that long?). Server Michelle T. Was careless, rude  and did not care about us or anything we needed during the meal. 

Ordered two simple drinks (a cider and a cocktail) waited 15 minutes for them to bring the cocktail to my boyfriend and then am informed that they don't have the cider I ordered. Suggested a new one and asked for a sample. The gentlemen (maybe the manager?) brought it over and said it is suppose to be super dry. It was so dry I think I could of choked. It was so bad and then told him it was horrid. He suggested the Kurant bees and said it was sweet with hints of honey. Got that and it was worst then the sample and read the can label and it says it's suppose to be a super dry beer. Spit it out and then our server said nothing can be done, and then proceeds to fill my drink and overflows it. 

Our food was just okay. I ordered the shrimp Mac and cheese which came with only 4 pieces of shrimp which for $25 is horrible. He ordered chicken which was okay, but he said it was dry and took most of it home because he needed to add ketchup to it. That was $24. Told our sever we wanted to see a manager and she told us they can't be bothered they are too busy and too understaffed. Our bill was $77 and I literally wanted to cry over how much the bill was. I've had bad experiences at restaurants before but this one topped the cake. I don't see myself coming back because it was so bad, and that's coming from me who believes in giving everything a second chance. 

 Being someone that's in the restaurant industry I can honestly say that's never how you treat your customers. You always treat them with respect and they are always right.

I've been eating here about once a month for about a year. They deliver. My last 2 orders just recently were horrible. I don't know if they've changed their oil or the value of their ingredients but it's awful. I had the House Special Rice that I always get and had to spit it out the meat in it was inedible. HORRIBLE! I also ordered an eggroll and the wrapping around it was a strange bright yellow color but I tried it anyway and same thing, I just couldn't eat it.  Crab rangoon, crunchy rolls, yellow dragon roll, fire roll,& house special rice all horrible. We will not be ordering again. Been ordering from them for a while now and it's sad. :(

From their sign outside it talks about the half price appetizers, Coors light for happy hour. I came in to basically order the half price appetizers, not wanting to drink beer right now. I ordered my appetizer and the waiter tells me I have to order a beer in order to get the appetizers half off.... nowhere on the street A Frame sign does it mention this. 

Food, red beans and rice was good, nice and hot. Jambalaya, had great flavor just not warm - tasted more on the cold side, crab cake good flavor, not warm/hot.

The yellow sign is on the street and the white sign is on the inside hallway up against the wall... you would not notice the sign unless you were looking for it. The manager sounded "shocked" when I mentioned that the yellow sign did not have the notice about the beer. I mentioned you may want to put that on the signs. He said, well you can just buy a beer and not drink it, well that would basically be paying full price for the appetizers. The manager really did not care, he simply said, well that is the rule for the special....Pretty deceptive place and not a nice manager!!!

Meh, tried it because it was recommended. But this restaurant is definitely a tourist trap (as someone else on here mentioned). I should've listened to that review because it's very accurate. I had better food in NOLA for MUCH less. Honestly, I wanted to love the food but it just OKAY. We ordered the fisherman fish, Mac and cheese, twice baked potato and oysters. I thought the service was good and the food came out pretty fast.

Something changed, and not for the better.
I have been here many times, and the reason to keep going back...thin, crispy crust, tasty sauce, great cheese..well done. 
Tonight's Pizza..seems like they went next door to Giant and grabbed a few out of the freezer. Doughy, undercooked crust, barely a coating of cheese.  
I hope this is just an off night for them...

Got seated by a cheerful hostess, Mimi, but the server we had (Joe) was being trained and we waited 20 minutes to have our order taken or to be offered water. And that is after I went in to ask if someone was going to come take our order while 3 people were folding napkins in the window behind us. 
My coffee was brought to me, but there was still lipstick from the customer before me I'm assuming on its rim. Ew. Asked for A1 and got an empty bottle. The replacement had to be shaken to get any out had me feeling like I needed to slip the server a $20 to get a real full bottle or something. 
I ordered the skillet and the eggs were so dried out seemingly compensated by an overwhelming abundance of cheddar cheese drenching it to mask the lack of life in the eggs. 
5 minutes after getting our food, our check was dropped off at the table with the "no rush" statement even though it felt premature after having to wait 3 minutes to eat the food in front of me while waiting for A1 to be brought for me to use. 
The skillet was super greasy, the sausage was super sugary so if your looking for a paleo/Keto meal stay clear, and the eggs that were in the skillet were way overpowered by potatoes onions and cheese. 
Service was lacking, food was below par, and I could see this spot being a go to in a moment of savage hunger after bartime. 
Mimi, the hostess, was wonderful the entire time but our server Joe clearly does not enjoy serving or have any customer service skills regardless of being trained to learn this particular restaurants flow. So thanks to Mimi for aiding us in not regretting the entire experience (just 99% of it). 
I would suggest FrogPond or Beverly's for your breakfast needs (worth the drive trust me).

I'm surprised at the amount of good reviews. My girlfriends and I went and none of us liked it. The food is okay at best. I ordered an avocado soup and it came out in the style of a mousse. I did mention to our waitress that they should consider renaming it because it clearly was not soup. Our charcuterie board was some peanuts and some deli meat from publix. One of the girls ordered an old fashioned and she had to return it because she said it tasted nothing like it was supposed to. They had some "entertainment" that was a little questionable. When I think of burlesque, I don't think of trashy stripper. This is no offense to the performer, but again, the restaurant's descriptions were misleading. It all needs help unfortunately.

I was very hesitant in shopping for a car at this place due to recent reviews. But I took a chance.

I got here and I bought a Acura TSX about a month ago. Less than a week, there was issues with the dashboard/intruments not working. The odometer, lights etc was not working. 

we brought it back, they replace the fuse, it worked for a day then it didnt again. So we knew it wasnt the fuse.

Now nothing works again. Its very dangerous to drive since we cant see how fast the car is going or the lights doesnt even work.Instead of helping us, they told us to contact the CEO.

This is just another way of saying, we sold you the car now deal with it yourself.

PLEASE, ANYONE READING THIS do not give this company your money. They do not care about you.

I already told all my army buddies since they are duty here with me not to shop this place. Next step is to inform my blog and all the social media channels not to shop this place. 

They could of atleast afford to help me pay to fix or diagnose the issue somewhere else. But no, thanks for giving us the big hint that we are on our own even though its less than a month of buying this car.

Thank goodness there is a PA lemon law, we are in process of talking to an attorney to get this situated

I've never been to a Schnucks with more  ridiculous long lines than at this store. You'd think they'd figure out that on a busy Sunday they need ALL the registers open, including the self check out lines.

I ordered my food at 6:30pm. Around 7:40pm I call back to see if the person who is delivering left already, the person who is working there (a man) tells me that it'll take longer and gives me an attitude. Will not order from here anymore.

We went to Charlie Palmer for my birthday dinner on 3/24/18 with 9 people. We sat in a private dining area which didn't make for better service. Our waitress was very nice, however everything else was all wrong. My mother ordered the lamb which came out and it was cold. We ordered 4 ribeyes and got 3 and a tomahawk, so my husband had to sit without his food while everyone else ate. Not to mention his hand cut fries came out first which he finished before his steak came.. They confused our orders and I got medium and my brother got his steak well-done and they just switched our plates around. My sister ordered blackened salmon with no skin and she got pan seared with the skin on. I thought the fries were awesome so I asked for an order and they apparently cooked them in the oil from my husband's order because they came out oily and burnt. They offered to make new ones but at that point, so much had gone wrong, I said, no. At the end of our meal they brought our table one of each dessert, which was nice, but we went there for food, not dessert. It was the biggest waist of 700.00 I have ever spent. When I emailed them to tell them about my experience, I never got a response. Honestly, I've had better service at Red Lobster.
Went here about a month ago. Not nearly as tastey as the one on Central. This food had no flavor

Went to Rothman KOP for the first time, after severe exacerbation of longstanding and complex back problems.  Almost immediately, before my visit started,  an x-ray tech told me she wanted to take x-rays, even lthough I told her I brought a new MRI and x-rays from a few years ago.  She proceeded to take x-rays of my spine while in my street clothes, meaning the metal zipper on my high waisted pants would obscure part of the view of my spine.  Standard parameters on the American College of Radiology website state "You will be asked to remove some of your clothes and to wear a gown during the exam. You may also be asked to remove any metal objects or clothing that might interfere with the x-ray images." Afterwards, when seen by the Physician's Assistant, the x-rays they took weren't shown to me or discussed. Only the MRI that I brought was briefly shown to me.  I wasn't asked to change into a gown for an "exam" either, nor was my spine/back examined in any detail.  I was asked to bend forward and backward, sit and lift my legs and push them against the PA's hand, checking for strength or lack thereof.  A test for lack of feeling in my lower legs was done through my pant leg and knee socks, not against my skin.  After this minimal "exam" and after relating my complex history as briefly as possible, the PA said, "So, do you want surgery?"  Really?  I'm supposed to be the judge of when surgery is indicated?  Apparently, saying yes to surgery would have been the only way for me to be seen by the Orthopedic Surgeon, who, in my opinion, should be the one giving me an "expert" opinion as to whether or not I need surgery.  It's one thing to have a preliminary exam by a PA at a physician's office, and it's another thing to rely ONLY on a PA for an exam and treatment of a very complex issue.  From now on I will only go where I can see a board certified Orthopedic Surgeon for my treatment.

I've never written a review before but I felt compelled to share our experience.  I am very disappointed that we spent so much money on such a bad experience.  We won't be coming here again.  We went to The Melting Pot for my very dear friends birthday.  We were not allowed to sit down until our entire party got there and the hostess basically told us to go wait outside.  They finally took us to our table and I had requested a flower to be on the table for her birthday but there was no flower.  The table seemed dirty and the skewers looked like someone had been biting on them.  We have never been there before so we were a little confused as to how to order.  Our waitress seemed irritated that she had to answer questions for us about the menu.  She even acted outwardly condescending almost as if she wanted us to think we were ignorant for not knowing how to order.  An expensive place like this should have excellent customer service.  She was rude and didn't act as if she cared if we were there or not for a special occasion.  We only got our drinks refilled once in 2.5 hours.

We have wanted to go to this place for YEARS and it was completely disappointing.  We had been warned that we will drop some serious cash on the mediocre (at best) food and may leave hungry.  Just that did happen.  We did not even drink any alcohol, our bill was $180 so we spend 220 with tip.  The cheese was runny and not good at all but we ate it because we were so hungry.  Looking back at our night, I would have preferred to have been offered a spoon and a bowl to put my cheese in so it was not so incredibly messy.  More options would have been appreciated.

The way the tables are set up, we had to awkwardly and rudely had keep reaching over our boyfriends to  get some not so flavorful and stale bread and dry veggies.  

The salad looked like someone had just threw some lettuce on a plate and squirted some dressing on it.  Not enough salad or dressing to even tell you if it was decent tasting or not.  The salad was so small that I'm not so sure it should have been considered a salad.

Cooking out own food?  Hmmm.  Well I had not even thought that could have ever even possibly been the case.  We were so hungry by the time we got our food that we put as much on our skewers as possible so our pot was filled with all our skewers and we had to wait 2 minutes for each piece to cook.  Some of the meat you couldn't get on the skewers so you had use your fingers to get the raw meat on it.  I don't even know what to say about that.  I didn't think we were going to be eating boiled meat.  We thought we were going to have a dining and eating experience, not a cooking experience.

We ordered the S'mores chocolate fondue but instead got the marshmallow dream fondue.  We were so hungry, irritated, and exhausted by the whole experience that we just went ahead and ate it so we could get out of there.

We were there for my friends birthday and they did not go out of their way at all to make her feel special at all.  The flower that I was supposed to have paid for would have at least been real nice.  I would not recommend The Melting Pot.  It wasn't in the least bit fancy or very clean, customer service was terrible, food wasn't good.  The website portrays that this restaurant is really fancy.  Maybe the one in Chesterfield is better???

We were driving through Reno and needed a place to stay that was easy to get to. The lady who I made the reservation with over the phone was very nice, however when we arrived we were greeted with a pretty grim experience from start to finish. 
It was about 9:30pm when I arrived and there was a line winding around the reception desk of people waiting to check in (on a Thursday night). It took about 45 minutes for the two desk attendants to get to us. I was exhausted and cranky, sure, but these people were the slowest reception desk people I have ever seen. Meanwhile, I was reading reviews on here that showed bedbugs and it freaked me the hell out. Bedbugs at hotels are my biggest fear. I asked the desk lady if anybody had complained about bedbugs recently. She snapped at me that SHE hadn't had any complaints, but SOMEONE ELSE MIGHT HAVE. uhhhh what?! What does that mean?
Anyway, we were staying in one of the "newly remodeled" rooms which boasted a jetted jacuzzi tub. It was FILTHY. There was old hair and dirt wedged in the jets. Crud lined the knobs and valves. It was gag-worthy and not in the fun drag queen world way. 
I had thought that was the worst until I got to the bed, which was literally loose sheets draped over a dirty mattress pad, and two loose sheets draped over a naked thin duvet. DO THEY WASH IT?! Do they just drape new loose sheets over it? The sheets are so scratchy I die? 
We tried to go to the gift shop, it was closed. Someone who worked at the casino said she "thought" it was 24 hour. Nope. 
There was a team of paramedics helping a drunk man in front of it, though, so maybe it was good they had the room. 
 The cafe, Rosies was the only thing open to get food from. I ordered french toast and then had to leave my husband there alone because it took so long I was starting to lose my mind. I was losing said mind because the light above us kept fading in and out while old diner songs like "wooly booly" played and drunk people tried to eat clam chowder absolutely wasted. Kinda felt like I was trapped in some horrible Twilight Zone casino episode. I had to hear about how my husband ate my french toast alone and I felt bad but also isn't that kind of hilarious? 
Anyway if you want a crazy yelp story, try staying here. I didn't get an infection from the tub, but I kept the water scalding just in case and didn't run the jets.

Made a reservation for 8 PM a week in advance.  Received an email saying it's cancelled for no reason on the day the reservation was scheduled for.  When I called to ask why this happened I wasn't given an explanation and was offered a later time.  Don't know how the food is and the way this was handled will ensure I never will.

I'm really disappointed in the service I received today at Blaze. I decided to order online to skip the line during my lunch break. When I got there I waited for a couple minutes for someone to even recognize I was standing there. I asked for my pizza and the lady said something about the printer being messed up and printed my order twice and it was never made. She said it would take about 5-10min to make another. I waited patiently and just as they were about to put the pizza in they dropped it on the floor so I waited another 15min for my new pizza. When I got it, the pizza was missing toppings and didn't have what I asked. So I waited about 30mins for the wrong pizza. Not happy.

Miguel's is a cute restaurant with nice decor. They have decent food, but nothing to write home about. The salsa wasn't great - it was kind of bland to me and had an odd taste (they use a particular seasoning that my husband and I couldn't put our fingers on). I ordered their house margarita and I don't know what kind of tequila they use, but it made me so sick!! I felt like I was hungover by the time I finished my drink (I only had one) and was hungover all day the following day. The service was awful. It was a busy Friday night, but they were obviously understaffed. It took about 10 minutes for our server to greet us and take our drink order, then another 20 minutes for him to come take our food order. Our food was delivered by a man who I'm assuming was the manager, and we didn't see our server again until he brought us our bill. I was really hopeful since the place is so cute and in a good location, but needless to say, we will not be back.

The manager was only pleasant to certain type of people. We were waiting for service and here comes two guys from some sort of military and the manager right away asked if they needed a drink. Thirty minutes later the manager went to their table to see how their food was. Not once did the manager greeted us and we were right next to those two guys (military). I don't think the manager realizes that all humans that attend the restaurant are equal and we all pay him to be pleasant to everyone. By the way this is Cajun Kitchen Cafe by Calle Real/Goleta.

I'm disappointed with Red Lobster they used took be my go to place now every time I order for pick up they ALWAYS mess it up today no exception. I asked that they put my sauce on the side since how that heard extra sauce which ruined my food 35.00 down the drain
Horrible. I waited in the drive through line for 14 minutes, ordered and paid for one item and received a dollar menu item instead. Avoid this location! Horrible.
The wings came out good, after a long while, understandable.  Ordered two Poké bowls, and we simply did not enjoy them. pricey as well.

Horrible service tonight. I called and was placed on hold. After 19 minutes I drove to the store. Was waited on in person while I was still on hold. By this time over 40 minutes was spent on the phone. I told the cashier what happened and didn't get an apology.

This branch of Dunkin Donuts is FILTHY !!  The staff had no custmers but there was garbage all over the floor..the tables werent wiped and the chairs had ground in dirt so bad that you were scared to sit on them...ewwww!!!

Brings me no happiness to say I think I've had my last sandwich at Mom's. After going there off-and-on for over 10+ years, the fact remains that it just can no longer stand-up to the number of great sandwich shops STL has to offer. 

I was in the neighborhood and hadn't been in a good while. My first thought was "Hmm...But remember how paper-thin their meat slices are?" But thought I'd give them a go for old time's sake. 

I regretted it. 

Flavor, etc. and all was fine on my Mom's Special, but the sandwich is about 8% meat, and the rest bread and Thousand Island sauce. It's just not worth the money at all. I was still rather hungry when I finished it. I think Mom's is surviving on neighborhood nostalgia, luckily for them. But it is not a destination spot for sandwiches this town. They truly need to adapt and step-up to the competition (See: Blues City Deli, Adriana's, Nora's, etc.).

Honestly I visit from Seattle and came with huge expectation of great food and a great experience.  It was a 30 minute wait and you can tell that the workers were exhausted.  My waiter never really tried to make convo he was too busy trying to worry more people coming in after hours.  No on the food I ordered the Creole combo platter which I order with creamed spinach & the jambalaya, red beans & shrimp creole.  The only dish I enjoyed was the shrimp creole, the spinach tasted old & oily and the dessert was disgusting which they called their praline Sunday - it was just not right.  Sad this was my first stop when I touched down in NOLA.  Don't go - don't do it

Made reservations for a table, club was empty and they only have seating outside where there is smoking. When making the reservations they did not inform us of the smoking and people in our party are allergic to smoke or have asthma. They would not accommodate or cancel despite the club being empty. We would've stayed and ordered drinks inside and still made up for the cost of the table while enjoying ourselves, but they refused to refund us. Half our party couldn't join us. Poor standards on their management. Music was good but it's definitely low class as a business. Definitely not worth it.

I really wanted to like this place because Thursday is half price seafood and bubbly night, and that just sounds like it's made for me. Unfortunately, this isn't the place for me. (EDITED: I moved my review of the food itself to the bottom because I think this next paragraph is important enough to talk about before I get into the food). 

Why the 1 star? We noticed that there were a lot of staff walking around. Mostly guys in suits holding drinks and talking to each other while hostesses and servers worked, cleaned tables, etc. You can tell they weren't customers though, because they had badges and they were walking through the back by the kitchen, etc. As we were leaving, a group of them were seated next to a table being cleaned by a female staff member. The guys were very loudly talking about another female staff member in a crude manner (her sexuality, STD's, etc.) It was disgusting and clearly the girl cleaning the table was uncomfortable. Hell, we were walking by on our way out and were extremely uncomfortable. It was rude, disrespectful, and completely inappropriate. I would never come back to a place that condones that behaviour from its staff, let alone its management.


And now, the actual review:

Walking up the stairs to the restaurant, you can start to hear the really loud music. For a place that is going for a romantic vibe, it feels like you're walking into a dance club. The hostess couldn't hear us, we couldn't hear her, and then another hostess came out and tried to also seat us because she couldn't hear her co-worker tell her she was looking after us. I think that's a good sign that your music is too loud.

We were seated in the back half of the restaurant, facing the kitchen window. It really is a beautiful space with big rounded booths, chandeliers and dim lighting. Our hostess dropped an iPad with the drink menu on our table and left. 

Our server came out and again, we couldn't hear him. He offered to ask them to turn down the music for the back half of the restaurant and we were much better after that. So, the Thursday special is half price on any sparkling wine and anything on the menu with seafood in it. We ordered a $20 bottle of Spanish bubbles, the lobster bisque, calamari and the seafood tower. Our total came to about $100.

Everything came out really quick and the server and kitchen staff were great. Technically, the dishes were all spot on. Flavour wise, ehhh. I liked that the bread came with blue cheese - that's something different you don't see at other places. The bisque was more a tomato puree vs a lobster dish. The scallop on it was seared perfectly. The calamari was perfectly cooked, but so bland. Finally, the seafood tower was ok. I don't think it's worth the full price of $84 - was a bit skimpy on some things. You can go elsewhere in town for a much better tower if you're willing to pay full price.

Just OK!
Heavy donuts. The Cinnamon Toast Crunch pieces were stale!
The Boston cream was marginal. Went early would expect fresher donuts.
Will not return!

I did not enjoy my experience here. I would recommend you go to the Brentwood location instead. The doctor who worked this Sunday doesn't seem like he cares at all about you or your well being - only about getting his job over with as fast as possible. I would've gone to another location had I known I was going to be treated so carelessly at this one. Not to mention the major downplay of my situation & the pain I was in. Ugh The disrespect. Never again. I appreciate that I didn't have to pay an arm and a leg like I would've had to at a hospital, but not at the expense of bedside manor & genuine concern. The snacks were great tho! & they have tv in the rooms, woot!

Only giving this place one star because the app won't let me give it less!  They are so disorganized and slow. Used to love coming here and going in the kitschy little shop which now sits mostly empty. What happened?!?!

Food was way over priced I liked the food but I'll never in my life will pay that much for a taco again that was crazy. $50 was just too much for 4 tacos 2 drinks and I'm not an ass so I left a tip, hopefully they change their prices soon. Good food though.

There were 6 of us in our party and no one was happy with their meal.  The gnocchi was crunchy.  My friend was told "that's the way we serve it."  Unacceptable.  The pasta and meat balls lacked flavor.  Our server was only interested in going home and said as much.  He's lucky there was a gratuity already added in because he cerainly would have gotten one from us.  This hotel needs to change chefs.  Don't waste your money here.
Not going back. Not a fan of overpriced restaurants with weak service. Portions were too small and the pickled vegetables were not pickled.

I stopped off for one night before a flight. Location is great, 5 mins to the airport. Make sure you call the hotel for airport shuttle pickup, they don't run on a schedule.

My problems were mainly with the room. The layout of the room is weird; I don't prefer the bathroom being part of the room and covered with carpet. The molding and details of the bathroom look a little dated. 

The biggest problem was the in-window AC. I didn't realize until I was going to sleep but it was terribly loud and ruined my experience. It wasn't keeping the room cold enough and it was so loud, being right next to the bed. I couldn't sleep until I put in earplugs. I wouldn't stay here again because of the AC.

The next morning, breakfast was pretty good actually, but yea, watch out during the summer.

Put it like this.. I can cook all this stuff in my oven with dry spices. 

I don't get it with a professional kitchen and a big ass smoker this restaurants is beyond disappointing.

I had a picture of the girl (K) harassing us who didn't know how to issue a receipt but she complained and yelp took it down. It is not illegal to take pictures of people in public, even at their place of work, I checked with the police when yelp did this before. Kayla messages md with laws and explanations for her rude behaviour but I live with a cop so she's just copying and pasting a lot of stuff. Some more customer service skills would not hurt this girl at all. 
Anyways, I ordered a bustier online for Halloween and paid for it, they said it was at West Edmonton Mall in the changing room for pick up. 
The girl in the change room handed me the bag with receipt stapled to it and told me I couldn't try it on. I told her that, yes I can try it on and I did. 
When it didn't fit, I went to get a different size but as soon as I stepped foot out of the changing room, another girl (k) stopped me and said she needed to scan my purchase, I said 'it's paid for' and I need another size, she still wanted to scan it and I asked her to please let me try another size then we'll deal with the scanning. She kept following me.  
The other size fit, so I took the purchased one with receipt and the one that was the size I needed to the cashier. 
The 'scanning girl' (K) followed, and said she refunded the original purchase and to make a new purchase with the one that fit, which makes sense, except When I asked for a receipt for proof of refund, she said 'it does not exist', she would not provide any proof that the original purchase was refunded. So, after listening to her patronize me for a while, I asked her to write that the item was returned and refunded on the original receipt. I was not rude, and I think it was a fair concern and request on my part. She wrote it while rolling her eyes at me. 
It's too bad my daughter spends so much money here on this embarrassingly overpriced store, because I have never come across a pleasant salesperson. 
K just let us shop please. Lay back a little.

Tucker's used to be My favorite steakhouse, and the twelfth street location was my favorite Tucker's.  But something went very wrong.  My absolute fav has been the sirloin... spiced right and very tender.  Tonight, I got the 20 oz sirloin and it took a little longer than usual.  My first bite was disappointing.  It was not hot and was very VERY grisly.  I sent it back to get it warmed up.  A few bites on one end was tender as I remember, but pretty much 80% of the remaining piece of meat was riddled with gristle.  I'm taking it home and braising it.  Maybe it'll turn into a half decent pot roast... as a steak, it missed the mark.  

What happened to you Tucker's Place?  Now I have to find a different steakhouse.

I would like to start with stating that this is my first ever yelp review and I downloaded the app and created an account to write this. The food is really delicious but the service is the worst I have ever received. The service is extremely slow, ineffective and oblivious. It took over an hour for us to be seated, I understand waiting but when we got upstairs they clearly have a bunch of staff congregating extremely loudly taking up 3 tables (this is a third of their seating). The whole set up of the upstairs is completely inefficient, if they want to be successful and maximize sales remove the pointless seating area and you can add a minimum of 3 tables. I have been a few times as the food is so great but I will never come again although it's super close to home because the service is so poor and simply frustrating.

Seats uncomfortable and cupholders were filthy.  Family of 6 ordered ONLY 6 sodas 45 mins before start of movie. Made 2 trips looking for them while just before start of movie, while staff stood outside almost empty theater doing nothing.  Movie interrupted twice during last 20 mins wanting to close check.  Mens room out of order when leaving and instructed to just go through mall.
I've been to this place twice just to give it a second chance. Food was blah... find somewhere else to go.

It's a chain... what do you expect? 

I sat at the bar for dinner. Service was slow, but the place was packed. I order chili, it was horrible. I had a fillet ($27) with broccoli, which were decent, but the waitstaff kept screwing up my order. I asked for butter and did not get it, then asked again and did not get it, on the third try I finally got what I needed. It took 10 minutes, by which time I had eaten most of my dinner.

Will I be back? Only if I have to.

This review is a critique of the service department, I had a good experience w/ their sales department from whom I purchased the vehicle in question.
Had regularly scheduled maintenance performed on a Toyota Highlander today and about 15 to 20 minutes after driving off the lot, my check engine light & a VSC code popped up on my dash. These warnings have never appeared before today. Did my due diligence researching the web to save me another trip to their lot and determined there were too many possibilities so I called back the service department & spoke w/ the gal who checked me out this morning and asked if it might be something simple I could fix myself, a loose vacuum hose, bumped sensor etc... if perhaps a suggestion by the serviceman would be possible...Nope. I was told, and this is almost a quote "Well...since it's a Toyota & we're a Chevrolet Dealer, we would have to have you run to the Toyota dealership to have that looked at...can I help you with anything else?..."
Thanks for the zero effort, Megan.

Highway Robbery one word.

When we call them, they said its $ 49.00 for service call. The guy came for service call name was David. He checked inside and outside may be 15 min at max. Then he finds problem in thermostat. So, I asked him how much he said $ 185.00............I say WTFFFFFFFFFFFFFF. You are worst than other company (Universal AC ) who ripped us off 1 month ago for same problem, at least they put 2 gallon Freon ( Hopefully they did) At last the David said its $ 139.00 and you will get 1 more service call for free which includes 2 gallon of Freon. Why the fkkkkkkkk they charge so much for lying and false advertisement. Please avoid this two companies( Universal AC & Velocity AC)
Good food with TERRIBLE service.   The service was so bad that they comped the dessert and the waitress forgot one of the desserts.   I would think twice before coming back again!

One of my worst dining experiences in years. Ordered sodas and teas with our appetizer. The stuffed mushrooms were hiding underneath a huge glob of cheese. While the plate and cheese was hot, the mushrooms were barely room temp. My wife's salad and daughters shrimp Alfredo were served 10 minutes before the other 2 dishes! I finally received my Stromboli. It looked flat and unimpressive. As soon as I cut into it, the oil covered my plate. I took one small bite and it was bland and extremely greasy. Server offered a new one but I refused and helped my wife finish her anti pasta salad. Mother in law ordered lasagna and she shared with me. It was hot outside but the pasta was cold! Obviously frozen then thawed. Waitress took my tea for a refill and never brought it back. While the server was nice, she said she told the cook that he "was screwing up her tip." She should have told the cook he was screwing up a family dinner. We will never be back. And I will definitely others about our bad experience. This place has gone downhill.

Let's just a mice ran across the floor. the host said "it's ok! it ran into the trap" and then said "I open the door to let in some air and I guess that's how it got in." No No No if this was true you wouldn't  have traps! They know they had a mice problem and that's not all the cook want to the restroom and didn't wash his hands! Ewwwwwwww!

This is my worst experience with a dispensary. I am not going to mix words . birthday gift means gift you thugs.not only did it take 30 min for two preroll.you know I have been using this place for 3 years never again. I am looking for a place to get my meds. I am just done.
Very unwelcoming patrons. Never been to a gay bar so intimidating and unfriendly. No women in this bar

We have lived here for 16 years, have gone to Design for Vision for at least 10+ years in Newtown.

Not sure what happened to the previous staff, who were friendly, happy and went above and beyond.  But our experience with them over the last year is horrible.  Walked in the other day and there was a 13 year old answering the phones.  ??  I will no longer be going to this store.  Such a shame

ups store in audubon, pa franchise owned by mr. asghar shahzad - if i could score them zero stars i would!  we had a return pkg that amazon told us to ship via dhl to california.  the merchant ***told us it was a **dhl** shipping label***.  my husband dropped it off at mr shahzad's ups store; he allowed him to drop it off there without verifying it was a dhl shipping label ****in their computer system**** before my husband left the store!!! 

mr shahzad's desire to make more money from other customers was more important than his personal integrity!  

now, we have to go back to his store and pick up the package to have it shipped using a more economical shipper. (which ups should revoke from him, because of poor ratings- and i am not the only one- on yelp four other customers rated him poorly!) 

i offered, because of his poor customer service, to split the $12.98 shipping fee, but his greed was more important- he just couldn't let go of $6.00.   oh and he hung up on me in the middle of a conversation!  he didn't pick up when i called back, so i called again using *67, so he couldn't see it was me calling again.  then he lied about hanging up on me.  

i hope ups pulls this franchise from this greedy selfish business owner.  i will be reporting this horrendous experience with ups store corporate office as well.  

do ***not*** patronize this ups store!  

horrible customer service!!!
The AC is leaking on our table and they don't want to move us. I can't believe this is happening in the evening.

Are they lazy or stealing everything from our bags?  30 minutes and we are all still standing here waiting for luggage for flight 17 from Houston!
Southwest Sucks!

This is the "carafe" of Pinot you get for fifteen dollars. The waiter did inform us when we ordered that a "glass" was 5 oz and a "carafe" was 8 oz. so we were forewarned. Chicken Caesar Salad was okay but overpriced as expected.

Doing an Amazon return I entered the empty store on Saturday. Gave the guy a package and was retrieving QR code from my email on my cellphone. Guy asked me to log into my email on their computer and told me there's a credit card reader on the side. Sat at the computer and noted that you have to pay to play. By the time I got up there was a line at the counter. Told the guy that he's going to do this according to the instructions I received and scan the QR code on my phone. He loudly responded "That's a QR code" in a condescending tone. Finally scanning it and giving me a drop-off receipt, I left. I'm still really bothered by this. Wonder if other locations are trying this scam. I'l never know because I'll ship from work or use the US Postal Service from now on.

Sad to see a once vibrant neighborhood club mismanaged right into the ground ......
Hopefully one day they'll make an effort to bring back their lost clientele.
2 stars is all I have to say about that. It wasn't great, the gyros weren't my jam. Won't go back.

Well I used to think highly of this YMCA. Everyone used to be so nice and friendly. Being new to TN it was refreshing to find people so nice. Then last Tuesday happened. As I was working out, a buddy of mine and his son whom have a family of 7 (all members) for the last 15 yrs, were working out as well. My buddy came over to give me a few technique pointers on my bench press. When not too long after a woman whom was working out looked at my buddy and said "your lucky your not shot". He looked around and said "me" she said "you should be shot" Called him by his last name and then called him a "crook".
