To think in this given day and age with shootings that someone would even say something like that Is appalling to me. I went and complained to Marlene the Manager on duty. She had me point out the woman and immediately came to her defense as an upstanding member prior to even speaking to her. My buddies and I were then treated like we did something wrong. We were asked to go to a back room so the threatening member could leave. Meanwhile we were never threatening in any way. We were then forced to go to a back room for her protection. Weird feeling to be treated like a threat when someone else out of the blue makes such outlandish comments. We felt the need to contact the police and file a report since this lady knew who my buddy was by name without him knowing her. Police arrived then Marlene kicked us all out to deal with it. Even the police. Turns out this was a business dealing where she wasn't satisfied from 15 yrs ago. Well i sure hope this woman doesn't have an agenda to be an active shooter at the Y given she's still bothered by something 15 yrs ago and clearly doesn't understand what our society is dealing with by her comments. Sad!! At the Y of all places. Also handled very poorly by management.

This place is not all that. I had better breakfast for cheaper at other places. 3.99 for a small glass of warm hand squeezed orange juice that's not refillable completely blew me ... the servings are really sparse but they are packed and get through customers pretty quick. Moreover the waiters/waitresses are pretty nice but wouldn't go out my way to come here again .

I want to love this place so bad!  It's a super nice bar on the inside.  They were supposed to be serving sushi on the top floor untill 11.  However, at 10:30 the kitchen was already closed and cleaned up.  When .I told the bartender that o was told food was available until 11pm her answer was so was I.  Apparently they weren't going to be doing anything about it.  

I had one of the specialty drinks.  The bartender walked around for 5 min asking people who to make it.  Got the same drink upstairs and it was comoletlco different.  If they have recipies for their specialty drinks I don't think they are being followed.  

There was great live music downstairs on the 1st level, but they didn't even have a decent DJ on the upper levels where people can dance.  

I understand they are new and there are going to be growing pains, but I was floored by the the no chalantness and lack of service.  I am hoping to update this post soon to tell you how amazing it is next time I go.

The interior was nice and the calamari appetizer was decent, but unfortunately, I've now used up all the nice things I had to say about Senae Thai. Our mains (kang pāk and karee gai) were bland and not very hot (heat-wise) when they arrived at our table. They also weren't very hot spice-wise. The karee gai was supposed to be a spice level 2 on a scale of 1-4, and the kang pāk was supposed to be a spice level 4. The former wasn't spicy at all, and the latter was only moderately spicy. Neither dish was seasoned well, either, and it took almost 10 minutes of trying to make eye contact with our server to get some salt at the table. Service was average.

My locked mail box was broken into 4/2/18. The door is bent open.  Mail was left in it the next day. I put a hold on my mail for 4/4/18 to 4/14/18. I called the post office the next day to complain about the post person leaving mail in a broken box and to get it fixed. I was told a work order will be put in. 4/9/18 mail was again left in my box. I have a hold and the door is still broken. Both times my mail was written on "box not secure". Hello!! That is why I put a stop on the mail and requested the door to be fixed. I'm going to have to extend the hold as the box is still not fixed as of tonight 4/11/18. I tried fixing it myself by bending it back but now the lock isn't working good so I left it alone. It wasn't until then that I realized how cheap these secured mail boxes are. I really thought they were a heavy metal. Not something I could bend so easily.
My other complaint with the mail person is they often leave my outgoing mail in the box. I make sure it is to the back of the box with the postage showing.
I often get mail for an apt that doesn't exist. I write return to sender, this apt doesn't exist and the mail person doesn't take it half the time. I have to put pink sticky notes on it before they take it. 
I have never had this kind of mail service until I moved to this address.

Just had the worst experience ever. Went through the wash after waiting an hour which is understandable because of the snow but the wash stopped half-way through and pushed me through to the end without washing the car.  the "boss" was very rude and literally yelled at me about the process. I pay 30$ per month for unlimited washes and no where does it say 1 wash per day. It says unlimited all over the place. I expect a call from the owners, as a business owner myself I know the importance of having a powerful SEO appearance and satisfied customers. What a joke

Owners Call me 804-814-4700.

Reached out and said they contacted me and never did. I reached back out to them... said they need the exact day and and time of my purchase... lmao months later you want me to recall a the exact day of crap experience. Then they say they need my card number and or name I provide.. no response terrible customer service. Smelly and crappy establishment. Run piss poor.
yummy fried chicken and yummy corn fritters....A ok it is...we requested for dark meat but was turn down , thats a bad  sign of customer service satisfaction .....

Terrible experience at this location. Very used to going to the other location on Veterans and having lots of options. We ordered frozen watermelon margaritas that came out on the rocks. We were informed that only strawberry and mango were in the machine. I don't totally understand not being able to add any flavor to a regular frozen margarita. Our server didn't tell us any of this until we received the drinks and were also inviting over that we could not change our drink choice. We were both disappointed with not having the frozen drinks we intended to and on top of that whatever they use for the watermelon flavor is sour for some reason. 

We ordered our food. The queso was the best part but every other aspect was underwhelming. Personally, I ordered a single enchilada and quesadilla, both items looked like I made them at my house (not even slightly restaurant quality), my friends decried beans were an abnormal color. I also ordered a 2 oz guacamole from my server after much conversation about sharing or not sharing at the table - I thought the guacamole I was given was a little large but I didn't think much of it. 
After waiting 30 minutes to get our check after our server picked up some of our plates and proceeded to roll silverware, my check was wrong. I asked my server why the 2 oz guacamole was $7 and the appetizer $5? She told me I didn't order that side portion, which is the second instance of her not fully listening to what we ordered. They ended up taking it off. The server came back to the table to ask which card was mine and then still charged the wrong card. Just skip this place and go to the one on vets.
Terrible service and worse food. And expensive for what you get. Not coming back. Everything Alex ordered they were out of.

Very disappointed! Waited 45 minutes for breakfast and it was cold! My husband's poached eggs were hard, my potatoes were burnt and the onions still crunchy and the eggs benedict was drowning in hollandaise. Had read reviews and gave it a try. Should have gone to Skidders as planned, never had these issues there.

I wish I could give this restaurant a 0. This is the worse restaurant we have ever been to and we eat out 3 - 4 times a week.  The pasta is out of a box and I could cook Mueller's boxed pasta and it would taste better. The pistachio lemon caper butter sauce was served cold and when I sent it back I was told this was the way it was supposed to be served.  The lettuce served for the salad was what I throw away. The salad consisted of arugula  and a vinegrette dressing. Wow, not a great start. They asked me if I wanted cheese on my pasta and I said yes, expecting real cheese. They brought out a bottle of dried Parmesan cheese in a shaker bottle. Not fresh grated and they didn't even offer to shake it on our pasta. The roasted potatoes were just potato wedges. We were expecting roasted potatoes. And to top it off both of us got sick when we got home. Again, the worse restaurant we have ever been to. Stay away!

Unreliable and poor customer service.  Called this morning and was given a time frame of 12-4 pm.  Wiated the entire time for someone to show up.  Never showed up because they said they called and didn't get an answer so they decided I must not be available and they took another emergency job. Never came to the property. Never said that they would be calling to confirm someone would be there or would not show.  Could not have cared less about the inconvenience and waste of my time when I called  Their only solution was that I could wait another four hours tomorrow.  No thanks.

The food here is typical Chinese buffet fare: meh. Our most recent visit, though, had our waitress haggling with me over the tip (?!). There are perfectly serviceable Americanized Chinese alternatives every quarter mile around here: Pick any one of them.

Over priced inferior furniture. I purchased a sectional sofa covered with blended leather. Less than three years later, fabric is peeling away. Total junk! I went to store to complain about it, lady called me back and said there was nothing she could do,sofa was out of warranty.
Better products at Rooms to Go at half the price.

Thanks the owner:
You don't deserve one star, it's just the lowest I can grade you and write a review. We stopped in for desert before a movie with our children and obviously you, or your staff, were too put off to offer decent service. Keep in mind our expectation were not high; however, we did expect par service. You, or one your staff rolled their eyes when we placed our drink order. After returning with the drinks, we asked if you had cups for kids. The response was "No" as this person walked away. 

Maybe that's the reason your establishment is empty and the one across the street is mostly full. Treat your patrons better and you business will thrive. Good luck.

As suspected, it was overpriced and not very good. I felt the same about it last time I went in2012. But my family insisted on going again. At $55 per person for dry, mediocre food, I'm pretty sure none of us will be back. $23 (after tax and tip) for a dry backed half a chicken? No thanks. Service was friendly.

If I could I'd rate this place no stars. Kim the "manager" was horrible to us, not to mention hung up on us on the phone. Request someone else if you go there. She wasn't a proper waitress, took food away from my fiancé as she was still eating.
Surprised with all of the five star ratings. Are upstairs. The food was below average. Nachos had cheese wiz on them. Pulled pork not hot, ribs had dry rub. Potato salad was ok.

This place is just way too busy, and expect to stand in line for at least 1 1/2 hour. I like going to TJ Maxx because they have amazing deals and the prices are just unbeatable but it's just too packed in there whenever you go! If you go before 12pm on weekdays there's not enough employees at the register. Also, the racks and floors are just a huge mess because of how busy this location it is maybe they need to open a new location.

Overhyped brunch place compared to rest of the city. The food is bland and really has no culinary twist to it. Patachou and petit Chou also give very poor portions in regards to price. Everytime I'm back in town I always have the urge to retry this venu yet it never lives up to its hype. 

Although in regards to service the Resteraunt does well and is able to handle crowds.

Seriously though. One of the rudest schools I have ever been to. From the massive amount of disorganization to laying blame on the students. From the nasty outwardly rude library staff ( ask for help at your own risk) down to the rude front desk people. Many fine Upstanding teachers. Absolutely. But many here are angry bitter acting staff. That being said I wish everyone who decides to enter through these doors Goodluck and seriously god bless.

The fact that this place is under a new owner or manager obviously hasn't helped it.  I should have paid more attention to the last review by Darcia and stayed away but, because we live so close, we wanted to give it a chance.  What a mistake!  I ordered the Buttermilk Fried Chicken and voiced my disappointment before I could even taste it.  It arrived at our table with what looked like a nice, crispy coating on top but, on closer inspection, was "swimming" in the oil from the sautéed spinach with bacon that came on the side.  Wouldn't someone be smart enough not to make crispy fried food a soggy mess before it even gets to the table?  The mac and cheese that was also served with this dinner was only mediocre.  My husband had a burger that he also considered so-so and thought that the side of mayonnaise he asked for was just awful.  The onion rings that came with his burger were great but certainly not enough of a reason to even return.

My point exactly, the first time I ordered I went through no such thing as "age verification." The second time, all of a sudden there's "age verification." I have 0 issue with verifying an age but at LEAST be consistent. 

I highly recommend you listen to that phone call along with every other call that resulted in a scam complaint on here because according to Yelp out of 193 reviews 112 are 1 star and 18 2-3 stars - you CLEARLY have a problem with your "business" practices. 62% of your reviews are negative, that should say enough about the company you run and you should be ashamed. I've dealt with people like this and I do not take kindly to this given I've seen what it can do to someone who really doesn't understand what's going on. The fact that the evidence shows you have 0 remorse for stealing money from people makes me sick. You know that even if you can trick 1 out of 3 you're good. Hope you sleep well at night. 

Again, I will NEVER order from this place again and I certainly plan on spreading to word to every ear that will listen to me and every cigar shop him or I step into.

See for yourself - a true scam artist has its own reddit thread 

https://www.complaintsboard.com/thompson-cigar-b120486

https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.resellerratings.com/amp/store/Thompson_Cigar_Thompson_and_Company_of_Tampa

https://www.google.com/amp/s/amp.reddit.com/r/cigars/comments/1ka9ir/scam_alert_thompson_cigar/#ampf=undefined

I got the Iced latte and it was not what I was expecting. They gave it to me in a slush form and it did not taste like coffee either. For a panini, I got the Tuscany, and it was not bad! Not a big wow factor and it was more on the expensive side for a small panini sandwich. Overall, not necessarily what I expected at a Cafe.

I think I got a bad batch, probably my fault for going right before closing. What made it worse was the business owner treating me like my opinion was just wrong. I really want yo try it again, but I can't get over this experience. 

To be clear, I had two other people try my food when I got it and they all agreed it tasted saltier than the ocean.

There isnt anything true NY about this pizza. It's a close imitation but the flavor isn't there. The crust is a good attempt but falls short. Being from the Tristate area it's as close to home as I can find in Reno but there is plenty of better choices in Reno that put their own twist to pizza.

Oh Luke, I'm sorry to write this review because I am such a fan of yours!l. First time to Nashville and least favorite restaurant I've been too.  I gave 2 stars because it's only been open a short time.  Seated right away and that was the best part.  Beer was luke warm and when my husband asked for a cold glass, had to wait for "plastic" glass to arrive because they were chillin.  Couple with us got pizza and they enjoyed that, my husband got hot chicken salad.  Very small salad with cold chicken! Told waitress and she brought a small very hot plate with a very small amount of warm chicken.  I had house salad, which was bigger than my husbands salad, asked for blue cheese dressing and got ranch.  Small things but they were not busy and we were 1 of 3 tables our waitress had.  2 beers, a soft drink, water and 3 entrees and she screwed up the ticket!  Sorry but a real disappointment.

John Fogerty & ZZ Top - Blues & Bayous Tour
Coachman Park
June 2, 2018 7:00 PM

The lines to get beverages from the vendors were insane. 
1. First line: (10 min) The ID line to prove you were 21 to get a wristband.
2. Second line: (15 min) to buy tickets for beer/water/soda. Beer 12oz = 7 $ water/soda 3$
3. Third line: (20-30 min) To get beer (warm draft).

So 2 drinks for Fogerty means I missed an hour of the show... I then just got back in line to get drinks for ZZ Top.  Another long wait. Volume was pretty low for a rock concert also. I like the bands, but honestly the girl scouts selling cookies in front of Publix do a better job of supply and demand. I guess they just wanted to prevent the crowd from getting anything even close to a beer buzz. The bathroom lines were non existent thanks to limited beverages.
Bottom Line: Venue either caved to pressure to limit beverage sales or it was amateur hour. Music was good but could have been louder.

Always a good place to get get fresh vegetables at the Maverick section, talk to the vendors slinging their wares, enjoy a cup of coffee in the food court and listen to Stefan rocking the 50s through   80s and of course Motown. You pay to park and you pay to use the restrooms.

How can I review something I didn't get? Abruptly put on hold by some rude twit at 7:52 pm on April 2, 2018. Left on hold for nearly 10 minutes and then she came back on only to hang up without taking my order.
Out of most cookie options for toppings . Environment toxic. No sneeze guard for toppings. Will not recommend.

The noise was almost deafening with a full restaurant.   They need some noise canceling architecture, wall art or something.   While the service was excellent, the food tasty,  the portions are extremely small and the cost as high as NY or San Francisco.  We split everything, so a salad, appetizer, entree and 3 glasses of whine was $115 plus tip.  Each glass of sine was $16. Would it cost them so much to make a decent size portion?  When they split the salad, it looked like a small handful of green.  The mussel appetizer was around $19 and somewhere around 10 mussels. Won't be back.

Costal spine was a horrible experience for me.Dr Deuch fused my spine and 1 year later I'm in as much disabling pain if not worse than in the beginning. I will not go back there anymore. Refused to give script for pain because he can't bleed my insurance anymore and I won't go back to them. It's all about the money. Not the pain I'm in. I wouldn't recommend to my enemy 
THEY ARE INSURANCE SUCKING LEACHES also screwed up closing me up because the went in thru the front and twisted my Bowel so they had to go back in OMG BUTCHER SHOP AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE

They refuse to see you without you giving your social security number on the phone before an appointment is made. This is not necessary for billing. I have insurance. They claim this is policy and won't budge. Beware!

Zero parking unless you have one car. Heard gun shots on more than one occasion, confirmed by scanner. Saw drug deals happen at the lake. Found hypodermic needles in the parking lot. Very small apartments for the price. Someone defecated in the pool, I told management. They never closed the pool to have it cleaned. Neighbors are either elderly or young people who are never home. Do not recommend for families with children. Great for single, professionals or college students.
Oh hey, Sonic. Don't claim to be 24/7 of no one responds. Thanks for leaving a hungry driver to be hungry.
The staff judges u and makes fun of u. There mote is no judgement. That is bull crap. I will never go back there again.

Omg! They have the worst customer service! The products are great so far but trying to get help is challenging and then paying is like the worst experience. If u get up front or run into Gigi just turn the opposite direction or wait for another register. It's like talking to the wall. She acts like she is annoyed that she has to ring up ur items.  Oh, and if u should need a manager. Avoid Rei.. I would explain but it's not worth the time. It's a same the CS sucks. They could easily staff the place with better employees. Their are some there that are great but not many.

Worst customer service department ever.   Over the past 4 months I made numerous calls and at least 5 trips to Reedman to resolve 3 issues related to my 2015 Jeep Grand Cherokee, which only has 48,000 miles in almost 4 years.  My issues included rust on the hood, a loose steering wheel and a recall.  I also made or received numerous calls from Jeep Chrysler customer service, who also had communication issues with Reedman and indicated their service was so poor that my file would be flagged for higher level review by Jeep 

At one point, Reedman was to take pictures of the rust and submit it to Jeep for approval to repair.   This was to take 3 or 4 days to get approval.  After weekly calls to Reedman, I learned from Jeep customer service after 4 weeks, the claim and pictures were never submitted.  Reedman eventually admitted after weeks of claiming it was in process that the employee who took the pictures no longer worked there and never submitted anything.    I was then required to take off from work again and return to Reedman.   Of course when I showed up the guy who told me when to come back was not in.  The service manager handled the situation personally, but again 3 days turned into 10 days and I had to call myself to get any information 

When I took the Jeep to be repaired, I was told the hood would be replaced and it would be done in 2 days.  4 days later I got my Jeep back but the rust was repaired not replaced. The answer was, I was one of the 10% of hoods that could be fixed rather than repaired.  At this point, I plan to take the Jeep back one more time as the paint job is awful   Let's hope they get it right this time.      

My experience with the other issues was equally poor and frustrating but I'm tired of writing and wasted enough of my time.   My next move is to trade the Jeep somewhere else and never buy from Reedman again.   

Good luck if you choose to buy and service your car at Reedman

Went today for the first time.
Ordered Pani Puri, Dahi Sev Puri, and egg burji for eating in the restaurant itself.
We weren't satisfied with Pani Puri and Dahi Sev Puri.

Have never seen anyone serving onions with potato chana mixture for Pani Puri.

Dahi Sev Puri was kind of ok but not appealing.

Egg Burji was good. Wishing they could serve a better option in toast instead of only white bread though that's the normal way to serve.

Then, ordered Daal Baati, Dabeli, and Vada Paav to go.

The Baati in Daal Baati was very dry and thick. We had to use a knife to cut it into pieces. It was still thick and hard even after dipping and soaking it in Daal.

Both Dabeli and Vada Paav were kind of ok but not appealing to taste as per the normal taste other restaurants serve.

There were many people coming in to eat or placing orders to go. We think it's good food for non-vegetarians as we overheard most people placing non-vegetarian food.

Also, many people were just coming in the beer store next to it.
That part of the store seemed kind of ok but still both the restaurant and store needs some maintenance and upkeep.


At the moment, we won't be going back there for sure unless we feel like trying it after a few months or so.

I have been there twice recently and cannot figure out the pricing system. Everything seems to have some kind of lot number on it. No one offered to help me nor were there signs saying ask at desk for pricing. Since I tend to buy multiple items I can't imagine asking someone how much something is 1/2 dozen times. How difficult can it be to price stuff? I won't be back. I don't understand this business model at all. Do they just make up prices on the spot?

I'd give it a zero star rating, if I could. Was waiting to be seated, ordered while waiting since she was trying to get our order in. Another couple came in, they got sat in the table promised to us. No biggie, but then the food goes out to them while we ordered 40 minutes BEFORE them, and were waiting for about an hour total for our food. Needless to say, my fiance grew fed up and we decided to walk out... never will return. A waste of an hour! Place was super tiny and packed.... Dont waste your time!
paid for interior & exterior wash... looks like they forgot to do the interior or just did a piss poor job... looks like just a light vaccuming didn't touch anything else

We went to Isaac Newton's for a farewell party. I'd been there only once, years ago. Last night the service was very poor and the servers were very rude. For example, when I told my bartender that my beer didn't taste right, he gave me a dirty look instead of offering to make it right. That is not good customer service. I'd never go back again.

My husband and I have been coming here for pedicures for a couple of years,with good results, then I have a manicure, the past couple of times the girls have been so rude, Saturday June 30 I had a girl that was so rough bending my fingers till they hurt and  yanking on my arm,while one hand was in the dryer and a nail  smudged, she got so angry she yelled at me showing her anger,, ranting to a co worker in her native tongue, I am sure it was about me,,how rude is that,? It was then I decided we were not coming back , I paid her ..tipped her very little and left ,,these girls need to polish up on their manners  and be professional ,learn English also. The men in the shop are very polite  and nice,, we will miss EZ Nails  but this is not the way to treat a good customer..

Great place if you're into beer but that's not why I'm leaving a review. I went last night and sat at a table facing the kitchen. I noticed the staff being extremely unhygienic and it really grossed me out. I didn't order food after I saw the staff not wearing gloves after using plenty of things that would contaminate the food.
I know it's an airport... but come on. Food was horrible, waitress was not good with her communication skills, rude undertones.

The decor was nice, the wait staff was nice, however the food was quite disappointing and nowhere near lived up to its hype on these reviews. For a $27 (small) plate of pasta, it tasted as if the chef dropped it out a frozen bag that you get at the supermarket. Will not be going back! So sad since we love staying at the Peppermill and we have yet to find a decent dinner in this hotel.

4 star average? It doesn't seem possible. I used to travel to Germany with some frequency, so I feel that I'm quite familiar with how German food is served in Germany, and this is not even close. I knew we were in trouble when the Wiener Schnitzel came out immediately after we ordered. As in any good restaurant, a dish such as Schnitzel should be prepared when ordered. What we got had been clearly prepared in advance and was probably sitting under a heat lamp. Tough, dried out, and tasteless. Yuck! Schweinshaxe should be a guilty pleasure: moist if not greasy meat falling off the bone. What we got looked good, but it was not cooked properly (or it just plain sat too long). The meat was dense and dry - how can that even be possible given how fatty that part of the pig is.

The service was fine, but it was telling that the waitstaff didn't even blink when they took our 1/4 eaten meals away - they must see that a lot.

Could be a decent spot with the giant TV but the service and the prices aren't very good. Bartenders aren't very personable and they get swamped with less than a full bar. Food is uninspiring and overpriced. Won't be back unless somebody else is buying lol
Other posts about this property are on target. Dated, musty rooms. Inexpensive, but there are better options in the area.

This would be a better food truck concept. Ordered avocado, shrimp and eel rolls, they were meh. I was hungry. No water for customers to purchase only sugary soda. And I don't think any running water either, because the gentleman running the cash register and handling money did not wash his hands before making our food. My husband asked if he could cut our roll and the response was "I don't have a knife." Which left me wondering "How DID you cut those avocados?" Don't think this place will last very long unless they step it up or change their to the "sushi burrito!" It's clearly not a sushi place.

What a disappointment, I order 5 large pies for my daughters 5th birthday party. Placed the order to be delivered at 2:15, they showed up to the location at 12:30 and were told that the delivery wasn't expected til 2:15. They then delivered at the correct time, but rather than making new pizzas they delivered the same ones. The pizzas were old and Luke warm. When I called, the owner said she would send new pizzas. Soon after, the delivery driver came back to collect the bad pizzas but did not have the replacements. When I called the store again the owner yelled at me and said she would send new pizzas. I told her I didn't want them and I'd prefer a refund, at which point she said I was the biggest B*%#! she had ever done business with and then hung up on me. Needless to say I will NEVER order from this establishment again.

I went to the ER for bad headaches and other problems. Waste of time unless you're dying!! I sat in there for 6 hours+ just to get pee taken, blood and a ultrasound. That may sound like a lot but it wasn't at all. The nurses were just having a good time while sat there. I understand that these things take time but the fact that had to get up twice and request my withdrawal papers‍ BIG NO.

Edit.. i was dehydrated!(they didn't tell me that) They did the most and gave me a ultrasound so they could make me pay more. Pieces of..

The food was amazing. But the customer service sucks. Don't know if I want to pay $50 for food and get the worst service possible. They are fighting over who's job it is to fill the ketchup. My son just needed ketchup. I really didn't care who's job it was just wanted 2 packets of ketchup. The girl at the register was a little too much as well.

Over a year later and the gift certificate the owner promised on more than one occasion to make my visit right never showed up. I just kept getting excuses then nothing at all. It's really a shame because my meal was very good. The issue we had with the bill and the ridiculous over charging makes me not want to go back.

Poorly signed - keep making changes and do a bad job of letting people know of changes - here every month and they do not seem to want to keep business travelers happy - now have an out of the way tram to take you far away to rent a car. That's planning at it's worst- avoid at all costs

It took an hour and a half to get our food and we came at 6:15. The server/bartender when asked about getting sour cream and he said a tube of it would be a dollar. I said to him after we had to wait and hour and a half for food, he said yes. "It's made fresh. This isn't Taco Bell." Food wasn't out of this park great. Bartender never asked us if we needed anything else or asked if we wanted another drink. Horrific experience with him.

The service was great-- LOVED our waitress who was so cute and attentive and our chef who was fun and generous.  Food was very delicious but definitely heavy on the seasoning, sodium, and BUTTER...probably consumed a whole block of butter by the end of dinner, that's why the food was so delicious.  The drawbacks...the meal overall was very expensive and the inside of the restaurant was just gross-- the place really needs a refresh.  Old nasty carpet and all the tables and everything just felt old, greasy, and very dirty.  Even the plates and forks were really beat up and greasy.  Don't wear nice clothes there...you come out really smelly from the cooked food.

I came here with family to celebrate a family member's birthday. The Caesar salad was saturated with dressing so all the salad was soggy. I ordered a ribeye steak, cooked medium. When the steaks arrived the waitress didn't know which steak was which since 2 had the same sides. Instead of trying to figure out which was the correct steak she just shrugged and left. The steak was very fatty, not flavorful, overcooked and not hot. Pretty disappointed.

This lady with one strip of pink hair she's THE I don't give a F kinda employee I've ever seen!! She's the typical "I am only here to clock in and clock out, I won't go a tiny step above and beyond, you should be happy if I even provide you any service at all."  She won't remotely do anything to make sure your experience at the store is smooth. She won't do anything to help other customers( and one of the customer is an older lady who needed her help to fold the small shipping cardboard box, she told the older lady in a rude way " We don't help with folding boxes" ). I said hello to her with a big smile on my face and she didn't even bother to fake a smile to me or even say hello back. I asked her a few questions and not only she didn't help at all she also said it in a very condescending and impolite and inpatient tone like if owe her money or got her daughter pregnant and ran away or something. I asked her i don't know how to translate foreign address into English and she said in a very inpatient tone " I've seen people translate it to English. But we won't translate for you, you have to do it yourself." Of course I know that based on that dead fish look on her face. I also asked since this package will be shipped out of the US that if I should write down the address in the destination's language, and she didn't really give me any sure answer, she said " if you want." I asked her multiple questions and all she said was " If you want."  Anyway I had to go to the UPS Store because I cannot communicate with this pink hair lady, she's like a broken record repeating " If you want." " We don't do it for you."  She's the reason why we hate government employees. I will NEVER EVER come back to this USPS again other than dropping off packages since it doesn't require me talking to her. Her attitude is carcinogen, she makes you frustrated and mad which makes you grow cancer! Stay away from this USPS like a bareback  prostitute post WWII.

Went to this salon with a couple of girlfriends this weekend, and I have never been so disappointed with a salon. First, we had appointments set up at 12:15 and still had to wait 30 minutes to be sat. When they finally sat us we were all split into different spots so we couldn't talk. I was sat in a pedicure chair although I was getting a manicure, because the salon was packed. When it was finally time to get my nails done, the nail tech looked like he had no idea what he was doing, and he used a coarse file ON THE TOP of my nail. I asked him for square nails and received a variety of shapes, most of which were crooked. Not to mention that I had to hold my arms up the entire time which burned. When I got home my nail immediately broke due to the rough buffing and filing my nail tech did on my nails. I will never go back to this salon.

I ignored the bad reviews and I was thrilled that they delivered even an hour before closing. I placed an order for a veggie pizza even though I couldn't find a menu anywhere to view (major points lost for that) and they delivered very quickly. It goes downhill from there. The pizza was the saddest, dryest, most underwhelming pizza I've EVER had. There was little to no sauce and and the cheese and toppings resembled pizza that had been left out overnight. Wouldn't recommend and I will NOT eat there again. 

Oh I almost forgot, the pizza and delivery ran me about $25. So, not worth it.

They don't deserve 1 star. I'm a member & This place has the worst customer service I have ever experienced. The owner is more rude than the employees but I guess it starts at the top to set the tone. When I get a corporate number I'm reporting this business. I just filed a lawsuit against this place. STEER CLEAR & GO TO DEPTFORD LOCATION.

Getting worse with every visit!  We have lived Pei Wei for yrs and have been to them as far west as San Antonio, Tx  and North to DC but, this location tops the list of worst Customer Service!  
Today, tilted me to speak with a Manager (who didn't seem to really care to acknowledge they were the Manager than they did when I spoke with them).  The last 2 visits we have encountered the same young man as cashier. This time was excruciating.... as he does not know how to at least fake a smile or even care to greet a customer as they walk up to the register to place their order without any Guidance from him.  Today not only did he not greet me but didn't bother to listen to my order and I had to ask him to repeat he order because I knew he was not listening. After reordering my order and paying a "Togo" order, I asked where I he preferred I wait he nonchalantly said "where ever!"


As I stepped away from the register I observed his interaction with the older lady who was behind me.  This young man could not be bothered with speaking to her but decided it was appropriate to nod his head at her as if her were passing her on the street.  Not only did nod to her once but twice because she had no idea what he was doing!!!


Even more mind blowing is that this cashier was training another employee!!! If this is what Pei Wei thinks is appropriate and train their employees like this ..... we will not be giving them our business...  looks like Chipolte or Jimmy Johns may be on the menu since they are all 3 next to each other.

This used to be one of my favorite spots when I moved to Nashville, but the last few visits have been disappointing. My boyfriend and I had four different people waiting on us yesterday, continuously having to wave someone down for more water, ketchup, etc. We usually split a salad and burger knowing it's plenty for the two of us. Keep in mind, the salad costs more than the burger. Last night, we even threw in a soup. When we got our bill, they charged us a $4 split charge, since we split the "entree" (the burger). I can totally understand charging the fee if we split the burger and ordered nothing else, but that just feels a little greedy.
Priced high for the amount of food. Nothing like the old vicents tavern... For most of the restaurants in Gloucester city are to pricey when I can go to Phila. For a better price and food.
Hotel Maid makes the guest leave the room to Steal Out Of Their belongings. I was robbed there after giving their hotel a good rating on trip advisory

Our time at Circus Circus Reno was very similar to my fellow Yelper's experiences.
The hotel is not very clean, the employees are less than thrilled to be there, the food and drinks are sub-par and there is nothing fancy about the rooms. 
But you get what you pay for. Being the cheapest Casino/Hotel on the block, what more are you to expect I suppose? If you book through the right site at the right time and get their SUPER discounted rates (I'm talking like $50/night) it is absolutely worth it. I will not pay over $100/night again to stay in this hotel. We had some frustrating experiences interacting with the employees of the hotel, attempted to order room service and was repeatedly hung up on and put on hold until I gave up. They could use some re-training on cleaning or maybe some extra staff. Just giving the place a nice deep clean would improve the overall experience significantly. 
I would consider this a 2.5 to 3 star hotel, my rating dropped to a 2 due to the frustrating experiences with staff, not accommodations.

My sister was visiting that's a good reason to go  a new restaurant.

Off we went to the RumFish Grill.   The Fish tank was great.  The Bar was great the service was great.   The Food was not so great. Crab Cake because it was one large cake, all meal no crab.  Salad  was bad.  This is a place not for dinner. This is a good restaurant for  drinks and appetizers only. P.S. the table behind us got a fly in the salad......  we heard this thru out our dinner....   Great...  next time Salt Rock Grill

I have an 825 sq ft condo with central air. Graham Heating and A/C came out and told me it would be around 600$ to replace the blower motor and they would order it and call me that day or the next. I called them 5 days later to ask what's up. The guy took 30 mins and charged me almost 1000 $ -No part number, no separate labor charge. I asked other A/c companies and looked up prices on the web and felt majorly ripped off, no quotes over 500$ !!. I spoke to the owner to ask how much labor was and for the part number I was being charged for and he said he told me that he bills a flat fee. Which means no part number or cost and no labor charge separated out which is suspicious, it didn't feel right in my gut, especially when I asked for the information he didn't want to give it to me.In speaking with the owner I am so dissatisfied with his unprofessional attitude and bullying that I'm sharing my experience. I will be taking my future business elsewhere.  This is my testimony, you reading this, you make up your own mind. I give my permission to share my testimony with everyone you meet

Seating was no trouble, but getting drinks and food seemed like a hassel. 15 mins for drinks and still waiting for food after 25mins and counting. If you have more than an hour to eat here, no problem. Go somewhere else if you don't have more than an hour just to get your food.

I have been visiting this salon for over ten years. I love my colorist and the man who cuts my hair. They are friendly and helpful. However, the manger who runs this salon was very rude today. She told the women making a reservation for me not to give me a weekend reservation for my children's haircuts. She whispered it but right in front of me and obviously not well. I understand if a salon does not want to cut children's hair although my children have been going there for two years and I have seen other children there.  I also understand if it is a busy time of year and you don't want children there on the weekend but just say that. Don't whisper it to the receptionist and force her to lie- Very unprofessional. I am appalled I was treated this way especially after going there for years. Shame on her!

Took my Buffet clarinet there in May to get repaired (repadded, overhaul). Worst decision of my life. Picked it up and didn't play it until September. I came to realize it didn't play half it's notes. I thought it was due to the repadding as I don't know anything about how that works. When I finally brought it in to get help, they were so kind. However when I got the phone call to pick it up, one of the men who works there scolded me about how I should have called sooner and how he didn't believe me that the bent key was their fault. Wow. The way that they talk to their customers is unacceptable. I felt like I was treated like a child. When I went in to pick it up tonight, he again asserted that "notification would have been nice". Please don't bring your instruments here for repairs or work! Take time to search for quality instrument repair!
What we ordered from the limited menu was pretty tasty, but Tijuana Flats (which is a similar style of place in both food style and atmosphere) is better and has a wider selection.

This Burger King location is so awful I felt compelled to post a review in an attempt to draw attention from their corporate office to do SOMETHING about the management.  I have never encountered such an unprofessional staff who obviously hate working there.... Nothing but bad attitudes when placing an order inside the restaurant and in the drive-thru.  Making a simple request to add or take off anything on your sandwich is completely ignored....And if you point out that they made a mistake, just be ready for an even worse attitude back instead of an apology... God forbid they make an extra effort to read the specifics of the order on the screen...All they do now is throw whatever is sitting out already made in a bag because the loud, obnoxious conversations they are having with the other co-workers is far more important than actual customer service.The last 5 visits I have discovered when I got home, my order was wrong.... (wrong toppings/wrong drink) or something was left out of the bag that I paid for. Of course I try calling to complain and no one answers the phone.....EVER. My last experience in the drive-thru did it for me.... I had one drive-thru worker literally throw my bag of food at me after I looked inside to discover they had given me the wrong order.  It took every ounce of my being not to get out of my car and throw everything right back at her.  On top of the bad attitudes, rude service and wrong orders...be prepared to wait a long period of time to get your old, cold, soggy food. I stop at this location because of the convenience since it is closer to home but I ABSOLUTELY REFUSE to spend my money there ever again. The staff needs to be trained properly or fired.... This place is a disgrace and after skimming through the other reviews online, it looks like 99% of their regular customers are experiencing the exact same thing.  Clean the place up........or shut it down.

Horrible service! My mom wanted to go for her birthday because she said they offer free all you can eat on your birthday. As soon as we get there we start filling out our forms there were 2 at the table so we started filling them out. Lady came by & grabbed one before we could even finish filling out the form. When the guy came by to pick up the form he said we could only fill out one form but took the second filled out form. After awhile we asked where the rest of our food was & come to find out he never put it in. After sitting back and watching the chaos of the staff & microwaving of sushi rolls I will NEVER GO BACK!
Worst Sam's club I have been to. The only thing that you can count on is rude service ppl, dirty facilities and an unsafe environment! I nearly my neck tripping over the big carts they leave out.

I've tried their smoked meat sandwiches before, and using LivingSocial coupons, they left me satisfied enough.  Why the one-star review, then?  Well, when you bill something as a meal on your menu and you run an establishment like this, the price of a drink is normally included.  $14 for The Real Deal Meal -- a smoked meat sandwich dealie -- and a drink isn't included in the price?  No, thank you very much.

When I asked the woman working at the counter what was included with the meal, she told me that coleslaw and a pickle were included, which any half-decent deli should include at no extra charge and without any fanfare.  They charge $3 extra for both at Baba Fink's and they make a big deal about it (you can purchase the sandwich alone, and that is listed on the menu).  When I clarified and confirmed that a drink wasn't included in the price, I walked away.  The woman called out to me, presumably to offer me a complementary or a discounted beverage.  It was too late by then, for I try to avoid doing business with shop or restaurant owners who get a wee bit too greedy for their own good.  I won't be back.

Pick a different Imos,  I bought pizza here last night and the amount meat on the pizza was scant.  some pieces did not have any meat.  I asked for crushed red pepper and someone from the back yelled out.  "only three per pizza".  We will not be returning to this Imos

I purchased a deal from Groupon for one conventional oil change for $32.50 (originally $66) as a gift. I was informed that when given the voucher, the difference after the deal was $46. Wow... WHAT A SCAM!!! How can you possibly offer a deal that ends up costing you more than what you purchased it for. So you're telling me that you charge (without Groupon) the original $66 plus $46 "difference" for an oil change?!?!.. $112 total for a regular priced oil change? You charge dealership prices for your mediocre shop? Doesn't make sense. Terrible deal. Very disappointed.

Sign outside of door advertising $5 margaritas for cinco de mayo. Get the bill and was charged $10 for a margarita. The server got the manager who stated "That is only if you have a wristband for the bar crawl and only after 4pm." I walked with the manager to the sign where it gave no indication of a bar crawl or only after 4pm. The manager would not honor the $5 margarita and walked away in the middle of talking to me. I will 100% not be going back, as they were false advertising to get people in to the bar and then rude when asked about it.

First visit, tried fried Oysters and they were awful.
2nd visit, had Gyros. The Gyros meat was cold and the bread was very cold!
The worst Gyros I have ever had !

It's a big space which is nice however they are very slow in service with the kitchen. I went on a day where there may have been 5 people in the whole space and it took almost 30 min to make a smal veggie bowl and grilled cheese . When I mentioned that it's been awhile the person working said it wasn't too long . 30'min when your dead seems long .  I would rather go to magic space up the street small family owned business but they are really on top of everything slow or busy

Arrived at 2:45pm for a quick lunch. Quick is the wrong thing to think of at this place. there were about 6 people walked in after me as when I arrived only 2 people were here. I placed my order and didn't get my food until 45 minutes later. The owner and cooks constantly were in conversation and there was no sense of urgency to get anyone's food out besides when it finally arrived no apology for the amount of time it took to cooks a Salmon Burger! This is yet the second time I've come here but this is the worse service. I definitely will NOT be back and if you're someone who has a schedule refrain for planning this into it. It will throw your day off. Horrible expediting of food and horrible customer service.

What a disappointment. There's actually a lady (Abuelita) who makes tortillas is the kitchen. However, there are NO burritos on the menu. Go figure. Also, the salsa they give you is good, but it's served in a bowl that holds about 3 tablespoons, plus we had to ask for it. The green salsa was so salty, it tasted like it had soy sauce in it. Nothing particularly good about this place other than the fact that it was a New Mexican restaurant that we were excited to try, but left very disappointed.
Awful service burger was raw when asked to be medium well. Waitress was rude dropped the food ran away dropped the check ran away. They werent even busy. Go some where else.

Buyer beware!!  My experience with West Elm has been less than stellar.  Ordered from their website and paid expedited shipping for a Christmas gift.  Part of the order arrived as it should have.  However the biggest part of the order didn't ship till 12/26 and didn't arrive at my home till late in the day, 12/29. 
When I contacted West Elm's customer service, was told "oh, that's not our fault.  UPS must have held up the delivery".  
Please note, there was no special labeling on the box to identify it as an expedited shipment and West Elm didn't have the package ready for delivery till 12/26.  
After a great deal of discussion, West Elm finally agreed to refund the expedited shipping fee....they refunded $6.  I had paid over $30 for expedited shipping.  
Then, decided to return the order, with the idea of re-ordering and have the re-order sent directly to the gift recipient.  Took the order to the West Elm store in Indianapolis 01/20, and they gladly began the return process, telling me the refund would show up in my account within 24 hrs.  Here it is 02/01 and still no refund.  
Called the customer service center yesterday and they told me that the refund was processed for payment 01/29 and I should receive the refund sometime over the next week or two.  Seriously?  West Elm has had my money for almost 2 months now and all I've gotten from them is a lame "I'm sorry no one told you" in a condescending tone.

I'll start by saying that we love Steak 'n Shake; but this location is just horrific.  My family has been coming here off and on for over 20 years.  Each time we come, we say that we'll never come again -- I guess we're masochists, because we eventually come back and have the same experience.  It's a filthy place, your shoes stick to the floor, everything is gross -- I feel like I need a shower when I leave the place.
DONT DO ANY BUSINESS WITH THESE PEOPLE! No one works in service, sales feeds you a tons of lies for a sale and the GM will avoid you by all costs.

So I think we all can agree that Olive Garden isn't the place to go for authentic Italian cuisine. It's usually just a matter of convenience if we go here and it's usually mediocre, at best. Yesterday I was craving pasta, and to be honest I do like the salad. We were seated and glanced over the apps and opted for Fried Pasta Chips with marinara. The pic looked amazing, like Italian nachos. The server brought them out quickly and they were hot with sauce and a few peppers on the top. I was excited and put a pasta chip in my mouth,, WHOA!!! SALT!!!! OK so maybe that particular area got hit heavy. Tried another chip. Same. And I don't mind food with a some salt, but this was completely inedible. The hipster server asked how the app was and I explained why we didn't care for it. He understood and agreed. He also said they're made in the morning. MORNING??? It's 6pm!!!! We ate our salad and breadsticks, which oddly seemed very salty as well. Since we bailed on the apps I decided to order a couple of meatballs, on the side. Now, in my experience, a side of meatballs are usually a good size, more than a few bites each, and brought to the table covered in sauce. Well, when the entrees arrived, which were just fine, the two meatballs were placed on the table in dish, bare. Naked. Sans sauce. And small... So small my wife looked at me like this was joke!! I asked the server if we could some sauce on them and he then brought them back with sauce. You could barely tell it was sauce. Mearballs should come swimming in sauce, enough for them to be at least a third covered. Come on!! That told me that they really don't care what they serve. Like they were saying 'f you, here's your sauce.' I will gladly give up going here and will gladly go out of my way to one of the many great local Italian restaurants that do know how to serve great food with heart, and passion. F you OG. We're done.

This is a cute little bakery in a small town. The pastries I had were pretty good not anything amazing but not bad either. They're pastries all seem a little on the store bought oddly processed taste. The store seemed clean but it was also very very cluttered and could use some rearranging and updating. Overall I had a nice visit but wasn't something I'd drive out of my way to get too.

Disorganized and clueless. The departments never talk to each other. The only real help I got was from a student in the bookstore. I signed up for an online accounting class. The professor agreed to help me find a tutor but did nothing. The first exam was scheduled for the day AFTER you could receive a 50% credit. I tried to get some resolution through administration and they offered nothing.  I know it's "community college" but if you can find ANY other option take it.

BE ADVISED: THEY NO LONGER ACCEPT CREDIT CARDS. CASH OR DEBIT CARD ONLY.

What is it about this nail salon that every time I try it, there's some new disappointment? I had no idea that, one WEEK ago, they started a policy of no credit cards. When I arrived for my appointment today, I was not told, there was no sign on the door....only at checkout, on the counter a sign, that I covered up when I set my purse down. They made an exception for me and took my credit card....well, good, because I had no other way to pay! I do not use a debit card and don't carry that much cash on me. Now I certainly won't return. I pay via credit card, as most people do!Darn...another disappointment at this nail salon.

Mt Laurel Concentra

This place is filthy, I have been to cleaner animal hospitals. Its basically a clinic and if you want real medical care do not come here. You will wait 3 hours past your appt time if you have one. Place should be shut down. A way for employers to get half ass healthcare for injuries on the job !!!!

This is an update on my last review of the Primanti Bros in Greenwood. Well... i wrote a bad review because we had a TERRIBLE experience. The manager and the higher ups contacted me to send a complimentary gift card and were apologetic. Good thing I was not holding my breath waiting on that gift card because its been two months and counting. Honestly I didn't expect to receive anything from writing a bad review but their second failed attempt at customer service only validates my initial impression of this restaurant, and in warning you, the potential hungry customer, to just go to Dick's Last Resort if you wanted to be treated like a peasant.

Horrible. 10 people in  line and staff stand around talking about their dinner last night not helping customers. The line is 10 deep and another gentleman is just staring off into space because there are no license plate customers when drivers license customers are out the door. Older lady with a walker had been standing for 15 minutes while they are oblivious to her obvious distress.  Horrible service.

**UPDATE 7/8/18** I dined in the restaurant today and everything in my mind is a work in progress. Not quite as decorative or opulent as shown on FYI 6 ABC' but nice chairs and lighting. My server was friendly and attentive. I received my order in a timely manner although the restaurant was full and the to go side pumping out meals. Great job! 5 Stars for that! But hold on....The lollipop lamb chops were grilled to perfection however like the Mac and cheese very salty. I got an instant headache! I took some home for another opinion. I just said, 'here are my leftovers' no further comment. Later I was told 'the food was good but too salty'. The cabbage was not salty, all the food was good but proceed with caution. Make sure you are up to date on your high blood pressure medicine!

**ORIGINAL REVIEW***This restaurants grand opening was listed for over a week ago and shown on FYI 6 ABC. I looked on the website to find the hours and location in West Philadelphia and they appear to be open. I arrived at the restaurant approximately 2:30 in the afternoon on Sunday, April 21, 2018 to only find the restaurant was not open for business. Not only was the new space closed so was the old or original space. The hours show they're supposed to be open every day up until at least 10 PM. Maybe it was just free advertisement on the Nto get people to come out. The windows had brown paper on the windows so you cannot see through them.

I will try again at a later date to see if they are open but, if this is how business will be conducted I can't imagine me coming back. No sign on the door, no voicemail, no notification whatsoever regarding the status of restaurant.
Horrible food and service. Like avocados? Don't expect a good one at green market cafe!!

I wish I never chose this company. They are only interested in the money. They dont care about the individual My attorney, Crosby Crane never reached out to me during the process. I was rear-ended, went through unnecessary chiro treatment and an MRI. My first time in an accident so I had no idea what I was doing. Needless to say, 10 months later, my settlement amount is a joke and the paralegal was not available on the day I was finally supposed to receive it. DO NOT USE MORGAN AND MORGAN. You are better off with a smaller, more personable firm.

Cruel and callous leadership is setting a horrible example for the employees and the human population as a whole. I've eaten here several times and the food isn't bad at all. It's a bit over priced but still good.

The service on the other hand... I found the waiters/cashier's to be pleasant and friendly HOWEVER, the short haired bleach bottle, I'm guessing manager, not so nice. She speaks in a kind tone for sure while she was having me thrown out for sitting on the bench in the hallway (EMPTY hallway) that's used for "business meetings".

I'd just moved out of my ex's apartment and had several bags with me and a bike with two flat tires. But she complained and had me thrown out because apparently I didn't deserve the AC in August in New Orleans with more things than I can carry, waiting on my ride. Had to sit out on the side walk at noon.

So much for the kindness of strangers.

BEWARE - MAJOR CONSTRUCTION GOING ON in neighboring lots.  Noise started at 4 am.  Beyond putting ear plugs in the rooms the hotel will do nothing for you.  Ridiculous to charge $550 per night and take no responsibility for the contractors breaking noise ordinances.  If you get assigned an even numbered room - demand to change.  We asked if the hotel would do anything for us as we were awakened so early and they said NO.  The hotel did not warn us - so I am warning you.  Nashville is a fabulous city - but this hotel is poorly managed and does not understand the meaning of customer service.

1. Rooms have ancient bathroom with very low water pressure, low ceilings, light fixtures that don't work and have receptacles that come out when you unplug something. 
2. Rooms are very dated.
3. Elevators extremely slow.
4. Reservations said the blow-up bounce stuff on water would be there for thanksgiving week.  Desk clerk said upon checkin it was closed for season.
5. The whole place needs a MAJOR makeover.  Don't waste your money.
6. Oh, and our room door didn't shut unless you pulled the handle really hard..or pushed it hard from inside.

They claim "over 55 taps." This is kind of true. I sat at the bar and did, indeed, count 55 taps. They had 45 of those taps actually going. Not a big deal but I've been here twice and counted the same last time as well. Yes, I know, I'm a total psycho that I count the taps. I should note that it's been 6 months since I've been here. That being said, the food menu is the exact same or at least virtually identical as 6 months ago. Very limited. The service is very very very slow at the bar. Each of my 2 visits I had to ask where my food was. Hummus took nearly 25 minutes to make its way out and it was very average and only served with pita chips...no option for raw veggies. Then it was another 25 minutes before I got the salad (which anyone with spinach, craisins, walnuts, blue cheese, and generic Italian dressing could make just as well). This time I ended up asking for my entree to go as I passed the hour mark without dinner. Both times I noticed the more alternative your appearance or bushier the beard (as long as you have slicked, perfectly coiffed hair to perfectly mismatch your out of control bushy beard to suggest the dichotomy of...some stupid point you're trying to make, while wearing black rimmed glasses whether or not you actually need glasses) the better service you received. Neither good nor bad; just the demographic they look to resonate with. If that describes you you'll love it. However, coming in town on business and with at least 5 hotels in walking distance, this place doesn't even pretend to try to cater to the business crowd. I'd recommend going somewhere else.

Terrible staff in the front, very careless and fatigued. The lady who helped me is very rude and seems like she could care less to be there, forget be helpful! Optometrist was pleasant and efficient. Front desk staff need a morale boost to do a better job!

If you're looking for baby boomers buying Nashville T-shirt's, this place is for you! Me? I paid $6 to park for 30 minutes and battled hoards of people who are probably fans of "American Pickers" while overhearing baby boomers make rude comments about millennial hipsters. 

The space is nice, but poorly lit, and the South is littered with old warehouses and factories that have been renovated into mixed use spaces. This one wasn't executed very well. I'm not sure why it showed up on my list of things to do, but I should have done a little more research first. It just wasn't for me.

Ok, we love the movies and we love this theater, but buying tickets is VERY Aggravating! We usually go the late afternoon movie and there is always a line and only one person working the booth. We arrive 20 minutes before the movie and get inside just in time for the movie to begin, not the previews, the actual movie. We should not have to wait 20 minutes in line for an afternoon movie. Also, the outdoor ticket machines rarely work. With all that staff milling about inside, when they see a line forming outside, they should man the ticket booth.

Alright I only put one star bc I couldnt leave no stars. This is a 24 hour location and we sat for 10 minuets wait for the man (that we saw inside) to take our order. He never came. So we went to the drive through and no answer there either. So Im not sure if he passed out while standing or what but I'm upset and hungry.
The worst McDonald's experience of my 3 decades of existence. Yes it was a busy weekend but seriously we waited over 2 hours for some fries.

Awful service! The man taking our order was obviously unfit to work the register. Not only did he require cueing to provide us with change, but when he finally did, the amount was incorrect. He also recorded our order under the name "Claire" rather than "David," the name we provided. Because of this, our food sat on the pick up counter for an extra 10 minutes before I became impatient and checked the order details myself, realizing that it was ours. Not only was the food cold by then (40 minutes after or order was placed), but the chips were burnt and they neglected to provide salad dressing. And after this all, no one so much as offered an apology or seemed to care in the slightest. Needless to say, we will not be returning.

We went on a Monday night when it is half off for seniors.  There were two lines and we thought that was so it moved faster.  We hadn't been there since they remodeled and before they didn't have two lines.  When we got to the front of the line a young man told us to come to him.  When he asked for our players card he said we were in the wrong  line and we have to go to the other line.  At this point we are pissed off because  we waited all that time and are now told to go to other line.  We are old and have bad backs and knees and are told to do it all over again.  We got in the other line and a manager, I'M assuming, came over to see what was wrong, as we are very upset.  He pointed to some stupid symbol on the rope saying we belonged in this line.  When  I pointed out both ropes for each line had the same symbol he talked down to us like we were  stupid and said no they are different.  He is  a moron.  Guess what?  When we got to the front of the line the same young man took us, asked for players card, and took our money.  We will never go there again 

We were seated at the far right end because my husband wanted to see the Keno board   he was also playing Keno and bought his ticket prior to going to the buffet.  The walk to the  buffet from here was very long.  For two handicapped seniors this is not fun.  The food was not worth going through two check in lines.  We will not go back.  We used to eat there almost every Monday before this incident.  We were treated like low lifes.  Good bye and good riddance to the Atlantis.

I've always wanted to try a Halifax donair but distance is a factor. When I heard King of Donair was coming to town I was excited as the originates it in the 1970's. Finally, I get to taste the real thing. 

The place looks welcoming with two separate doors leading to seating area, counter and their wall of franchise facts and photos. On the other wall is a great assortment of t-shirts, some of which are quite clever. I arrived around noon and I expected a lineup but instead found a disorganized crowd. Everyone in there had already ordered but they were all waiting for their food. For the number of people behind the counter and in the kitchen, I was surprised by the delay. 

They have four sizes of donair (regular, medium, large and supreme) but I noticed only two sizes of pita: small and large. I placed my order for a medium, no cheese, standard toppings. I moved away and found a spot to stand with the rest. 

I was lucky enough to get my order before many of the others waiting. There was some confusion if the order was mine as they call out numbers when ready but they didn't give me one nor did I get a receipt. Once I sat down and I opened the bag, I was pretty excited. Within I found an aluminium foil bundle which, when opened, let out a cloud of steam. On first glance, it looked like... a hot mess. Meat, onion and tomato covered in sauce. Because of only two pita sizes, the medium is a lot of toppings on a teeny, tiny pita. I didn't even see it at first. I tried picking it up but unlike western donairs that are served in a paper wrap or plastic bag, the aluminium foil barely held it together. It completely fell apart. Most of my bites had no pita but only toppings. Worst of all, the taste was only average at best. Average meat, average tomatoes, average onions, average sauce. Pita - below average. 

I was hoping to experience THE donair from the makers of the original, the King of Donair.
If this is the real thing, however, I'll stick with my western Canadian imitation instead.

Stay away. Very rude and unhelpful person at the store. Went in asking about a bouquet and a flower crown order and was met with dismissive and cold behavior (store was near empty!). Went to a place a few blocks down the street (nature's gallery florist) and had a truly wonderful experience.

Nearly impossible to get an appointment (they only do fillings in the mornings when the kids are in school) and although we are supposed to get the same dentist every time, we don't.  It's always a "you'll be seeing _____ today."  We never had an issue with the actual work, I believe they do a great job at dentistry, but this place is way too inconvenient for appointment-making and consistency in staff we see.  The waiting room runs Disney movies (nice) and is full of broken video games.

FIND A DIFFERENT LOCATION, NOT WORTH YOUR TIME!!!!! 
Super rude staff and unhelpful. Why do you guys make it so hard for me to give you my money? I've never seen such terrible problem solving. It's not the situation it's the principal, I'm not familiar with every specific name for everything they have, I asked for the fruit punch not knowing the specific name was "pomegranate cherry" the cashier stood staring blankly at me for an extended not providing any alternative help or solution to my problem, until I had to point at the fruit punch colored juice. Is it really that hard to problem solve ??? I don't work there I don't have the products memorized. Then after I had paid for my meal. The cashier stood there expecting me to lean all the way over(to his side) of the very wide counter to collect my meal, which being pregnant, makes laying on a table pretty difficult. NEVER coming back to this location EVER.

I think I am being generous with two stars...I agree they are very hard to get a hold of plus the maintenance department had to make multiple trips to my unit because they couldn't manage to find someone who knew how to properly paint a damn tub. The elevator is an accident waiting to happen and the parking is over priced given the fact they don't monitor that situation very well. Then I had mold in the furnace closet so they sent a guy who just painted over the mold instead of treating it. I am so over this fucking place because all they care about is making sure you pay that rent on time otherwise they will be emailing/calling

This experience being first time was not the greatest for my family and I. The lack of service and not knowing what is on your menu as sides and drinks is not right. Management stinks like crazy!!! Service is sooo slow and no one is walking around or able to be seen they're like hiding. Do not recommend coming here.... Only positive thing I can say about this place is it's easy access by the Hotel walking distance. The food was okay very tough to chew on

The entrance way is atrocious. The number and size of each pothole continues to increase and the problem didn't just start this year. They've continued to ignore the glaring issue. On my last visit there were city workers "inspecting" the area, truly doing nothing more than talking to one another. I'd say a good majority of this park isn't kept up. 

About 4-5 miles down the trail you'll come to a bridge which is wrapped on one side with caution tape due to a tree that fell breaking the wooden barrier. Instead of repairing what needs attention, they continue to either disregard the situation or mediate it with some terrible mediocre solution.

My mom and I showed up for 2 pedicures and I also wanted my nails painted with gel polish. I showed the guy at the front desk a picture of the gel polish nails and he said it was doable. I asked how long the wait was for the pedicures, he responded with follow me and I'll have you seated. The water we put our feet in was as cold as can be. Not even lukewarm, COLD. I happened to look over and there were 5 other people waiting to get pedicures who had been waiting before we arrived. We waited almost an hour before anyone came over to get started on our pedicures. Needless to say I was upset that we were sitting with out feet in cold water that long. As the 2 ladies started on our pedicures I noticed the lady who was doing my toes did not seem experienced at all which I'm fine with me but she had to redo my French tip several times. I asked for a flower and got 5 dots, I then had to ask her for additional detail because I wasn't happy with her "flower". It still came out horrible but I was so irritated at this point that I was over it. The same lady who did my toes said she would be doing my gel polish. I showed her the picture I wanted and she says she'll "try" to do it. I picked out a color that looked like a soft pink color. As she began to paint my nails I noticed it was practically clear. When I asked her she said she'll do a few more coats and it'll turn to pink. After the second coat I noticed it was still clear and at this point I had enough. I asked her to just add the glitter so we can finish and I can be on my way. We proceed to wait in line to pay. The guy up front says the total is $100 for both pedis and my gel polish. I said how is it that much when both pedis were $35 each thinking there's no way I'm being charged $30 for this horrible gel polish on my nails. He asks the lady who did my nails to come over and she explains the "design" on my nails was what made the price go up. I said the glitter you put over a clear coat? You can't be serious? At this point I was fuming and had enough of this horrible nail salon. We paid and my mother was nice enough to leave them a tip even though the service was TERRIBLE. Here we are a week later and my French tip is already chipping off. This place is horrible. I will never step foot in their place of business again. Spend your money else where is my advice.

I would not recommend them for your kitchen or counters.  they by far undercut the price on quartz countertops,  but when they measured their measurements were off by  over 25% from he other companies,  which including lowes.   They couldn't explain why even though I offered up the other companies measurements.   In addition,  they charged for things that everybody else does for free.  To make matters worse they and their contractor held on to my approximately $5500.00:for six months before they would return it.  I had to contact an attorney and better business Bureau to get my money back.  I ended up saving almost $1000.00 by using another company that was over $10/sq ft more expensive, go figure.   You would be better off going elsewhere they do not seem to care or provide quality service.

Great food. Drink orders took forever, and for a while my table of 5 were the only ones there. At the end of the meal they informed us that they could only take cash because their machine was down. Didn't offer to take an imprint the old fashioned way. Nope, they said that there was an ATM down the street. We were having torrential rains, and we were told to go get cash. A friend said this happened to him before. 

Not worth the trouble.

I'm Latin and I have to say I was naive and thought it would be pretty difficult to screw up a taco but Oscar's took the crown and completely surprised me with the WORST carne asada taco I have ever had. I took one bite and threw it out. It had such a nasty taste, I wouldn't even feed it to my dog. They didn't even have Tapatillo or Cholula, seriously. This place is absolutely the worst taco joint.

Worst car experience of my life. I made an appointment for 8 am Monday morning and by Wednesday afternoon when I physically stopped in to check on the car because I hadn't heard anything they gave me a run down of possible problems. This was after waiting to talk to the mechanic for 30 min so he presumably just looked at the car after I showed up. I ended up taking my car and leaving. If someone has an appointment the car should be looked at that day or better communicated as to why its not being looked at and a loaner car should be made available.

Are you kidding me! Pure garbage! I am sorry to be so blunt and negative, but there is nothing good to say about the quality of food here! Sauce is bland and VERY runny, pasta is cheap, salad was wilted! Party of five people from New Jersey walked out...please if you have any sense of quality, or even average Italian food then avoid this restaurant! The server was pleasant enough.
Worst service ever Samantha clearly hates her job stay here if you want to be treated bad.

The apartment complex was beautiful but don't let that fools you. The staff is nice upfront because they want you to of course sign with them. If you cancel an application and not even submit it they will charge you $370 for it all. $95 for the application and $290 for administrative costs. If you cancel an application and don't submit how can there be an admin cost? Good question right! Horrible management and rude staff when you have an issue. Great complex but management should be reconsidered.

Boring hotdogs with no real flavor tried the queso bacon chili dog. I must say I was not impressed cheese had no bite and the chili was Bland. The staff was snobby especially for a place trying to Jazz up a hot dog along side a donut. If this is the best hotdogs Nashville can offer I would say stick to Sonic they may not be great but at least it's cheap.
