Would probably not recommend.  Our experience was not smooth.  The pricing and quality of the products used were good.  The gutter job was very good but done by a separate worker.

The problems started when we were unable to communicate with the workers since they understood and spoke no english.  They were not replacing the plywood to parts of the roof that obviously needed replacement.  They had the wrong ventilation system etc.  Had to track down sales rep to communicate with them.  Very careless work done causing unnecessary damages to our home.  Had to call several different people with several visits to get the damages repaired.  This company is supposed to be a Master Elite GAF contractor but the work that their employees or possible subcontractor did were not evident of that.

I came on this placed strictly based on the 4 star rating but my god this is lucky to be getting two stars from me. 

Maybe, I will give them the benefit of doubt and assume that the take out or a la caffe might taste better but the buffet...lets say two stars rating is very generous. 
If you want tasteless Indian buffet this is the place you need to come. 
It has a nice, beautiful interior, friendly staff, but then a go serve urself with napkins/cutlery from
The side table service.
$18.99 for a buffet is not bad as long as the food is decent but I found it below average and defiantly will not be coming back.

Again, food was decent for the price, but the service by the same waiter drags down the rest of the place.  The young man requires coaching, but seems his co-workers overcompensate for him, which in the long run, will hurt everybody.

The pizzas are great!  Their customer service & ability to meet their forecasted timing is awful. Plenty of people - but they need to be trained to deliver on what the owner expects with regard to customer experience and level of service. Restaurant can't deliver to meet customer demand. They need to train people, expand to meet demand or not accept orders they can't fulfill. Updated 12/18. This place continues to disappoint. Great pizza, but they don't know how to handle their business or deliver on customer service. Phone rang for an unbelievable 30 minutes- and they're open  - who does that and clearly doesn't care about their customers. Apparently they think they're better than they really are.  Done trying to give my business to a  local operation. They need major help in customer handling skills, operating processes and telephone systems. SAD!

I have enjoyed their food for years working overnights in University City, especially because of how late they deliver (3:30 AM on Friday and Saturday), their location, and that I'm not able to leave the building until 7:00 AM. Saturday morning around 3:00 AM, I place an online order. Confirmation e-mail estimates delivery around 3:34 AM. I wait another 15-20 minutes past that to call because I am busy helping clients. I call twice to confirm my order and the phone rings several times before it hangs up. No one called to say they were on their way or that they could or could not fulfill my order, so now my card's charged and I received no food. If their hours changed in general or because of the holidays, they should have reached out to me. I had to wait to call them the following morning to get refunded. They were apologetic and handled it, but it was disappointing considering I did enjoy their service and menu previously.

Do yourself a favor and do NOT come here. Showed up for a physical, was asked 4 questions by a doctor while getting blood pressure taken. He then left the room for 20 minutes and came back, telling me I'm healthy and can leave. I questioned why no blood or urine work was done and he replied "oh we only do that if something is wrong". Thought it was odd, but left. Called back a week later to complain and they said that I needed to still schedule a physical. Finally got back in and got an ACTUAL physical. A few weeks later, I get a bill for my first visit. The visit that the negligent inexperienced doctor should've performed the routine physical exam I am now getting charged for. The billing department was just as useless as the doctors themselves. They gave little to no effort in resolving this issue and felt like at times I was talking to a revolving door. I was looking forward to the convenience of this location as it's a few blocks walking distance from my house but I will NEVER on my mothers dead body return here, let alone give them any of my money.

I booked this job almost a month in advance explain to the owner that I had a shoulder replacement and it had to be moved he contacted me for the work through Thumbtack which I will never use again I scheduled the job for the 29th at 7 p.m. I checked in repeatedly over a month are we okay are we okay are we okay are we good are we good are we good he kept saying yes 7 p.m. he calls and says they're running late. I'll be there at 8 then he text me back and says spoke too soon they're running late 9:10 they were four hours late and a no-show very disappointed in the service very disappointed in Thumbtack and I'll never use either again and I suggest you don't either this is not really a business to me it's a hobby if the men were not available then it's up to the owner of the company to make it right even if he has to get in the truck and come move the furniture when we had a contract extremely disappointed,,, they expected to move flat screen TVs and computer stands in the dark that was The Proposal in the dark and next stop Facebook I really don't like bashing people because everybody has bad experiences some people do some people don't and they use these forms to unjustly judge but I am not unjustly judging a month planning checking with the owner sitting here waiting shoulder replacement in pain 7 was the job 8 no people no people 10 no people loving people the owner talked about the guys should have let them know about the previous job but again if you own a company and you make a commitment and you make a contract if you have to get in that truck yourself and come do the job that's how you maintain a customer that's how you get repeat customers that's how you get referrals there will be no repeat there will be no referrals there will be no more Thumbtack I like to move it didn't like moving me last night

Waited over 45 min for nothing. We anticipated getting seated sooner since people were leaving and barely anyone there! Over an hour later and still nothing. There were empty tables and peoples Togo orders sitting for more than 20min ! Don't waste your time at this IHOP!

DON'T GO!

So, I have never written a review but I made a full effort to this one time. I needed silver anklets so I called the number to ask if they had any and the owner answered. She was very sweet at first and actually opened her store to show me some (it was a Sunday). I was so shocked thinking that wow, she really truly care for her customers. Saw a few options and even thought I could have done a lot gift shopping for people. She would have had a regular customer. Unfortunately, I picked out a pair of anklets and trusting her, I paid what she asked for. I talked to a friend of mine who is a jeweler, who stated she RIPPED ME OFF BIG! I would have paid 2X what they were worth just because she opened up the store and I needed them for a function. Unfortunately, she got out 4-6X the price of the anklets. NEVER AGAIN! CANT TRUST HER!  I RECOMMEND AGAINST GOING TO THIS PLACE, TOTAL RIP OFF!

We were told they were not seating anyone on Monday night when there were 15 open tables. Kitchen was "backed up" so we left. Staff was not particularly nice but good location and cool feel inside. Wish they had service.

Placed our take out order through Yelp with specific instructions to omit egg and broccoli from the Lo Mein. After waiting 45 minutes, and bringing our food home, we realized our order was incorrect and the dumplings were soggy, chewy and tasteless.

Browsing today it was of less interesting than many others I have seen.
In and out.

I have been on several cruises and enjoyed them all!  Some I booked on my own and some I booked thru agencies.  Although, I am booked to cruise next year for the first time with Royal Caribbean, I'm quite nervous given the experience I have had with them thus far.  

I contacted Royal Caribbean (RC) to book as part of a group.  The group was set up by a family member.  I was given the group number and name of the agent they worked with along with pricing for the specific rooms that were blocked as part of the group.  I contacted RC and asked to speak to said agent but was told any agent could help me.  I was then given different prices for the 'group rooms'.  Unsatisfied, I decided to call back.  I contacted RC a total of 6 times over the next two days to get pricing on different types of rooms for the cruise in question.  Every time, I had to speak to someone new and start over.  When I finally had what I wanted I asked them to hold the rooms for 24 hours while I confirmed with my family to ensure they were happy with the rooms and pricing.  I was told they could not hold the rooms without a deposit.  This is crazy since my travel agent could do this for me.  In addition, my travel agent could get the same EXACT rooms but cheaper than what RC was quoting me!

When I asked RC why I was not given the same pricing that was given to the group - I was told that when the group made the group booking, they had received a promotional rate that was no longer available.  They would not honor this even though when this booking was made it was made for the group - but because our deposit was not given on the same day... we were out of luck.  

I wrote a letter to RC to explain all of the issues we had when trying to book our reservations, our dissatisfaction with the 'group' process and their reservations line.  They wrote back addressing my concerns and apologizing.  They did not offer to match the rate my family had received.  They did not offer me a single concession.

I've always heard Royal Caribbean was a great cruise line but honestly, I've yet to see it and I am a year out from actually cruising with them!   

If I were not invested in this particular cruise (due to a previously planned family milestone celebration), I would not give RC a dime of my money.

I went to the deck at the Moshulu for the first time this weekend with a few friends this weekend. I wanted to love this place since it is a 5-minute walk from my house but sadly I didn't. The view and décor are great, and I love the Mushulu but the deck was a major flop. We sat down at a bar seat and asked a waitress if we could order drinks and a few apps and she went to get us menus. She came back a few minutes later and told us they were no longer serving food on that deck and we would have to sit on the other side. We went to the hostess on the other side of the deck and asked for a table for 4 and she told us it would be one minute. After about 10 more minutes we checked back in with her to see how long it would be to decide if we should get a drink at the bar while we waited, and she again told us one minute. Another hostess then went to seat another table that walked in after us, so we checked in with her about our table and she told us that we weren't on the list. There were about ten open tables, so we were very confused about the wait. Finally, the second hostess came back and walked us to our table but after a few minutes we found out we couldn't order appetizers in this section and that we would need to find a table in the top section. We had asked if we could sit in the top section when we first walked in and were told no so we were all confused. Basically, every single person working at the restaurant except for our waitress seemed like they didn't have a clue. Our drinks and our food were great but not worth the hassle we had to deal with to get a table.

Dont book an event here!!!! As a guest here's my experience. No ice machine on the third floor, the staff do not know how to connect guests to the WiFi network and when there is a problem with the room after calling twice hotel staff never fixed the problem. As an event attendee free coffee was offered but free water was not u til halfway through the night. Myself and other patrons had to purchase water from the bar. Furthermore the next day the banquet team did not set up enough tables for dinner eventhough there was a seating chart provided to the banquet team. The food service was slow. Only a total of 6 servers were present and servicing tables for a room of 240+ people. Our timeline of event had to be altered because of the slow service. After all this nearly half of the event patrons food was not only cold or barely warm upon being served it was also inconsistent in terms of some food was cooked and some was just plain burned or dehydrated.

This was supposedly the best gumbo in all of NOLA. I have to say we were extremely disappointed. The gumbo was just mediocre at best. The server, balding white guy, was a huge asshole. Not an ounce of professionalism or hospitality. Nothing but attitude for no apparent reason. Their Caesar was god awful but the crawfish etoufeill was good. Avoid.

We usually stay at Holiday Inn Express and once in a while do the Holiday Inn, although it seems to be to remind us to stay at the Express instead.

Check in was decent enough, nothing great, but not rude or anything.  She kind of whipped through everything like she was running through a script.  I get it, you repeat the same thing multiple times a day, but since it's the first time you're telling me, you should probably slow down a little and at least pretend that you are speaking with me and not just blurting out your lines.

The hotel itself was decent looking but the elevators are so small!  Our family of 3.5 could barely fit in there together and we actually had to take two elevators to get us up there along with our luggage.  The dollies were tiny too, like half size, but I suppose they have to be to fit in the elevators.  Our cooler had to sit on it sideways, but then it didn't fit through the elevator doors, so we had to take it off the dolly and drag it in.

The room looks like it was recently remodeled so it has that retrofitted look to it, when you take an old room and replace the fixtures and such with new things so it looks old but new.  Kind of like putting all new stainless steel appliances in your 1920s kitchen.

I like the flooring, no carpet, it's this faux wood tile stuff.  It was clean, I wore white socks and they stayed pretty clean, and my kids ran around barefooted and their feet stayed clean too as long as they stayed out of the corners and away from the edges.  It seems like they come in and damp dust/mop the floors and push everything to the edges and leave it there.  The baseboards were dusty and hairy and the edges of the room were dirty with hair, big piles of dust and a bonus tree nut. 

Also whatever they use to clean the floor, I'm guessing it's some kind of cleaner system like Swiffer or Bona, leaves a sticky feeling residue so the floor feels kind of icky, like it's not clean, even if it is.

The sheets were clean, although we discovered when we were leaving that the mattress cover/pad was stained.  There were a lot of hairs in the bedding and towels, which I know get stuck in there during the wash process, so they were like kind of stuck in the weave, not just sitting on top.  I realize this happens however, when they're making up the beds, they should be looking out for such things and pulling them out.

The bed itself was standard IHG, soft, with the different pillows.  No complaints there.

The refrigerator was tiny, one of those little cube ones, we had to take the shelves to fit our milk gallon and then there wasn't really room for anything else.  No microwave, although there was one available in the lobby.

Tub was old and dingy looking and had not been rinsed out.  Shower curtain was missing its inner liner and appeared to have been that way for a while because there was a good bit of mildew growing on the cloth outer curtain.

The toilet paper holder was mounted on the side of the vanity in such a way that you had to reach a little behind yourself to get to it.  Our roll was almost empty upon arrival and there were not reloads in the room.  The bathroom itself was very small, the door hit your knees when sitting on the toilet.  There's no exhaust fan in the bathroom so it got very steamy when the shower was on.  The water was temperature locked or something because it did not get hot past a certain point, no matter how much you turned it to hot.  It was warm enough to be comfortable but I have thick skin and it takes a lot to warm this cold heart.

No free breakfast served here, but that's standard for HI.  Indoor pool and hot tub plus outdoor pool; we did not use either.  There's a restaurant there, but from the room service menu, it seemed overpriced.  There is a steak n shake next door though, if you're into that.


We would not stay here again.  There are lots of HI and HIE around the STL area to choose from, so we'd try a different one.  Although we will be sticking to the HIE until I have time to forget and stay at a HI again.

T&T at North gate Edmonton.
Great vegetable selection... 
Poor service on hot food. Asked for 3 ribs of the roasted pork and was given lots of fatty meat instead. Definitely not what I ordered. Found out when I got home. Very disappointed.
Bought 4 of the 2 item combo meals for the family and it was not well served. We barely had any meat on our rice. Not recommended!
Avoid, horrible.  Twice they messed up my order; twice my food tasted like it had been sitting for awhile.
Have a weeks notice for them to fix the recall. They didn't. It's been months. And I still all and they don't have the parts to fix the big recall of Ford Explorers and the C O emissions. Wow.

If I could give 0 stars I would!!  I wish I would have read the yelp reviews before I went, but they did my regular mani/pedi before and it was okay. The polish and top coat was put on so thick it wouldn't dry and crinkled up. They tried to fix it, but it was bad too. Even the good hand looks like I did it!!  I don't normally complain because I know people have bad days. The most frustrating part is I tried to call 3 times after I left and no one answered.  I just wanted to state my frustration.

Food was decent but the service was not great. Waited over 30 minutes after being seated and placing our drink orders before ever receiving our beverages (no bar drinks) and placing our meal order (we arrived at the restaurant at 5pm).  Food finally arrived at 7:05 but was told no baked potatoes as they brought out our food and was rudely asked "what else do you want?" I don't know the menu, so I asked what was available and the waitress was pretty snippy.  Due to the long wait times ( 2 hours between being seated and food arriving), half of our party had to leave to pick up their child and wasn't able to finish their meal.

Our first visit here, on Christmas day,  was very good but the last two visits were unimpressive....hope they do well but we won't return..

Used to be a better deal but they are selling many things for maybe $1 less than Costco regular price and sometimes more.  Even if the packaging is torn or its missing parts.  Not to mention things that are on sale at Costco  not worth the time

I never write online reviews but I've made an exception due to the fact that Beach City is a corrupt and obscene place for anyone trying to get a collegiate education. First I will address the noise. It is abnormal for even the biggest party schools with neighbors speakers rocking my walls until 2 am on a regular basis. If you don't mind incredible sound and a sleep schedule that involves waking up at 10 to get 8 hours of sleep then to each their own. Now I would like to address the state of the apartments. They have a massive bug infestation that they fail to address and you will most likely have bugs in your bed, crawling on your phone screen if your looking at it in bed. On top of that my apartment came with multiple areas of water damage and rusted out hinges/ shower poles that would make you desire a tetanus shot after touching them, some of the water damage many months old showing black mold. My roommate told me that one of the water damage areas occurred 6 months ago, meaning that they will deduct the cost of fixing it and not do the repairs. That being said that is just the beginning. The "Security" is nothing more than a bunch of punk kids who live their and get a reduced rent for attempting to rein in parties that resulted in multiple injuries and a mattress being thrown into a crowd of people, risking life. The real security doesn't do anything and it's a private company. The management team, short of Sheri who is the executive director, is nothing more than a bunch of crooks. When I got a lawyer to remove myself from the community he told me that St. George has a reputation amongst the entire legal community as being the worst among the worst. Just look at other student housing and try to find 32 one star reviews anywhere else on yelp. Let's also not forget the amount of blow dealers and stuff going on, which happens everywhere but not with such open solicitation for complete strangers. If anybody needs a lawyer I personally had a great experience with Mike Brelje, but don't expect to get out of your lease easily or cheaply, and without some boarder line illegal intimidation So here's a few tips for the folks that are stuck their waiting for repairs. For starters if they don't fix something in 14 days properly you have the right to hire someone of your own choosing and they have to pay it. Another thing is that they have a whole bunch of code violations (I.E broken glass on the fire extinguishers, improperly built carports, and a whole bunch of little stuff that st George will have  pay and if you consistently report it to the city they will get fined and that's how I was able to get them to let me out easier than expected. Just contact a lawyer because they will charge you full rent and lie about putting you on a waiting list. However I will say the location is killer and most of the people are genuinely nice. But at the same time you could be walking and get struck with a water balloon while your using expensive earphones or holding school work (happened to me). And on top of all of that I had an asthma attack and my doctor required me to put in an air conditioner unit and the management threatened to evict me for it even though I would not be able to breath without it. If your not going to school and want to party and you don't mind being in a shitty apartment this is the place. Don't be fooled by the nice location and the outside because the appliances, plumbing, management, and general atmosphere could not be further from the aesthetics that indicate class and quality. Also if you own a bike and don't keep it inside it will be vandalized, guaranteed. Oh and I forgot I know at least four apartments, mine included, with broken heaters.

If I could give this negative 5 stars I would! Took my car to the one on Westshore last year for a service engine light. They had to replace the coolant thermostat and housing. Cost us $500. In less than a year, my service engine light came back on with the same code. We took it to this one and told them how we had this fixed a year ago and it is telling us it already needs to be replaced again. We paid them $120 thinking they replaced the thermostat. 4 days later the service engine light came back on with the same code. Took it back and after waiting another 2 hours just for them to look at at it (2 hours wait on each visit just for diagnosis), they told us they needed to replace the thermostat for $250. We told them they just replaced it last week and they said all they replaced was the sensor. I have never in my life screamed at a professional and always wondered how people could do that. Well, for the first time in my life, I found the place who could bring that out of me. We left and will find somewhere else to fix it. They are not getting another dime or time from me!

OK, I hate to write bad reviews but I have to make an exception.  I'm not familiar with Scratch Magoo's but they had a write up about delicious tacos, one of the five best in the city.  It must have been a very old review because they were the worst tacos I've ever had.  Now realize it was $2.50 taco night but there is no excuse for what got served.
For $2.50 you get two choices: beef or chicken, I chose beef.  The tacos came and they were below the level of what my mother gave me when I was 10 years old.  They were so small, I had to open up the flour taco to make sure there was something inside at all.  It turned out the meager filling was a little ground beef that I don't think was even seasoned, a little lettuce, and some sour cream.  That was it.  Seriously, $2.50 isn't much but save your money I get a kit from Acme you'll be better off.

The dining room is really dark which makes it romantic but you can't see your food.  The dining room wasn't very busy on a Tuesday evening which made it a little lonely for the three of us.

I root for every restaurant to succeed and I hope Magoo's succeeds but they need to at least try a little.  I'd go back for to try something else but they haven't given me any reason with all the options in the area.

I'm disappointed with this place. I tried it a few years ago and it was actually probably 3 stars then.  I've just recently started going about once a week since I work close. After my most recent experience I will never go back. The food isn't good enough to be worth their expensive prices. Extremely oily too. The last few times I have gone the service has been horrible slow. They leave you standing at the door for days (I only have an hour lunch) by the time you sit and they actually bring your food you have to turn around and get back to work. Once they drop your food off you'll be lucky if they even come back to your table. This past Friday was the worst. A friend and I had to wait 10 mins even to order to go. Then it took about 20 to 30 mins to get our food. One salad with chicken and one Moo Dang soup with steamed pork wontons.  We leave and get back to work and find out that they forgot the dressing for the salad and the steamed pork wontons. We had to go back. They apologized and blamed the kitchen. They gave us a couple egg rolls and spring rolls free, for our troubles. That was nice. So they gave me my steam wontons and I went back to work. When I finally was about to set my soup up my lunch was over. The soup itself was good until I ate a wonton. It was overwhelmingly doughy. I spit it out of my mouth and it was RAW. I unfortunately ate half of it. I dug out the other wontons and they were all raw.  Are you kidding me? I called the place and told the server they where raw. She apologized and blamed the kitchen once again. Didn't offer my money back or anything. Just "I'm sorry the kitchen did it" WOW this place lost my business and the other girls I work with who were coming here as well. Horrendous. I much rather eat at a real Thai food place that care about their customers and who doesn't serve raw food. Also the place is disgusting dirty. On their ceiling fans are tons of spiderwebs covered with dust. Which are right above the tables so the dirt falls into your food. Gross.

I use to workout at this location regularly but this is by far the worst La Fitness in the city. The staff and management makes no attempt to make sure the gym is at least half way clean, no one re rack weights, and equipment is always broke.

Farmicia used to be excellent. However, over the last year, their food has become increasingly greasier and saltier to the point where it really is just sub par. Last night was the last time I am ever going to go there. I had the salmon for dinner and it was the last thing I ate that day.  In he very early hours of the morning I woke up feeling sick to my stomach and not long after, I was very ill.  I have not had food poisoning this bad in my entire life.  I'll spare you all the details but the degree to which I was sick had my girlfriend and my parents thinking I might need to go to the ER.
Nice place, but why play old music so often, kills the vibe!!! Update your music and we would come more often!!'

I was disappointed with the service and some of the food. We had a reservation for 7. We were told that we had to wait 15 minutes to be seated. The service was slow but we eventually got our food. We were a party of 6 and the food arrived over a period of time.There were people who came after us that had their food before us. The food was mediocre to good. I have been to this restaurant several times but I don't think that I will return.

Do not buy the CRAB SOUP!
 I made the mistake of doing so and it was terrible.  There aren't any words to describe how basic and cheap and how lack of crab led me to make this review I was disappointed majorly!

This McDonald's isn't hurting for money.  I ordered the 2 for $4 breakfast sandwiches, but I wanted one without the egg.  The order taker said that wasn't a sandwich on sale.  I said ok.  Put the egg on it and I will just take it off.  If you are going to take it off, it makes it another sandwich that isn't 2 for$4.  What??  Ok.  Never mind, just give me a sausage McMuffin and a breakfast burrito.  She reads the order back with 5 items listed.  Let me start over.  I only want 2 items.  A breakfast burrito and a sausage McMuffin.  The only good thing that happened is I ended up spending $2 instead of $4.  Next time I will order the sausage, egg McMuffin and leave the egg at the window!!  Geez!!

I keep waiting for their prices to drop like they have been advertising. The food bar is usually low to average, their fine pastry looks better than it tastes and their deli dept. prices are nuts. A product found there is usually about 50% higher than Frys or Safeway. I usually avoid them and go to Sprouts, Trader Joes or AJs.

Be very careful if you chose to use this mechanic. They will charge you double markup on parts. (Proof below.) This is unethical. We are from out of town. Our car broke down and we had to have it fixed immediately. Google had relatively good reviews of this mechanic. However, the tow truck driver did not recommend them. Now I know why.

Our bill for repair was way too high. In full disclosure, they did call ahead with the price estimate and I approved. That's my fault. But after receiving the bill, they would not provide an itemized bill, to hide the fact they intentionally overcharged. I noticed the part was quoted $688! This was way too high. 

After research, the Napa part they used only cost retail $344. Guess what $344 times two is? You guessed it: $688. I caught them doubling the price on me. Not only would they not fix it, they would not accept that they knowingly charged too much. 

Please do not use this mechanic unless you have written quotes and double check everything they say. All documentation is below. You can see what they charged me as well as retail pricing for the actual part, to do the math yourself.

Proof with receipt and Napa pricing: https://imgur.com/a/cmT0qMF

As much as I love the food at Pats, I can no longer continue to come here during normal business hours. Let me preface by saying, the food is exceptional. From pizza to cheesesteaks, anything you get is mind blowingly stellar. However, my issue is with how busy they are and how it affects service.
My job is a mile down the road and I usually order delivery. It takes no less than 45 minutes to arrive. So long! The other day, I decided to sit-in for lunch thinking it would be quicker. I was sadly mistaken! I came at 12 o'clock (typical lunch break time) and waited 35 minutes to get my food! What did I order you might wonder? A cheesesteak! That's it! I don't understand what took so long because when I came in, they're only three patrons seated in the whole restaurant. The phones were not ringing off the hook, either. When my food finally came I had to take it to go-to because so much time had passed. While I waited, the servers gave a half-hearted apology.. as though it was the norm. When I went to leave, there was a line almost to the door of people waiting to order.
For my cheesesteak and fountain soda I paid just under $16. Not worth it, too expensive and too long of a wait, I'll go elsewhere. 
Also, one time when I got delivery to my job, the delivery driver asked me, "why do you eat this junk?" Not cool. If you don't love your job, quit.

Walked in on a Monday to get my haircut. Never been here and saw they take walk ins. As soon as I walk in the door I get greeted with a very rude we don't have any one who can do walk ins. I definitely don't recommend anyone going here  if you are going to only take appointments then put it on yelp. Don't false advertise and then be rude when someone is just following what is on the website.

I was excited about going to LUVi, but disappointed in the whole experience. The atmosphere is cute and cozy, but upon being seated, things started to go downhill. 

We ordered a bottle of sake, and it took more than 20 minutes for our server to fetch it from the fridge. My boyfriend and I both ordered the "Feed Me" omikase, and we're excited about balling out with some creative sashimi. (They're are 2 "Feed Me" options - $45 per person for raw and cooked food, $60 per person for just raw. We got just raw.)

This consisted of 5 teeny tiny dishes of raw fish. 2 salmon, 2 tuna, and one snapper. They were sooo small, and there was nothing special about them - just topped with some ponzu and mango purée. They had obviously made an effort with the presentation - there were tiny flowers cut out of mango slices and one tuna dish had the fish arranged like a rose, but these decorations weren't enough to distract from the rather boring taste. 

When our waiter came over to ask if we needed anything else I was so surprised I literally said "wait, there's no more food coming??" I did not feel 'fed' at all. Please at least throw in some rice or something!!

My boyfriend and I were very disappointed that a dinner that cost over $200 left us feeling completely unsatisfied. We went straight to Company Burger and each devoured burgers and tater tots. 

Who knows, maybe ordering the "Feed Me" was a mistake and ordering off the menu is better, but that makes me sad because typically omikase is a chefs opportunity to impress guests and really blow them out of the water. 

My tips to LUVI? Cut the price in half for the "Feed Me" or kick it up a notch with some more creativity and carbs.

Typical Waffle House, angry waiteresses, burnt toast, dirty glasses and sub par food. Exactly what I expect from a Waffel House.  Our wairess was very tenative to our needs and kept the dirty cups full so +1 star for her.

Still upset about the overall ridiculous experience with the personal trainer there. So unprofessional and over a year later the knee I injured following the exercises he assigned still gives me problems.

We ordered a pizza after a great night out. Super satisfied with delivery time, there was only one problem. There was a decently sized wad of pubic looking black hair in a tight clump on one of the slices. We called immediately to get a replacement pie, and they confirmed the request, but took an hour and 30 minutes to deliver the satisfactory pie. To put this into perspective, we originally ordered this at 1:00am, and didn't receive the good pie until 3:10am. Terrible. Do not recommend.

Went to the ER 6/9/2018. I had been coughing 2hrs non stop. Triage was a 5 star. From there it went downhill. From asking 2 nurses(I assume they were RNs) for a blanket with no results to asking the Dr for one when he arrived(Dr will be in to see you in just a few minutes turned into about 40 minutes) and his response was "I'M your Doctor" which I took how dare I ask HIM for a blanket. He did bring one, left the room with no communication of what was to follow. Waited. Waited. Portable X-Ray done. Waited. Waited. Nurse, "he wants you to take this cough medicine and 4 puffs of this inhaler. Have you used an inhaler before, Yes I have. Hands it to me , not the same as I had used before had no clue as to how to get started and leaves the room to get water. She returns we get that done. DR returns X Ray is clear. I state I am ready to leave.
My first experience at the ER and prayerfully will be my last. Poor patient/customer service.

Definitely not worth checking out. The food was bland and had no flavor. The chips and salsa tasted like they came out of a bag and a jar. The service was subpar. I had to frequently flag the waiter down throughout the meal just to get basic service. The margaritas were average at best. 
STL has so many great Mexican and Tex-Mex restaurants to choose from. El Maguey isn't one of them. Skip it.

This was my first time at the Cartel location on Broadway downtown. I've been to other locations and my experience was good but this visit to the Broadway location was very disappointing and I won't be back to the Broadway location. 

Long story short it is a pain in the ass if you use a wheelchair. The barriers to gain entrance are large. There is a step up from the front sidewalk and no signage indicating an accessible entrance. I found a ramp on the side of the building with a car parked on the street blocking the ramp entrance. So, a wheelchair, cane, or other mobility impaired user could use this entrance IF they indicated No Parking in front of the ramp...they currently do not. It's a roll of the dice whether or not you can get into the place. 

So just letting other wheelers (and their friends and family) know this is not the place for you.

Decent food terrible customer service and wait times.  If you're used to people with terrible customer service skills this place won't bother you.  Have tried to give this place a chance on three separate occasions...just not worth it for the money you pay.

I wasn't impressed.  I had the creme brûlée donut. The filling tasted like vanilla pudding and the topping was a bit too bitter so there wasn't a good balance of flavors to me. The chili queso dog was ok but I wouldn't order it again. The hotdog was kinda hard and spicy and the chili was too sweet for my taste.  Truffle fries were good. Visit at your own risk of spending nearly $20 for 1 person (Dog, fries, donut), but I would not recommend it.

They told us a price for doing an oil change over the phone and then we got their raised it $40
Stating it's because they're labor rate went from 95 to 130

Terrible service.  They lost my SSD and never returned calls to talk about it and try to help on this matter.
1 star is very high feedback for this "company".
Don't ever go with these people if you really need your data recovered. They are very unprofessional . Didn't care about the problem.

Horrible customer service! I've ordered alot of parts and spent alot of money with AM. So I order an SLP loudmouth catback exhaust it arrives and it's missing one of the tips I discovered this on Friday so I call them and they tell me we will have it by Tuesday! Here we are Tuesday and they don't have a clue when it's arriving. Customer service is the corner Stone of any successful business and this place missed the mark big time! Bad communication, they don't offer anything for my inconvenience and the fact I lost money due to this. It's a social media erra we live in I'll be sure to spread the word about there horrible service!!!

DO NOT BUY THE GEEK SQUAD PROTECTION (GSP) PLAN

The hassle they introduce on a claim far exceeds the value.

I purchased a 4-year protection plan for $270 on a home theater projector.  This month, the bulb died.  I popped open the bulb door, snagged the bulb and went to the Geek Squad desk at this location to get a simple replacement.  

Reese, at the Squad desk, confirmed that the bulb was covered under the GSP plan, but explained they can't just give me a replacement in the store.  He gave me a 1-800 number to call to the Squad's main office.  I drove home, called the number and Squad member there insisted that I need to do that in the store.  

I returned to the store and talked to Reese again.  He explained that the only way to honor the warranty is for me dismantle my entire home theater system from the ceiling mount and bring it into the store.  They will then replace the whole system with another system.  All I need is a little bulb.

Yes, Best Buy, we customers want reasonable prices and selection.  But we also want a hassle-free service experience.  Quit complicating it.

This was the rudest staff I've encountered in Brandon.   I tried to order water, chips and sa..... and was immediate and sternly interrupted and then chastised for having the audacity to ask for chips and salsa and queso.  Then she touched my arm and appeared to be talking down to me as she explained that she was waiting two tables at the same time (mind you there's only THREE tables at the moment) and proceeds to talk shit about the new girl, as if that's why she was so busy with her two tables.   I had all I could do not to walk out after placing the initial appetizer order.   My food was cold and tasteless.   We waited 7 mins for the tortilla to our fajita - so now we have seasonless, lukewarm chicken, onions, and peppers.    We will never be coming here again, let alone leaving a tip.   (And we never stiff staff on their tips - we've been in their shoes and know what it's like.) this place is horrendous.

By far, the worst Indian restaurant I've ever eaten at. In general, I like Indian food. I went with my family during the weekend for the lunch buffet only to be completely disappointed. To start with, there was no good food options. Yes, at a "buffet." There were rices and sides but no good options if you eat meat.  They had Tandoori chicken...but...the first piece I got was colorful outside and completely raw inside (rare if we would be talking about a steak). The second piece I tried was blah, no flavor. Another meat option was a butter chicken but was also dry and with lack of flavor. They kept filling up the trays with veggies and rices but no real options to taste. I was there waiting for about 45 minutes but the meat dishes never came out.   I have eaten several times at Indian restaurants for both buffet and ordering from regular menu with fantastic options. How does Haveli ought to call this a lunch buffet when there's no food?! Unbelievable. It was probably 12:30pm when I was there so it was a good time to get lunch, no excuses to not have food. I was hungry when I left. One thing is being cheap but this was an extreme. I will not go back, for sure.

This is probably one the most disappointing places I have been to in a long time. I went after going to paint and sip thinking that I would get a good meal. Since the other local sushi place was full this was my second choice. I wasn't really sure what to get but I got the shrimp tempura and miso soup. I was very disappointed in the tempura shrimp. The shrimp was very small. And the coding didn't really stay on any of the vegetables. My friends got sushi rolls. The fish on the sushi didn't look quite right. And the shrimp that was on top was very thin. The only good thing about the meal was the miso soup. When I got my hot tea. The water was luke warm. I would not recommend going here as a first choice.

Garbage! Andy the owner is a complete fool! His nail tech used that pink power to create a natural look ok! Fine I get it! However she wasn't supposed to use it over the white tip! Now my nails have a pink hue! I went back the next day because the day I had them done, I had a Christmas party that I needed to get to so I went back the next day in person and spoke to Andy the owner and he told me that if I wanted to get it done again I have to come back the day that nail technician was there!

Uhm.. No! I'm not going my entire week with pink nails bro! I'm like " Uh nope! You'll do them today because I paid for a service and I expect that service to be honoured!" I was livid! And his response was, as he placed his hands to his tenples "Oh my God you're strong me out! I'm stressed out! Please just SHUT UP!" 

So yea! By all means ladies, keep on going there!

Some of the worst customer service I ever experienced. Specifically in the service department. They don't care for the customer at all. They "fixed" our tire and then the next day it was flat. There upon their tow service completely ripped off our front bumper. Then when quoted to fix a tire they without asking decide to put the new tire on. Unbelievable. This makes us not want to get a Volkswagen ever again.

We wanted Po Boys.  It was raining and this place was close to our hotel.  Reviews weren't great but we were hungry !!!   OK.......we should of known better.

I had a small fried shrimp Po Boy for $14.50.  The roll that the sandwich was served on  was like Jimmy Johns white bread.  There were some (not a lot!) of fried unseasoned shrimp on there with just a bit of slaw.  HUH !!!!!

I love to visit the local dive restaurants.  We ordered at the counter and someone brought our food to the table.  They luckily had several hot sauces on the table for us to use.  Otherwise the sandwich honestly wouldn't of had any taste.

I did love the area where this restaurant if located.  FAR from the hectic Bourbon St crowd.  Maybe we just ordered the wrong thing ???   Maybe you should try something else ?  Just don't get a 
Po Boy.

I suggested to take my in-laws there tonight and it was a big disappointment. All four of us were disappointed with the food we had. We started small with a hush puppy appetizer. I cut mine open and found a large piece of paper packaging within it. The dinner never ends well when you start out like that. My wife's house salad tasted fishy and her crab cake wasn't good either. Those are the easy items to get right, I won't go into the rest. 
Our server was average too. No refills on drinks and never pre-bussed any dirty dishes so the table was cluttered. 
There are so many good restaurants in Tampa, I'm sad we wasted a dinner here. I guess this is why we stay away from chain restaurants.

I don't really know what the huge hype is. I've tried this place a few times. The service was "okay," not really good and not really bad. The food hasn't been awful, but I've found it to be dull each time- lacking flavor. My breakfast sandwich wasn't toasted- so it was a little weird eating a breakfast sandwich on floppy sourdough bread. The crepe I got the first time I went was also boring, even though it was a huevos rancheros crepe. It's nothing I couldn't do better at home. The drinks were decent- I prefer their champagne drinks, though I'd say their bloody mary's don't have distinct differences.

I would give no stars if possible. We tried to have breakfast two different times. Walked in and dining room closed, no seats at bar or booths. No staff acknowledges presence or tries to assist. We won't ever be back.

I'm only here to suggest avoiding brunch at all costs. I'm sure their dinner is worth it but that's not what I came for and unfortunately I doubt I'll be back. 

For starters, I was starving when I got here. I was lured in by the huge brunch sign and I went in and ordered a Frozé as my drink choice and it was bitter and gross. I understand wine is dry but once you turn it into a cocktail it should have a bit more flare to it and it just tasted like cold wine. 


The best food I had was the baked bread and olive oil appetizer. Everything else was just bad and it took forever to come out even though there was barely a soul in there. 

I ordered the biscuits and gravy and the biscuits were thick and hard as rocks. Hard, dense, crumbly and not appetizing. For what it's worth, the fried egg was cooked to perfection and the sausage gravy was flavored well but the dish as a whole was a fail. They asked me how I liked it and I begrudgingly said no because I don't like sending food back but I was so hungry. 

I ended up ordering French toast with berry compote. I need to mention that me and my friend ordered this to share initially and the waiter just completely forgot to put it in. So here I am ordering it a second time only for it to come out gross. It was little soggy pieces of wet sponge bread and a bitter berry sauce on top. I was so disappointed that they brought me yet another bad meal and I'm sure you could see it on my face because the waiter came over and assumed as much without me complaining. 

The one thing that allows me to give this place two stars is the fact that the manager and waiter seemed to be genuinely concerned that I hated my food and kept asking if I wanted something else. They took both meals off of my bill even though I didn't ask them to. I appreciated that they at least they provided quality customer service where their food was lacking.

All in all, don't come here for brunch. The waiter even said he hadn't tried the brunch food and I see why.

amazing this dealership pushes so much volume bc their pricing is simply not good - they offer all the snazzy marketing ploys - warranties that u will never use or need, and a 5,000 customer savings card which is basically a coupon book which u can get online without buying a car.

i ALWAYS find better deals from other deals.

Recently, I tried to negotiate a 2018 accord with these guys.  I got the same sleazy sales pitch and an offer that was substantially higher then the other dealers i checked with.

I have empathy for customers here who don't do their homework prying to try to buy a vehicle.

Been a long time member. The place was nice when I started, but has gone downhill. The machines are showing their age and the electronics frequently do not work. (Can't get parts is the standard reply).
I originally wanted to join because of the pool. They had good "open swim" times that worked for my schedule. About 1 1/2 years ago they started a Master Swim program that locked out the regulars 4 mornings a week. They also do not enforce the "no children" rule when the pool is open to members. 
Top that off with their extremely high dues and the place is no longer for me.

This used to be one of my husband and I's favorite places to eat. The food has just gone down so far, this time we felt ill after leaving. As we left I just hoped that my two little kids hadn't eaten anything that is going to make them sick. The green beans were good, and the sushi was actually very good (only reason it got 2 stars instead of 1) We never eat out, and were so disappointed that we ate here as our rare "treat". $40 for 2 adults and a 4 year old down the drain. I know with recent increases, they are probably trying to save money, but I would rather pay more and get better food.

I'd give zero stars if I could. I just left this place I ordered pancakes.After watching the staff converse over my food , touch different things with their bare hand and then have the nerves to touch my pancakes with their bare hands to put in the carry out container, I'm disgusted. I ordered pancakes!! Not pancakes with a side of fingerprints and spit particles!

Fried hair, high price even with a groupon and unhappy customer!  I bought a color groupon but they wouldn't honor it for a highlight so I then bought a highlight groupon.  It's $10 per bowl after the 1st so I had to buy 4 extra bowls (even though she did only the top 1/2) and a toner for $50 over the groupon.  By the time she checked my hair was really light on one side so she left it on really long to make it match.  It took 5 hours and my hair was fried!!! They refuse to refund the color groupon even though the groupon itself says it can be presented at The School for purchase price at anytime.  I've done beauty schools before but this was worse.

The worst experience of all the Lexus dealerships. But the general manager Chris is a rude and condescending man...Needless to say will never lease from Lexus again ! And definitely won't deal with this particular dealership ever !! You will not see any more of my money ! Been with Lexus for 15 years and gone through 5 cars..

The food was disgusting. The chicken had no flavor, the gravy on the potatoes was lackluster, the potatoes tasted like wallpaper paste. The worst was the biscuits. They were just disgusting. One bite and my entire family soit them back out. The tasted like salt. Just salt. The lingering taste prompted my to ask my son for his shoe to chew on to get rid of the taste. And after we ended up throwing away the inedible food, my wife ended up in the bathroom to vomit.

FILTHY!!! In the extreme. Shower stalls slimy from mold/mildew, floors slick, dark stains between grout. Looks as if it has NEVER been cleaned with anything other than a dirty mop. 
Whirlpool constantly full of dirty dark foam and the area surrounding it is very dirty. I have to keep up on my personal hygiene after visiting so as not to catch skin diseases. 
A dirty hole of a place. 
AVOID at all costs!!!

My doctor didn't even come back in to diagnose me before she had the nurse write me a script and send me off with my discharge papers. I went in for what I suspected was a bacterial infection in my intestinal track (I have a history of IBS and Gastro. Problems) I was willing to do whatever tests needed to figure out my issue and a course of action. I heard my doctor mocking my symptoms with the nurses outside my door. Belittling my discomfort because she couldn't 'see' my issue. (Diarrhea for 5+ days with no relief and blood in my stool) She remarked that she hadnt seen me go to the bathroom once since I'd been there, so I must be fine. Because in our 2 minute interaction I didnt poop on her table. In reality, I had gone two times while waiting for her to get to my room. And again when I was in my room after talking to her. I'm hoping the antibiotic she prescribed helped me but I'm confused as to why a doctor wouldn't even try to diagnose you before rushing you out of the office...I didnt feel like this doctor cared at all about my pain and only about getting me out as fast as possible so she didn't have to help me. My doctors name was Dr. Katie Shine. I'm very disappointed in my experience here and have had more helpful experiences sitting 3+ hours in an E.R. it would be worth the wait if the doctor cared about helping you.

I love the location also the store was nice and clean. the only thing they need to fix the food quality were terrible. I have 2 rice bowls for to go today at lunch time i got the white rice were over heated and hard ,  so me and my wife wont eat them instead we went to eat at whole food at center city. they need good quality control.

First time at this Panera location. Never an issue with my orders at other locations. I ordered a sesame Asian chicken salad. Upon arriving back at work I found I had been given lettuce with crunchy won ton strip topping and a few slivers of almond. No sesame seeds. No cilantro. Most importantly, no chicken. Called to complain. I was offered a free cookie next time I am in, or drive back to them to correct the "mistake." 
The next time I am in..?! 
Will be never of course. They could have at least reversed the charge on the salad. I guess I should have looked first at yelp to see this location's terrible reviews.

The screen I got replaced has dimmed color saturation and doesn't correctly fit the phone. On top of that, they charged me 3 times ($152 x3) by accident and had I not mentioned my bank alerting me, they wouldn't have known. They also never apologized for any inconvenience and blamed their system. Just go to Apple - it costs about the same without Apple care.  

Update: brought my phone back, and they fixed it no questions asked and also threw in a free 40$ case. I would still check your device to make sure the screen replacement isn't finnecky, but they did resolve my issue in the end.

Started out 2 hours late due to mechanical issues. The replacement bus didn't have it's GPS so they couldn't tell me where the bus was. Got to Nashville and they didn't have a driver scheduled for the last part of our trip so on the rebook which pushed me 12 hours over my initial arrival time I lost my job. The clerk said he would have me on a 11:45P bus, but guess what ended up on a 5:30A bus THE NEXT DAY. After being stranded there they finally issued meal voucher and guess what they closed the Restaurant. My first time on Greyhound my last time on Greyhound and I do not recommend Greyhound.

I do t get the fascination with this place.  I like burgers as much as the next guy but this is place is so average.  Need to order at least a double to get any meat.  Toppings are bland.  I am amazed that this place is a chain.

This post office a major joke. They don't deliver packages on time....excesses range from..oops sorted wrong bin...oops put on wrong truck...someone quit....
Like today...again...not delivered and says on tracking...could get to front door. Seriously?? Had this before...called...was told..oh that is just what we put in as an excuses. No wonder customers choose fedex..ups..anything other than USPS.
Horrible food.  Such a shame nice setting.  Use to be good , they're obviously cutting corners , using cheap products.  Doubt I'll return.

First, I judge a restaurant by its bread. Theirs is supposed to be homemade. If so, they should buy their baguettes at Publix.  Their bread is doughy, flat and tasteless.  Ordered penne with eggplant. Eggplant is not an expensive vegetable but there were only three, maybe four tiny, unpeeled pieces with the pasta.  The peels got stuck in my teeth.  Could they spare anymore?  Small portions and not worth it.  The place is pretty though.

Was slightly confused when I reviewed the feedback on yelp. I believe there is a much higher rated place by the same name in Bellevue. The food was largely frozen items reheated. The wonton in the soup was still cold in a like warm broth. My son and I ordered two different dishes but when they came out the base was the same frozen beef and frozen chicken with different sauces. The rice was the only non frozen item. I would avoid. The Chinese food place in Wal-Mart down the street is way better.

another panera another 2 hour late delivery another excuse!

this panera for 2 hours did not answer their phone. i had to go through customer service on 2 different occassions before anyone picked up

i highly suggest avoiding panera catering services. this is if i could guess 5 or 6x that i have had issues with food being delivered on time. this is not how you run a business

panera always has some kind of excuse and never seems to rectify the situation. they don't care that people are on limited lunch schedules and can't just eat whenever you feel like delivering! why have delievery service and options of catering, if you are never on time!

not one person from panera has reached out to me to address any issues i have had because "it is not something they do"



this is unacceptable and i'll be sure to let any other person wanting to use you guys to stay far away.

Extremely long lines on a Sunday brunch.  Sluggish ordering methodology. Ran out of sweet potato French toast.  Unfriendly service. Food is good but not great (we got a burger and a scramble). The coffee is so-so... no refills. Cool physical place and space though.

We drove over 1 hour from Delaware to have the dim sum there. Part of the reason was I got a 12% off coupon expiring 12/31/2018. I had dim sum all over the world and this was the first time I tried some dim sum in this area. I understand the price is cheaper so I didn't have that much expectation. What made me upset is when we checked out, I showed the cashier the coupon. She got very angry at us and told me the coupon was expired and they don't accept the coupon anymore. My husband and I were very confused. We had a valid coupon. Another person (manager maybe) then in the restaurant told her that they still accept the coupon. Then the cashier (owner maybe) gave us a 10% off. I don't really care about the 2% difference. But the whole experience of not accepting a valid coupon from customers making me feel cheated. It feels very unpleasant. We do not recommend this place and we will not go again.

Finance was misleading when they sold me the tire and wheel protection warranty. I was advised that it would cover rims if they are scuffed Nor true make sure that you read every word on the contract. 

They like to slide coverages and misrepresent.

Beer was good. The food was horrific. Ordered wings. The seems microwaved (mushy not crispy). Also they were green for some reason? 

Friend got a cold chicken sandwiche. Won't be eating here again.

Absolutely HORRIBLE service, they are STEALING money from the public. I had to cancel my service due to family matters that caused me to move to an area where Frontier was not available. I was told my last bill would be prorated, to reflect the 2 weeks that went unused in my billing cycle (I have this in writing). I ended up being billed the FULL amount and told that being billed in full was their fault and I would receive a refund within 60 to 90 days. No big deal... THEN I'm charged again in FULL for 2 more additional months, luckily, I removed auto pay so the amount wasn't drafted out. However, I was told I was going to be sent to collections due to failure to pay. I had to call and an hour later the additional amount was taken care of, I was told this was a "system error", no apologies. I then asked about my refund. I was told that per their contracts that they do not offer refunds, and that I have been told the wrong information (several times), because of "bad communication within the company". I asked to speak with a manager who told me the same thing, I told him I had it in writing (via the online chat) and spoke to different managers who "noted" my refund in my account. Again, he said there was nothing he can do and it's their policy, he couldn't explain to me why I had been told I would get a refund. I ended the conversation asking to speak to someone with more power, I was told this wasn't an option and I won't receive a refund. Money has been STOLEN from me. I DO NOT recommend Frontier.
Phone is always busy when i call. 3rd time in month i call them and the phone is down or busy. Wtf
They worst pharmacy I've ever been to. If you like waiting hours for simple medication fills, then this place is for you.

I'm not really one for writing reviews on restaurants, but ooooomg. Not only did we wait forever for our order, they left two items out....so my husband went inside (we went through the drive thru originally) and stood in line with a bunch of other people who had their orders given to them wrong....he finally came out over 10 minutes later, and they STILL gave us the wrong item, and it was barely warm... If we weren't going to be late to an appointment, I would have gone in again.....it's pretty much ridiculous.

Out of all the different trampoline parks I've been to, this is definitely in the lower half. It's really small, there are not very many different types of trampolines, your tricks are limited the basics (ie no double flips, gainers, or triples) they closed the main trampoline while I was there to vacuum it, so I paid to sit there because there no other open trampolines. Really disappoint and not worth the $11 for 1 hour.

I have been to this Marigny location a few times but today was the worst. If you get a server named Tim ask for someone else. One of the servers had to give me his name because he didn't introduce himself. He was rude,
And I feel racist because he catered to the Caucasian table before me. He was pleasant to them but barely acknowledged me. The food was greasy, the biscuits were hard. It also lacked taste. Not the usual food I get there. I do not know if Tim is his real name but he is very tall and Caucasian and slim built. I spoke to the manger who did comp my meals for me because I didn't eat it and was apologetic !

Good selection but prices are ridiculously high. Often these prices are even beyond what is found in the secondary market. Many bottles in the glass cases are comically overpriced. Be careful though as they do not appreciate being told about their prices. Many better options exist in a 5 mile radius for liquor, wine and beer. Go there first. Don't overpay.

After three attempts to get service at this AT&T dealer I've decided to never return. Not once, in the three visits was a problem resolved. All three times I was told either I could do it on my own, I could go to a different AT&T store, or, my favorite.... we're closing soon and that would take too long. Customer service is a foreign concept to these twenty-somethings. They should all be fired and the shop should start over with new management.

Decepção com este restaurante, que anteriormente quando era pequeno e em outros lugar ,tinha um excelente atendimento. Esperamos muito por uma mesa, as bebidas não chegavam nunca, tivemos que procurar a garçonete -uma moça de cabelos coloridos- e nada gentil...e para completar o peixe que pedi para ser Levemente grelhado, veio queimado e sem nenhum sabor ,vejam a foto. É lamentável a ganância de querer ganhar mais dinheiro, perder a identidade e não se estruturar para um espaço maior. certamente não retornaremos e avisaremos os amigos .

I've been going to this restaurant for several years now for breakfast.  This past Sunday though, I was highly disappointed to see a customer with her dog inside roaming around.  It was clearly not a service dog, just some older lady that wanted to bring her dog with her.  This is extremely unsanitary.  Diseases can be passed directly and indirectly from animals to humans.  There are also vector born diseases which are passed from the dogs parasites to humans.  As an example, ticks carry several different types of diseases.  When someone brings their pet into any establishment, but especially food, we are at the mercy of their habits such as picking up their dog's feces in their yard or letting them roam amongst it for days picking up parasites.  We are at the mercy of them keep their dog free of parasites/worms/fleas/ticks, etc.  We can only hope that their yard is free of fleas, ticks, etc., and the yard of wherever else their dog has been roaming.  We also hope that they take their dog to the vet regularly to be tested for parasites, and receive proper medication when needed.  But we all know, that in fact, is not the case with every dog owner.  We all know that people here let their dogs go to the bathroom anywhere, and then do not pick it up.  Dog excrement is loaded with parasites.  Then other dogs are roaming amongst it, and the Parasites are attaching themselves to the animals, which are now coming into the restaurant and attaching themselves to carpet and anything else in the restaurant.  One worm.....can lay 100,000 eggs per day, yes, per day.  These eggs come out in the dog's feces, and remain active in the environment infecting both animals, and humans.  In addition to impacting our health via parasites and diseases, it is highly insensitive to people that have allergies.  I had a neighbor, whose throat would immediately close up, and he required emergency EMT to assist, despite the owners claiming their dog was hypo-allergenic and shed free.  You just never know, nor can you predict, a person's sensitivity.  It is also insensitive to people whom have had negative experiences with dogs.  Dog attacks is one example.  In addition, we don't all own a dog, so please don't shove yours down our throat.  If you want to have breakfast with you doggo....eat at home.  My family and I will not be back to Lenny's due to their gross negligence for the safety of their patrons, and employees.  Bad form, Lenny's.
http://www.petsandparasites.org (1 of several resources on this subject)

If I could leave a 0 star I would. I ah e tried to ship things here multiple times and have always end up leaving disappointed. They do not ship glass. I have overnighted and shipments did not get to their location next day. 

Go to the 4th street /Bainbridge location and save yourself a headache!!

I am a guest at the Residence Inn. The older white male who delivered a pizza here sped past us in the oncoming traffic lane. We were trying to unload a handicapped teenager into another car. After dropping his pizza off he almost backed into our car, while making a 3-point turn to get out. We had to back our car up immediately. When we yelled at him, his response was truly assholish. He was not apologetic nor considerate of what we were doing. I understand being in a rush BUT to treat people with no regard at all is disrespectful and poor business.

5 Star for the service, the manager is really awesome, great attitude! ONE STAR FOR THE SUPERVISOR OR GM. The owner's right hand. This guy is so unprofessional. I worked here. He never ever ever ever gives the manager here a day off. The GM (Pancho) never even works his entire shift. And threatened all of us to take our jobs away if we did not come in for a shift we could not attend. Everything bad that happens if anything is because this guy ( Pancho ) does not try. He does not have respect for his employees. He overworks them. Especially the manager I had which im sure still works there ( Jose ) I used to come here alot, so I worked here then quit a few weeks after because of how (Pancho) treats the employees. It's disgusting. The manager works 7 days a week! The Gm or whatever he is does not give him a day off. Supposably the excuse would always be "nobody could cover him" or "come in or you'll lose your job" MAYBE EVEN IF HE HAD A FUNERAL TO ATTEND, the GM would say "No! Come in or I'll fire you" (All former employees under their business have experienced this from him) even probably when he is on his death bed, he still can't get a day off. He gave me very little hours. They do need a new GM or whatever (Pancho) is. Because they will keep on loosing employees because of how he manages the business. Alot of people barely lasted 2 weeks with pancho. PLEASE TREAT YOUR EMPLOYEES RIGHT! Yes the food is decent, although PANCHO isnt all that clean with the products &&' it's disgusting what they do to the manager and the employees here!

Firstly, my Grubhub driver was amazing and I am very satisfied with their service. As for this IHOP, never again will I order from them. My food was cold, again not because of my delivery driver but because the restaurant just had my order sitting there and told the driver it was not ready. When my driver went back she realized it had just been sitting there. Then when I got my order it was incorrect. Do yourself a favor and choose somewhere else to order from.

I spent $11 on lunch and I wasn't pleased at all. This place is hit or miss.
So much for roasted veggies (no mushrooms no carrots)

If you want to know how to not run a restaurant and particular a breakfast buffet go to this restaurant on Sunday morning, you will see hundreds of dirty dishes on dozens of tables. You will not see quality cooked hot food, fresh fruit, hot coffee nor will you see delicious orange juice. You will see haphazard food and unsanitary containers and rude condescending employees. Please don't leave my review without seeing my picture of all the dirty plates scattered all upon the restaurant. They do have a good refund policy though. I won't be trying it again though

This post office is right next to where I work so it's convenient but wow... only mail something here if you've got 30+ minutes to burn each time you stop in. There is never more than one woman working...she's friendly enough but she works at a snails pace.
I've lived a lot of places and I do my best to not be a complainer, but seriously if you have an option between this post office and one 15 minutes away just go to the one that's farther away. You'll still save time.

I was looking for a new(er) car bc my Solara with 1/4 million miles blew up. Started to speak with Jocelyn(may be spelled wrong) about a certified 2018 Subaru Legacy. Not exactly the car I want but need an AWD basic transportation. The price listed wasn't what I willing to pay. Explained I would be coming with cash(check). We spoke back and forth a couple times(email) and the last email we came within $500 of what I wanted to pay(in their favor). Went to see the car on a Saturday afternoon(1.5 hrs from me). When we got there, I spoke with Rod and told him of who I spoke with and what was agreed upon. He got another employee, Bill(very nice). He was aware I was coming and I dealt with Rod from there. This is  where, in my opinion, things went downhill. Car was inside. Asked to take it for a ride. Rod went with me. Not a peep from him. I expected him to tell me of what the car had(options), and what they did. He only told me of the option to link my phone after I made(sarcastic) comments about 2-3 things in the car(including a sunglass holder).This is a basic car. I explained I wasn't interested in linking a phone , I'm a simple person and really don't use a cell phone. He makes the comment of "I can tell you're simple, you're impressed with the sunglasses holder!" Someone was begging me not to buy a car! Didn't care, need a car. Sick of driving junk. Get back, agree to buy it. Then comes the sales pitch of wrap around warranty. Mind you it's already certified. He gives me a price of $1615 for this coverage. Most of this is profit for them. I say no, still pressed. Tried to make it clear I just want the car. Without asking who's name it's to be in, the start the process without telling me. The wife notices what they are doing. I go into finance guy and tell him car has to be in both our names. He replies, sorry I already printed the title. Ha, funny. I told him either both our names are on the title or he can keep it. So they comply(attitudes are getting better!) Then comes the paperwork with this guy. No introduction, no hello. Possibly the rudest person, almost ruined the sale with his ignorant ass basically throwing papers at us and crying about his no commission and I wont buy the "wrap around" coverage. He basically called me stupid for not buying his overpriced coverage(which he kept changing the price of) Overall, I think I got a good deal on the car. It's a nice car. Never would I step into this dealership again unless the price was right.(this was around 2 months ago). If you go here, I hope they treat you better!

Was optimistic about this place because of the many good reviews, however we never actually got to try the food. Once we were seated we waited 20 minutes and not one of the many workers that seemed to just be walking around even approached our table. (The restaurant was not busy at this time and many of the servers seemed to just be leisurely walking about) We decided to get up and leave, as we were walking out the hostess that had just seated us didn't even notice that something was off and told us to have a good day. Would be 0 stars if possible.
Awful, we live only a few blocks away and the pizza is cold? Come on. And the garlic-parm wings are probably the worse ever, no flavor. I miss the old owners.

While hearing good things about Johnny's and being told it was a place to go, my wife and I decided to come in and give it a shot. Now, we did a tour and that ended at 4. After walking all the way back to this location, it was 425pm. Apparently closing time is 430pm. We walked in, noticed about 4-6 people sitting inside, a bunch of staff, one staff on the phone. He tells us its closed. 

So you're telling me, with 5 minutes left of business hours, a good amount of people still inside and someone on the phone, maybe taking an order, I can't give you my business? With the short time spent in New Orleans, this was the only time we were able to get down there and its sad that they cant accommodate cash paying customers. We came from far away to see this place so its a shame that we couldn't try your product.

Stopped on the way home from a road trip. Didn't want to cook. Ordered Big Mac's from the drive-thru and they were all old. Dry buns cold meat. Call from the house and was told by manager Sapphire they would replace on our next visit. How about monitoring the food going out in the first place? Did get them replaced and although they were "fresh off the grill", still nothing to write home about. Never again.
The food is fine, but the service is just way too slow. Don't bother ordering ahead - you'll still end up waiting just as long.

June, the barista was clearly having a bad day today. My drink was delicious as always, and the guy who made it was very sweet. However June couldn't give me the time of day and gave me attitude when I didn't day what size I like right off the bat. I come here often but haven't seen her before, must be new. If I were running a business I would not want someone like that greeting every single guest coming in.

The physical property lives up to the W name, but I was very disappointed that the staff couldn't resolve a basic ask.  We asked by phone for in room coffee pods that weren't decaf.  We were told at first that there were none in the hotel.  I went down to the desk personally and was told that I must have been misinformed and that they would send the coffee to my room.  Again decaf was sent.  I called down to the desk again and was told that they would send up the regular coffee right away.  After an hour with no word from the desk, I called down to check again and was told that there was no regular coffee in the hotel.  How can they get such basic customer service so wrong and how does a hotel run out of coffee?  I am a gold SPG member and a regular in Aloft and Marriott properties; I have never had this problem before.

the only reason I gave this restaurant one star is because I was NOT able to give it NO stars because it would not submit my review!!!! The food was fair at best. I ordered the Bar Harbor Bake the first time it came to the table the not one of the mussels were open so I sent it back, but buy the time it returned the meal was just warm. My partner ordered the create your own combo, she ordered the scallops and asparagras (not bad) but when the bill came there were 3 additional charges on the bill. When I questioned the server we were told they charge extra for double scallops and " seasonal veggies", not mentioned anywhere near the listing for the option. I don't blame the server but the company for miss leading the customer. I think they should post ALL exceptions near the option in the menu listing not in another section of the menu. As for me I will NEVER eat at red lobster again!!!

We got a noise complaint for playing any music at half volume. Be sure to whisper on your way through or you'll find yourself whispering your way the fuck out of a room. You book a room in the French quarter and don't find yourself a serene hotel, wow no surprise. Don't bother because fun after midnight not allowed. Tyron "neighbor" (definitely a fake last name), does not have any control over this hotel. Awful experience and it doesn't get any better after speaking with him

The juice cost almost $7 for a small one, which would have been fine if it were not mostly made of ice. The lady tried to give me my salad without the waffle because it would take 5 minutes to make.
