She cordially addressed me and all customers, but I could feel the tinge of anger and disdain come straight through the seemingly respectful verbal facade. Honestly I just wanted to give her a hug and let her know that if serving customers isnt her thing , that she can take another path. The salad was on the better side of airport food.

I wish I could give this negative stars. I don't give a two Dollar bill if this chicken joint claims to be the originator of Nashville hot chicken. We are hot spicy food fanatics we have to try it. 

We got there at 11:15 and we're 11th in line for the 11:30 opening. Fine. It's legendary. Doors open, line shuffles in to an ordering window with this awkward counter in front of it, effectively jamming the line up as the people try to get back out if the way after they order. We know it's tender Tuesday but are concentrating on the menu. I notice there's a sanitation inspection sheet over on the wall with a 95 drawn on it. I say eh looks good. 

We order 5 XXX meals to go as we promised some guys back at work in Indy we'd bring them some back in the plane. #pilotperks 

Then we proceeded to wait. Then wait some more. Then even more. Literally a half hour or more before the first order comes out. And we're 11 in line. Mind you we have a 12:30 show for a 2:00 departure back to Indy. 

Some lady comes in with a rolling shopping cart looks like it's full of books. Pushes her way through the line. An excuse me would have helped. Then proceeds to unload 40 clear plastic clam shell containers of various desserts onto the awkward counter. Now jamming the ordering line up even more. They did look good. Then she proceeded to touch up her nail polish while we stood there watching. 

This is when I really started looking around. Floors. Sticky and disgusting. Walls. Equally disgusting. HVAC vent above the cash register. Looked like it hadn't been cleaned since the building was constructed. Then I started to notice the flies. Everywhere. 

One nice enough lady taking orders. But then if you start trying to watch the kitchen staff it looks like most of them are back there bull shitting. We comment among ourselves about the clear operational inefficiencies as food slowly trickled out of the kitchen. After an hour of standing there I decide to go to the car get my iPad and finish up my preflight paperwork. On my way out I notice how the floor is sticky everywhere there's no rug, everything is just filthy looking. And the flies. 

About 15 minutes later, DMat comes out with the for and we head to airport. I talk about the filth, DM says yea that sanitation report was probably a 12 and someone used a sharpie to write a 95 on it cause you can't get close enough to read it. We laughed. We sit down to eat. It's ok. It's XXX hot. Get a little sweat on. 

We change into uniform, get plane ready, passenger shows up. We leave for Indy. About halfway into the hour flight I feel queasy. Then sweaty queasy. I burp and get this nasty spoiled grease spicy make me want to puke burp. I say man I don't think I'm right. Tried chewing some gum and a little water. My minds racing for the possibly location of tums or Pepto in my backpack in the rear of plane. 

We land at Indy and secure the plane, a Co worker we brought chicken back for him and his brother drops us at DM's house. We change and he drives me over in his badass Jeep CJ to my hotel. The whole time I'm looking for somewhere to grab cause I feel like I'm going to need to lean out and puke. 

About an hour later DM text me and said he was working around the house and got cold clammy sweaty and started to feel really ill to the point he called for his better half. Said when she came downstairs to him thought he was having a heart attack he looked THAT bad. 

We eat spicy food. All. The. Time. Him and I look for spicy food on the road. Hot wings. Thai. Vietnamese. Indian. Chile and chili. Doesn't matter, we'll try it. Fresh jalapenos in the kitchen? Put them in my omelet. Hot peppers? Put them in my salad. Dinner? You guessed it, at least bring me some hot sauce. 

We've had Hattie B's at their downtown and hills location. The shut your cluck heat level. Spicy wasn't the problem. This was food poisoning. Girls at airport told us Party Fowl just opened and they heard it's good. We may try that next time. Hattie B's is a clean efficient choice always. STCU never bothers us, well except for the burn on both ends. 

Stomach still feels queasy as I write this 20hrs later. Good thing today's flights are two real short hops.

Customer service is not their strong point. Very home style. Owners are impatient with and hardly speak. Their kid was sleep in one of the booths...  I got the falafel, over cooked but still good. Vegetables were COLD. But overall decent food for a quick bite. Will return if my choices are limited.

We stood at the entry way wondering if I'd be helped for a while. No one did, we seated ourselves (even though it said to wait to be seated..pet peeve of restaurants - Be attentive!). Service was slow. Location sucks (Summerland is soo weird to me..that freeway in front of the ocean). Seating in front of the kitchen was annoying. Frankly from beginning to end, it was all annoying. Having been in places w/ very crappy food, though, in all honesty the salad I had was ok (nothing special, but seemed fairly fresh and tasted good). Trying to be fair here, but we won't be back.
This Wawa is a converted 7-11 so it does not have a public bathroom. Major problem after a long drive. Also the parking is awkward and limited. Love Wawa's in general but this one is lacking.

Probably one of the worst visits. I've had the bubba gumps my food was cold the bar was not crowded it was Sunday night about 8:30 PM there was nobody at the bar we ordered drinks it took forever to get two drinks and towards the end of the meal we ordered two more drinks that never got there until after we were finished eating during a meal I asked for some catchup and butter which never came I asked two different waiters I don't know where mine was by them or french fries were cold and the corn was cold potatoes were cold mashed potatoes coming out of the kitchen we put our stop sign up but nobody stopped so I probably won't go back

This used to be my favorite place to eat. Unfortunately it has gone down hill lately. This place is never clean and it's hard to get a server that's not new. Very poor management. One of them even got confrontational with the table next to me. It's terrible to say but I will not be back.

I used to love going here, would go 2 days a week. The manager is absolutely rude and i refuse to give him my service at this point. He never welcomes anyone into his store and is completely rude and unprofessional when checking people out. The other night i just got a salad from here and as im eating my salad, theres a big black piece of hair in it! Disgusting! Clearly not mine because i have brownish blonde hair. I will not go here anymore after this, this was the last straw! Completely grossed out and they will not get my service anymore.

Apparently I was the last customer of the night, and ordered medium tenders... They literally came out so hot that it was hard to eat them. As a matter of fact, they had so much pepper on them that it put a blister on the corner of my mouth. I ordered six and could only eat one.I'm guessing that this was some kind of joke for the last customer, but I didn't think it was too funny.

We got there around noon on a Friday. We were seated fairly quickly, but did not see a server for about 10 minutes. The manager took our order since the server could not be bothered. Pardon me, but aren't appetizers suppose to come before the entrees?  They got the entrees wrong, our drinks were wrong, and we waited 20 mintues before my husband and I decided meander around the restraunt to locate our server again to get the bill. Food was awesome, but the service is not worth it. We will not go to this one again. Thankfully there are some in the Phoenix area.

Figured I would pass the time while I wait the 20 mins for my order. NOT fast food. This location is atrocious.. there was one person working the front during lunch rush.. she was not pleasant at all. She didn't give anybody a receipt, so nobody knew their order number. She was forgetting to give everyone their cups. The line was out the door and nobody was at the counter for 5 mins at a time. People were walking out. very disappointed.

I want to like this place because it's close to my job, but went last week and received a bad spicy chicken sandwich. I'm not sure if it was not cooked all the way through or what. It was inedible. The staff was nice, but the quality of their food is poor. After this, I'll go out my way for lunch to another establishment.

I wish I could give this place 1/2 star because it sucks so bad and I don't know why it is so popular. I believe people who come here haven't had authentic Indian food. All their gravies taste the same and are sooooo overpriced. I ordered vegetable biryani tonight and all I got was a mush. If you've had biryani before, you'd know that it is a rice dish that has layers/ beds of vegetables and basmati rice. What I got was a mush of rice with frozen vegetables and food coloring don't believe me? See the attached photo.

the girl that did my hair left it worst then the before picture. Super disappointed reached out to her to get it redone and she ignored my messages. It's been well over 4 months and no responses. The picture with the hat is the before and the other two with orange hair are the after

Called Keefe's for a new whole house A/C system quote. Elden arrived in front of my house at the appointment time, which was my only indicator that he was from Keefe's, as he had no company logo on the vehicle,  he had no keefe's logo on his clothing, no keefe's logo on his clipboard and when I asked for a business card "he was out".
He briefly looked over my existing system and asked me what kind of system I wanted. I asked him what was the best one, he replied with the first of many sarcasms "the one installed correctly". He would not answer a direct question about what I needed as far as tonnage, return air placement, vent placement. He said that would all be figured out by algorithms. He then spent about 30 minutes bragging about how great THE $24,000 A/C system was that he put in his house and shared a few other of his useless life wisdoms. At this point I still do not know if he works for Keefe's or is some kind of scam artist. After playing games with me for 45 minutes he says, just tell him  how much I want to spend and he will put together a system for that price....What a Horrible expierence.  Never received a follow call, or email or letter.

Highly unimpressed, never going back! Way over priced for such a crap place. Much classier places for the same price. Firstly staff member was smoking right outside the entrance, very tacky. Went in for pedicure, no one greeted me. She did help the guy who cleans the fish tank before me, which apparently the owner didn't sign the check to pay him. (Another professional move). Saw the sign in sheet filled it out Went to pick a color, which they have a repeat of a lot of same colors (I couldn't even find a mint or coral which is what I wanted). Waited around 5ish minutes and the girl said I'll get your water started...... waited a little longer finally got back to a chair which they were only about 25% full!! Should not of taken that long. Get to the chair....... the water barely covers my feet, it was warm for about 2 minutes. The massage chair was a cheap ass piece of shit. The seat had zero padding left, Screen was broke and kept stopping the massage after 30 seconds. Had to wait for the tech of course. When she finally comes over she's making a personal call. Trying to pretend with head phones she isn't. So by the time she starts the water if cold not even luke warm. The service was fine, I asked her to put on my sandals before she painted my toes. She didn't understand so I couldn't wear them out. Wasted throw away flip flops. Went to go pay the greeter girl was talking to other staff saw I was walking up, was following me. Then some lady walked in she greeted her, ignored me, which would of been fine if I wasn't ignored when I walked in. Finished helping her ran back said something to a coworker. Filled out a board thing, then finally ran me out. Then I got asked if I wanted to leave a tip, out-loud for all to hear. I of course left one because I got a serviced preformed,  but I felt that was also tacky, and a cheap way to make people feel obligated to tip more! Needless to say I will not be back, Paris salon is the same price maybe cheaper and much better service.
My son and I were visiting NO and stop in for dinner both sharing the food.  The food was just OK.  However with that said, the next morning we both woke up sick to our stomachs. No not great!!!

I ordered the California roll and it was more like an avacado roll with a MINISCULE amount of crab. I honestly couldn't find crab in a couple of the sushi pieces. The chicken teriyaki was also super average at best. Incredibly bland. Oh and the miso soup? More like "miso" disappointed. I rarely review but this was really not a good meal. With that being said order was correct and prompt.

It wasn't BAD, and if it was just the sub I'd go 3 stars, but since we got the pizza too.  Being from NJ I need to stop getting pizza from DE/PA.  It really tasted like nothing to me.  But it was hot, delivery was fast, and the sub was good.  I think I also had high hopes since they put Yelp loves us on their menu.  Oh well.

Tonight's dinner was a mess. The restaurant was very understaffed and the wait staff and managers trying to take care of tables were rude to us and tables around us. A couple at a table near us got tired of waiting and got up and left. We should have done the same.  Lots of other good places to eat in this area, avoid this one.

Sunday Brunch: Wooo where do I begin? We came
For my friend's birthday as a party of 8 and....

1) Our table that we reserved wasn't available and we were told to sit upstairs with no music, no table, and no one was upstairs. Away from the atmosphere. We spoke to management and finally got sit in a booth 

2) We ordered our food and mimosas for unlimited brunch and the mimosas came. HOWEVER, the food was all wrong and cold. For the next 2 hours, we got all of the wrong orders. 5 out of 8 people cancelled their orders because the food took too long to come and the orders were all incorrect even with corrections

3) We were charged for our awful food. I'm also currently waiting for an order of wings that I ordered at 2pm with my original order and yet and still they're not here when I was promised to go

I understand the Sunday brunch just started but I shouldn't have to order hookah to have a perfect order. You can rectify hungry stomachs with a shot of peach schnapps! No no NO! This was one of the worst brunch experiences I've ever had. Alcohol couldn't save this.

The Red Robin at horizon blvd in Trevose PA is easily thee most inconsistent restaurant. I never know what I'm going to get when we order curbside. Today's experience was, unfortunately, disappointing. My "no pink" burger was crunchy. That was a first. It was so well done it was dry and as crunchy as the bacon. I don't know if it's the management or the kitchen staff but they definitely need to get their act together.
We were disappointed with the quality of the food.  Thankfully  they got our order wrong;otherwise, we wouldn't have  gotten the fries, which was ether best part of the meal.

I am very disappointed with the service I received at this location, I even left a email with corp. office to receive no answer back.  Poor service. I ate there the day of the waffle house shooting.  I did speak with the manager at this location in which he was ok & told him that is worker needs to have customer service training.. my rating would be 0 but in order to rate it I have to hit 1 star.  This was not my first time eating at this location.

I had used Frankie's on Fairview previously for an event in my home.   I ordered many items from their catering menu.  I was extremely satisfied.  Because I was so happy with the quality and service I was using them again for Super Bowl.  When I called to order I was given a woman's name and number to call for catering.  I called and left my name and number.  I never received a response.  Not only is this disrespectful it also would leave anyone to believe that Frankie's is not interested in customer service.  I was very disappointed because I was so happy with my previous experience.  I will never use them again and will encourage to do the same.

Bad first rental experience ever I won't recommend this company to any of my family and friends. 
I booked online from Orbitz and bought insurance for my rental car because it's cheaper than the other online company.but when the time I pick it up from the rental company the Filipino guy who was helping me told me a different price than the Orbitz online booking and he also told me that he can't see any insurance and suggested to buy from the there company for safety. my charges went up and I have two insurance on that when I get home I called Orbitz right away about the different price issue and also about the two insurance for the rental car. 
I only rented the car for one day and insurance from Orbitz. Around 6 pm we went to Vallejo to do our last trip which is grocery to Seafood city and eat at jollibee. Someone smashed out the window and steal two purses inc. the special document, car keys and also house keys. we were only inside the store for 1 hr N 30 minutes to do our last errand. to make it short I drove that rental car with broken glass to exchange it to Sacramento so we could go home to reno. we arrive at Sacramento around 11 pm. to exchange the car and one of the employee name Emily who was helping me told me that she will give me satisfaction certificate so I could $50 discount I told her every detail about what happened. She even put a note about the certificate and told me I'm only going to be charge 170 total but unfortunately, my total charges went up to $256.17 I've been calling dollar company and been told their manager or supervisor will call me regards to my issue. I will post all the transaction charges here also the amount they charge my card. You could see the two different price of two company.

UPDATE: 8/2/18
I have since received a sincere apology from the GM, and have been invited back for a dinner while he is there. I will update my stars and the review after I have gone 



I went to Boundary for brunch with some friends, and I have to say that it was quite disappointing.  Let me start of by saying that I was in the service industry for almost 12 years, and my friends are all retail veterans. Customer service is something we are all great at. The Boundary staff is another story. Our waitress wasn't attentive whatsoever, and quite frankly she had the personality of a wet rag. There was nothing there. Just all around BLAH. No smile, no chatting, no nothing. Even when we tried to joke with her a little.....NOTHING. We are a fun loving, polite, and friendly group. Let's not mention that we had to flag her down for refreshments. I then waited for a cider for almost 15 minutes, and the restaurant was NOT busy.  
My friend received cold food, and obviously sent it back. The manager then brought it back, and instead of apologizing, started going over how they pre-cook certain parts of her dish etc, and gave it back. I am not 100% sure if he threw it in the microwave for a bit, but she ended up sending it back all together after that. I completely understand that some foods are pre-cooked, and why, but when you then serve it cold, you need to apologize, and not make excuses. I apologize for things at my job, on a daily basis, even when I am in the right, because that is how customer service works. Then my other friend, who comes here all the time, ordered a burger, which she gets from there regularly, and asked for medium well, but received medium rare. Again the manager didn't offer an apology, but an explanation (aka. Excuse).  At this point my friend just said she would eat it, but considering the level of this establishment, I was expecting him to say that they would either a) take it off the bill, or b) offer her a drink or something for the mishap. We also wanted our 2 bottles of wine a little colder, and instead of bringing over wine buckets or chillers (that SHOULD have been standard for white wine), she brought us ice. Yes, ice for wine. I have worked at everything from a nightclub to fine dining, and this is NOT how you treat your customers. 
Keep in mind that even after all of this, we still tipped our waitress 20%.
4 weeks to sew a couple of buttons on a blazer wow! 5 days to dry clean a couples of shirts. There are better/faster services in town. Don't waste your time stopping in here.

Been a favorite for a long time, but going downhill fast.  Went last night with friends.  Lousy service, nasty waitress, drinks were terrible, beer served with two inches of fuzz, sent back for decent pour, came back worse than first, figured bartender did on purpose, sent back again, want what we're paying for.  Began to wait for dinner, sat one hour, place was not crowded, no waitress, no dinner.  People that came in after us were served and finished, still no dinner. Got up and left with total disgust.  Needless to say will never go there again and will spread this to everyone we know.  Not the first time we were disappointed there but this was the worst. Couldn't find a manager to talk too.  No wonder business is getting worse, no secret if this is how customers are treated.  By the way, a message to corporate, I know how I like my beer poured and it's not with 2-3 inches of foam on top, that's at least 4 ounce loss of fluid to the customer.  When you start paying or give it free then pour as you like but I don't want to hear "that's a corporate policy" !  Don't insult me or others with that bull...., your biggest profit is on alcoholic beverages, I was in the business.

By far the worst fish tacos I've ever had. They were cold and with very little flavor. There was very little fish in them; mostly filled with pico de gallo and lettuce. I would describe the dining experience as sad and disappointing.

Every time we come in here the service keeps getting worse and worse.   The manager walks around here not helping out his bartender whose in need of help.. the food is always good,  but the service is in need of a serious overhaul

Horrible service.  Manager ran away when questioned about order.  When she finally checked on status, never returned for update.  Hot dogs should not take an hour.  Will never return and would not recommend.

I dined here for the 1st time this evening with 5 other people. At first, service was great and food was great, but then service gradually became slower and slower and slower to the point where my party and I had to stand up and start putting our coats on just to get our check! After waiting a good 10-15 mins we finally got our check and paid the bill. My husband headed outside to get our car from the valet service while I paid the bill, thinking it would be quicker that way. Nope, not at all. We waited 25 minutes to get our car!!!! Absolutely unacceptable!! I'm not sure that I'd be so fast to dine here again, just because of the crappy and slow service.

This is the WORST cheesecake factory ive been to. The wait was horrible and the food was not cooked all the way and un-seasoned. They did not seem to care about customer service at all worst experience Ive ever had!!

Called in an order and asked for fried rice with 2 Dinners instead of white rice. I was charged 3 dollars more for fried rice. We've ordered from Super Wok for years and the food isn't as good as it used to be and was never charged more for fried rice.  The rice was white with a few carrots and peas , no pork. I asked for soy sauce and duck sauce and none was put in our bag. When I called about the rice the guy wanted to argue that a driver worked their and could tell me the rice hasn't changed. Will be finding a new Chinese place. Very dissatisfied since this place use to be very good. Chicken and beef lacked flavor.

Let me start by saying that I've never had a bad experience here until tonight. We wanting to eat a late dinner. Checked the internet to find published late hours (Sunday night open until 10pm). We arrived at 9:05p to find the door locked bit the staff was still inside. We called and was told they were open and a very nice greeter explained that they were thinking of closing but everything was still up and everyone started walking towards a table. Then the a woman walked up from the back, appearing annoyed and told us "we're closed!" No apology, no gratitude -- just "We're closed!"  We left and walked across the street to another restaurant (with the same hours) that actually honored their published hours.

As I said, we've never had a bad experience in the past and we've eaten here numerous times. This was incredibly annoying.

Had high hopes for this place based on its 4.5 standing...but sadly it was bleh. Hubby and I ordered a pizza and wings and it was below average and cold. Wings were puny and had no taste...one I even called a "bone ball" bc that's what it was...?! Pizza was measly and sauce and cheese was barely there. They offer no dessert options and the salad dressing to accompany the wings was inedible because it was the kind in packets and it reached probably 100 degrees in the bag. Ewww... that's dairy...and no celery. Maybe at 3 am if I were a college student it would be ok...but don't waste your money here.

We came here for my birthday after a day of walking around the city. After we were seated the waiter told us he'd be right with us... then never came back. We saw him waiting on other tables that had COME IN AFTER US and got increasingly annoyed. Finally we flagged down another server who went and got him, and he came back apologizing that he had, indeed, forgotten about us. What?? Isn't that your job?? We ordered and the food took a long time to get to us (again, tables who came in after us were getting their food and LEAVING before we had ours. There were only 2 of us). The bacon cheese poutine was awesome, the turkey sandwich was very dry, and the skillet cookie was amazing. However, we were running late to relieve our babysitter and before we ordered dessert we asked how long it would be to get. Answer: 7 minutes. In actuality, about 20 minutes and very late getting home. I'm not sure how good our waiter's sense of time was.
Consistently mediocre, but everybody is always really nice about it. What are you gonna do in the cultural wasteland known as Burlington County, NJ?

The food was very bland. I ordered the shrimp and grits, and it was mostly tomatoes on the plate. I was here for a birthday dinner so I honestly don't know if that was a factor. I'm ok with never coming back.

Lousy service, took 30 mins to place entree order.  Lobster was over cooked.  Charbroiled oysters were a little over cooked also, they had burnt edges.  For a seafood restaurant, you'd think they'd get the seafood right?!?!?

Ok vet but pricing is getting out of hand. Besides their vet service pricing going up, their prescription prices are 60% higher than 1800petmeds.com so now they charge $10 per script. A change they don't mention on their website. Still I'd rather pay that rather than an extra 60% (in this case, $137) for my dogs medicine. I've never seen a Dr or Vet charge extra for prescriptions as that is included in the basic charges when they did their annual checkups, so I'll be looking for a new veterinarian.

Good sandwiches...love the outdoor patio when there is live music.
Wish that there were people to wait on. You rather than having to get up and run in to order food and drinks.

I was sadly disappointed with this restaurant. It seemed more like a bad diner than a nice place for brunch. The food was mediocre at best. There was plenty of it, but the appearance, taste, etc was just ok

Switched to Sprint from Verizon. Set up auto pay. Went back a week later because they said we hadn't paid bill. Set up auto pay a second time. Now a month later they say we hadn't paid the bill. So I go into their web site Sunday at 0400 and set up auto pay personally. Now Monday they shut off our service because we haven't paid. They have serious issues with their ability to process payments. Spoke to another couple in the store and they had the same problem. Sprint isn't as good as Verizon coverage wise and they certainly can't get their process of billing right. I think our trip to the Sprint store by Dicks today may be our last. Terrible corporate service. But the local folks in store are nice but they too are frustrated by corporate. Sadly when we were going to switch Verizon wouldn't do anything and now they offer just what we wanted a month ago.

Be careful with Sprint, they have major problems beyond just dropped calls.

I was referred to Greco Rose Beauty for an upcoming event in early August 2018.  I sent an email to their info@ email address in mid-June and received a response from them 4 days later confirming they are available and would love to be a part of the event team.  I thought, "Great!"

I followed up with them in July a few times to confirm and discuss details but have never heard back.  I also left voicemail messages on the only phone number I have for Greco Rose Beauty -- listed in their email signature.  No response.

I am now frantically trying to find new make-up artists for an event next weekend. Really disappointing experience.

I love Starbucks coffee. Go there often. Just experienced the absolutely worse service ever. The cashier was rude. When my coffee came out it was not what I ordered. I politely told the barista and she argued with me and walked off and said something bad as she walked off. Her name was Chris. Little did she know there were other people who saw her. I will never return to this location again!

I Absolutely love Gloria jeans coffee they used to have Amazing staff .. but the past 2 years I don't know ..what the he'll happened!!! Rude lifeless girls at the counter I drive about 35 mins to get this coffee because I love the taste of it and I'm from the Chicago area where they are everywhere! The staff is awful this is honestly making me not want to come here anymore after 9 years which makes me really sad! They need a happy staff with personality.. look happy to serve customers who are paying 6 bucks for a medium drink my last visit was Thursday around 2 cashier horrible! Managers owner do something!!

We stopped at Ace hardware, so I decided to run in and give it a shot while the hubby did his shopping.
I was expecting a regular donut shop showcase filled with 
Donuts, but there wasn't.... they explained how the ordering worked, and they had a small example of the donuts. I asked if they were the size of the examples and they said yes!... uhhhh.. no regular donuts?.. there was a worker frying the mini donuts near the cashier,  that was it.
Oh well.. a cute idea, probably for kids,.. but I could just get a can of biscuit dough and fry them myself and top with cinnamon sugar for pennies..

Horrible experience. We went to the new location on eagle road. We waited for 30 minutes before our food came and it was cold and she gave us the wrong order. So if that's not bad enough I told the server that we would not be coming back, I wasn't mean or yelling, I just camly said we won't be back. So a few minutes later one of the managers a female came to our table and looked very angry and pissed off at me. Hmm...what happened to the customer did nothing wrong but wanted a hot breakfast....she then proceeded to scold me for the next 5 minutes that her server is new and how dare I speak up. It was my fault that they were in a new location and I got the new server. I had to stop eating and let my food get colder to make eye contact as she continued to chew me out for complaining about my food being cold and bringing out the wrong order to me. It was the most bizarre thing I have ever experienced. My husband was so embarrassed for her behavior towards us. I have never been treated so rudely anywhere. Oh and the last thing she did after she ranted and raved for 5 minutes was slam our check on the table and said I  comped your meal, then she stormed off. I was so embarrassed that I couldn't eat another bite and we just left. Worst restaurant experience ever

This place had the worst service ever. Came in with an hour of time and had to rush to eat because the food took forever to come out. Waiter was nice, but otherwise this place sucked. My fries were cold and my burger didn't taste fresh at all. 10/10 do not recommend eating here & I won't be returning.

this place is horrible the service sucks , the manager is  condescending towards people of color which leads me to think he's racist. I could not get proper seating for a party of 7 .
When I asked the manager was entirely to loud and nasty talking towards me and afterwards  he had the nerve to talk bad about us to our waitress before she even greeted us , so this caused her to be unfriendly towards us. After carefully observing the managers interactions with other guest I determined that he was in fact bias.

Hot Tin is the first rooftop bar I experienced in NOLA. The view is great and the design is very modern. Would be a cool place to swing by, if the execution was better. The drinks are not bad, the bartenders know what they're doing. In all honestly, service sucked and the crowd stinks. I would elaborate, but I'd rather focus my attention on great joints these days. I wouldn't return unless I had friends that were very persistent on going.

I wanted to like this place, I really did. The inside is pretty cute with all of the sticky notes on the wall.

So I went to go order at the front desk; just 2 drinks, a mango slush with lychee jelly and a taro milk tea with boba. The first drink took a few minutes, which was totally fine. However, when it came time to wait for the next drink, it took close to 20 minutes. 

So I go back up and ask the cashier if they were still working on my taro milk tea, and she said that she completely forgot to put it down on the order. Luckily, they were able to get it out within 10 minutes, but I can't help but think that the customer service could have been a lot better. They didn't really notice me waiting there; they were to busy talking amongst themselves and friends who walked in to say hi. I get that these kids are in college, but respect and good customer service is an important skill to develop. First impressions are key!!!!  

Also the taro tea was very sub par. Francine out.

The Red Hot and blue restaurant has fizzled out . The restaurant smells of amazing Barbecue but  that is nothing  more  than illusion . My wife  asked the waitress  what she recommends she said  I don't know I'm not fan of barbecue. So I ordered the  pick three the food came  and the chicken was edible  but a  very small portion , the barbecue  beef brisket  once again was a small portion. With no flavor , the Barbecue  ribs were burnt to a  crisp . When  I told waitress she like I guess I could get you more .  Approximately 20 minutes  later more ribs  arrived  and they were no better. Finally the waitress got  the manager  who agreed  to remove it for check .  We left hungry as came  in . The best part of the meal was our drinks .

Okay guys updating this. I recently went back and tried this place again. It's still the horrible little sweat box that it was years ago!! I had received a gift certificate from a relative who had no idea of my last experience. My skin was burnt and their so called homemade wax sucks it didn't even take off all the hair. The owner Sarah is horrible too

I was really excited to come to Taco Bell after I had a nice first experience at a location in Knoxville, TN. I don't blame the employees though, there was just some lack of communication with my order.

I ordered the nachos, but with jalapeños instead of meat. Luckily, they didn't put any meat on but they did forget the jalapeños. The queso tasted worse than it did when I'd previously been to a Taco Bell. It's tolerable when mixed with the hot sauce and refried beans, but on a chip by itself it's rather awful. The other problem I had with it was the same problem that I had with my taco: I didn't ask for sour cream and I didn't know it'd be included. Even the best sour cream makes me nauseous, and I didn't know it would sneak it's way into my "only beans, cheese, pico, and guac" taco. Also, there was no guac to speak of.

In the future, I don't really think this place is worth splurging on my lactose intolerance for again. If I do decide to return, I'll try to make sure the communication is more clear.

The room is nice and the hotel itself is well located. However, this wifi service is unacceptable in this day and age. It takes all of a 40 seconds to load almost any page. Then they have the audacity to attempt to up-charge for 10Mbs PER DAY!!! I didn't know that I'd have to check this kind of thing in 2018. Completely unacceptable.

Beyond furious with Ashley Furniture. I just bought a new house on my own with plenty of rooms to furnish and it has been a rollercoaster of disappointment. I purchased a sectional December 3 and still yet to receive it. My delivery date has been pushed back 6 different times due to not having all the pieces of the sectional. I will never purchase from Ashley again!

I wanted to like it here but I didn't enjoy my experience. The foot massage was lengthy which is usually a good thing, but the person doing it used her nails. Heavy clawing at the bottom of my feet wasn't great. The polish was also sloppy. For $30, you can get a better pedicure at other nearby salons.
I wanted to love it but the mole' was mediocre. I have had many types of mole' and yet to find a good one in Tucson shoot even great authentic Mexican food. What happened to the food here?
Stale cheese. Rock hard buns.  Rude and nonchalant employees.   Everything was terrible about this place.  Dirty.   Poor management obviously.

I have had absolutely the worst experience with this company. I hired them to do 3 small jobs in my house. They came, completed them, and then massively overcharged me.  They also put a horribly ugly faucet in my bathroom as a replacement without first OKing with me. I went back and forth with the owner, Brian, about getting reimbursed for the overcharge and having the faucet replaced, and finally got him to agree to it.  My husband and I later realized that whatever they did to our kitchen sink caused us to not have any hot water. The owners brother came with the original plumber, and claimed that it was not from what they did, and told us we needed a new faucet. They also came with a check for the money I was owed, but it was made out to the wrong name. Since they left, my husband again spoke to Brian who assured us that he would come take a look himself. We have now tried reaching him and the company for over a week, their office phone goes right to voicemail, and no one is calling back. Our handyman was about to fix our sink in less than an hour without replacing the faucet. This company is horrible to work with, does not communicate, and the plumbers they hire are inept. I would NEVER work with them again.

All of the balls are cracked or broken. The place smelled of cigarettes. Not a good place for kids. The computer kept messing up and when the pins were put down a few would fall. 
Would have given it 1 star but I gave it 2 because the staff was good.

This was probably the worst fried chicken I've ever tasted. No flavor whatsoever. I'm from the South, and the North just doesn't do soul food, especially fried chicken like we do. I tasted a heavy taste of celery flakes which was not pleasant. All you need for good fried chicken is some seasoned salt and flour, so I'm not sure why they are going through all these changes using celery flakes and whatever else. The hot sauce shouldn't have to flavor your chicken, that should just be icing on the cake, but I had to have hot sauce to flavor every bite. The cornbread was delicious but that's about it. I won't be going back.

So I went here for an eyebrow wax even after seeing the not so good reviews. I entered at 6:45 pm. The open sign was on and the hours on the door reflected that they closed at 7:00 pm. I entered and told them I needed an eyebrow wax. They told me they were closed. I said the sign says open and the hours show you are open until 7:00. They then repeated that they were closed and would not help me because they had other clients. I would not go back.

Do Not Stay Here unless you bring ear plugs!!  It seams that the hotel is next to a club that does not shutdown until 2am. It is loud enough that in my room on the 8th floor that I can clearly make out all the lyrics. 

I asked for a quiet room when I checked in and this was the best they had?!?  I have status with Marriott...I guess that does not matter much. 

I called downstairs and got a rather unsympathetic response of you want some ear plugs...I can change rooms but our daughters were able to get to sleep somehow. I guess it is adults that have to put up with it. I am very disappointed that we were not informed of the massive noise issue at check-in so we could at least have a choice.

I Tried the ear plugs, and they were not effective. I went to the lobby to speak with the front desk and they told me the room was listed as quite. I can feel the baseline by putting my hand on the night stand!!  This is going to be a long night...

Absolutely worst service I have ever had. The food was okay and it took about 45 minutes to get our drinks. There were big table parties around us that were getting their food and drinks immediately. It was the strangest thing ever and such a bad experience in New Orleans. Our waiter was not okay seemed like he was stoned or something. Everything was very off and the people in the kitchen were just standing there doing nothing. Worst restaurant. Don't go because it will ruin your New Orleans experience.

Just walked out of this place because my husband and I were waiting for a table and they sat a family of 4(who just walked in) now. How rude! This was my first time coming here because my family have dined here before and rave about the food. Well, I won't be returning after this incident.

So this is a pretty popular spot from what I can tell and it's trash. I've been to many cheesesteak places up here and this is by far the worst. I can't even express how bad this place was. Another place I'll never reconsider on my quest for the best cheesesteaks.

Had to wait awhile to be seated. Finally seated on the patio. Sticky table. Waited and waited for a server to come up. A server approached us and asked if we had been helped, stated no, he said, oh well I'll pick you up. Felt like we were an inconvenience from the start. Ordered fish tacos and a pitcher of margs. Slowest service of my life. Second time going and the last.

This company sucks, they have been out to my house several times and they have not solved the ant and spider problems I have been having.  They now want to charge me $290.00 to cancel the agreement.  I don't know how this can be possible when the product has not worked the first time.  Now they want to send someone else to my house.  Insight I don't think you understand this product does not work and I should not be responsible for a termination fee for something that has not worked since day 1!
I consider this company bad business to deal with.  I wished I checked them out on yelp before I went with the little sales man that knocked on my door.....

The schnitzel was the schitzel, but I couldn't find the hammocks. I was told there would be hammocks in the beer garten, but it must have been a bring-your-own-hammock situation because I didn't see any hammocks. I know the owners of this place, and I wonder why they got rid of the hammocks. Must have been their call.

Tried to bring a party of 13 people all on the same check here. The manager Stephen stated they would not accommodate a group more than 10 and that we should go to a different restaurant. We told them we didn't mind splitting up, but Stephen refused and again told us there were other good restaurants in the neighborhood for us to go to. I'm so surprised they would turn away perfectly good business. We have had our Christmas party here for several years in a row and Stephen stated this year the rules were changed. Beware if you would like to bring a group larger than 10!

Terrible, don't waste your money. Same food you'd find in the freezer section of your grocery store. Chicken fingers were hard as a rock, mac and cheese barely edible. Chicken wrap chicken was hard as a rock as well. Curly fries old and hard. Service was terrible as well. Took 15 minutes after receiving food for waitress to come back so we could ask for ranch. Another 7 to get it. Meanwhile our drinks were empty. Waitress was seen walking around eating. Smh. McDonalds would have been better.

Charbroiled Oysters are pretty dang good. Shrimp Étouffée wasn't bad, but cant complain for its $10 lunch deal. My server Robert was attentive and nice. The 2* is directed more towards management. Robert accidentally charged the dinner price, no biggie, should of been a quick and easy fix on the bill. I saw that he took the problem straight to the manager, Jay, but then I sat there for over 15 minutes (not exaggerated) for Jay the manager to change one item on the bill. Being in the service industry, it should NEVER take a manager that long to fix such a simple mistake. Overall, there are plenty of good charbroiled oyster places, and this is one place I will now never recommend or be back to.

Sign clearly states OPEN.
Yet staff says they are closed.
Lost sales & confusion, not sound business practice or customer service

Slowest Waffle House I've been to and I've been to waffle houses all over the country. They are nice just incredibly slow. It wasn't very busy, especially for a Waffle House. They also don't have gluten free waffles here like many others do. Overall I was disappointed and incredibly tired after waiting an hour for my to go bowl, not getting dinner until after 1am when I had planned to be asleep before then. I had an important morning and waited because they kept saying 10 more minutes. Again very kind people, but I would eat somewhere else if you don't have time to kill.
The foods look good but taste extremely salty. My fiancé and I stopped eating after couple bites!

Food is great, however service can use a bit more common sense. Server brought out food for whole table except my paratha. Come to find out he had dropped it on the kitchen floor. Things happen but for it to take another whole 20mins to remake a single paratha is not justifiable. Table had already completed eating their food by the time paratha was served to me. Please prioritize whats on the cook's to do list by using some more common sense.

Stay away!  The previous owners of the house we purchased left their containers at our house, so we decided to go with this company.  They failed to pick up our recycling on several occasions.  The first two I figured I'd let it go.  The third time I called and they rescheduled.  When they never showed up on the rescheduled date I called back and was told that there was no way to verify that they didn't perform the pickup, so they assumed that it was picked up as GPS showed the truck in our neighborhood (but they couldn't verify if it was at our house or not).

So, I cancelled service and figured I was done with this company.  Probably wouldn't have even bothered writing this review had I not received a bill for just under $80.00 to pick up the containers.  Now, to be clear, this is about what a quarter worth of service costs (~12 pickups).  They charged over $25/container + admin fee + fuel fee to cancel service.    

TL;DR - Be warned that this company provides bad service, doesn't believe its customers, and nickle and dimes customers at every opportunity.

Used to like their food but it's gone downhill after the move.  Chicken breast, sausage, everything was dry.  Worst were the wings.  I can't believe someone closed the lid on these and sent them out to a customer.  Burnt beyond belief - like they were post-apocalyptic.  Bummer, they used to be so good, but I wont order again.

I'm giving them two stars not cause of the food but the service. tried the online ordering everything went well got home my jumbo hot dog was no where to be found instead was a polish sausage with onions. It was good but not the jumbo hot dog that I ordered. not worth going back to complain

I agree that customer service was lacking. Walked in and was not really greeted, just more stared at with a 'Hey' as the guy sat in his chair. Kind of weird and awkward vibe from him. I would have thought he would have at least stood up and asked what he could do for us or what we might be interested in and/or needed. I wont go back because of the experience. I think the guys name was James maybe but Im not sure. The only plus was the prices were pretty good but I think I can find things at the same price elsewhere or find a place that might price match.

I have been to Jose Pistola's several times and I wish i could rate it higher. They offer very good mexican food I highly recommend chips and queso and they also always have a very good beer menu.

But sadly the staff every time I've been to Jose's has been very unfriendly not very helpful and sometimes just rude to myself or my group. Another frustrating fact for Jose's is their bathrooms are up about 3 flights of steps and is incredibly inconvenient to get to.

I will continue to try this location because the food and beer is that good and hopefully the staff and can improve eventually.

I saw all the good reviews and actually thought this place would offer good food. The pepper for the attieke was so salty, the lamb also salty, the peanut butter soup was burned with no taste. My boyfriend and I came all the way from Virginia for this disappointment. Never again!

Harrah's Reno Hotel and Casino 
Overall my trip was good , but my stay was disappointing. The room was clean but when my husband and I returned from our date in the evening a lot our belongings were stolen. We had made sure our door was locked before leaving so the only people with access to the room was hotel staff. My luggage and shoes were there but a shopping bag containing my dresses, curling iron, and all of my husbands clothes was taken.When I spoke to the receptionist about the incident my dresses and curling iron was returned to me but my husbands belongings were "never found ". We then made a report to the hotel security and asked to speak to the manager but he was gone for the day and never got back to us. Security then said that in cases like ours nothing would be done by the hotel. Arriving to the hotel we made a refundable deposit of $100 in case of any damage to the room but the hotel doesn't really care for the belongings in the room. My stay was two nights. My husband and I were never given an apology or even offered a refund or discount.

Not acceptable to use bait and switch tactics to deceive customers. 
 Received a blast email offering free lenses, took the bait, clicked through to find that the link to 'redeem' the offer was broken. Second email comes through claiming that this was a mistake, but for the trouble here's a 20% discount code, the likes of which can be had at almost anytime somewhere in social media.  So they drive traffic to the website under false pretenses.  Bad business.

Definitely not! Don't waste your money. I had them for three years and probably got five good cleans in the entire time. The last time was the last straw. The kitchen hadn't even been touched as far as I could tell. I spent the evening cleaning everything that I had paid to have cleaned. They won't be coming back to my house!

The store is nice, but the customer service was TRASH! Extremely rude, not helpful, you instantly feel like they are looking down on you as soon as you walk in. The girl told me my clothes smelled like baby powder and she couldn't take them. I purchased a shirt from them the same day and it had a big whole in it like wth. If I could give you half of a star I would have, and I hate to say it but you guys make minimum wage and you don't even get benefits. You should definitely humble yourselves.

I have used this vet for a couple years. It is the only vet i have used since moving to this area (the midwest) The staff is friendly but the visits always feel like a cursory review. I know they are busy but you want to feel your pet is cared for in a personal way. Or at least I do. I never had a complaint really, though, for the annual exams. Recently however my family had to make the difficult choice to euthanize our elderly dog who had become ill and would have needed at least one surgery we were not sure she'd even recover from. 

This was an incredibly difficult choice and one I have only made once before. The first time, my dog was put on a table and covered in warm towels. His arm was shaved and he was given something to calm him and lull him into a deep painless sleep. I was given all the time needed to say goodbye and when I was ready that vet applied the lethal dose and my beloved dog went in his sleep. 

While All About Pets did give us time to say goodby while the dog was awake and with us, they had us immediately put our terrified dog who was disoriented with pain meds and still in pain on a set of blankets we had brought for her to take her home in. We thought we'd have more time once she was asleep and her anxiety had been alleviated, giving the kids a chance to see she would have no pain and would just drift off in her sleep. The dog was scared and struggling to get away as I held her to me so they could shave her arm. While she still struggled in terror, there was no peaceful sleep for us to take time a little more time to say goodbye, instead she was given the lethal dose immediately in her terrified state and died almost instantly without any peace. Her eyes open, her tongue out. She evacuated her bladder all over me as I had been holding her and no towels had been offered.

I am horrified and haunted by this experience and knowing this wonderful creature's last moments on earth were scary and forced. Perhaps my last vet was just very compassionate and that experience was unique, but the experience at All About Pets impacted all of my family in a traumatic way and none of us will be returning or recommending them again.

Ate here all the time when it was Cielos. 
Thought we'd give it a try now that it's been reopened as Cinder House. 
Firstly....we love fine dining. We have eaten as most of the places in and around the city and of course have our favorites. Occasionally we find a place that's trying a little too hard and comes of ridiculously pretentious....(grape/bacon/corn chutney over lamb anyone?) but almost always the strange preparation of foods turn out to be delicious. 
Not here...you get all the pretentiousness followed by awful tasting food. 
Yes there is a nice view...but views can be had all over the city. 
If you want to eat as basically the casino....eat at ANY of the restaurants downstairs...the food not only tastes better than Cinder House...it's 1/3 of the price.

Wanted so much to like this place, but the lack of organization of waitstaff and food quality didn't make it possible. My wife ordered Blueberry pancakes and bacon. Her pancakes came out runny in the middle and after receiving the second batch they were over cooked and super dry. I ordered the crawfish Benedict which was the only good part of the meal, my side was loaded Barn Browns (hash browns with bacon, cheese, and sausage gravy which were charred to a crisp on the bottom. This all happened after being sat at our table and forgotten about as tables sat after us were served. Needless to say we don't plan on returning. Sad to say because on the surface it seems like a great place.

I'm not exactly sure how this place is getting such good reviews. Besides the fact that the staff was kind...I ordered guacamole and chips, a chicken taco, and a beef taco. The guacamole was old and bland...it literally tasted like nothing, the chips super oily and tasteless, the tacos were cold. The chicken had a odd taste...possibly nutmeg? Not sure but it wasn't for me. I prefer more spice/heat for my tacos. The beef was also cold and didn't have a good taste. I could of done better with an Old Elpaso taco kit from the grocery store. I'm sad that I wasn't pleased. But maybe it was just me because at least 4 "soccer mom types" were waiting in line for pickup??!!! Haha

Zero Stars!

Still waiting for the agent that stepped outside 20 minutes ago. Only one agent and three customers waiting, but she needed to go outside to see what cars she has... yet the lot is full and she has not returned!?!?

Just found out the only person working is the agent, the cleaner and the checker of the vehicles, only one employee for the days operation. 

My rental pick up time was for 10am and it is now 11:30. I can see another 45 minutes since my car will still need to be cleaned After the two people ahead of me. 

I would rent from Advantage only if you don't need the car in a hurry.

I encountered some of the rudest and ignorant service employees I have ever run across at this location.  This evening when I went in to order dinner for myself, my daughter and her children the "gentleman" who was waiting on me opted to ignore me and just push me along.  I understand this place is about push and go BUT I told him I had three dinners to order.  I can only guess that an older person is just not welcome in this place.  Another employee made a half hearted offer to wait on me only after I complained.  I opted not to order and just paid for the meals already packed and waiting.  I have never felt more uncomfortable at anytime if a public place.  I will do my best to ensure I spread the word about this location and the rude servers that they employ.  My wife and I dine out over 15 times a month.  We will NEVER return to this location

This "hostess/manager" is the reason why I gave this a 1 star, if I could , I would give zero stars. When I called to make our reservation the lady booking our reservation said we can add dinner once we board the boat, which we did. This man was upset we were adding dinner and then tried to deny our friends dinner because there was not enough food, even though there was more than he enough and the dinning area was half empty. When called out about his lack of customer service skills , he said he does not have to have good customer service skills . When we asked for the manager we were informed HE WAS THE MANAGER ! How a man like this could be the manager with his attitude and lack of customer service skills ! Because of him our experience on the boat was ruined and I do not recommend this boat cruise to anyone!

They have a two can dine for $28 special but none of the good food on the list was in stock, they didn't have any pizza, coconut chicken tenders or pretzels. The waiter stated that they had to throw a lot of their food away because they did not have any power up until yesterday, they should have posted signs or something informing customers of the limited menu. We ordered fries and Thai chili wings which were good. The movie was fine, I didn't care for the area. I will stick with my local theatre.
Service was terrible. Took 1 hour for the waiter to come out and tell us it would be another 30 minutes before our food was ready.

The music is terrible but the ball put is awesome. Two stars for that and for the overall high energy atmosphere. The security guards are cool too. 

The music is just really terrible. I felt like every song was from 2001.

I've been bringing my puppy to them for several years for grooming. Liz and Megan were wonderful. I made an appointment for my Shih Tzu three months ago at 11:00 am hoping she would be done around two. It got later and later and when I called there I was told probably another hour.  After another hour went by I called again and was told maybe a half hour more. They never said there was any sort of problem. I finally got a phone call after 4:00 that she was done. By the time I got there it was going on five. When I walked in it seemed like I was the only customer there. A young girl was holding her and she had put little bows in her hair. She really looked cute and I never got to thank her for putting the bows in. There was another woman there who was doing most of the talking and she told me I would be charged more because she was so matted. Several more workers came over and were telling me what kind of matting tool to use. I said I had that kind and I always used that on her. She was not matted that badly and I was told I would be charged for that. The woman who told me she was the groomer told me she had fleas. I was shocked and I said that I had never.seen a flea on her. Her vet would have told me if she had. The groomer at that time told me she was just infested with them and they had to give her a treatment. I couldn't believe it. A treatment. I use Frontline on her every month. They could have killed her. Of course I was told I would be charged for this treatment. Why didn't they tell me this when I called there twice in the afternoon. What were they doing with her from 11:00 to almost 5:00. She didn't smell like she had a treatment but I was constantly told that she had fleas and I of course would be charged. She never cut her nails and did not look as good as other times. The owners of Dog Wash Depot have always been very nice and always did a good job. It was a nice place to go to. I know I will never step foot in there again and neither will my friends.

First and last time that I will visit. A friend recommended this a while ago and we were craving a Philly Cheese steak. I got the Wiz and girl got the original. The bread was stale on both sandwiches and there was not much meat in them. We both walked out thinking that it was not very good at all. Two large sandwiches and two fountain drinks for 30 bucks before the tip should be outstanding for that price.

I had to cancel my toddler's general 6month check up appointment and needed to call back to reschedule. That was 1 week ago and they have contacted me no less than two times per day to reschedule her. This morning I received 2 texts and 4 phone calls to reschedule! Are you guys serious? That is bordering on harassment.  Not to mention, every appointment we were expected to be there 15 minutes early, which we were, and then would finally be seen by the dentist at least 45 minutes after we arrived which by that time my daughter was less than compliant. You work with young kids, you have to know that they don't have the stamina to wait for an hour before being seen.  I am now willing to drive to a dentist that is further away to save myself the trouble.

Thought my pizza was going to be delicious because their coal fired oven was imported from Italy. However, my pizza was TERRIBLE! I got a spinach cheese pizza, it was swimming in oil, the dough was extremely soggy and raw. Every time I took a bite of my pizza I drank a cup of oil with it... 

Very, very, disappointed..

Super Heat & Air was a no show at their first appointment.  At the second one, they claimed my less than 1 year old compressor was faulty and mysteriously needed $440 worth of parts.  I authorized the work, not really understanding that the parts were worth just $75, with the rest paying for a 20-minute installation.  Most significantly, though, I paid them to seal (mastic) my attic ducts.  Super H&A failed to issue me the $150 rebate sponsored by my electric company.  When Lakeland Electric  examined the work, they discovered that only a few duct connections closest to the garage attic access had been sealed; none of the others had been touched.  Super Heat & Air has not returned any of my calls.  Their techs asked me for a favorable review; instead they get this.

We came here for dinner and immediately noticed that it was too bright and loud in the restaurant. It's fine for lunch time but definitely not a good dinner ambience.  The menu in my opinion was limited because they repeat all the same ingredients in almost every roll like crystal shrimp, cream cheese, or green onions. The ones we did choose had pretty good flavors but like the other reviews said, the fish in the rolls were scant and you can barely even taste any fish. They really skimp you on the most important thing when it comes to sushi lol. Salmon nigiri did not taste very fresh either. I expect a fresh clean taste and smooth buttery texture when it comes to salmon but this was chewy, room temperature and tasted a bit "fishy".  Coming from the east coast I have been spoiled with delicious sushi and unfortunately I have yet to find a comparable sushi restaurant.

I went back again, but only because I had a coupon.  The food was still bad, so no change from 2017 for me.

You can't just put a celebrity chef name on a crappy restaurant with greasy, overcooked food and charge a lot for it!

Ok, I lied, it can be done....it's this place.

Came in so excited to see the new insidious movie. Theatre was packed, as expected with a new movie. Took a while to be served after sitting and made an order. Tried to get the attention of one of the workers to get water and was ignored - they only work to the button on the seat. Group of people watching was very rowdy and made it difficult to pay attention to the movie which is uncontrollable by the staff. What they can control is how distracting the employees were walking through the aisles. In past experience they would crouch down in an attempt not to disturb the audience, but they made no effort and constantly walked through without any care. Decided to leave early and hit the button to get the bill. waited 15 minutes and no service. Left to pay outside & service was still bad. Manager didn't seem to care about how the employees worked, and didn't give any compensation, or apologize for the bad experience.

Tldr: food was solid 3-4 stars but a giant cockroach flew down from the ceiling onto my shoulder during dinner, and the staff handled it so poorly. I want all visitors to know about it. 

I am not going to talk too much about the food. We ordered the cajun fries, NO favorites, redfish and bread pudding.  They were tasty.

The real kicker of the story here started when we got done ordering our food.  I felt something smack against the side of my face. When I reached for it, I felt it move down onto the table.  We then realized that there was a 3 inch long roach right there on our table crawling around. I jumped out of my seat right away because I am absolutely terrified of roaches. A few moments later, the staff came by, and "took care of it".  We changed table but I was so traumatized that the rest of the dinner was less than enjoyable.  

Our young waiter came and was somewhat apologetic about it.  He even told me about a time a roach jumped down his shirt. Thanks for that mental image...not. We ate our dinner and then came the bill.  I was so surprised to see our bill charged as full, given to us without another word of apology. No, no, no.. I asked to speak with the manager, and came a gentleman wearing a red tie.  I explained the incident to him calmly, and he explained that the restaurant passed all health checks and that they have no control over the court yard where the roaches can come from.  Um... did he just try to justify this?  I pressed on and said how is a roach landing on your customer INSIDE the restaurant an expected outcome of dining here? And then he got defensive and said that roaches can fly wherever they want and there isn't anything he can do.  I was furious at that point. Not because a roach landed on me, but because this manager thought my poor dining experience in his restaurant was not his problem.  A few more rounds back and forth, he suggested a 10% discount and free dessert.  I didn't think he was going to be more sympathetic than that so we paid the bill and left with a bitter taste in our mouths.  With so many good places nearby, I cannot recommend anyone to dine here if you care about good dining experience. YIKES.

This is what I was served by Philly Pretzel Factory on Cottman Ave today. The pretzels look like a rat has been chewing on them. I was told by the manager that the pretzels were sticking to the bottom of the oven and that they were very busy this morning. Also told that the owner was the person who made these pretzels. So that tells me the owner doesn't care about the quality of the product he's serving to the public. And to think, I was gonna place a large order for the Super Bowel. I definitely will not be placing my order with this location. Only received my 2.25 back, didn't offer a free pretzel or anything for my inconvenience. Won't be coming back to this location. Very disappointed.

Worst Outback Steakhouse ever!!!!! I guess I should not have expected it to be as good as it was when it first opened and when Outback was all the rage. Well, now there is plenty of competition near this Outback such as Grand Luxe, Yard House and Longhorn, etc. I am not even a fan of Longhorn but even that is better than this Outback. I have been to other Outback's and they are much better. The Proprietor Sue Midiri needs to make some serious changes if she wants this restaurant to survive. I have given this restaurant one too many chances, so shame on me for coming again. The food was cold and the service was lack luster. There is no excuse for poor service since the restaurant was empty. The bartender was horrible and he could not make a good Wallaby Darned. Needless to say I will never, ever, ever come here again! Bye Outback!!

Went there for Mother's Day brunch buffet.  Long lines at the buffet.  Food was meh (a little salt went a long way). We could not get a drink refill to save our lives!  Our waitress constantly walked by us in a fog.  When the bill came, an 18% gratuity was added...for a buffet...with no drink refills...

I purchased a Tesla Model 3 Performance with all the options.  Since I live in Knoxville, this Tesla location was the closest one for pickup.  Unfortunately, the experience was not very good.  When I arrived, the salesperson wanted to rush me through the paperwork before I had even seen the car.  I'd imagine a dealer selling a used Honda would've put more effort into the delivery.

When I inspected the car, the interior was dirty and there was a small nick in the door.  Also, the spoiler and "Dual Motor" badge were not included on the car (even though I paid for that option).  The salesperson was rude about the situation, said the missing items would be installed "post delivery," and made a snide remark about how Tesla's mission was a little different than other luxury car manufacturers.  These types of condescending remarks annoyed me.  Obviously, as someone buying the car, I understand Tesla pretty well and agree with their goals.

The workers also barely spent any time showing me how to use the car.  For the Model 3 (which is so different from a normal car), this was a little frustrating to me.  Fortunately, as I'm not that old (yet), I figured it out quickly.  But, I'd hate to think how someone less facile with technology would do with orienting themselves.

OVERALL:  Tesla seems to be a great company and the cars are all really cool!  But, this location really needs to step up their service.  Treat customers better.

Terrible customer service. Have a laptop that wont start up so i called apple customer service. They informed me that I could walk into the store and would be seen for repair. Upon entering i was greeted with an extremely rude reproresinitive. He informed me that he would not be able to see me. I then explained to him that i spoke with someone on the phone and they informed me it wouldn't be a problem. After arguing my point and realizing he wasn't going to help I asked for a manager. The manager (just as rude) came by introduced himself, then told me the same thing. I stormed out frustrated only to have to drive another 40 minutes back home with my broken laptop in my hands again. If I could give 0 stars I would, this isn't the first bad experience at this location.

Extremely unprofessional staff. That's not appetizing. I will say the food is very good. It's the staff that left a foul taste in my mouth. The management lied to me via phone call about my complain regarding a rude staff member. I definitely will never go back. It's a shame because this establishment had potential. Replace the management and staff then you may flourish.

My car was towed for allegedly "blocking a driveway" which my vehicle was parked no where near.  I was forced to retrieve my car at their incredibly shady location and pay them almost $300 cash. On top of that my car was rummaged through and my $200 sunglasses were stolen.  I wish the owner of this company and his loved ones nothing but agonizing pain and misery for the rest of their pathetic lives.

This is a new car wash in the area but pales in comparison to other car washes. The brushes go in every direction which is great for a sedan possibly. My vehicle has a rear windshield wiper and as I went through the wash one set of brushes so powerful pulled my wiper up and I got to sit and watch the brush going in the opposite direction take my wiper clean off. Staff went back to retrieve my wiper and I again was able to watch in horror as the young lady forced putting the wiper back on. I noticed a crack in the unit attached to the window which I promptly got an estimate for and the owner did reimburse me but had me sign a waiver absolving them of any further responsibility. 

I did pay them another visit to use their free vacuum machines that had very little suction. Think I'll take my business elsewhere.

If you are not a white local, don't bother! Please bear with me. I want to be very clear and fair...In NOLA to celebrate my birthday and this was to be the special birthday meal. We were so excited but experienced a colossal disappointment. Gentlemen at front (proprietor?)  was ok initially-acknowledged my birthday and even put some confetti on the table. Very nice. That was the end of any niceties. This waitstaff was cold and apathetic. Receipt says Benjamin was our server. Honestly, he was the worst but at least he actually spoke to us. Assistant (water, bread, dessert never spoke a word and food runner practically threw dessert on the table). About the food - I had the beet and fried goat cheese salad which was lovely but very short on beets. Proportion of frisée to beet was out of wack but when you got it all in your mouth it was delicious. We also had the scallop appetizer which seemed to have three totally different sized scallops that cooked differently (perfect to chewy) but sausage with it was tasty. Veal cheeks were a very generous portion and perfectly braised; but the tarragon was overwhelming and root veggies way undercooked; so I swapped with my husband who ordered the snapper which was good. We ordered creme brûlée which was burnt and bitter. Benjamin saw we only ate two bites and did actually ask if we liked it (first time he did that with any of the food or wines we ordered). When we told him we thought it was burnt he just said he would take it off the bill. No  "I'm sorry" or "Would you like to try something else?" He just took it away. We eat at a LOT of great restaurants in NOLA. This was the Solid worst. Also dark and loud. Bad energy. Felt total disdain from all staff. In such a diverse town known for its food and hospitality we picked the one homogenous place that didn't care if we lived or died. So be it. But if you don't want a brown tourist to eat there, get off Open Table.

We used to love this place, we still like the way they make the pizza.  Today is a very disappointed experience.  We ordered two pizzas and one Italian salad.  They brought the wrong pizza out and took a while for the correct pizza to come out.  The salad had hair in there, so they exchange a new one, but the new one has no meat, it looked like they cut the salad in half due to their own fault.  When we paid, it took more than ten minutes for the credit card to come back.  In summary, the server was inexperienced and the management did not deal with the hair issue in an appropriate manner.

Beers great, maybe because they don't cook them ? service sloooow and rude, food not ok to the bland side. Ordered a grouper burger, fish was unseasoned, no flavor, bland, soggy bun, tomato not fresh, a total disaster, I could not eat the whole thing. overpriced at $21 Mac and cheese again bland absolutely no flavor. When pointed out to server, he simply did not acknowledge and walked away. Maybe they are not used to constructive criticism. Won't come back for sure.
Waitress was nice and friendly, however my dish was extremely salty I barely ate any of it and will not be back.

I recently left this company after 2 1/2 years of employment. They cut my final check, I cash it and begin to pay my bills to float me through until my next job starts as you can understand as I'm a single father with 3 children. Now how my bank and alot of banks work is they make the funds available even though the check is still pending confirmation. Few hours later I get a call saying they've over paid me and need the check back well sorry I've already deposited the check and paid multiple bills like my rent and car payment. So what do they do they put a stop hold on the check pull the funds back out of my account and cause me to go negative and get multiple fees on my account do to insufficient funds and payments being returned. Now when I call Chelsea in payroll and ask if they're going to reimburse me for the fee's she tells me no she gave me "ample" time. I'm sorry but ample time is not calling me after I've already deposited the check into my account nor is it my issue that you've made a mistake in the first place. Now I'm responsible for over $200 in fees due to their mistake. This is the first time I've had to go through this but it's not the first I've heard or seen of them messing up payroll. This company is also the perfect example of a "right to work state" and is a revolving door and have a extremely high turnover rate as they will let you go for no reason and without warning. I know first hand as I transferred departments because of this. They charge you a fee for phones and mail, work outfit, and so on. They have many great people working for them that I thoroughly enjoyed working with but they do not have the employee's interest in mind nor do they own there mistakes. If your looking into applying for this company I'd look elsewhere. I'd do your research as I'm sure they'll just burry this review with a long list of fake good ones like the rest of the bad reviews that are more than likely true. I'm glad this company is behind me.
