Owner/Busboy/Waiter- whomever he is-is rude. It's the middle of winter and he refuses to turn the heat on. Everyone in restaurant was wearing their coats and gloves, including the staff! Extremely slow service.

I purchased a used 2011 Volvo xc90 6 months ago and have already had over $7,000 worth of "repairs" done to it.  I initially brought the vehicle back to Keystone 2 months after purchase because the battery completely died, even though it was brand new when I bought it.  This visit they tried to charge me over $500 dollars to have a "Software" update done which was supposedly draining the battery....Why wasn't this caught before you sold the vehicle to me? You do run diagnostics on your vehicles don't you?
I next brought the vehicle in because the oil light went on. This turned out to be a leaking oil pump($750) and while you are here you need two new tires because it "looks like their is in metal in the tire somewhere".  The oil light trip ended up costing $1,200....this time.  I next received a suspect phone call back from the dealership telling me that I needed to bring my vehicle back in because of the oil light?  Apparently the pump wasn't the only problem and now they need to look and the pistons and possibly replace all of them($4k-$5k)? But "Don't worry, this trip will be fully covered by Volvo".....Volvo did cover the pistons, but they did not cover the clutch  belt which apparently is in dire need of replacement!! "We do not feel safe letting you leave without replacing this!!".  This ended up costing another $500....."But this would have been a lot more sir because we are waiving the labor since we already have the engine apart".  Ohhh then please take my money!!  They just don't get it here.  The "Owner" called me 10 minutes ago and literally got defensive and yelled at me on the phone.  "I am happy that I won't have you as a customer in our future because all of my customers are pleased with my dealership".  No SIR, They are not!! It is clear to see why the reputation of this business is shit! It starts at the very top and trickles down to its every level.

Worst customer service ever!!!! My client and I go there once in a while, I never have problem with requesting separate checks. When I asked the front desk for my client's own receipt, she just refused to give him one. She was a real rude lady!! She shouldn't be working at the front desk if she can't be friendly and accommodate people!!!!! Never going back there ever again!!

Hate to say this but place has gone really downhill ! had 2 episodes first time they messed up my order and refused to fix it second time glass in my food ..kind of strange right ???so won't be dining here anymore. Sad because this place used to be quite good

The food is flavorless. This is the second time we've ordered from here and I ordered the Kung Pao, Hot and Sour Soup. The Kung Pao is loaded with mostly onions and bell peppers but is not spicy hot at all and the same is true with the hot and sour soup. We have been very disappointed that there are no decent Chinese restaurants in West County.

2 stars for delicious, creative menu and attentive waitstaff. HOWEVER, zeroes because of racially profiled treatment we received when we walked in. We are a late 60's racially mixed couple from San Francisco, well dressed, well traveled, well educated and used to higher end dining. We had a 5:30 reservation and restaurant was still half empty at that hour but we were seated at the worst table in the place... table #41, wedged between the bathrooms and waiters station. We declined the table and requested a better location. We then decided to observed how long it would take for other diners to be seated at that location... nobody... until another interracial couple arrived about 30 minutes later, also well dressed, very dignified and younger than us. They too apparently complained about the table and were also reseated elsewhere. That table was not occupied again, while we were there, until there were no more available seats in the restaurant. SAD! What should have been an enjoyable dinner experience on our visit to New Orleans was marred by the discriminatory treatment we received. This is a place that could do with serious sensitivity training. Until then We will NOT BE GOING BACK!  Sorry.
Worst Cuban sandwich I have ever had. That's what I get for ordering it at the St. Louis airport.  Can't  believe Mike Shannon gives his name to this place.....

Ordered a 2-ingredient large to go, mid-afternoon while it was slow. They got 1 out of 2 ingredients right. 2 stars, instead of 1 star, because I should have checked before I left the restaurant, but the pizza was good, if inedible for half the recipients. If you're going to wildly substitute ingredients, you might check for allergies first, Yall.

Congrats on being the worst hotel in Philadelphia for such a prime price. As someone who has been to Philly at least 10 times a year for the past 4 years, I've yet to encounter the type of ineptitude that I had with this hotel. 

1. Apparently you need to put two diff names on a reservation- when a name Change occurs, and it is updated over a week prior to checkin, and the hotel still can't put the proper party into a hotel. 

2. AC/ Fan/ Heat unit went awry, woke up sick due to drop in temperature. Nothing like coming home sick from a three day vacation. 

3. Also perpetual inability to deal with clients and locking them out of their own room, because of a "system error"

Should of had a better soft opening and been better prep



-----

To the general manager-
  The stress I've received from your hotel, should've just went to work, got paid and not wasted my money. 

No thank you. 

So when you're offering a drink to try and compensate for the atrociousness and ineptitude- don't be cheap and make the two for one

We went for a barrel tasting event on a lovely weekend.  This location has a tasting room and a small food service area, but not the vistas of bucolic vineyards that are so calming at other locations.  The people were very nice and the food was quite good, however, I didn't like their wines at all.  Every one smelled faintly of barnyard.  I suspect they have a problem with brettanomyces. 

https://www.winespectator.com/drvinny/show/id/42258

The good:   Awesome tacos,  if you like Taco Bell tacos you'll love these.  

The bad:  what's up with all the hot sauces, almost 20 types, too many to choose from, and they don't event go with the type of food offered.   You don't have many other choices of good eats here.

Came here on my birthday, 11/11. I really wanted to love this place. Really. It had a great feel to it and an upstairs, outdoor balcony with tons of TV's? What's not to love, right? We were the first on the balcony and I bought drinks on the way out there. We found our table and watched the end of the soccer match prior to NFL starting. Great start! Perfect weather. Then, more people came and received service from what appeared to be wonderful staff. My wife and I waited, no service. More and more people came, sitting at tables next to us receiving service. Us? Not a server to be had. I finally waived one down, asking for the tv to be changed (needed a remote) and he said he would be right back. Never saw him again! Needless to say, I had to get up for drinks any time we wanted one. I really, truly wanted to stay, spend my money and enjoy my birthday watching football in an amazing place, but it was not to be. When another couple joined us, they, too, did not get service. He went in and asked for a server. When she came out, she acted as we were bothering her! During the well over an hour we were there, we never did get the tv changed or orders taken. Sad, really.

I go to nail splash for the sake of convenience, when I need my nails done and I don't have much time. But overall, they suck. Everything is rushed. I would never pay for a pedicure ever again, staff are not very polite. Prices are always random. I feel as though they include their own tip without telling you. My nails are never neat, because they rush through the whole process and barely file the nail.

Went there on a Saturday mid May about 4pm.  Should have known when we saw it was not busy at all by the looks of the parking lot.  Getting inside, we were seated right away, but noticed two tables near us were not cleared or cleaned.  It stayed that way for over half an hour.  We went there because Applebees was running a special this month on Dos Equis beer.  The add said they offered both the lager and amber.  The waitress took our drink order and had no idea of the amber one, saying they only had one tap beer of Dos Equis and it was the lager.  I said ok and she went to get it, returning with out saying they were out.  How do you run out on a Saturday afternoon when your promoting that beer.  We should have just left, but we didn't.
We completed the order and don't get me wrong, the server was nice but never saw a hint of a manager and other than the server, no one acknowledged us as there.  The food came out, and it was one of their specials with steak and shrimp.  I'm not a food snob but the shrimp was tasteless.  I ordered the steak medium and should have ordered rare, as it came out well.  I just didn't want to waste anymore time there so I just kept the steak.  The server did ask if the food was alright.  It told her it was ok and not medium, but was not going to have her refire another.
Just very disappointed in this Applebees and was the worst one yet.  Usually we get pretty good food, but it's been a long while since we have gone to this one....now I know why.

Nice location, and our service was excellent
That's really all I can say, i was so put off by the crab soup
Basically a large bowl of mayonnaise and butter, you could stir the spoon around and not find a piece of crabor anything else for that matter. It was the texture of porridge
To their credit though they took it off the bill, did not question our complaint, I guess they're used to it
Instead we had chicken wings, pretty average
These guys are surviving on their location, and perhaps past performance

The gentleman who installed the doors took 7 hours to install two storm doors ok so maybe it does take that long, not sure.  He was a smoker and left a cigarette butt on my property as well as nails that were found later.  He installed the glass for us and left the screen and never tried it to make sure it fit.  Now when we went to put our screen door in it was bowed and would not seal correctly.  I called them to come check it out which they did a week later.  They told me 5 weeks ago they would order me another screen door as I can use glass or screen.  I just called today to find out they never even ordered the screen door.  It will be quite cold soon and I won't be able to enjoy the screen door because of what they called "an honest mistake".  I paid a lot of money for these doors and that is not the service I would expect.  I am very disappointed and now I have to wait another two weeks maybe to even get the doors in and than however long it takes for someone to bring it out.  Not happy at all but they got paid.

I was so hoping this was going to be good, as so many of my fellow NYKers like this place as we are from brooklyn...I get it was a Friday Night....We went in to order our pizza, we waited over an hour. We ordered 1 large cheese pie which was burnt and tasteless with the cheese was very salty and crust was doughy and tasted like rubber...We then also ordered a 1/2 veggie and 1/2 Buffalo....The mushrooms were canned mushrooms who does that and claim to have NY style pizza, anyhow Nothing on the veggie pizza  was cooked...We also ordered 20 garlic Parmesan wings and those were soggy and nasty.... this is what it looked like...Im sorry but for 53.00 for pizza and wings it was awful..

This Rita's is really strange. I think there is an overwhelming bleach smell - maybe it's mildew though like the other reviewer mentioned. It's so powerful that the water ice tastes like it smells. No thanks! I will stick to the one in Glenside.

Very rude staff today. 4 meals put in two boxes. I know this is not what the Self family wants out of their business. We are loyal customers but today may be our last time. Rushed to order and treated like honestly, a piece of garbage. Please seek customer service training in hopes of satisfying customers. Also, when was the last time a Hillsborough County inspector came? Very dirty. Think twice about coming here.

Disclaimer: I've definitely come here before and had really good pizza. This time around I left very disappointed in the product.

I got a personal Paulie's pie. It was supposed to come with meatballs, sausage, sweet or hot peppers and ricotta cheese. It ended up costing $19. I was not happy with what I received. My main complaint is that I asked for long hots and the peppers that came on the pizza were whole and not de-seeded. They didn't even bother cutting them up or seemingly touching them at all before throwing them on the pizza. They made the pizza very unwieldy to eat and I ended up pulling them off and cutting them up myself so I didn't just get whole mouthfuls of pepper. Also I don't think there was any sausage on the pizza. For what it's worth, there were plenty of meatballs on the pie. However, the toppings made it impossible to appreciate the sauce or the dough. Overall, I was very unimpressed by the pizza and turned off from coming here again. When I spend $30, I expect to get more than a beer and a really mediocre pizza.
Loved everything about the hotel. But after I was charged $35 for a HALF bottle of wine in my room, I couldn't add another star. This is petty and piggish.

We used to be regulars at this restaurant, about once a month we go there. Sometime in 2016 the food quality and the service started to drop. We probably hadn't been there in over six months.

Went today for a late lunch and will probably not be going back. Service was courteous but slow. Food was fair. Too many other good choices competing for my dinner dollars.

Seating, ambience and cleanliness are usually decent. Caesar salads are under dressed. Kitchen habitually screws up food orders.

Garlic shrimp scampi is hit and miss.
Maine Lobster tail has been consistently good for 3 years. Their iced tea is consistently good. Greater attention to clean silverware is needed; check yours before you order.

I was VERY disappointed in my food. I ordered a simple chicken sandwich for a late lunch. I was shocked because I was able to drive right up and place my order. I had minimal wait time & the food smelled delicious. 
I got home and was ready to eat my food...bit into my chicken sandwich and the chicken was RAW on the inside. Not just a LITTLE raw, but rubbery, pink, wet, RAW CHICKEN! GROSS!!!
I will never ever waste my time visiting here again!!
EVER!

This place used to be good but has gone far downhill. Avoid it at all cost. Walked in and they tried to sit me and my son at the bar. I told them I'm not sitting at the bar with my child. Place was pretty empty not busy at all. Got seated and had Michelle as a server. She asked us what we wanted to drink, I never got my drink, sat for 15 minutes then saw her take the food order of a family that just walked in. 15 more minutes I see that same family get their food and Michelle finally takes our food order. Another 30 minutes go by before I get my food. Brisket was full of fat over cooked and served on toast. Nothing like the previous time I had ordered it. Canceled the desert order after waiting an hour just to get food. Oh yeah and I still never got my drink or a refill for my sons.

I will never come back to this sushi spot, first and last time! Customer service was horrible, food was disgusting, under portioned and the prices are ridiculous. Called and placed an order for pick up around 1:45 and ordered a beef bowl, seemed more like a rice bowl, I was so excited to try it being my first time and all and was so disappointed because of the amount of beef it had according to the manager and owner of this business  (Lakman Perrera) it has to have 6 ounces of beef, called the store around 7 and asked to speak to a person in charge or a manager and was passed to this horrible rude man. I told him that I was no satisfied with my meal and why I wasn't satisfied with it because of the under portioning of meat keep in mind this bowl was $15 and had nothing but rice and veggies, asked him nicely if I can come in and show him the plate and he told me to bring it the next day around lunch time... told him if I can come in about 5 min and maybe get my meal replaced or a refund and was told that he didn't believe anything I was saying and also that if I didn't like the food then don't come back and then hung up one me, I was so shocked with what he had told me,my husband called about 15 min later and asked him nicely if we can bring him the food and show him that we were not lying about the under portioning of the food and he told him that if he didn't like the food then that's not his problem. We were both in shock, please don't not come back here don't spend money on this horrible restaurant you'll just be disappointed and not satisfied at all just a waste a money. If I can give this no stars I definitely would because it doesn't even deserve one star.

Went last night with friends for birthday celebration.  A total disaster for 3 main reasons.  Frist, an dinner was forgotten and we had to wait 4 mins for it to arrive-an eternity.  Second, coffee ordered was ice cold, had to wait 5 mins for hot coffee, an eternity.  Third, it was a surprise birthday and was set up prior to us arriving.  The waiter forgot about  the cake that was delivered mid afternoon, the wait staff started putting down desert plates before the cake arrive blowing up the surprise.  The food was expensive and only average.  Certainly not worth what we paid.  Never again.

I made an appointment here stating that I had a spa finder gift card. When I arrived at the spa I told them first thing that I had a spa finder gift card and asked if it was a problem. I was told it shouldn't be a problem. I then went to pay after my service and was then told that they don't accept spa finder gift cards. They offered to take off part of the price of the service and told me that the owner would call me to discuss the matter. I never got a call. Also the credit they gave me left $70 that the spa finder card would've covered. As great as the services were I will not be going back due to their lack of professionalism and not honoring a gift card they never told me I couldn't use. So for everyone's reference they do NOT accept spa finder gift cards.
Way too expensive, 3 tacos $13-14, everything super pricey. Prices not worth the food you get.

I should have read the reviews first. Visiting from Florida and came in for a gel mani. Scraped the old gel off and got mad when i asked if he could soak it off. Then starting applying the new gel without letting me wash off the residue from where he removed/scraped the old gel. Told me "you wont see it after im done." Sure enough after he is done my gel is bumpy and to top it off he painted my skin around my nails as well and its dried on. Never would recommend coming here.

This McDonald's needs to switch being 24/7 with the McDonald's on Lemmon Valley Road. The Lemon Valley McDonald's at least has competent employees, who get the food right and make sure it's made decently. I can see why this McDonald's has a whopping 2 stars. Deserves less...

I really thought this place was going to be good because of the reviews on here. But the paint job was very sloppy. Also when I had my pedicure done, he was digging under my toenail.... just the one. I don't even know what he was doing. But I woke up today in pain. Horrible just horrible.

First off, I was very excited to try this place out after looking at their menu.  We came here for brunch on a Sunday and chose between their brunch specials and lunch menus.  Two in our group opted for the unlimited mimosas for $10 (which I was told were very weak) and everyone but me ordered a speciality pizza. Their pizzas looked great and the three of them was were fully satisfied with their buffalo chicken, Korean and Greek pizzas.  I opted for their buffalo chicken sandwich.  This is where I was extremely disappointed.

Their buffalo chicken sandwich aka the Voodoo chicken sandwich states that it is "crispy buffalo chicken breast, voodoo chips, tomato, melted cheese, lettuce, ranch, with a side of fries."  First off, the sandwich comes out on a very hard sliced baguette (which isn't the best bread to even eat a sandwich, let alone it being very hard, barely able to bite into).  The lettuce on the sandwich is shredded and melted into the cheese, ok, no big deal, right?  But the issue I had was that the chicken was just a fried chicken breast, no seasoning, no buffalo sauce, nothing.  If you order a buffalo chicken sandwich anywhere, it comes wet.  This had absolutely no flavor whatsoever.  I was bummed and my friend took the liberty of saying something to the waiter since I didn't want to be a pain.  The waiter said "oh, it's seasoned" and I begged to differ.  He then got the manager (10 minutes later) and the manager questioned why I was not happy.  I clearly stated it wasn't a buffalo chicken sandwich and he looked at me dumbfounded.  I began to just shrug it off while my entire table was practically done with their meals (obviously offering me some slices since i wasn't eating my own order) and the manager said he can take that chicken and toss it in buffalo sauce.  I told him not unless you are giving me a new piece of chicken because the cheese and lettuce are melted together onto the chicken, that would not taste good.  He then just looked at me with a blank stare, and i just said "never mind it's not worth it".  He left and we proceeded to get our bill.  I was shocked that the sandwich wasn't discounted and there was no apology that my order was not given to me as advertised.  

As of now, I do not want to go back, despite their extensive drink menu and other great looking pizza I can try.  In time, I might be back to try the pizza but I am just very disappointed in the lack of customer service I got from management.  I left hungry and got food elsewhere afterwards.

My boyfriend, myself and our friend came eat here tonight and our service was horrible. Probably some of the worst service I have ever had. It was empty when we first got there. One side was busy so we sat in the area where you seat yourself. The hostess told us yeah it's faster on that side. Well that wasn't the case. The waitress took forever to wait on us. The whole night she never came to our table to check on us. We literally had to call her to our table every single time we needed something. My other friend was sat at the bar also said they had horrible service at one point when the bartender just disappeared for a good awhile. I was extremely dissatisfied. If you want a good tip then you better give good service . The manager definitely needs to speak to some of the waitresses that work there.

I very rarely write reviews...this was a terrible place to visit.  When I arrived at the front desk, 3 rooms that just checked in were getting refunds and leaving.  It was not dirty, it was actually FILTHY!  I don't think I need to say anything else.

3rd orthodontist in just a year! Pretty pathetic they so cheap cant even pay what these doctors are worth . Then i showed up on the  day when they cancelled everybodys appointment and because there pathetic ass's cant keep a doctor because there too cheap to pay them , they didnt even call me to tell me, had me show up and the office looked at me shocked that nobody called .this was 10-1-18.

I heard this location was opening and wanted to try it out. Came here on 3/11/18 and yes it was packed, which is a good thing in a sense considering it just recently opened, it's a weekend and I'm sure everyone was here to check it out. I really liked the gravity ropes course and all the fun arcade games. The line was pretty long for laser tag so we didn't get a chance to do that and I didn't book online to reserve lanes for bowling but that was fine because I was just happy with playing the arcade games. Unfortunately, it seemed as though Main Event catered more to you if you were bowling because you had your own area to sit and hangout for awhile which is probably why you won't be able to get anything upon arrival. It's a shame because if you don't do your research ahead of time, you won't be able to get the full experience. There could be a better management of that. Also, the bar restaurant area definitely had more seating and it's only available to those patrons. Labelle pizza had a very limited number of seats which made it very hard if you made a large order. There's approximately 10 tables??? The line stretched all the way back towards the arcade floor and the tables that were filled, even if they finished eating they stayed there to have a place to keep their belongings so that was frustrating. Tables nearby were for parties only which is fine but I do feel it could've been managed much better as far as having the employees make sure seating is open to patrons that are dining.  If that was the worse thing about Main Event, I'd still return because I'm sure it would improve over time. The worse thing we experienced that day was the majority of the employees. Most had an attitude when we asked for assistance with different games and things like that. I understand if it's not your job or something you're unfamiliar with, just tell the customers that you don't know but will find someone who does. Instead, they would suck their teeth and act as if we were annoying them. Customers are what's going to keep businesses open and are the reason the employees have jobs, the same jobs they chose to apply for knowing they would be working with people. I could see if I came and asked them to do open heart surgery, yes that would give them every right to think I was crazy but I simply asked about certain games or ticket machines that have malfunctioned.  I did not expect anyone to magically turn into an expert on how to fix the machines but I did expect better customer service to help rectify the issue. There simply wasn't much effort put into it. I know that it was busy and there were numerous issues at hand but no one resolved the issue. If that was done for every customer that day then I guess Main Event won't be open that long. Everyone pays just like the next person, even if I didn't spend a lot that day, who's to say I haven't or won't spend more during a different visit. My family and I had a great time during our visit from the moment we walked in but it wasn't until the end where something as simple as someone's attitude towards us, made us leave feeling frustrated and not wanting to return. I really hope over time these issues really improve, especially when it comes to the staff. They should know and/or be trained to deal with complex situations in an extremely fast paced environment and properly handoff customer escalations instead of ditching them. I would definitely like to come back moreso during the week when it may be a little less crowded but I will definitely pay more attention to how the staff treats us. I really hope this feedback helps because my intention is not to offend anyone.
This is probably one of the worse nail places in reno. Be careful when going they will rip you off.

First time going there and i won't be back. My eyebrows are zig saggy and not clean straight lines across. I don't know who i had but when she cut my eyebrows she didn't cut all the way across. Horrible work.

Horrible experience. Waiting time just to place an order was 25 minutes. And I saw an employee walk in and start working without using the hand wash station. Either close the employee door or wash up.

Nonas is one of those "close but no cigar" kinda places for me. I had high hopes since its right by my office (so I really wanted to like it) but no dice... More of a deli counter inside a convenience store, the "incremental meat portions" concept on basic sandwiches doesn't justify the already midrange price. The (small) patio has potential though. Maybe buy a beer and chillax? Sadly not much going on...
The burgers are overpriced and disgusting. $8 for just a cheese burger in aluminum foil soaking in copious amounts of grease. Not to mention, the customer service is nonexistent.

Ugh. Two stars is just about right. I had about a 55 minute layover. Was going to go to Starbucks, but figured I'd try the local joint. The food looks like it could be half decent. But most of the menu wasn't available. I wanted a butter croissant, which shouldn't be a problem at 9 am on a Monday, right? No bread items. I asked why, and the server responded with a disinterested shrug. The coffee tasted like day-old Folgers. A supreme disappointment. Should've gone to Starbucks, and I won't make that mistake again.

I'm just getting around to realizing Red Brick Management responded to my review, apparently I'm a little less petty about the situation...but since the response is there....I have photos timestamped from the day I moved out that prove the door lock was still broken and the light you're referring to still wasn't fixed. 100% photo-documented. It's a little ridiculous to have to fight management especially when they consistently insist to know more about building codes and construction when you're an architect with two masters degrees in the construction industry...

Horrible service. Over and hour and a half wait, no table. Terrible wait staff. Went in and they said it would be 10-15 minutes. After 1.5 hours we just left and the hostess looked relieved. Terribly run business. Do not make the same mistake we did and visit this establishment.

During the day this place is decent but tonight we waited  almost an hour for a table, placed our order and finally left and hour later because the food never arrived.  Give me a break, this was the worst service we have ever experienced.
Way over priced . They want $25 for a kids north face sweater that's old and worn. They have security tags on loft and the limited shirts. Just not worth it . I wouldn't waste my time.

Probably the worst service provider I've experienced. Since they bought Brighthouse the service has degraded substantially. In addition they have not upgraded their technology as other cable services have to allow more then 2 shows to be recorded at once on the DVR. Optimum and others allow 4 or more recordings simultaneously. I'm paying over $200/month for degraded and unreliable service. I will be looking at Frontier Fios and satellite services to replace this crap.

So to start there wasn't a single person inside the restaurant and I was still told to wait in the drive through for 4 1/2 minutes. Then I waited for 8 more minutes for 1 item. Fat boy manager was just playing on his phone and everybody who talked to me was in a poor mood. So despite garbage food that tasted 3 days old, I was greeted with garbage customer service. You need a training team or a whole new crew. I will not be returning.
I really hope this dump goes out of business. How anybody can give this place five stars is just sick.

We made reservations and was told we had to wait till the other white people to be seated because they was here first not that they made reservations but because they was here first what the point of making reservations if we have to wait the guy was rude regu

Make sure to take a free trial class before signing up for monthly payments--I wish I had.  I can't believe they call themselves a "small business" when they charge hefty sign up fees and make you pay a lot for contracts.  No small business boxing gym I've been to makes you do any contract or sign up fee.  The trainers are ok but I don't find a lot of them motivating and they take a while to get to you if you have a question.  The group equipment smells like feet and when I inquired about it they said it was because they only clean it once every 24 hours...obviously not very well (again have not had this issue elsewhere).  The solution I was offered was to spend MORE money at the gym by buying my own overpriced equipment.  When you terminate your contract, you have to pay for the next payment period as well which resulted in another 30 days of unused gym time.  I also find it ridiculous how much they charge for personal training on top of the monthly fee.  Spend your money elsewhere, even chains like LA Fitness have better pricing than this place.

I have been trying to contact this dental office for the LONGEST time now.. But I guess it's great that they have poor customer service  because recently my friend (who referred me to go here) received a bill that he should not have. Instead of answering the phone and responding to voice messages, this office simple ignores all calls and fails to answer questions as easy as "did you bill my insurance before sending me a bill in the mail?".. I have been trying to help my friend with this issue for weeks now with no response or call back from TeamDental.  

DO NOT GO HERE unless you would like to received a surprise invoice in the mail for services that your dental insurance plan covers ($100+ in payments when you have insurance..?!?!). Save yourself the headache of trying to reach the staff at this location and just go to a better dentist and office that will not try to take your money (and actually cares about your teeth and dental hygiene). 

P.S. bonus negative stars points to this office for trying to milk your insurance plan even more by *suggesting* you get Invisalign and have unnecessary teeth extracted.

It is very busy in the morning when I go. there is lines for the showers and half the time there is no toilet paper in the restrooms. I just confirmed with the manager Matt, that their child care area only gets cleaned 1 time a month. this is very unsanitary and disgusting when children are putting toys in mouth and drooling on them

HORRIBLE SALON. Do NOT go here! Walked in, waited 5 minutes to be seated. Then went to the chair, lady followed about 30 seconds later filled up the tub and no one ever came back. After about 5 minutes she came back to finagle something then left. 5 minutes later I walked out. Foot drenched and all. DO NOT GO HERE. Rude staff, horrible service, all they care about is money and shoving food in their faces.

Alright wrap but was really unimpressed with the service.  My mum and I ask for the same wrap with added avocado. When it came out there was no avocado and no dressing. No big deal but when we let the waitress know she responded "well I ring it in its on there, maybe just thinking slices or avocado. And there's definitely dressing." She then went to the kitchen and brought out avocado and proceeded to say the cook had no idea what was going on back there ever, and that she thought he would be able to have doe a simple request like add avocado. We then got charged for the dressing side that they brought half way through the meal. A single.ole sorry about that would have been appropriate, no need to throw the kitchen under the bus and certainly no need to tell customers they're wrong because you pressed a button. Really off putting and I won't be back.
Worst super nachos ever. I asked for no beans and extra Pico but it was same. For $9.00 it's not worth it.

I will start off by saying I have been hesitant to try this place, mostly because of the name...but last Friday we decided to give it a go. We were a group of 4 adults and 4 children (7-11), when we got there it was extremely busy(don't go if North Dakota is playing hockey) we had a table in the back corner, within about 10 minutes. It took another 15 minutes to get our drinks ordered and then another 10 to have them delivered. The pickle chips tasted like burnt fish. Another 20 minutes passed and our food started to come out....person by person. None of us had our food at the same time, they forgot one of the kids food. Over all it was a horrible 2 hour experience.

Don't believe the hype. Unless you like overpriced, small portions there are many better options. The food was tasty but we left hungry. Carrot yogurt had some crunchy granola, a little fruit and mint but the whole thing could have fit in a dixie cup.   For over $10?  Similarly, the tostada tasted good but was tiny. And a $5 glass of OJ need to be bigger than a thimble. The decor is too contrived and the line out the door. I wonder how it will survive when the buzz wears off.

Make sure to get a receipt for EVERYTHING.  Bought a $7.99 Health-o-meter weight scale.  The product was sold in non-working condition.  Changed battery and still inoperative.  Called store the next day after purchase and was told I would receive an in-store credit.  However I will never be "in-store" again.  Maybe that was the wrong answer.  Maybe just watch yourself on every single product you buy here.  The charity here is for the owners.

Sean, the manager, lied to my PREGNANT wife about a car he had already sold being available. She spoke to him on the phone, he confirmed the car was available, she drove an hour to look at the car and he had one of his salesman appraise her car and waste an hour of her time. They then informed her the car was sold yesterday. They then tried to get her to buy vehicles she wasn't interested in.

If you are interested in which guy is Sean, he's the 5'5 guy wearing man jewelry with the spray tan.

Utility Billing overcharges me every month for my water and sewage bill.    I have to call them, wait on average 28 minutes, and then talk to a customer representative, who is nice but unable to do anything for me directly.   I am then told that an account manager will call me back within two business days, which has never happened.   The bill is reduced without an explanation.   The following month I have to call again!   Bases on my experience, they are likely overcharging people who don't realize it.  Terrible company

POTUS:  Please fire the Post Master General.  The postal "no" service is a failure.  This government welfare institution is the swamp.  The US Postal "no" service is a Prime example of waste and no value.   They have no experience in measuring and improving customer satisfaction.   Shut this awful institution down.

If you love over salted, over cooked, cold  blan food when you are at citizens bank park stop at @Harry the K's broadcast bar & grille. Our whole table was disgusted- and  agreed we could have had better food at McD's (which we haven't eaten at a McD's in years). 
Child's pizza- no taste.
Fries - extremely over cooked and over salted. 
Chicken fingers - ice cold
Ceasar salad- limp and no taste
Pulled pork- had a kick but drowning in BBQ that had little taste
Caribbean turkey burger- over spicy & dry. 
The best part of our meals- the dill pickle. NEVER AGAIN

This Walgreens is detrimental to the black community. This pharmacy is literally acting as guards and are suppressing life saving medications. Diane Jones and Tan V., "licensed pharmacist", have attempted to convince me there is 25 doses of medication in a 2.5 ml/10 mg nasal spray. When confronted with dosage and calculations, I was met with obfuscation and the inability of Ms. Jones to get the correct calculations. Afterwards, they called the oppressors' guard, Richard Hilliard, an "assistant manager", whose job is to intimidate patients. There is no rapport between patients and pharmacist, just prisoners and guards. This is clear class antagonism, which extends to the Doctor's office of Dr. Wanda Timpton, who is complicit,  by writing incomplete and irregular orders. Walgreens need to be regulated because obviously they have a bunch of incompetents running amuck!!!

If you have to choose between this Modell's or the one on Walnut, go to the one on Walnut. It is much better stocked, the store is much nicer and the staff is way more helpful. 

When I came in looking for ski goggles I had to first search for a staff member to help me and then they sent me on a search for the goggles... pointing a customer roughly in the direction of where they should go and not making any effort what so ever is not good customer service. The store was very disorganized and honestly, didn't look very clean (?). 

This store will be an absolute last resort for me in the future.

Agree with the other reviews that are unhappy with this location.. I am about to replace all my makeup .. lucky to have several gift cards to help.. this location is so close . I went in Thursday to start looking around .. I was basically ignored and even spent 15 minutes browsing. There was a sales person with a white coat on and was too busy to bothered as she was stocking makeup in the front of the store .. left and decided to come back the next day. a Friday .. even took a ulta bag  from the lobby to show I was getting a few items .. this time at least she yelled to me welcome to ulta but that was it ..it was the same sales clerk and was too busy to come up to me because she was too busy stocking the same exact spot as the day before .. after 10' minutes I left .. with several other ultras are close this one won't get my money
how can people find this place good when some got food poisoning from their food?  what is wrong with people?

I have had experience dealing with other consignment shops in Tucson.   I have found that they are hit or miss with inventory and clothing they will accept.  I have found this shop to be less than friendly, especially to consignors.  I have brought almost new items in and watched them turn their nose up.  I am very careful to bring things that are not "donate only" items.  I have had nothing active in the store since March, 2018.  Since I heard nothing on the status of my items, I stopped in to get my check and was told that I missed the pay-out time for the month (by 3 days).  Now I have to wait until November 15 before they pay out again.  The $2 charge to write you a check for your money is ridiculous as well.  I am done dealing with this store and will continue dealing with Post Boutique instead.  Much easier to do business with and very friendly staff.

Terrible customer service!  As a royal customer, I have been coming here for a long time. I will not come back here again because of the customer service. On September 15th. 5 pm. The African American cashier is so rude! He spoke no words and did not ask if I need a receipt or not. Do I need to beg him to take my order. And he has been playing with his self phone the whole time while the customer was in front his face.    Sobol's owner, please improve ur customer service!  There are so many competitors around here. Why would I come back again? I feel just sad !  Terrible customer service!

Everything about our stay here was disappointing. 

First: the construction going on at the hotel made checking in confusing. There were zero signs telling us where to go, just one sign for the elevator. When we got off the elevator, we had to ask someone where to go to check in (it's the restaurant, FYI). Once we checked in, we had to deal with the elevators. We had to take a specific elevator to go down, but pushing the button calls both. So of course the wrong one comes and you have to trick it to get the other one to come. 

I understand construction. But some of the issues we had were not due to construction. Like the drain. The drain wasn't installed properly in the bathroom, so every time you turned the sink on it would stop the drain. We finally had to pull out the stopper. The bathroom door not shutting properly was also ridiculous. It's a door. They're not hard to replace. I actually got stuck in the bathroom, and I had to pull while my husband pushed on the door. 


The manager did call us after I complained on Twitter? but last time we had a problem at a Marriott property and wanted to change rooms, we sat around waiting for over an hour waiting on a return phone call. So, we just decided to stay put this time. But overall this was a terrible experience & I would absolutely NOT recommend this property.

I signed up for an annual contract and after a year they offer free cancellation. I wait the remainder of the year after I stop attending due to a work relocation. I then go in to cancel my membership and they conveniently "lost" my contract so not only do I have to pay the cancellation fee of $50 but I also have to wait for another billing cycle to pass. It was a great gym with decent classes but after this experience I'll never sign up for a gym again.

The portions are great like many restaurants but there was an argument with the Hispanic staff and An African American customer that did not sit well with me. It was perceived as the Hispanic staff teamed up on the African American. I question the customer service but time will tell. I gave two stars because racism is not good business in any circumstance. That argument could have put customers in hostile environment because the staff teamed up instead of de-escalating the racial situation. Although I felt the staff the wrong.

The food is good but it's a bit expensive, and also, they *force* a tip onto your initial bill. They call it "recommended" tip, but then when they handle the debit machine, they use that for the bill total, and try to get you to tip a second time...it's just all very strange.

If there is a table with a bigger group or even just with Filipinos, notice how they cater to them more and are friendlier with them. If you're white you will get unsmiling service and not checked upon often...

But really, it's the tip that does it for me. It's scheming. It's an attempt to trick you out of money. It's maliciously dishonest. And do I want to be giving money to people who think that's OK? No! Which is a shame, because I really liked this place the first 3 times I went. And I would have been a repeat customer. But on the 3rd visit, I noticed they forced a tip onto the bill for the second time, and that makes 4 bills in 2 visits, and it 's no longer a mistake.

Today, we visited this restaurant in Philadelphia.
We drove from New Jersey to come here not a very inviting welcome. Almost, borderline rude this place will never get anymore of my money!!
If proved you shouldn't go to places you follow on Instagram. Not sure how the food is as of yet didn't taste it yet. Just put off by the vibe!! The lady at covered in longs and scratching her hair. A worker comes in she working in her coat topping food,packing food.. WTH once we finally got our food my husband checked the bag to make sure all our food was in there, It started to leak out everywhere no came over they saw the mess. When, I asked for more bags because it was leaking bad he said what kind of bags......
They customer service suck assssss, we drove from NJ just to come here. What a terrible experience..

I went there right after it opened and it wasn't too busy and everything went smoothly....today I went again and it was a complete disaster. There was a manager and two workers behind the counter and the restaurant got a little busy and they were completely overwhelmed. We were given someone else's order and it took around 10 minutes for them to give us the correct order. The manager did apologize to us for the trouble. Then, after we got our order, the manager started yelling REALLY LOUD at a customer at the drive-through. She was telling the customer, I'm going to call the police on you, or something like that. For a minute I thought maybe there was someone with a gun or something but then I figured out it was just an unhappy customer. It disturbing and not an enjoyable experience and  I will not go back. They didn't have enough people working there. The bill was over $20 for 2 people and the way we were treated was completely unacceptable. The fries and milkshake were good but the sandwich wasn't that good. The bread was kind of soggy.

I have to say that when we talk with them (especially Art), they are kind and sincere, genuinely expressing they want to make it right.  I hope these guys can turn it around for us, and in doing so I'll gladly update this review when the time comes.

The problem is that we just don't understand the confusion and runaround we're getting trying to sign up for routine oil service.  After twice submitting a "keep-full" application and credit check for oil service, and twice receiving confirmation that we are on a keep-full plan, we've twice run completely dry, only to call Crystal Ice & Oil Company and be informed that they don't have us.  Each time, we've emailed back proof that we submitted the applications, and both times have never received any good reason why they don't have it.  Each time our furnace runs out of oil, floods, and costs a $400 visit to get it restarted.

These guys are apparently the best in town, so we've given them another chance to make things right.  The five-star reviews must be for good reason, but we're not there right now.
We went across the street to Felix's and they had the same oysters. Both of which gave me the ass of a loose faucet.

Dirty campsite next to the train tracks- spent two miserable nights here.  Lured in by the low price, you would expect much more out of a 3.5 star "resort".  Long check-in lines, arrived to the room on the 21st floor, it was extremely hot.  Room did not have a mini-fridge or microwave.  I turned on the AC which only blew more hot-air.  Called to complain at 6pm, also requested that they unclog the bathroom sink and shower.  They never showed up.  Called again,  finally at 9:45pm a maintenance guy knocked on the door.  Our kids were already asleep so I asked him to return the next morning, which he never did.  So we cracked the window open to cool down.  It would only open about 8 inches, so not much air would flow in.  Then the cargo train noises all night long kept us awake.  We thought about changing rooms, but with the long check-in lines, kids and all of our stuff, we just suffered through the second night.  Room was not very clean, one light was out so I pulled back the night-stand to re-plug in the light, I nearly barfed by all the old scraps of food that had fallen behind the bed and stand, but never cleaned.  Needless to say, we'll never return.  Pay the extra money and sleep somewhere else.

I'm not super picky and this was by far the most disgusting food I've ever had. I couldn't even swallow the pizza it was nauseating- it tasted like 3 week old frozen pizza. The meatballs were spongey and as someone previously wrote, the sauce tasted like spaghettios sauce. I took one bite of them and had to spit it out because it was all fat. DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE. We spent $35 and couldn't stomach any of the food, we gave it all to our dog and ordered from francoluigis (amazing pizza and much cheaper)

So disappointed in this service.  Had no complaints until they went from 2 day per week to 1 day per week at the same price.  Service cut in half should also cut the cost in half.   They came today and only took 1 of 2 cans of garbage.  So the service goes drastically down and price stays the same? So illogical.  Calling the state next.  Doesn't even sound ethical/legal.

Well it is cheap! Mariam at front desk great, but this place is gross. Bed had no blanket. What!? Yes, like they give you two sheets.  Shower head was falling out of wall. Stains on carpet and wall. Paper thin walls so bad we had to request a fan to drown out the talking and coughing from next door. I couldn't wait to check out. So uncomfortable.

The food was cold and the chicken, vegetables, and pork was bad quality. The peanut sauce was watered down. Quality has definitely gone done since the change of ownership. Egg rolls were good. That was the only thing we liked.

This IHOP is one of the worst I've been at in a long time. The first table they sat us at was leaking. The waitress took our drink order and didn't come back for 15 minutes.  After waiting another 40 minutes, we were told that our food was taken to another table and that our food would be out soon. We decided to get up and leave after that. We told the woman at the front that we would pay for our OJ, but were not waiting another 30 minutes for them to make ya eggs and toast. I wish I could give them 0 stars.

Horrible service.  They rushed and did not fully address the problems from the collision.  When the vehicle was brought back due to these problems, I was met with constant excuses as to why they wouldn't have thought to check for problems connected with impact and that they had only test drove the vehicle in the parking lot.  Asked for manager and he was extremely rude.  Instead of a "make it right" attitude, he couldn't handle that his shop didn't fully address the problem and refused to take responsibility for further damage to the body of the vehicle that happened in their shop.  Horrible!

DON'T DO IT!  Unless they can guarantee a service provider (which they can't) you may find yourself with NO provider at all.  No pool company will service it.  I am sitting here with a leak and nobody will come to fix it.  Nobody.  Not a local pool company; not an Endless Pool trained provider.  So... WTF do I do with a leaking pool   and INDOOR pool?  They are happy to take your money but if anything goes wrong....which it will....you are SOL!  And out $20,000 PLUS!  DON'T  DO IT!

I'm sorry I didn't read these reviews before I ordered their food. I ordered Chicken Parmesan, which didn't taste bad, but the portion was barely enough for a child, and I am a very sparse eater. There were two small pieces of chicken on top of about two tablespoons of pasta, and very little sauce - nothing like it was pictured. Sorry, but this was my first and last experience with Applebee's grill. Don't go there - just say NO.

I can tell this is a family friendly staple but my food was disappointing. We stumbled across this place because it was close to our Airbnb. We needed some late night food and it was the closest. It also had good reviews on yelp.  I got the 9th ward gumbo and a side of Mac and Cheese. The gumbo was a little bland and the Mac looked like it was made with spaghetti noodles. The woman that took my order seemed a little rude or rushed I don't really know. I asked her what came on the voodoo philly (the menu does not have descriptions) and she told me she didn't know. "I guess roast beef." We waiter over 45 minute for our food. It was just an overall bad experience. I expected more.

This place was my favorite Chinese restaurant, we use to come here a lot, their food is really good, but last week me and a group of my coworkers were there, we were seated immediately, when we trying to order with the waitress, she was extremely not happy, because she was talking to another staff, so we just left, clearly she didn't want to serve us. And tonight, my husband drove over 30 minutes to there, trying to order take out, and the waiter told him that they have a big reservation, so they can't take any other order. Seriously?! How big is the reservation?? It better be 100 people!! This is ridiculous!!! It doesn't make any sense! Be ware everyone! Don't waste your time or your money there! Maybe just like me, they don't even give you a chance to let you waste your money! I will never go back!!!

This was the worst experience we had dining out in downtown St. Pete on what was our last evening of vacation. When we arrived, we asked to sit outside. What we thought was the manager told the hostess we couldn't sit outside, but were told by one of the wait staff we could have a seat while they cleaned the table for us. We checked a 2nd time because we thought we were being ignored. He gave us a plain "no you can't sit outside." The restaurant was closing in an hour so we decided to have a seat inside because we just wanted dinner. 

After we ordered two chicken pad Thais and sangrias, we waited for our dinner in hopes it would be better than the horrible greeting we received when we walked in. We were incredibly disappointed in the sangrias, tasted little alcohol and did not come close to sangrias we have had before. We decided to keep them because maybe after a few sips it would get better. By this time, our food arrived. After the first bite, it felt like we were eating noodles drenched in salt. We have both had pad Thai from authentic Asian and Asian-Fusion restaurants, but never this bad. 

The one upside was that we didn't have to pay for the entrees but had to find another place to have dinner. So disappointing!

Tried this location the day after having Acme's chargrilled oysters (Unbelievably amazing) Unfortunately, I was really disappointed with Drago's version. The gumbo was average and l the chargrilled oysters did not meet the hype of food network reviewers. The topping tasted like warmed imitation butter with no flavor and wet breading. All the fire and flames made a good show for atmosphere, but they didn't actual add to the flavor of the food.

Great ambiance...had very high hopes for a new authentic Mexican restaurant in St Petersburg. If I never ordered anything and just had the salsa and chips I may give this 4 stars.  However, service...umm?  Let's just say, we'll see the blonde next Tuesday!  Generally love table side guacamole...and would have so, liked to see a better presentation of it. Our food arrived cold and cheese was not melted plates were not hot. Choice of beer was limited. I'm so terribly disappointed. Although I may give another try and see if second time is better.

Don't even read this just GO TO PENN. 6:15PM This place is terrible. If I was not referred here by an urgent care doc, I would have never came. Showed up to a busted "under construction" Emergency Department where a lady shuttled 5 patients down some winding halls like we were all on a field trip together (SUPER WEIRD) we reached another run down looking ed with some registration desks. They told me to sit and wait. At around 7PM another registration lady took my info. Around 7:20 I went back. Not terrible, I kind of expected to wait. 


It's not 9:10PM no resolution HAVE NOT seen a doc yet. They did give me an IV which the tech butchered, he dug around in my arm then went into my hand. My veins are great, I've given my self multiple IV's when I was a medic in the military. I am hydrated and can clearly see some very easy veins. That didn't bother me since I was already in pain. What bothered me is they said a doc would be in and then some random guy shows up to take blood for an issue I hadn't talked to a doc about yet. 


They had me go to the restroom to give some samples. I walked in to THE MOST DISGUSTING bathroom I have ever seen. Toilet paper wrappers and literal Poo all over the place. It had lint and stuff all over meaning it hasn't been wiped down in a while. It was really rough and I've pooped in the ground in Iraq. This is just ridiculous. I hope this helps someone and you diverge from traveling here. 

I never thought I'd say this... I miss the VA medical center  yeah, something is wrong here.

I will update this IF the resolution comes.

Always wanted to stop and today we happened to be in the area.  We went in and asked if they had a kitchen and were they serving today.  Yes to both. We were told to sit anywhere so we picked a table close to the bar.  We waited about 10 minutes and no one ever came by to ask what we wanted.  I asked my wife is we were invisible just to be sure.  I would have been happy with even someone yelling across the room with some sort of acknowledgment we were even there.   

I could understand if we had snuck in with a crowd and sat in the corner but since we were the only table with people I assumed someone would notice.   A patron who came in after us walked by and mentioned it would get busy later because of the band.  Pretty sad when the only one who notices you is another patron. 

I guess they have food since they supposedly have a kitchen but I don't know if it's any good or not.  I can say their service is not bad it is non existent.   

There is an upside to our Crehan experience,  we left and ended up at 4204 on Main St and had an exceptional experience and some outstanding food.

Prices are reasonable, food is good, place is cute, servers and staff are charming. So why two stars? Waited over an hour for our food, that's ok but only my plate came out.  We waited 25 minutes more before my partner, Sychaeus, got his breakfast. Poor Sychaeus, he is so patient. No wait staff said anything about it either, no apology or info. So I ate while he watched. I felt really uncomfortable with that and as the time passed I grew anxious and lost my appetite. Just as we were about to leave, his food came. 

If you have hours to kill, like our immortally damned to Dis souls, this may all be fine. Yet, I really love my partner and wanted him to feel happy and important. Don't worry, he's happy and everything is wonderful but we will be hesitant to return on a Sunday. There are many more places to eat beyond the great flames of Dis, where my poor Sychaeus doesn't have to wait out his eternity, watching me revel in the glorious carnal treats of this earthly paradise.

Very bad experience with this location and management.  I placed a larger order for delivery (9 sandwiches and some sides).   When I placed the order, it was reviewed and confirmed that the order was correct.  When we received the food, which was very timely (only positive of this), all but 1 sandwich was wrong.  Unfortunately, most that had placed orders didn't know each other and many had food allergies so touching the sandwiches and finding out it wasn't right, then swapping out with someone else wasn't really acceptable.  Therefore, most didn't get to eat.  
When I called the restaurant, I asked for the manager.  I explained what had happened, with some hopes of resolution.  First explanation was that it was the fault of the "new guy" that took the order.  I explained that the "new guy" reviewed the order with me and read it back correctly, so the order that was taken was how we wanted to sandwiches.  It was not his fault.  However, what we received was completely different than what he read back to me.  The manager's response then was, "Sorry, what do you expect me to do about it?"  My reply was a simple, "I'm not sure but a little more than I'm sorry?"  He rambled on about how they're changing things with their training so that this type of stuff doesn't happen and on and on.  He did eventually offer to remake the sandwiches and send them out to us.  I declined as the people that were supposed to eat the sandwiches were leaving in 20 minutes for the airport.  They had an international flight and were not going to have time to get food on the way (which is why we ordered Jimmy Johns, "Freaky Fast").  They might be fast, and they were, but not correct.
Dissatisfied with the customer service that I received from the store, I called the corporate office.  I was told that this is a franchise store so they have not control over them.  She did say that she would forward my complaint on to the owner of the store and that he would be in contact with me within the next 24 hours.  Here's a snippit from the email I received from her:
 "Thank you for contacting Jimmy John's Customer Service. My name is Emma and I am a Customer Service Team member located at Jimmy John's headquarters in Champaign, Illinois.
I'm sorry to hear that you weren't happy with your experience at the Indianapolis Jimmy John's location. I understand how upsetting it is to crave some Jimmy John's and not receive what you ordered!
This location is independently owned and operated by one of our franchisees, so I shared your feedback directly with the owner.
We hope you'll visit again and give the Indianapolis team an opportunity to make it right.
If you need anything, please contact me at enewman@jimmyjohns.com or 866.276.6302.

Thanks,"

It's been 2 weeks now and I've not heard from the owner.  I did receive a $10 gift card in the mail this past week.  Our order was $110.  
I won't be ordering from Jimmy Johns anymore.

This hotel is disgusting and the manager  lisa is very unprofessional. The beds size was wrong ,carpet has holes and stains also stains on the curtains tv wasnt workin6...called the front  desk to ask them to send someone to fix the TV in the living room. They said they would send someone and hung up in my face.. the maintenance guy came who was very polite and helpful said he would try to get our room changed 3min later the manager called the said" she didn't know what to tell me but there wasn't any more rooms available".it was 5pm and the parking lot was empty .. the maintenance guy managed to fix the TV.. now all i need is a bio suit..the bathrooms are pretty clean might sleep there
If I could give this business 0 stars I would! The manager couldn't be more rude and unprofessional. I won't recommend this restaurant to anyone!

This review is for their facilities maintenance:  I was appalled when I went to visit the men's room. Very dried fecal matter coating the toilet seat. It wasn't from that day. Shameful. With Cabella's AND Scheels in the same city, they need to step up their game!  They also didn't have what I was looking for in stock. Lose / lose.

I used to love this salon, until my last 2 experiences. For one - they used the same foil to remove my gel, as they use on some prior. Yes, took off the foil, unwrapped it and reused it. I found this absolutely disgusting. They do not clean any of their tools after use and the one women had a massive cold and still choose to do my nails. Completely appalled and they need to check for sanitizer issues!

No stars! Worst service ever!!!
Called twice last week and emailed three times to report 'no pick up' on the scheduled service day- got one reply to an email saying it was noted that they picked up on schedule- well, they didn't- then said they would pick it up the following Monday (today) even though our regular day is Tuesday- and now a message was left saying the 'driver' had mechanical issues -so no extra pick up ( for which I already paid for) the best part is, I gave the driver a very nice Christmas tip last December! Well....forget NEXT Christmas, buddy! No tip for you!

I had previously complained about this Taco Bell location and its notoriously poor customer service to the corporate website. That complaint which was made last year seemed to have fallen on deaf ears because the specific employees I had complained about are still working at said location. 
  First, a little about my experience in the past. I had a minor complaint that could have easily been dealt with but when I asked the girl (yes she was a teenager, most employees are at this location) to ask the manager to fix the complaint she just advised me that he was busy. Did not ask anyone; just told me this. Then when I asked for his name and the owner's name. I received a reply of "German" for his name. No name for the owner and a bogus phone number. The girl preparing food next to what I assumed to be the manager(male) at the time (again another teenager) rolled her eyes and said, "Doesn't she know our DM quit!" She couldn't have stood any closer to him if she tried. I informed them that they would be losing my business and I would be contacting corporate. Their exact response: "We are a franchise. We are not owned by corporate."Not only did I say that they represent Taco Bell, but I said they would be losing my business as I would now be having to travel to another Taco Bell rather than deal with their service a block from my house.

    This visit was an improvement yet still messed up the order as is always the case. There was one gentleman in front of me ordering in the dining room. I ordered after him. He got his food and left. I overheard the conversation on the backline of this Taco Bell as I was wondering what was taking my 1 item of food so long. I ordered the new Nacho Fry Bell Grande. Turns out they had given the gentleman in front of me my order as well as his and had to make me a new one. This among other food mishaps are consistent to the point customers must check their food every time to make sure it is correct and all items are there.
  I'm really not trying to bash on these employees considering the fast food industry is where I got my start and I continued for 6 years before moving on to bigger things to pursue my passions. I just have a hard time when the employees make the customer feel like it is an inconvenience on them (employees) to serve the customer not only food but with respect as well. This is now happening too frequently to count.
I wanted to like this place, but I put my foot in the tub and there was left over sugar scrub from the previous pedicure. And my gel nail polish was very streaky.
Terribly slow service.  Tables sit empty while dozens wait to be seated.  It seems to be a trend that no one wants to fix.

The hallway is super sketchy and the elevator is sooo slow. I practically aged waiting for the elevator. There were no big towels just hand towels. We were in town for a concert . We woke up skipped the breakfeast and got the hell out.

This place is terrible.

I am always open to trying new places, but sometimes that means finding yourself in a restaurant you hate.  You live and you learn, but I will not be back. 

I arrived with a party of 6 around lunchtime on a Saturday and we were seated right away.  We all ordered food and drinks shortly after being seated, and our drinks were brought out promptly.  Our food, on the other hand, took AN HOUR to arrive.  And it arrived cold.

I got their nutella crepe, my girl friend got their golden monkey crepe, her husband got a burger and fries, one of our other friends got an omelet, all completely cold.  I think maybe two of the dishes came out hot, but they were served in small cast-iron skillets, so that couldn't have hurt. Everything I tried seemed like it could've been pretty good if it was served hot, but I'll never know, because I would never go back here.

Aside from the disappointing food, the dining room is also very small.  I wouldn't imagine a party much larger than ours could hope to find a table during peak hours.  The bathrooms were also very dark, with two of the four light bulbs in the vanity being burnt out.  

Like I said, not a fan and I wouldn't recommend this place.  The only reason they get 2 stars is because the staff wasn't rude and the food wasn't disgusting... but seriously, get your act together, SoBro.

Wish I could give a better rating to this salon; the two stars really just reflect how friendly the staff were who helped us.  My friend and I booked this salon prior to a special formal event for hair and makeup; we chose it for the location and the fact I've always liked Aveda salons for the special little extras they offer (hand massages, facials, foot soaks, etc.). Our appointments were late in the afternoon on a Saturday.  Perhaps this was our downfall? We were offered no special little "extras" at all.  My hair was pinned up but the stylist used so much hairspray I felt like I was back in the 80's with my Aqua Net.  My hair was super stiff, but about an hour later the front pieces she'd pulled out and curled were flat.  My friends hair fell flat, as well in the same period of time.  Our makeup seemed haphazard and rushed.  Although it was a warm day, we both had to touch up (I had to essentially do mine over) before we left for the event. I really didn't feel special and/or glamorous at all and honestly could have done my hair and makeup better myself.  We paid over $250 (including tip) for both of our services and I feel we really didn't get our money's worth for this price.  
Perhaps their regular clients have better experiences here; I really wish we would have!

If I could give no stars, I would. Let me start by saying they are terrible. Me and two co-workers came in for ONE small and very simple order. A 6 piece chicken and an egg roll was all that I ordered. When the cashier took the order and I paid, he did not give a receipt. (IF YOU ARE GETTING TAKEOUT HERE, AFTER TOU PAY, GET YOUR RECEIPT!!) After I pay and he takes the order, we have a seat in their "waiting area" right at the door. Time moves along and we realize we have been waiting for over 20 minutes for a simple order. I then question how long it will be as we have been waiting a while and I am then told the food will be ready in 1 minute. 5 minutes pass and at that point I'm angry. I then go to request a refund and what do ya know, the small order comes up. I go to take the order from the now different cashier (who was there when my order was placed) and she asks for a receipt before she gives me the food. I tell her no receipt was given when we paid almost a hour ago and she then takes the food, goes over to the other hostess to ask if i truly paid as if I was trying to steal a 6 piece and an egg roll!! A second cashier also had to ask if it was paid for. I then had to explain the guy who took the order didn't give a receipt, took the food outta her hand and left. The amount of hunger and anger I experienced at this place will never be forgotten and I will never spend my money or encourage anyone else to spend their money here. Trust me. A better experience awaits you in the same plaza with better food at Beijing House. Thank me later.

This motel is awful. There were ants in my bed and bathroom. However, the most horrifying detail of my weekend stay was the sex trafficking that took place on the premises. To say I felt unsafe is an understatement. A person in my conference group reported the incident to the hotel staff and authorities. Do not stay here.

On Saturday, July 28th went to see Mama Mia for my birthday.  I had a free ticket for my birthday.  I was told that there were restrictions and I could not use my free pass to see this movie until 2 weeks were up.  There are no restrictions on the email and the young lady said just tell them at the ticket counter what happened when you go to use the coupon and it will be honored.  Needless to say I was very disappointed.  Very unhappy birthday experience.  I would like to hear from someone regarding this restriction and it not posted on the email. Thank you.. Judyfonash@yahoo.com

Fun course for both kids and adults but woman who checked us in would not honor the coupon we received for signing up for their mailing list via email. Wasn't going to argue with her over a $1 per person off coupon, but then at the end of the round she hands our group coupons for...you guessed it...$1 off per person. Also didn't offer the senior discount for the people in our group that were 55 and older. Good time but don't expect them to be forthcoming with any discounts. Would have been nice since we spent $75 for 5 people to play one round.

The food gets a 5 star rating.  Our food tasted great.

The cost gets a zero.  The menu is grossly overpriced compared to the competition.  

The service gets a 1.  It should not take 3 workers over ten minutes to prepare 2 sandwiches in a restaurant void of any other customers.  Unfortunately when one worker is too busy flirting with her boyfriend, rather than making our order, we got to wait unnecessarily.  I can only imagine the fiasco during lunch hour.  If I could afford to waste anymore time here, laughing at the lunch rush fiasco would be the only reason to return.  

Jerksey Mike's is yet another inefficient, overpriced, poorly run Boise eatery.

Joe was great and the booking process was fantastic. The 2 stars is that they said they would give me three different quotes but I only received one, for thermocrete, the highest priced option. I feel like they forgot about me????  

Also, after scoping my chimney they never cleaned the junk that fell etc during the inspection???? There was a pile of junk left in my fireplace. 

Looks like I will be calling another company....
Compared to everything else we ate in new orleans this place fell short. Unseasoned, tasteless grits, bland eggs, and soggy bread. Skip it and go somewhere more authentic.

I have never had a worse experience with any company than I've had trying to get my lost phone replaced through Assurant. As others have stated, the representatives use a script that is often unhelpful and there is no way to speak to upper management other than sending a hard copy letter to a corporate office in Wayne, Pennsylvania. I filed my claim 2 weeks ago, and every day I am given a new reason that the 3-5 day review process has restarted. As just a few examples, I asked if any additional paperwork needed to be submitted to substantiate my original claim, and I was told that the claims filing process was comprehensive. 3 days letter, I checked my online claim and found that they required more information, including an original purchase receipt (even though no one contacted me to tell me that). I uploaded it immediately and called to inquire how long this would slow down the process, and was told 3-5 days and there was no way to expedite. Then I received an email that the receipt was missing 5 categories of information that were clearly present on the receipt. I spoke to another representative who explained that the processing department just made a mistake and he would push it through to be processed again. I asked him if any additional documentation might be requested so I could upload it to my claim. He assured me nothing further was needed, and he understood Assurant was responsible for the delay. But guess what happened anyway? That began the clock over. Then I checked my online account again the next day and saw that the "duplicate" receipt was again marked as "unacceptable" because it did not list the serial number. I called again and explained xfinity mobile didn't include serial numbers on the purchase receipts. I was told to handwrite the serial number on the invoice because all the information needed to be together. I asked if I should also upload a separate document with the serial number in an abundance of caution and was told that unnecessary documents could slow the claims process down. I uploaded the invoice with the handwritten number and was guaranteed by 3 different supervisors that my claim would be expedited because the service had been so atrocious. The next thing I know I checked my claim and the serial number was rejected because it was HANDWRITTEN. You can't make this stuff up. I was again told by multiple supervisors that they would monitor my claim and make sure my replacement phone shipped the next day. No one contacted me. I called again, and was told that there was now an IT issue holding up the claim, because an analyst accidentally put the wrong date for when the phone was released, which made it seem like I lost my iPhone XR before it had even been released. Obviously this too was not my fault, but it again re-started the 3-5 day claims process. And my only option to complain or speaker to higher level management is to write a letter to corporate. I will certainly be doing so and canceling my policy going forward, but I am amazed this company is even able to stay in business. It's a disgrace. The entire point of paying for insurance is to receive a replacement phone quickly in the event of loss. Instead, filing a claim through Assurant requires basically a full time job of staying on top of incompetent people, and doing so still does not result in a replacement device.
