My engagement ring has lost 2 stones in 2 years. Jared's refuses to replace the stones despite the fact that I have a warranty specifically for this. They also say that unless I lose 3 stones per year, my ring is not considered to have any issues. I called to speak to corporate who told me they would "rather speak to my husband on these issues"...what??

Food was great! Their baguettes are very good. However I found the place not very hospitable. The lady at the register was not very helpful. I asked if there was any recommendations for the banh Mi. She unemphatically started to list meats that were already on the menu. It was not helpful at all. I almost felt like I offended her and she was listing the names as if I should have already looked at the menu and decided for myself what to get. I asked for extra meat for the Banh Mi which was a $1.50 more, but when I received my sandwich it looked like just a regular amount. I was not sure if the order was wrong but did not want to say anything as the service did not seem very hospitable. Granted this was thanksgiving day so maybe everyone just wanted to be done and leave. But I did not feel like the service was very friendly. Nice place if you want to just pick up food and leave.

I visited the opening day yesterday around 7pm and have been debating since then how many stars to give. I'll start with the one positive, this location is ideal for those who work west of City Hall. I'm not sure whether to cut this place slack or feel they should have done better but when we arrived they only had 4 (meat/fish) options. The line was long and overall it took us about an hour to get our food. The place was HOT! Like I'm standing in one spot sweating gross hot. I'm not sure if the AC was broken, couldn't go higher, too many people? It was just super uncomfortable. The employees looked tired and irritated which is understandable but still we're the customer and that left a bad taste in my mouth. Speaking of bad taste, the food...pretty gross honestly. I was forced to get chicken (that in itself is a crime, chicken on a poke bowl, yuck) which I paired with shrimp, white rice, mango, corn, cucumber, pickled ginger and for sauce the Sesame Ginger. The chicken and sauce were both bland in my opinion. My friend and I did the BOGO free and out total almost came to $15 and neither of us had anything extra so compared to other places this is def on the pricey side. Will I return, ehhh maybe in a few months when they sort out the kinks.

I have to be honest, I'm shocked at how bad this place actually is. We stopped by here Sunday for some sandwich's to go. Big mistake! We ordered a variety for us and some friends.

Presentation wise, all the food looked good. We ordered pastrami sandwich. It was terrible! Overly salty and covered in lettuce. The rye bread was by far the best part. The turkey club was equally as bad. The turkey was beyond dry and the bacon wasn't very fresh. You could tell it was reheated, it was chewy but rock hard. The Italian hoagie flat out tasted funny. The meat was cut super thick and it was also very slimy. The hoagie lacked seasoning but it was covered in onions. Due to the taste and look of it we trashed it. The pierogis were easily forgettable. They were your typical stuff and not very good. They turkey special, again the turkey was dry. The thousand island was good but again something out of a jar, cole slaw was the same. All
Of the sandwiches are large but that's not always good. I'd prefer quality over quantity but that's just me.  The cheesesteak egg rolls were the best part of our meal. They were actually edible.

Overall it was a terrible experience and we would not return. To say we were disappointed would be an understatement. It's really hard to mess up one sandwich, let alone 6.

Cool place but seriously.... we asked for our food to be boxed (before it came out mind you) and this is how they gave us our kale salad - NO DRESSING NO LOVE- basically here's some kale and two slices of avocado for $11.50- lame- we had two Korean tacos and three tinga chicken tacos- spent about $75 if we add our split checks together. I do not complain about money,  Oak steakhouse and Kayne Prime are two of my favorites and eat there regularly - don't think I'll come back again- service absolutely was horrible except the host - bigger dark dude- he was cool.

I love the old school steak houses with the showmanship and art of flambé anything. My son and I decided after carefully going through other choices of steakhouses in the Reno area, Harrah's Steak House was the winner. 

We get in the casino and looking for the directions to the steakhouse well it was behind us next to the keno area by the entrance door downstairs. Hmmm no sign but the on next tot he stairs lol. 

Anyway we get downstairs and you can already tell it's one of those old school steak houses with the servers in their tux's, flambé carts and dessert tables on display. I was getting excited and I knew I was getting something flambéd. Whatever it was.


Before we ordered, we were served our waters, bread basket, butter and amuse bouche. We started with a seafood platter for two. Which came with 2 halves shelled lobster tails, 4 Cajun shrimps, 2 oysters on the half shell, 4 pieces of seared Cajun ahi tuna all wet! Why they are all laid on cubed ice that is used for your drinks. Not crushed ice that is for seafood. And why the Cajun flavor on anything? I just want seafood no flavor just dipping sauces to choose from. Sure they gave me soy, cocktail sauce, seafood mustard like sauce, but what's worth the sweet pickle, wasabi, pickled ginger because I'm not putting that on the Cajun tuna, that's just not right. Aside from the Cajun seasoning, why was the shrimps over cooked, so rubbery. Don't order this! 

Second course was stage lobster bisque, this was good. Not amazing but good. 

Mains were shrimp scampi and New York med rare add. On Oscar topping. Here's the problem, the linguini was over cooked, the shrimps once again hard and rubbery which was over cooked. The steak more rare than med rare, the Oscar topping looked like bits of shredded crab leg meat in a weird sauce. It didn't look appetizing. So don't bother with the Oscar topping upgrade. Actually don't bother with the scampi either. 

For dessert yes we kept going, I said I was going to get something flambéd! We ordered the banana fosters for two because that's the minimum which is $30 and profiteroles with hot fudge. The desserts were the WINNER!! I would come here just for the desserts! I wanted to try the cherries jubilee but my son like banana fosters uhg. 

Would I come here again sure for desserts. Yes they were busy and it seemed like they only really wanted to cater to the loud obnoxious drinking customers and the servers are working the tables for more tips. The other server I witnessed leave mid ordering from customer to say bye to his other customers that have apparently been regulars which was laughable but rude. Our server was at least trying to pay attention even though he is working the other table hard. I mean we probably spent more money than the other table of 4 but we weren't drinking and they were so he was pouring that wine. 

At least now I won't wonder about this place, sometimes you just need to experience it yourself and give an honest review.

Made an appointment with the Eye Doctor. Pleased with the Eye Doctor appointment. Walked out 10 feet to buy new glasses with my new prescription from Eye Doctor. Was told my insurance was not valid. I said I just walked out of Eye Doctor and Eye Doctor had no trouble with my insurance. She supposedly check again and said my insurance was not valid. Walked out and got 2 new pairs of glasses down the street - with my insurance. They had no problem.

PGW's parts and labor plan is total garbage! My water heater went out and the man from PGW explained that it was not covered by my parts and labor plan. 20 years ago my heater went out.  It was replaced, with the same parts and labor plan. What happened? Now nothing was covered except maybe a bracket here and a screw there. Yeah,  I was paying the same amount of money, yet I was never informed of the changes. Well, I guess that's what fine print is for. We took icy showers for a week waiting for PGW to do.......nothing. If you have the same crap parts and labor plan, you better get an immersion heater from Amazon (for $50) and a big plastic bucket to avoid the same fate. The PGW man explained that my house heater suffers from the same diminished coverage, which is scary.
This was our first visit with our daughter for her birthday. Don't waist your time or money.  Service was terrible and our order was so jacked up.  It was a train wreck and irritating.

Place was packed, stood on the street over 2hours, watched patrons walk out, 20 plus, and establishment seated no one.  Management is terrible, and service is even worse. Started out a 20 minute wait, turned into indefinite. Servers had no answers. Might be a great place if all is well, but our experience was terrible. Had to find a restaurant at 830. Not easy. Avoid them if you have to wait, as they aren't very honest to their customers

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. I went in for an oil change and not only do they try and rip you off they did HORRIBLE work. Long story short I had a sever oil leak that lead me having to tow my car to the dealer after they inspected it they called with the problem. Whichever employee did my oil change must have not known what they were doing because they used a tool that should have not been used causing them to crush the outside of the oil filter. Driving around like this cause to much pressure leading the oil filter to break. I now have to pay $200+ to get this fixed. My dad stopped by to talk to them and from the beginning they had a really bad attitude. DO NOT COME TO THIS JIFFY LUBE!!!

If I could I wouldn't even give this place a 1 star.  My daughter and her friend went before homecoming and it was a so unacceptable.  Polish was all over their fingers and hands. Nails were not shaped.  I can't even describe the French tip nails it was so bad.  Awesome nails did not fix their mistake or refund us. They said they don't work for free.  YIKES.  
PS.  Forgot to mention...their power went out and they still saw it as the customer's responsibility to pay for their service. wow.

Three stars because I'm sick and tired of them not toasting my bagel. I've given this location multiple chances to make me a toasted egg and cheese bagel, but time and time again, my bagel has come out room temperature with cold egg and a slice of cheese. DnD has the best egg and cheese bagels when they're made right. I love when the cheese is melted. I can't help but think that they just have previously lightly toasted bagels standing around and then throw the egg and cheese on. Yuck. This DnD is in a great location, it's just too bad some of the employees don't care to do their jobs correctly.

Shen Yun was not a good experience. I adore live performances however this was very difficult to get through Stories told by dance were colorful but lacked excitement or interesting aerobatic movements. Singing and music was not pleasant. Don't waste money or time.

Really rate a -1

We recently stayed at Grand Plaza as returning guests.  

We found the room extremely filthy!  When we complained, we were shown another room and found that to be just as filthy.  When complaining, the manager was told to come up to see the filthy condition of the room, he ignored the request.  No follow up from management was ever made to determine what we were going to do.

Furniture was all chipped and extremely worn and we were unable to use the drawers due to the filth in them.

Housekeeping spends about 5 minutes in the room - witnessed one day. Absolutely no cleaning - as is evidenced by the filthy conditions of the room.  See pictures below.

The mini fridge would tilt forward when opened... thought it would fall on our feet every time it was opened.


Extremely disappointed with our time there.  As frequent travelers, We ALWAYS found employees at various locations welcoming and friendly... acknowledging their guest everyday, throughout the day. NOT so HERE.

You lost returning guests and will never be recommended!

I would give this zero stars if I could. I just had the worst experience with such awful customer service from the Avis employees. I'm still in shock at how rude they were to me. I'm a President's Circle member of Avis and I will never use them again after this experience.

My daughter had sesame chicken and I had Gen Tso chicken. Both were full of fried dough balls and little meat. The dough was either dry and crunchy or soggy. Disgusting either way. Both sauces were way too sweet. Lo mein noodles were not authentic but edible. Still can't figure out how our two meals and two drinks came out to $19.05 based on their advertised prices. Just don't.

I called Green Meadows to order an arrangement for my mom as she has  ordered arrangements from them in the past and loved the results. When ordering, I asked for bright, colorful, and cheery. I referenced their Instagram post from the day before which featured peonies and was very colorful and asked if I could have something like that. 

What I received was night and day from what we discussed over the phone. It was bland and not what I expected. When I picked it up and saw it, I asked if I could pay more to add some color to the arrangement and was told that I could not. I am not sure what happened here. There were bouquets for sale that were the similar to the Instagram post from the day before and closer to what I had requested, so I know that they had the flowers we had discussed on the phone, but I do not know why what I received and what I ordered were so vastly different. 

The flowers I received weren't bad, but it was not something I would have ever picked out for the recipient. This would have been a three star review if I had been able to modify the arrangement to something closer to what I had ordered. I was surprised that they wouldn't let me make changes to the arrangement after I expressed that I was unhappy with the order and offered to pay more to get it closer to what I wanted.

Pretty disappointed with the food. I ordered the pasta without chicken and it came with a plain garden salad which cost $18. There was no price reduction for not ordering chicken. The pasta pomodoro was flavorless and had barely any sauce. The deserts I tried weren't good either. The lemon bar tasted funny almost artificial and the brownie cheesecake was overly sweet and rich. Prices are too high here.

Memorably awful. Restaurant fairly empty- took over an hour for food for 3/7 people in our party-- one of the people who actually got food they made it incorrectly but somehow remade it wayyy before the rest of us got food. An hour later after we finally got up to leave and my coworker literally knocked on the kitchen door, they did bring the rest of the food in boxes.. worst part was through the entire hour the waitress did not check on us or acknowledge any issue.. ultimately they did comp most of the food but it was still horrible.. tater tots cooked in old grease- nasty! Boneless wings really overcooked, but the regular wings were alright. After the over an hour wait, one would think the food would at least be hot or taste good. Nah.... after an hour of not acknowledging us, the owner introduced herself..... wow a little too late. Just awful. Never seen anything like it to be honest.

Went to Clarkville for lunch about a year ago.

Food was disappointing: edible but not tasty.

Warm Cauliflower salad was mediocre. The salad was overwhelmed by large chunks of bread which were like sponge-y slightly soggy chunks of pizza dough. Cauliflower was okay but there wasn't much cauliflower in this "cauliflower salad". This bland dish should instead be called a "bread & kale salad".

The pizza was edible but not enjoyable. I tried the White Pie. 

In summary, Clarkville's food is generally mediocre, and overpriced for its mediocrity. Given that I enjoy eating tasty food, I have zero inclination to return to Clarkville to eat. There is much better food to be had in West Philly.
This place sucks!  Bought a car because I was moving to Hawaii.  They screwed up the paperwork and now my car sits useless unable to title.  Don't walk away from this place run away!!!!!!!!!

We went to Paladar last night which was the last night of restaurant week and it was awful.  The food was fair but the service was the worse I have experienced in a long time.  My husbands appetitizer was served with his main course, he tried to return it but it was quickly given back to him. We were there three hours and the waitress kept blaming the kitchen. One bright star was the guacamole....

The new BAG policy is ridiculous! No bags at all? I had a totally empty backpack, and even after seeing it was empty, they denied me entry to the movie I already purchased a ticket for. There is no place for me to keep my bag and they didn't budge. For a theater on a university campus, EVERYONE has a backpack. Simple check the bags for contraband - banning seems ridiculous. I won't be going here again!

one star because you can't give zero. i moved out of state several weeks ago, filed my change of address form well in advance - this post ofc has not forwarded a single piece of my mail. also, when i lived in 37212 it was not uncommon for this post ofc to deliver me a package that had been sent from the shipper fully one month earlier (according to the postmark). the employees at the counter were always friendly, at least

I don't live in this area but I stay in West Chester frequenty for work. This Starbucks location SUCKS! No sense of urgency from the workers here. I've been here numerous times and it takes at least 10 minutes for your coffee to be made. 

Today there was no line, maybe 5 people sitting, 2 workers, and it still took over 10 minutes for a f'n Americano. Let's put a little pep in our step here people.

We ordered carry out through DoorDash and it arrived pretty quickly. I understand food is best eaten while dinning in/hot/fresh but the Beasty Betsy was the most awful burger I've ever had. I assumed sausage burgers were going to be a blend of ground sausage and ground beef, but they were 100% all sausage and it was horrible. I will take full responsibility for misinterpreting the menu, but there was barely any pulled pork and was assembled very poorly. The Sweet Chicken Club wrap couldn't have been any more bland. The mozzarella sticks were also over cooked. You couldn't even tell it was a wonton. Just a burnt wrapper. Would not recommend.

Stopped by for lunch for the first time last week. Ordered the tlayuda, they didn't have it, so switched to mole oaxaqueno. The taste of the mole sauce was strong and peculiar, but that's absolutely fine, as taste is very subjective. But the whole entree looked very different from what the owner shows in the photo. Portion was the smallest I've had at any Mexican restaurant; I left hungry and had to eat a second lunch after that. For $13 (if I remember correctly) they gave me one very skinny chicken leg. The meat itself was so bland it tasted like it was boiled in plain water and the only taste came from the sauce. The rice was so-so. The beans were like those that came from a can, unlike in the photo. 
The two stars are for the good chips and friendly service.

Circus circus Reno is horrible. The room was filthy. Drug parafanela was in bathroom. Toilet sink floor gross. We were moved to another filthy room. Sticky fungus on night stand. Dresser glibly. Bathroom dirty.  Even tv screen dirty. The only thing they do is change bedding. And even that is discussing. Management could care less. 145.00 for this shit hole. And management could give a ====. And it's suppose to be an executive suit pshhh.Wont ever be back. 1/6/18

Beware of billing! The staff who helped me were very pleasant, helpful, and professional. However I never received any notice that the billing department would take the full amount that I owed after my insurance claim went through, and have been left with nothing to live on due to what I view as unethical billing practices. I received the bill the day after the funds were drawn from my account - without my consent - with a due date of almost two weeks later. 

Again those inside the office itself were wonderful, but be careful of the billing department.

As a native Idahoan, I've eaten at the Stagecoach more times than I can count throughout my life and many times since it changed ownership a few years ago.  Last night a friend and I had dinner in the bar and found the food substandard by all measures and, for the prices we paid, I really should give this review 1 star and not 2.  We found the halibut chunks and "famous" Stagecoach shrimp to be lukewarm, the breading an odd flavor that did not taste at all what we'd experienced dozens of times before. The accompanying tarter sauce was room temp and had a glossy gelatinous appearance and the sour cream was mixed with artificial bacon bits and tiny green flecks (chives, maybe?)  Upon request, I did receive plain sour cream and it arrived at the table cold and fresh and the sourdough rolls are delicious (thus the second star). Our waiter lacked all personality, but I don't expect to develop a relationship with the wait staff when I go out to eat, so that doesn't really reflect in my review.  We ate less than half our food and my friend took the rest home to her pets.  What a missed opportunity for this new ownership.  The Stagecoach is an iconic Boise restaurant with a loyal following.  Their bar regulars can't keep it afloat if  they don't maintain some effort toward quality of food and service.   They certainly lost our business.

Yelp really let me down on this one. I am floored. This was MI-STEAK!!!  No flavor, cheap meat, average roll. From the reviews, along with the hole in the wall ambiance I thought I has stumbled upon gold. As it turns out It was honestly below average. Go to John's Roast Pork if you want a real South philly steak.

DO NOT STAY HERE!! my dad is a hilton honors member always stays with them and woke up this morning with bed bugs from the location !!! Anywhere else but here. Told the manager and he said he couldn't switch our room cause he doesn't wanna spread it throughout the hotel... very upset.

This place has gone downhill..I tried it again because it's so close but they do not seem care how your nails look when you leave! They are not gentle and they seem to lack the experience to handle ingrown toenails! I have been getting my nails done for years now with this condition  and not only was it extremely uncomfortable but she took a huge chunk of my nail off and nothing feels better.  From now I'm going to have to make the drive to Mullica Hill! Also, I think they liquid down their polish because nothing every lasts. I wish it was different here because it's so convenient but I will not be returning.

This is the worst restaurant on the planet. I have never experienced such incompetence in my life. DO NOT GO HERE EVER. My experience has been the same the last two times but I didn't leave a review after the first terrible experience. 4 cars in front of us in the drive thru. No cars in the parking lot so not a huge crowd inside. Takes literally 25 minutes to get our 3 tacos. Our mistake. Didn't check the order til we got home and missing a taco. Should have known better after the ridiculous wait and no apologies. Worst excuse for a restaurant on the planet. In the future I would rather starve to death than try to order from this excuse for a food establishment.
W............T............F is the pizza ? is this real ?? ummmm its not its mushy nasty its not good ppl THIS is a big old NOPE!!!!!!!!!
All I can say was mediocre at best. If you are starving and not in a hurry it will suffice.

So it's been a few weeks since my visit to this medical clinic and as medical clinics go, they serve a purpose. For some, the location provides a needed place to go for their health care due to transportation limitations. For others, which category I think I personally fall into, its more than just location. Being able to get an appointment when I need it is a must, the friendliness of the staff is a requirement and most importantly, the bedside manner of the physician must meet my personal standards.

Most of the criteria was met by Sanitas but my examination by Dr. G. Figueredo was less than stellar. Hospitals and clinics are expected to have a 'cold, clinical' feeling to them but the doctor, in my opinion, has to have a pulse. Healthcare is a serious business but does that mean that to be a doctor you must be stern, rigid and humorless? That's the feeling I got from Dr. Figueredo. 

It's a feeling that invited me to cancel my follow up appointments and continue my search for a permanent PCP (Primary Care Physician).

The place was immaculate as they all should be, very neat and up-to-date looking. The support staff was friendly and knowledgeable BUT I couldn't get past the sternness of the doctor. I try to make serious situations less serious with humor but I could break the scowl off of this doctor's face with a jack hammer. The photo on the website is a poor representation because I didn't feel cared for, important or that I mattered. Healthcare is a science yet analytics and algorithms must go out of the window when caring for a person.
Nice room but marginal food. Fish tacos were bland. Enchiladas unimaginative. Guacamole was good . Service friendly.

I'm not sure if Fiorello's is under new ownership/management, but I've been disappointed in our takeout from here the last three times. This makes me so sad because this was my favorite local Italian restaurant, especially for take out. Their Caesar Salad used to taste homemade and delicious. Now the dressing tastes like it comes from a bottle. Our mozzarella sticks had O% cheese inside, our pizza crust was tough, and the chicken parm tasted off. Usually Fiorello's food is ON POINT. I'm just not sure why their quality has gone downhill.

Service was very,very slow considering it is an order at the counter place. I got the salted caramel donut which was good, but not great. The donut was a little heavy. I also orderd the cinnamon roll which I did not care for. It came swimming in gooey icing and was soooo overly sweet that you almost couldn` t taste the cinnamon. Plus they had sprinkled sugar on top of the roll too!  Sometimes balance of flavors is more important than just throwing everything in. If they had free wifi I couldn`t find it.

Hi Yelp! This is a review that averages our three experiences here, thus far. For two people, dinner experiences only.

About four months ago we decided to try this place. I love Greek and Mediterranean food and don't mind it even when it's American-ized. The staff was obviously new and getting used to working with each other. We dined in, and our simple gyro and falafel wraps took about 30 minutes.
The food was good and as expected, it was too long of a wait and all of the available tables were dirty.

About one month ago, I joined the Lunatic Reward Program and placed an online order. The app told me the order would be ready in 15-20 minutes. I arrived precisely 30 minutes after placing (since I remember my first experience) and the order was just being finished up. They threw in a hummus app for free, which was nice. The food held up on the drive home and was tasty and the order was accurate upon unpacking.

Last night, my husband wanted to dine in here. (LOL, not sure why?!) The Grill was SLAMMED to their credit, and the woman who I have observed seems to keep this operation going was nowhere to be found. (She appeared before we left, and was wearing a pink shirt.) Our cashier got our order wrong, my husband noticed, and I quickly returned to the busy register area to get it fixed. A woman in black (in management?) tried to re-input it, and was extremely flustered. I informed her the receipt was correct, except for the type of wrap. She still put in the wrong side. It took 45 minutes for our two, simple wraps to come out. They came out at different times so I had to hang out near the reg to beg for my food. No one apologized or offered anything for the issues. Two groups that ordered after us received their food before us. My food was fine/cooked and my husband's exact same order was cold to the touch.

I realized, during this long stay, that the online/phone orders are churned out very quickly. So, that must be who Luna caters to. They need a better Manager/District Manager that can help them figure out how to pace in-house and pick-up orders. Management should be empowered to fix their mistakes. 

I'm not sure that we will return. We were supposed to get a big to-go order for a dozen or so people for two events in the next few months and I am definitely looking for another option at this point.

Since Cafe Luce bought this location from Sparkroot it has gone downhill.  Coffee isn't half as good, service is lacking, menu isn't as vegan friendly, music isn't played regularly (which is weird because the store came with an awesome vintage jukebox from prior owners) and the cleanliness leaves much to be desired.  Even the ceramic mugs have been replaced by disposable plastic capped paper cups (we did NOT order to-go either). This was the first time we'd been in since the shop switched owners and will not be returning.  The place lost its feel of being frequented and staffed by area locals and now feels like it's run by and for disinterested college students.  Too bad this shop joined the investor vibe that is taking over downtown.

I never write reviews but this place is so horrible , over priced , slow service , got my order wrong and forgot my dipping sauce then tried to charge me one dollar for it after I just got a 50 dollar order , small portions and I had a hair in my tuna taco , not impressed at all , I tried to call back 8 times and the phone didn't even ring it went to a machine , bathroom is filthy too

As they get closer to closing, they offer less pastries and seem determined to sell off all the pastries that no one wants and refuse to take a few minutes (even in the last hour) to bake something fresh.
So disappointed!

Scheduling has been a problem for me since the studio in Nashville opened.  Several times I've booked appointments at the Cool Springs studio and when they call to confirm I find that my appointment has been scheduled for downtown and not CS.

Several times I've called the Cool Springs studio to reschedule and have been put on hold for long periods of time.  The last time I called, I left a voicemail cancelling an appointment the day before and was charged a no call no show fee.  When I tried to explain that I had left a voicemail because no one would answer the phone, I was told that there was nothing they could do about it - not cool!  I suppose losing a customer is worth the $15 fee.  There are other studios in town that offer excellent services as well - check them out.
Went back to my room to take my medications and a shower. No water. Can't flush the toilet, take a shower or my meds.   Nasty front desk!!!
Mediocre food, mediocre service, sufficient margarita.

Updated Review:
I decided to give them another try, as some time has passed and again, we got home late from working all day and we were famished. Upon ordering a pizza, I ordered 12 hot wings and asked the lady placing my order to make sure they include a full container of blue cheese, and I told her about my last order. She assured me that it wouldn't happen again and they would include a full container of blue cheese. My boyfriend picked up the order, asking the man at the register if they included the blue cheese and he was told yes. Once he got into the car he checked the package only to find that they didn't include ANY blue cheese. He went back to the door, but it was locked. He knocked and the man at the register looked at him and ignored him. I called and asked to talk to a manager. The manager I spoke with is named Dari. I know this because he spelled it out for me.  I explained the issue including what happened with my previous order. The manager told me to hold on while he checked with the cooks.  The cooks told him they put it in the bag. ugh.  He told me to hold again and then told me he checked and they don't have any blue cheese at all, so he doesn't know why the cooks told him they did. I asked Dari what could be done about it. He told me that he doesn't know because they don't have any blue cheese to give me.  I responded "you should know that in the food industry you can't allow items like that to run out." Dari got angry, though he still hadn't tried to fix the issue.  He told me he would give me half off the next time I ordered wings.  I said, "This has happened to me 2x now and I've learned my lesson! The last time this happened they told me they would give me extra blue cheese with my next order to make up for it, even though it wouldn't actually do anything to fix the situation. I'm tired of this happening to me!" He followed that up with, "We'll give you extra blue cheese the next time you order."  FOR REAL. I simply cannot understand how this type of thing can happen repeatedly. I told Dari, "I gave you my money.  I placed an order and explained that there was an issue the last time I ordered and I was assured it wouldn't happen.  I would NOT have ordered the wings if I had known you wouldn't be able to fulfill the order fully!  Is there another manager I can speak with, or maybe the owner?  Can you give me the email address or contact info for the owner so I can speak directly to him?"  He started yelling and told me that he's not going to give me any info for the owner and if I want to talk to the owner I have to go through him.  He also included that he (Dari) is 50 years old and he shouldn't have to put up with me.  He told me that he just offered to give me wings for free the next time (which is NOT what he said) and that he can't help if they ran out of blue cheese.  He continued to yell while I stood there with the phone on speaker shocked at his attitude...  Then Dari hung up on me. All I wanted was sincere apology, sincere CARE for me as a customer.  This has happened to me twice now, and if I've been treated like this by the manager, then it has to be happening to others, as well.  
Also, the $2 credit was never applied.

The service was terrible. I have eaten at Wingstop numerous times and food is normally the same. This place place only had two people working. The front guy seemed nice and took my order. He told me it would take at minutes and I came back in twenty. He handed me my 30 wings and large fry. I checked the bag for the large ranch sauce that I paid for but was missing. There was only a small one, when I told the guy it was wrong he tried to give two more small ones. I explained that's not what I paid for and he became angry. He eventually gave me the right size but seemed angry. When I got home I found my wings slightly under cooked. I will not be back to this location. Also my lemon pepper wings barely had any flavoring it was like plain wings.

Wouldn't recommend this place that all! Racist and bad customer service , won't be attending again. I never feel so uncomfortable in my life. The bartender was acting really weird towards me and my friend I was with. Idk many she a little tired who knows but I won't be attending this place ever again  I am disappointed

COCKROACHES!  This was our first time here, and we really looked forward to it.  Alas, it was a disaster, which had nothing to do with the food. That being said, we will NEVER go back. 
 Sure, the food took a long time to come out, and one entree arrived about 15 minutes after the other, but we can deal with that.  But just after we finally got our food, there came a COCKROACH crawling up the wall next to our table!  We told the waiter and he took a napkin and squashed it.  Then he split, without the slightest apology. Despite that, we decided to suck it up and continue our meals. Not 1 minute later ANOTHER cockroach appeared, this time on one of the PLATES containing our food!  Needless to say, that was just too much. We all got up to leave, and I asked to see the manager. The workers that we told said the manager "just left". Our waiter was nowhere to be found, either. (I suspect they were one and the same guy.) One of the workers (a woman) said "they (the cockroaches) come from upstairs". So obviously this is an ongoing problem. We received not the slightest apology from anyone.  We will never return, of course.  And I will report them to the health department on Monday (today is Saturday).

I haven't been here in two years but I definitely will not be back ever. I ordered shrimp tacos and even though the tortillas were fabulous the shrimp was so greasy it coated the inside of my mouth to the point of not being able to taste my food. The chips seem to be from a stale bag of chips you can get at the grocery store. I should have went to Chipotles.

This was bad from the start. We were told it would be a 40 minute wait, it turned in to a hour and 5 minutes. Now normally I wouldn't complain about that but several people went ahead of us that didn't wait as long as us. In the restrooms, the men's to start. Both sinks inoperable. The women's had a flooded floor, three toilet seats held on by one screw apiece. Then the food came out and it was great as always. I don't like being lied to by a red dyed hair 25 year old trying to look 16. She was the hostess.

Used to be my absolute favorite place ever. I have even gone to them since it was a food truck on pantano and 22nd. since they have tried to expand too much their quality seems to have declined significantly

Soooo.... I wish I could give a 1 1/2 a star. So arriving in New Orleans for the Essence festival and just stayed for the night after my plane being delayed in Denver for 3 hours. Already annoyed I walked in but was greeted by the really nice day at the desk. Getting to the room wasn't bad and pretty easy to follow with all the signs. Pretty cool history being it used to be an old coffee house. I get to my room, very dim lighting so it was horrible and the TV was crooked and wouldn't stay up being mounted on the wall you would expect it to stay up.... nope! The bed was seemingly comfortable looking at the snacks on top of the dresser there was no price list so you assume they're complementary...nope I didn't even touch anything. I was also handed the key for the mini bar which idk you would hand me a key, so everything in the mini bar is free? Lmao no... Woke up the next morning to leave and go to our REAL rental home turned on the shower.. WORST WATER PRESSURE EVER! Oh and our view looks like you can throw a body down into a pit and won't discover it until rigormortis sets in. The only thing that was really dope were the vintage accessories in the room I thought were very eclectic. I don't recommend this place there is a nicer hotel next door.

I can't give this place zero stars, but I absolutely would.

Tables and menus were disgusting! Took 15 minutes to even get a water and take my order and the place wasn't even busy! 25min after she took my order and she noticed I was getting irritable, she said "it's almost ready." Another 15min passed and still no food, so I left.

Pretty pathetic service! If people are coming in after me and ordering the same exact meal, eating, paying and leaving, something is not right. Add in that she had to come back TWICE to ask my order again. I don't know how much simpler my order could've been- the sunrise platter with bacon.

Overpriced, under salted, overpeppered burgers with unwelcome chewy bits inside.  Way overcheesed - I've never had to remove cheese from a cheeseburger before.  The fries were mushy.  Cole slaw was a warm bowl of mayo with no vinegary bite.  The waitress was gruff and didn't check on us.  But worst of all was the weird, weak Guinness with no head.  Awful.
The entire store smells like walking through an ash tray. I wouldn't buy anything based on that alone. Never again.

I haven't been here in a year or so and it will be even longer until I return.  My husband ordered the Ultimate Bloody Mary which is supposed to have a fennel salt rim, topped with pepperoni, mozzarella, olives, lemon and thyme .  It came with none of those, except olives.  When we questioned the waitress she said this was how it comes.  Then we asked her to check again and the bartender came out with a glass of pepperoni mozzarella and lemon and said she stopped tipping the drink because they have so many vegetarian.  There was still no fennel salt rim and no thyme.  Very lame excuse if you ask me.  Service was not good and my Italian Chopped salad had no flavor.  Very disappointed.

I found this establishment to be very uptight and/or rude. First of all, a little direction on where to go would be helpful. Second, maybe you should supply your visitors with a list or your ridiculous rules. The museum is nice but the snottiness of the staff made me hate it.

My friends and I wanted to try the Meridian Bodovino laocation, We had dinner at Grimaldi's (which is excellent !!), and headed over to Bodovino for some wine.
As we entered there was no direction, or person to tell us to seat ourselves, or wait. We looked around, no one to direct us, so we found a table and sat down.
Again, we were not sure if now we needed to go to the bar to get our drink order in, or if someone would wait on us. I went to the bar, and bartender said she would come over. She dropped off a couple of menus, with no instruction, or conversation.
we all picked out our selection (glass), and waited. Finally drinks were ordered. Then 2 of the wines we selected were empty on the auto dispenser (Which was weird that that was the only way for them to get our selections...It is a wine bar right? So after a lengthy wait we got our wine. The pours were very small, and the wine was really cold (we were drinking red). For $12.00 a glass for a pretty common Sonoma County Cab, I'm not impressed. 
So fair to say, we won't be back.

I really want to love this place because it's the only one of its kind in the area, where you can order food and drinks from the comfort of your recliner chair as you enjoy a movie. Sounds like something you'd enjoy right? You'd think it would be! BUT the inconsistencies and unqualified staff make for a less than pleasurable experience.

Granted they TRY to keep the menu fresh and exciting by switching SOME things around but it's always hit or miss. Never a guarantee even one thing will be the same, that goes for drinks and food. Call me bougie but when does a mule come in anything but a tin mug? 

As for the staff, sometimes they're good and sometimes they're just plain terrible. Forgetting things or just not showing up at all. Hellooooo does this lil blue light thingy workkk?!!! 

As recently as today, we had tix for a noon showing of Widows. We arrived to signs plastered on all the windows stating the theater was closed due to inclement weather. Uhhh excuse me but the streets were clear since late last night with no snow nor rain in the forecast today. Management should have advised their staff to be there, instead we were told only kitchen staff were there and they couldn't open without someone to work the box office. Major fail management! 

Honestly the one in collegeville isn't much better so I guess I'll just suck it up a little longer until something better comes along to replace this disappointment.

If I MUST say something nice it would be you can pretty much always find parking and that shopping center has some pretty decent stores lol

Seriously have been waiting 31 minutes for ONE smoothie!! This is ridiculous. It's 2pm on a Saturday. Either hire more efficient workers or set the expectation of a long wait when ordering. It's unacceptable. I'll be going to smoothie king from now on. If you go here, order online ahead of time

I went to this Sears store on May 29th, 2018, to purchase a futon. I was scheduled to have major foot surgery the following week. Stairs impossible for awhile, going to be on crutches for some time, hence why I needed a futon. Couches are okay for naps, but not ideal for sleeping on every single night for 4 + weeks. 

So. I go to Sears. I go upstairs to the furniture department, and the woman tells me they don't have futons in store, but we can order one from this computer right over here for delivery to your house. So we go over to the computer. I put in all my information, we set up a delivery date. I pay for the futon with my card. I get a paper receipt. We set up a delivery for 6/6. Someone will call me Tuesday, 6/5, with an estimated time of delivery for the 6th. 

So June 5th comes. No phone call from Sears. Maybe they got backed up. So the next day, Wednesday, the 6th, the date of delivery. Around 10 o'clock that morning I finally call Sears, as no one has yet called me with an estimated delivery time, and as it is the day before my surgery, I kinda have things to do, so I would like to know when they are coming. 

So I call. And I am told, my futon was apparently damaged en route. When my futon arrives back at the warehouse, I will get my refund. I ask to speak to a manager. I'm told there is no one available but someone will call me back. I wait all day. No one calls me back. I called Sears at least 3 times over the course of that day, and talk to a different person each time. Each time I am assured I will get a refund within 3-5 days. The woman I spoke with during my last call to the  that night was very snippy with me on the phone. 

So I have my surgery the following day, the 7th. I am now forced to crash at my boyfriends, as I have no futon at my parents house. The weekend passes, no refund. I call Customer Service mid-week. I am told they need to garner my information either via the receipt or the card the futon was purchased on. I give them my card information because I could not put my hands on the receipt at that moment. I give them my card number, they find the order. I am reassured I will receive a refund within the next 3 -5 days. 

A week passes, no refund. In the meanwhile, I find my receipt.

On Thursday, June 21st, my boyfriend and I go to the Sears where I placed the original order.  I have the paper receipt. So we go in; we stop at a customer service desk. A woman who looks to be about 110 years old is working. My boyfriend tries to explain the situation; she cuts him off and tells him because it was a piece of furniture, we must go upstairs to the furniture department. My boyfriend gestures to me and asks if perhaps an employee could just come downstairs instead, as you can see this girl is on crutches. The woman says no, we must go upstairs. 

So we find an elevator and go upstairs; it is a ghost town and not at all busy. There are at least 4 employees wandering; certainly someone could have come down to deal with my boyfriend and I on the first floor so I wouldn't have had to have gone all the way upstairs. But no. So we go to the customer service desk. I explain what happened to the woman; I am clearly getting exasperated because she cuts me off and tells me to calm down. At this point, I get really pissed off. If this had been done right the first 8 times, I wouldn't be standing in front of you right now. I am on crutches in your barely air conditioned store, and have been promised over the course of the past 3 weeks by every Sears "employee" I spoke with that I would receive a refund for something I purchased and never received so don't tell me to effing calm down. I give them my receipt. They tell me they cannot refund my money, because even though I bought it in the store, it was purchased from a computer; therefore, it is considered an online purchase.They give me an 800 number to call. I breath deeply, and ask to speak to a manager. 

I speak to a manager. She disappears for awhile. She comes back, and tells me that my money will be refunded to me within a week. She apologizes for the inconvenience. 

A week has passed. No refund. Yesterday, my boyfriend calls Sears Customer Service. They tell me the money was refunded on the 25th. Today is the 29th. I call my bank this morning; they go into my account and tell me they do not see any kind of pending transactions from Sears. I will now be taking the next step to get my money back, which is going to be an ugly one. 

I will NEVER EVER even SET FOOT in a Sears store again. I have never dealt with such incompetence from a place of business in my life. The staff is incredibly rude. No wonder this place is going out of business.How hard is it to just refund a customers money ? Absolute BS. Maybe by the time my foot is healed I'll see my refund. If I could give this store 0 stars, i would, because that is what they deserve. SHAME ON YOU SEARS.

Yesterday's lunch was not a good experience, wish I'd read these reviews first. Our waiter was a sweet guy and that's all the positive I can find to say. Margarita certainly wasn't good, not worth buying but carpe diem. Then first taste of enchilada sauce was kind of Chef Boyardee, still I'm no expert, so we started lunch. Then the man in next booth collared an employee and loudly debated immigration politics. His opinions went on and on. There were no waiters around so eventually just moved ourselves to where it wasn't quite so overbearing and obnoxious. And even though he watched us move, the employee let this guy carry on at him awhile more. No one ever inquired why we moved or stopped eating. I finally asked for manager, and that was a waste of effort. He basically kept telling me "the 4 things waiters weren't supposed to talk about", not helpful from a customer point of view. And yes, we still paid full price for everything, same prices as the know-it-all guy. We'll never return to such an upsetting place and I hope others will beware.
Worst experience... Been to the place for around 3 Years and the experience I had yesterday was horrible ... Haircut for my son was done very bad... not recommend!

I used to really enjoy this place. However, the last few visits have been lackluster. A couple of times, it's been straight up the food that's left a lot to be desired. The last time I was here was primarily the service. I totally understand that when it's busy, service is going to be a little slow here. They don't have much staff. However, the couple of people on the floor would check on every table but ours. We only had a table of two. But, throughout our meal, literally every table was attended to but ours. No check up to see if our food was okay. No asks for refills on our drinks. It's one thing if this was a consistent thing for the other diners there, but that was not the case. Several tables which showed up way after us were attended to multiple times while we were sort of left in the dark. Working in food, I rarely ever complain about service, even when it's lackluster. I really liked Saigon, but the last few times here have left a bad impression on me. Unfortunately, I won't be frequenting here any more. If I have a craving for some Vietnamese food, I have no issues with making the drive out to St. Louis from here on out.

I thought this place had some class, but, BOY, was I mistaken! They do not respect their clients and show no respect.  Their work is okay, but considering their attitude, I would strongly suggest finding a salon that appreciates you. Go elsewhere!

Massage was okay (nothing great, and also ended a little early), but I just had THE worst facial ever. She literally broke my skin in several areas and now I have cuts on the left side of my face. Beyond that, the $20 extraction was a rip- I sat home afterwards and continued the extraction myself, because she skipped half of my face. In hindsight, that was probably a good thing or I'd have more cuts. Too much product pushing and not enough care for my face. Also, the massage she gave during the facial was awful- Like being poked and yanked around, and pinched repeatedly by her fingernails. Kind of ruined the "relaxation" idea altogether. I skipped the complimentary wine because I just wanted to get out of there. Don't bother!!!

Avoid this place, if not you'll only be throwing away $$.  The self-serve wash takes your $$ and doesn't work half the time.  On the off chance it does work, the time runs out WAY faster than stated and you'll pay more in the end than going through the tunnel.  If you go through the drive through wash your car will get wet but not clean.  Yeah it rinses off a layer of dust but if you have any road dirt or bird mess, forget it.  An rinse?  Nope..spots and streaks all over.  Never again.

I have been going to Nicole for a while but my last encounter was shocking. I got my usual microneedling service and pre paid $160 for products I was told I would get in a couple of days. A week later I heard nothing and contacted Nicole and was told it was out for delivery. I texted numerous times afterward with no response and drove from Tampa to Saint Petersburg only to be told that she didn't have my product. I Have heard nothing to this day and have to dispute it with my credit card. She knows I have a family to support and I am appalled! Buyer Beware!

Sandwiches are ok but are overpriced. Do your self a favor and walk 20 more feet into the Hong Kong market and get a lot better sandwich for half the price! I have not had those bubble teas so I can not comment on those.
The food was pretty tasteless for a Tex-Mex restaurant. Taco's were just ok. Strawberry Margarita was good. Would not eat there a second time.
Will not return, worst customer service ever. If you want to be treated like a P.O.S. and over pay for sub standard food this is the place for you.

Definitely NOT sales savy people, which they admitted they dont usually get actual walk-in traffic.  Drove 56 miles to go look at a $17,000 bike they had advertised on Ebay. I had bought things from them in the past and have had reasonable experiences. Nothing to complain or brag about but have never actually been there personally until this occasion.
     I called them ahead of time, at their request, so that they could "have the bike available". I walked in to ask to see the bike. They seemed a bit lost at this request. Finally they got a mechanic to come up front and show me back to their warehouse where he took about a minute and a half to flip some switches, talking at 100 miles an hour and then he started the motor for 30 seconds. At this point he asked me if I had any other questions and then proceeded to disappear behind closed doors. During his "walk-through" I was informed that they do not allow test rides(due to insurance restrictions), which I thought was odd (since Harley had just allowed me a test ride on a $24,000 bike, the day before). So, I was left in a warehouse to look at the bike. No one came out to follow-up or see if I was actually interested in purchasing the bike. I had to go searching around for someone.....you'd think that selling a $17,000 piece of equipment would get someone off their ass but apparently not. 
      Long story short, it looks like it was all a blessing in disguise. I purchased the bike from the local Harley dealer and got a Harley factory warranty (which included electronics). I may still purchase parts from American Classic Motors, from time to time, but would never recommend purchasing a motorcycle from them. 
********* On a side note: was informed from a local dealership, that ACM would not accept / purchase back one of their own bike builds, for half of what they sold it for, just a year later. Makes you wonder how much confidence they have in their own products. ************

The service up front was polite and courteous, until I paid for the car. After making my down payment the salesman told me it would be ready next day because they needed to detail it and put new tires on the vehicle. Well I paid for it on a Monday while I didn't receive my car until late Thursday. The primary reasoning was waiting on "parts" and detailing, well the only thing I saw different about the car was tires. I was also charged for the Auto Butler interior and exterior protection service while as well for $250 interior and $250 exterior, so $500 altogether when I saw not even a penny put into the detailing. Including the ridiculous wait for the vehicle over something that they clearly didn't even do and I was charged for. This dealership clearly makes you feel welcome up front to sell the car but as soon as you put the money forth they kick you to the curb. Saying that safety and satisfaction is the biggest concern of a car dealership or any business for that matter, this dealership has failed terribly.

Took dog in to get sutures out and some laser treatment and they say it's going to be a bit of a wait. Surprise surprise, NOT!  Looking for a new vet please spam me with a good, not overpriced, on time! Vet.

I wasn't particularly pleased with this place. 
I've always wanted to visit Morton's steakhouse but this visit was very lackluster. The service was great. However the food left much to be desired. I ordered the lobster bisque and I was not pleased at all. The lobster bisque was quite tasteless and the lobster with scant. I had to add quite a bit of salt and pepper to the soup to even be edible. I also ordered the shrimp scampi for my entrée and the shrimp had a very chemical taste not really sure I know how to explain that. My boyfriend also ordered the jumbo shrimp Alexander for his appetizer and shrimp tasted the exact same. Also to add to the lack luster food it's took a considerable amount of time for entrées to be delivered. Management apologized several times for the long wait, but that is neither here nor there.

We have come here several times, but this experience was noticeably different. Very slow service, food quality was subpar. My sliced tomatoes were not fresh, but rather wilted and old sitting on the plate. Seems like the new competition in town has killed the spirit of this place. Much better food at Kiki's, La Segunda, or metro diner.

When I complained to the manager, he gave me a coupon for a free entree. I tried to use it at checkout but couldn't since my kids had not ordered "entrees" but rather 'kids breakfasts'... good luck to them. This place won't last as the Tampa breakfast scene becomes much more sophisticated.
This place said it was open 24 hours on Friday and Saturday and it's closed. Tried calling and no one answered.

Super BIASED reporting.NON existent SIGNAL. NOISE NOISE NOISE. Should just report WEATHER!
Your BIASED 7pm news reporting is sickening.
Used to be reliable news, weather, and traffic.
Now it's Politically correct garbage.
SNL wannabe !
Watch your ratings DROP

The bartender will steal your points if you don't immediately give her your phone number when paying your check! What's the point in providing a mechanism for customers to log their points later through the app if the bartender will just steal them beforehand??? *angry*

Ordered delivery at 8:15, when i called at 8:30 to confirm, she said "thank you for calling woodys would this be pick up or.... Oh wait its 830 we stopped doing deliverys now" i asked if my order would still be processed since i ordered 15 min ago and she said no even though they got my order before. Also ordered off of yelp and wouldn't get my money back till 3 days later. Wont be back

Went to Florida Dental after finding them on Cigna website as an in network provider. After verifying our insurance and coverage we were charged a reasonable amount for the service that were provided. 2 weeks later we received a bill for an additional $160.00. To be paid immediately. After a call to the insurance company it turns out that the Dentist that they used that day was not in network and our Deductible changed from $50 to $250, because of the Dentist that was in the office on that day. Really. After talking to the billing department at Florida Dental I was informed that the patient should have done their due diligence and made sure that they requested an in network provider. I explaining to her that they (Florida Dental Service) were listed on Cigna's Website and we came to them and provided them with proof of insurance that they had to call and prequalify us for treatment and they were well aware of what was covered and what was not. She let me know assuming they would continue to give us in network treatment was my mistake. The print in their contract (you know the contract that you sign just wanting relief because your in pain)states that some of the providers that they use do not subscribe to ppo's and other insurance. I asked her if they felt any obligation to verbally tell any of their patients this she stated no its not office policy. THIS IS THE DAY MEDICAL PROFESSIONS HAVE BECOME A BUSINESS ONLY INTERESTED IN THE INTAKE OF MONEY AND NO LONGER ARE CONCERNED ABOUT THE WELL BEING OF A PERSON. I WOULD NOT RECOMEND THEM TO ANY LOVED ONE OR FRIEND. THE ONLY REASON I RATED AS ONE STAR IS BECAUSE NEGATIVE STARS ARE NOT AVAILABLE.

Terrible company. They did a section of the fence at my new house and were supposed to stain it, never heard from them for 4 months after the fence was up. They finally stopped by in April but it was windy and they could not do it, did not hear back for 4 weeks. I received an invoice for the balance 5 months after my construction loan was closed and now all the sudden they are in a hurry to collect their money, saying they won't stain the fence and threatening to put on lien on the house which they can't but whatever. This company is by far the worst I used for this construction.

Well. I can definitely say this is a St Louis hotel I have not been to.
Easy to find, but missed the entrance so had to drive around the block. Not marked well. 
Older building, so had great character. Definitely could tell at some point in its lifetime it was a great hotel. Lobby was almost deserted. Restaurant that isn't used anymore. Front desk staff were friendly. Elevators small, but it's an old building. 
Room was a nice size (king), clean, but bathroom was too tiny. When I pulled the lever for the shower I was afraid the spout was going to come out of the wall. 
Parking was $25 in the back lot. Very over priced!! The lot is tiny, didn't have much space around the car. Had to pull out for my friend to get in the car because the car beside us was so close. 
Price was reasonable.
In a part of downtown that definitely has more restaurants to visit. 
Did like the location. Only a few blocks to Busch Stadium. 
I honestly can't say I will visit this hotel again, I have too many other favorites.

Worst experience I've ever had. Waited over an hour for our meal. Onion rings were cold. Steak burger wasn't made how it was requested. Ordered milk shake. Milk shake sat on ledge waiting to be picked up from wait staff so long it melted. They made another...again had to wait for them to get it together.
Don't think any pizza should take an hour and 16 minutes don't care how good it is.  I might suggest they put orders in a little more timely.  Poor process but good deep dish pizza

Love the ice cream but the service (or lack thereof) is horrible. My husband and I walked up to the window to order. There was no one in line and only one car in the drive thru. There were three employees inside. One was helping the drive thru customer and the other two were watching something on their phone. They saw us and completely ignored us. We waited for over 10 minutes being completely ignored so we left. Very disappointing.

Took my fiancé here for his birthday breakfast. After reading all the great reviews, I was so excited for this place. But we were disappointed. My fiancé ordered the berries and cream crepes. The crepes were 1) hard, and 2) filled with plain sliced strawberries and generic whipped cream (tasted like Reddiwhip). I had the French toast which was bland and doughy. It's a cute cafe and service was nice, but the food was not good at all.

Don't know what happened to this place but it's really gone downhill. having to pay for refills for lemons and limes is I don't understand how an owner can let this happen I don't understand how an owner can let this happen..ridiculous as even more ridiculous having to pay for sides to put on your hamburger. The food is expensive it's not that good. Maybe the owner should spend more time doing drug testing then charging for side items. every time I server walks by u can smell the pot on them. Plus there r certain people that go to the house next door to smoke the pot before going to work. How does an owner let this happen. The management there is horrible. Cindy's got the worst attitude I've ever seen in my life. she doesn't know how to talk to her employees all she knows how to do is yell and criticize.

My wife and I decided to stop in for some food. We were seated quickly and were told that everything was made to order and was fresh. This seems to be the selling point. 
We placed our order and waited for the food to be prepared. The atmosphere is very casual with some TV's on the wall. I am not quite sure what the vibe is, but it felt kind of relaxed - sports bar'ish. The food did not take too long to come out.

I ordered 3 different tacos to get a sample of the place. I ordered the Al Pastor, Korean BBQ and Barbacoa Brisket all on corn tortillas. I was very disappointed in the Al Pastor. The corn tortillas (double layered) were overwhelming and the ingredients were underwhelming. Half-way through I pulled off 1 corn tortilla so that I could taste the ingredients. The flavor was lacking and it was disappointing. I gave my wife a pineapple piece to taste and she agreed, it tasted like water. These were the pineapple tidbits you get from a can...a very cheap can with no flavor. So much for fresh ingredients. The highlight of my meal was the Barbacoa Brisket. There was a good amount of meat on it and that is where the flavor was. The Korean BBQ was similar to the Al Pastor, just lacking flavor. I was hoping to taste the different ingredients combining in my mouth, but it was overall pretty bland.

My wife got the beef bowl. The portion size was good, however she also said it was bland. She does not like spicy food, but she likes food with flavor...and here it was lacking.

Most of the ingredients may be fresh (pineapple was definitely not and not sure about the corn tortillas), but they lack something to create a taste bud memory.

Horrible customer service. This is my second time here and clearly nothing has changed. I was very excited when they first opened because I used to travel a little further up the road to Thai Chili Pepper. But never again. I called in my order to avoid the long wait as I had experienced that last time. Surprise surprise my order wasn't ready. I walk in and no one greets me. The two women at the counter acted as if I wasn't standing there. If I hadn't already waited 30 minutes for my order I would have walked out. Then the owner I'm assuming says um let me cash him out first then I will help you referring to the walk-in customer who had just placed his order. It was very rude and dismissive. I shouldn't have even ordered anything because on the phone there was no customer service so what did I expect when I got there. I ordered a spicy tuna roll and asked for them to put spicy mayo on it. She informed me that they don't do that but I can order a side of spicy mayo for $.50. What?! This place is an epic fail and I will not be back or recommend anyone go here. The food is lack luster. No flavor. Their spicy is a joke. Travel the extra miles to avoid the aggravation.

Update. Down to one star. Out of everything. The area is growing and you apparently can't accommodate for growth. Constantly out of everything we need. Crappy service. I'm done.

My neighborhood store. For the last few months, I'm disappointed in customer service, selection, etc.

You're always out of canned organic beans. Half of the time, shelves are not stocked for products I'm looking for. We literally just got in an argument with some lady in produce over green chili. We needed Anaheim green chili. She took us to jalapeños. Then insisted we were wrong? I buy chili and jalapeños weekly. If my children know the difference, why does the employee not? Especially living in Southern AZ? You, lady, need training and basic education. I don't need your attitude or your misinformation.
Food was mediocre at best.  Won't go back.  This is the second time we've been there and the food was gross.  I've had better at Taco Bell.

I purchased a 2010 Mazda 3 from royal auto group in July of 2013. While I had a good experience at the time it was only recently that I learned of the shady and dangerous practices of this store. I recently purchased a new vehicle and when my Mazda was being appraised for trade in value I was told the car had frame damage and would not be worth much. This came as a shock to me as this was never disclosed when I purchased my Mazda from royal auto group. The dealer that I was buying my new car at told me that it was dangerous to drive a frame damaged vehicle and asked if I had known about the damage previously. Since it was never disclosed I did not know about the issue. They pointed out how they could tell body work had been done to my Mazda and then they also produced an autocheck report showing that Royal auto group purchased my Mazda from the auction knowing it was frame damage as it was reported as a frame damaged vehicle at the auction. They knowingly sold me a dangerous and damaged car without disclosing this information to me and also provided a clean carfax report. I am extremely unhappy with this dealership and would highly recommend other shoppers look elsewhere. This turned out to be a horrible experience once I learned that I had been driving a damaged car for over 4 years. I am currently looking at what legal recourse may be available to me in order to have this dealership rectify this situation. I also lost thousands of dollars in value as my Mazda was worth far less in trade value with the frame damage. Please please please stay away from this dealership for your safety.

Are they serious: $37.50 for a 6 slice half sausage/half plain pizza. The damn thing tasted no better than little Cesar's or Dominos. 

How do I know it was mass produced ? We ordered it and it was brought to the table in less than 10 minutes. 

Not recommended

Stopped in this place for breakfast before leaving Tampa. Felt like my breakfast flatbread was made a little too fast(failed to add the bacon), especially considering that they were not busy at the time.

Absolute dump. Rude bartender made us feel unwelcome the second we walked in. Overpriced beer. When I asked if there were any drink specials (on a Wednesday) bartender said she had no idea what I was talking about. Told to move our table "in case a stroller comes in". Do not waste your time or money here.

This is the worst venue I've ever been to ! What a dump !!! Parking is a joke . Neighborhood is horrible , I'm from the Bronx and even I was worried about the area . Will never ever be coming back to this hell hole ! Jesus could be appearing there and I still wouldn't go back !

My husband and I were very disappointed in the food.  It came out too fast which told us it was a precooked burger. The burger was dry and tasteless, no juice whatsoever.  I had the brisket sandwich and it was dry, tough, fatty and flavorless.  I could deal with cutting off the fat since it is brisket, if it was properly prepared.  The tots appeared to be baked which is ok but and they were dry as well.  The service was ok and the prices are reasonable if they improve the food.  I gave constructive feedback and hope it improves.  I would love to see them succeed as an eating establishment instead of just a bar.  They do need to install soundboards it was very loud.

I stayed at the Radnor for a full week.  The front desk people were good and efficient.  I had a decent meal at the Glenmorgan and every evening I enjoyed the company of colleagues in the bar.  The overall hotel is a bit a tired and in need of an update.  That is about all the good I can say about this hotel.

On my last evening there, I came to learn that my room was within a block of people who were there for a wedding reception.  By 1:00 a.m., I decided it was time to call the front desk so I could get some sleep.  I heard the hotel employee say that the people in Room 310 were complaining.  Great!  That's when the fun began.  

Things quieted for a bit but quickly the party was on again.  More calls to front desk and people knocking on my door at 2:00 a.m. telling me they were there to sell me Girl Scout cookies.  It was a scary experience and I will never go back.

Despite sharing my experience with senior management of the hotel, I have not received any sort of call or e.mail back.  Very disappointing at many levels.

Nobody who worked there had a smile on their face, we were greeted by the owner who did not smile at us when he was showing us to a table. There isnt much options, no special rolls...
The rolls were really cold. The rice was hard and it literally tasted like they left the sushi in the fridge for a couple of days and took it out, cut it, then served it to us. The sushi is not recommended...
This is not worth the price at all!

We double dated with great friends but were quite disappointed with not only the atmosphere but with the food quality as well.

The sushi  didn't taste fresh (definitely words that you never want to hear) our orders came out cold, the lobster and shrimp were over cooked, salad drowning in dressing, - none of us 4 were satisfied with our food. Desserts were served with plastic spoons  - really plastic spoons????

The portion sizes was exceptionally small - I got 2 shrimp- 3 small scallops - two 2 inch slices of zucchini- 6 pcs of overcooked lobster 

We were there for two hours and we counted 14 times The Gong being beaten and the Happy Birthday song being sung- so loud that we had to stop talking every time- literally 
We will not be going back

Hostile Service - poorly managed
We ordered carryout food the night before and it took 50 minutes instead of the quoted 20.  It wasn't busy but there was a birthday party in the other room, the food was ok.  The next morning my wife and I had breakfast there and the waitress was all business.  "what ya want" and then she was gone.  I must say it was prompt but she brought me a coffee that was barely luke warm and if it weren't for the busboy I would have had to flag the waitress down.  It wasn't that busy, but on the way to take the neighboring table's drink order she knocked into my chair without uttering a word, a minute later, she knocked into it again without a word.  Our food arrived timely but she never checked on us until the end when she asked my wife if she was done with her food.  She said no, but the waitress still took it and we had to raise our voice to get her plate back.  I called the restaurant an hour later, feeling unsettled, calmly explaining my issues and never even got a call back.  So now I have no shame in shaming them.

Anytime I am flying out of the east terminal I stop by the Great American Bagel so I can buy one of the various flavored coffees that they brew (Hazelnut, Vanilla, etc); however today they had none.  I asked the attendant if there was any flavored coffees that had been brewed that they could put out, and I was told they no longer brew flavored coffee after 9am!!!  Ironically it was 9:15am and all of the flavored coffee dispensers were gone!!  

That's very disappointing as that is the only reason I walk all the way to the end of the east terminal to visit their location.  If all they are going to serve is regular black coffee, I can buy from coffee from Dunkin, Starbucks or Burger King, all of which are located in the middle of the terminal by the security check-ins.  

I, like many others, do not like the "flavor shots" as the artificial sugar or oil that contains the flavor bothers our stomach, which is not a good thing when traveling/flying. 

Management - Please reconsider your decision to stop serving flavored coffee or I will boycott your store every time I fly until you do.  I'm sure your are saving a few dollars a day by only brewing one type of coffee, but think about the lost business and the fact that the flavored coffee differentiated your business.
Consistently late. And more times than not the driver is on the phone or just flat out rude.

Me and my girlfriend went here and the food was decent. We sat upstairs, but we were confused because we thought it was hibachi where they cook in front of you and this that and the third. When we went upstairs I ordered the chicken hibachi and it came out how you normally would get food in a restaurant. I don't know if the miscommunication was on our end or if they really do have a hibachi dinner where they cook in front of you. Also the sushi was bit very good at all.

We went here for our weekly office lunch. We usually try to keep around 1 hour lunches, but this whole endeavor took over 2 hours. It took almost an hour for them to seat us after being told it would take only 15 minutes. We waited outside, looking at all the open tables on the patio. When our table was ready, the hostess came up to us and said we'd be sat in just a minute, but our waiter was closing out another table. We continued to stand for another 20 minutes until we were finally seated. Our waiter didn't come to our table for like 15 minutes, and by the time she did arrive, we were ready to put in our whole order. When we told her that, she had to go grab a bigger sheet of paper, which then took another 15 minutes. The food was pretty good, but we had no water to go with it, because the only thing that the waiters seem to be good at is avoiding eye contact. I had to renew my parking twice. Service was terrible. And at the end, the receipt math was wrong. Two tacos for $3.50 and a side of (bad) rice and beans for $4 does not equal $15. Didn't even take the time to get it fixed because I didn't have 30 minutes more to spare. Unless you have half the day to waste here for lunch, I do not recommend Little Donkey.
I ordered the salmon it was terrible so dry over cooked. Won't be going back there. Service was good

I really loved this place when it first opened. Then the front staff changed and both service and sanitation went left with them. I don't know the last time the condiment containers were cleaned or changed, but it has been a long time. I showed our waiter that one of the chili sauces was spoiled and fermenting. He swapped it with another table but didnt didn't throw it out. I had to tell the next table san not to use it. Absolutely unacceptable. It's too bad because the food is terrific.

The waiter was more interested in showing his personality than making sure our order was right or that we were not being poisoned.

Awesome location. Perfect Taco Bell! The managers need to treat their employees so. Being alone to serve 400+ orders for five hours with no bathroom breaks is impossible and inhuman treatment. This needs to be corrected. Do not leave one employee alone to fend for himself for more than a small 15-30min break.

DO NOT RECOMMEND. They are
