RUDE , SEXIST, AND UNACCOMMODATING. Came in with a party of 9 and were told to "we dont have a table for yall wait over there " with a slight attitude. The place had decent reviews so that was fine. While waiting we decided to check out the "casino" which is really a corner with 3 mini slots. Came back to the waiting area and another lady approached us stating my male friend is not allowed without sleeves . This was not
told to us by the host when we walked
in. I approached the host asking where does it state that to which she replied "it doesnt say that and its a family business we can make our own rules". I pointed out ladies dining without sleeves to which she stated "it only applies to men" . I inquired as to why and she said "its a family business we can do what we want". That sounds sooooo SEXIST and DUMB . THEN We waited all that time only for them to try to seat us at separate tables. We left and went to the "Creole House" restaurant . There was barely a wait and the employees  were very nice and accommodating to our needs. This is an example of another black owned business that does not know how to properly treat their customers. If your gonna have "rules" like that invest in a sign so that u dont waste other peoples' time.

The service was horrible. Our server was rude and sarcastic. I had to get up and walk to the bar to request refills for our drinks. When I asked him a question he was condescending and downright nasty! The other 6 people in our party said the food was excellent but hated the service. There was no mgr on duty and our server was talking to other employees rather than taking care of his ONE table at the time! The camp salad I had was just "ok". The hot food items were very good however. If you really want to enjoy their excellent cuisine then I suggest asking for the female server who seemed to be very efficient and friendly. It is overpriced for the amount of food per entree however.

Our waitress was great (alex) very friendly and took her time explaining the dishes to us. Didn't rush us during our meals. The food was not good. The only thing we liked was the queso. The tacos were small for three dollars and did have much substance to them. The nachos were terrible and had a lot of brown lettuce on them. We got the margaritas for drinks as well which were also awful very shugary and filled to the top of the cup with ice.

Very uncomfortable chairs (my butt isn't THAT big) to sit in for more than a few minutes.  Maybe everyone who's given a good review was in a booth.
I had today's special -- a grilled chicken sandwich, club style, on focaccia bread with a side of onion rings.  The lettuce and tomato on the sandwich were fresh and high quality.  The chicken was flattened and grilled well; the bacon was crispy.
The focaccia was a little too "wonder-bread-like" for me, could have had more chew and crisp.
It was the onion rings, though, that were the big disappointment.  They were undercooked, greasy, and limp.  So sad.  
Service was timely for a late lunch hour.
Worst Wawa ever don't get prepared food there dirty gross employees don't care Management careless
Can I give them a 0!?! Literally the worst. Avoid at all cost. Waited 20 minutes just to get skates and there wasn't a single person in front of me. And when I complained they gave me an attitude.

Very inflexible. I understand that they have a vegan bowl with a vegan option for those who choose to eat vegan. But refusing to allow me to PAY to add a a protein to it when you allow protein to be added to other bowls makes no sense, especially when there is no other option to build your own bowl from scratch but this one (I wanted to add the tuna option). My wife, who does not eat meat, asked if she could substitute her protein for a vegetable and they said no problem. Just pick another vegetable. However, they charged her for the extra vegetable without stating they would. I went across the hall to Zukku and ordered what I wanted without any issue. I will not return.

We arrived as a group of 3 with no reservation and we were told it would be a short wait as they just had to clean a table. About 5 minutes later a group of 4 arrived, clearly heard they had no reservation as well and maybe 7 minutes later they were seated before us. I approached the host to ask how much longer we had to wait and she said they just had to clean a table (again). I don't like to make things about race or anything but 3 people of color who arrived before a group of 4 white individuals and were left to continue waiting kind of rubbed me the wrong way. Food was okay.

Mediocre ice cream, no strawberries in the strawberry ice cream and worse,  A STALE SUGAR CONE!  We threw most of ours away.  Must be the only place in Doylestown for ice cream because I don't understand these reviews. Soooo disapponting and on a very hot day. Stale cones are inexcusable.  And I can get better ice cream in the supermarket.

So I went to go try out their new kiosks love the bright redesign of the restaurant I hate the new service...
The kiosks are kind of fun they're very easy to use but that's where the good ends.
It took over 10 minutes to get one large order fries we were not recognized by any of the employees... And when we got our fries they were ice cold.
The fried they gave us have been sitting out not under any type of the heat lamp for at least 5 minutes

I did a grub hub order so take that into consideration.  I asked for no jalapeños on my sandwich and of course it came on the sandwich....  the sandwich was ok....  nothing to write home about...  the fries were thick frozen fries and were actually terrible especially because I didn't get any sauce or ketchup in my order.  Mediocre but I will try eating in one time maybe it'll be better.

Am sorry to have to give this Days Inn only a 2 Stars. This facility SHARES the same property as Super 8 motel, same check in desk, pool, etc. just different buildings in the same courtyard. Room was acceptably clean except there was some mold in the corners of the bathtub. Really dingy looking towels. However free WiFi was good. My room had a fridge, microwave and coffee maker, all in good working order. Heating/ac is ok but they only can send one or the other to the entire facility at a time, although there is individual controls in the rooms. So hopefully your body is set to the same thermostat as the management.  The exterior of the buildings  need some upkeep work. Mediocre continental breakfast, just coffee, cold cereal, frozen waffles, yogurt and toast and apples. No jam or peanut butter or any protein. The positive is that it close to the Meadowwood mall and all the surrounding shopping and dining places. Ask for downstairs inner courtyard where there is much less traffic noise. It's a OK place as long as the rate is below $60. Otherwise your money is better spent elsewhere.

9/21/2018:  I. REALLY. WANTED. TO. BUY. SOMETHING . . . ANYTHING. AT. GAP. OUTLET . . . No matter how the store manager and the retail associates made the rack and shelving displays presentable, marketable, the clothing sold here was like TIRED 2017, 2016, 2015, and eons of old, overstock, unsold inventory.  Meh~I kept perusing upon racks, shelving, and displays recognizing inventory I saw being sold even at believe it or not, ROSS!

WOT~NO WAY!  YES, WAY, WAY, WAY OLD:  Long time forgotten, unsold clothing from West, North, South, and East Gap Outlet's retail stores OLD INVENTORY were being sold, liquidated at this location; however,  sadly and shockingly, the price points didn't trickle down to truly saving customers' buying power purchasing liquidated, unsold, old inventory, i.e., LOW stockturn equals poor, sales inventory performance!

Truly an egregious disappointment visiting this Gap Outlet:  I shall not return.
Ate here and saw 3 roaches! Nasty!!!!!!!!!!  Lisa is the owner and she didn't even refund our money!!!!! This was so awful and she is a really rude person!!!!!!

Food was oooooookay for what it was// the quality of the food definitely went down since the last time I was in. Tonight the lettuce on the side salad was very brown and dirty and the chili was cold ...which is a shame because that's one of my favorite dishes ....for it being a 24 hour running place I guess this quality of food was expected. Most likely last time coming

Jamal messed up my hair sooo bad, he put multiple large balled patches throughout the entire back of my head & they looked like alopecia bald spots. As I was pointing out to him what he had done as I was still in his chair, he act like he couldn't comprehend anything all of the sudden & his wife abeena was rude & kept telling me in a nasty tone that  it's supposed to look like that as if I was some fool. And still charged me $30. Never in my life have I felt so disrespected by such unprofessionalism at a salon. I had to wear a wig for 4 weeks before another barber could fix it because I had to wait for the large bald patches to grow back in so new barber could be able to blend it in. Everyone who saw what Jamal did to my hair said it looks like a junkie did my hair. They said there is no way that someone sober did that to my hair & I must say that I agree with what everyone else's said, that it looks like someone was heavily on something recreational when they did that to my hair. Worse barber experience in my life & abeena is the most nastiest, rudest & unprofessional person that I've ever come across in the salon business. Not to mention that I am also a licensed beautician & have been doing hair for over 20 years. Will never recommend this salon to anyone.

I am not happy with the experience at The College School and certainly cannot recommend it. We supported this school in many ways, including through our firm serving as a sponsor of a school fundraiser and sending multiple teachers at the school on a trip to another country. Our kids also attended this school for almost three school years before the relationship ended. While running a school is certainly not easy, in my opinion, this school has a lot to learn in terms of professionalism, empathy, listening, communication and compassion for the children and the families. The College School talks about "love" in their PR video, but I personally didn't see this "love" in my families time of need. Additionally, a greater working knowledge of how to accommodate and adapt to children with various special needs would also go a long way toward improving the school in my opinion. In the 3rd grade classroom with Matt Diller, my view is that this is seriously lacking.

Really bad service . Front front desk took forever to help me out . I asked to get an alignment done on my car and they told me it would need extra parts for it to be able to be done and still charge me for it . If you want good service and quality parts do yourself a favor and don't go there .

My family and I ate here on Mother's Day and will never return. The service was sub-standard. The Flank Steak and Shrimp were nasty and over-priced.  It's a wonder that this place stays open!  $61.00 plus tip?  We should have stayed home, cooked the same meal, and saved money!  Diner beware. This place could be so much better but sadly, it's not.

For Management:  Please don't respond to this post. Nothing you say or do will encourage me to return to your restaurant chain.
Super rude girl at the front. Immediately left. If that's what you get when you walk in to ask a simple question I'd hate to see the final product

This place was terrible, me and 3 others came on Friday night. Like most clubs or bars we were asked if we wanted shots as soon as we walked in. We all said no, but these girls looked like they were messed up on something, they legit shoved the shot tubes down our throats, Im a big guy and I had to actually push the waitress off me, than they had the nerve to ask who was paying for them. Ended up having to pay for about 50$ of unwanted shots. So only come here if you want drinks forced inside of you

Man, was I disappointed in this place. I waited over 30 minutes to get in but I didn't mind considering this was supposed to be the BEST hot chicken in Nashville.

I give the chicken itself a 2/5 because it was freshly made and hot but the flavor was terrible and it lacked juiciness. The coating itself on the chicken was spicy ( I got hot) but it tasted like someone poured Tajin on top of the chicken and called it 'hot'. 

The sides were a 1/5 for me. Again, they were all hot and fresh but the French fries were too salty, the Mac n' cheese too 'bleh', and the baked beans too one- dimensional sweet. 

Last year when I was here I tried Fannie Mae's and that chicken was AMAZING: hot, juicy, and the outside crispness was a hot oil that, while it burned everything it touched, was absolutely mouth-watering. I'll be trying that again this year and, hopefully, it's still as terrific! 

I'll pass on Hattie B's from now on.
Yeah, these guys are crooked. So many stories... they've been extremely predatory at my apartment complex. They towed me twice. I live here. Go away.

Not worth the money... really cool location and atmosphere but for the price I expected a lot more. On the website it made their bloody mary bar look out of this world and then they just had the basic fixings. Overall, not impressed. We went for mother's day so we were a bit bummed. Check out the ladies bathroom downstairs though, that was the best part!
easily the dirtiest hotel I've ever stayed at. garbage all over the floor, under the bed, inside cabinets etc. do. not. stay. here. disgusting.

Only good part was the food... horrible service couldn't even tell who my waitress was because 3 different people kept switching off so drinks weren't getting filled asked several different things like straws and ranch multiple times before it was actually brought out.. and at the end the bill was split incorrectly because of the confusion between 3 people serving.. half of the bill was supposed to be on a business card and the other half personal but we ended up paying for more of the bill on our personal account.. frustrated to say the least

Because of the loss of several employees at this Manayunk Post Office and the passport services that tie up the clerks interminably, I have not been able to process my customers' packages.  I waited six months and today I gave them another try.  It was a nightmare.  I was the only customer with only four packages and the clerk said she need to leave 
early and asked if i could wait until she closed out her register with the other employee.  In other words they would keep me waiting to finish their administrative duties. I let her know this was not good customer service and she agreed to process my packages.  But I was not treated kindly, and one of my packages dropped to the floor and the clerk did not even look back to pick it up! Totally unacceptable.

I stopped in for the first time heading home for Philly late yesterday 
The ribs were lousy...
Burnt dried out left overs  probably made early that morning!
I won't be back!
Terrible service. The food is mediocre. You won't get it on time. I ordered from them and it was over an hour late, so I called, and the guy hung up on me.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. I am so incredibly disappointed with Ikeas customer support! I have called now 3 times trying to get information on my case. I called last week because I needed a new top for my Hemnes dresser because the one i purchased in store was damaged. After staying on hold for 45 mins a woman picked up and dealt with my case. She provided me with a case number and explained that my top for my dresser would be on its way! I never got an email with a tracking number and have not heard back from Ikea. No word where my dresser top is, or if I will be receiving it. Now it has been weeks without my dresser for my bedroom and my clothes have been just sitting on the floor. Completely unacceptable. I am even typing this as I wait on hold for the third time trying to figure out the progress of my dresser. Everyone who answers keep throwing me around to different departments and have no idea why my shipment has not gone out yet. I have been on hold for about an hour and a half now. I am extremely disappointed I even wasted my time purchases furniture from you when I could have gone to target and had a completely different and Professional experience. I feel like I am being hassled and I still have not relieved the full product that I have purchased. This is not how you do business. This has been the worst waste of time for me. I will be writing reviews and giving feedback on my experience until this is handled...... Again, very disappointed.

Food was adequate. The food took FOREVER to get to our table and we got each persons meal 15-20 mins. apart and got our appetizer last. A 6 person family ate their whole meal before we got our food. Their pepper didn't look like pepper but it kind of tasted like sand. They also carried the trash passed us three times and it was gross.

Such a disappointment. We were so looking forward to going back to Blinkers. Unfortunately as good as everything was the last time we were there it was that bad this time around. I ordered my steak medium rare and it came out close to well done. I'm assuming it was the manager that came to our table to let me know they were preparing another steak. This one came out seared on both sides and raw in the middle. The meatballs that were to die for last month tasted like road kill this month. The manager came back out and told us the steak would be taken off the check. Unfortunately I was still hungry and the free dessert was no substitute for a nice meal.

I received nasty and sticky and starchyshrimp Fried rice!!!! I asked for vegetables and got none!!!! Also LoMein was starchy and sticky with too much soy sauce!!! This is my last visit I will never order from this place again!!!!

I wish I could give this place a negative star review. I signed up when they were offering reduced rates before the gym officially opened. I signed up for their peak membership in August because of all of the great bonuses. I was told numerous times I could easily cancel, transfer my membership to a different location, take advantage of their online workouts etc. thing is, it was all bs. Their employees were obviously either totally misinformed, or didn't give a crap what it took to make a sale because it was all just a bunch of lies. Fast forward 6 months and I've cancelled my membership but am STILL being changed a monthly fee, can NEVER get a hold of a manager to figure anything out, NO ONE returns calls. Stay away from here at every cost possible. This place is a big fat JOKE.

Main point is that it's slow with terrible service. Even with an appointment it takes over an hour before you see a doctor. The worst staff with no people skills. I've never been talked to or treated so rudely by people who are in the business of helping people. With two small children my current waiting time in the exam room is 2 hours and counting. This was supposed to be the better alternative than our regular doctor for sudden illness but it turns out it's the 9th layer of hell.

2nd visit: went to try and get a school physical when on the website they say that's a service they provide (photo) we get there and they inform us they don't do those. This place is a waste of my time.

If you want to order 3 salads, you better order 4 because they forgot one of ours. Make sure you speak slowly and clearly when choosing your toppings otherwise you'll end up with a completely different dish. I'm really glad we ordered and paid extra for a pizza they claimed was gluten free and had to help clean up my friend in the bathroom later from being sick. You can assume this place is decent but proceed with caution for your own enjoyment and safety. 

P.S. if you're lucky, they'll hand you the wings you ordered on your way out the door.

I used to work at a Lululemon and am a loyal shopper there, so I know the standards and what is expected out of the staff, and this has got to be the worst customer service I have ever experienced.  I walked in by myself and no one greeted me, even as I walked right past 3 employees. I got to the pant section and deliberately looked and felt every single style of pant after I noticed that the employee working in that section was just staring at me...and yet she did not ask me if I needed help. 

I went to the front and asked a question, and only then did they speak to me, but it was as if I was inconveniencing they by interrupting their conversation between each other.  I NEVER write reviews on yelp, but this one was very much needed. I will never shop at this location because of how unfriendly and unprofessional their staff is.  And looking at the other yelp reviews, it seems like I'm not the only one. 

They seriously need to step up their game and learn how to represent Lululemon and their culture as it should be. 

Just horrible...

I have many reviews on here...check them. I'm usually pretty nice when I leave reviews. I don't leave too many low reviews at all, but this place is pretty overrated. I could be wrong, but I'd be surprised if most of their business comes from tourists and not returning locals. I asked every Uber/Lyft driver we had and they all said the same thing. Overrated. But...I had to try it out and see for myself. 

Luckily, we caught it at a good time, because honestly I'd be livid if I waited in line for this stuff. The chicken wasn't really anything to speak of. Popeyes spicy chicken is a better option in my opinion. 

We got several spice levels of chicken. Now, as someone from the South who enjoys spicy foods and has a pretty high tolerance for spice, I was a bit surprised by the scale of spiciness. "Hot" should be hot but not knock your socks off hot. "Damn hot" should be a little on the make me sweat side. But if you think you can handle "damn hot" just know that spice level doesn't exactly convey how spicy that actually is. I don't see how anyone can eat that and actually enjoy their meal. It's more like a "Man Vs Food" spice level. The fact that there is another level above that is insane. 

I only tried a bit of the damn hot simply because all you can taste is the spice. I guess that's to cover the fact that the chicken meat is bland. The zero spice level chicken wasn't very good at all on the inside and the skin wasn't great at all.

Now...my real issue with this place. Myself and 5 other people...some of whom did NOT have the "damn hot" and some who did...ALL spent the next day and a half on the toilet. Tore our stomachs apart. My girlfriend got the ZERO spice version and she was sick all day. 

Look...don't jump on this place because it's touristy. Ask around, other places serve better food. I'm not getting into that, but just do your research and try going  somewhere that doesn't survive by being a tourist trap. More like Hattie F minus.

Don't book with this club. They'll take your deposit then you'll never hear from them again unless you track them down in person where they'll finally tell you they double booked your event oh well for you. Not even a sorry no apology nothing. No cares that invitations with their address were already printed and paid for, no cares for the people who already bought their plan tickets for the event since it is MONTHS away! What a nightmare.

Run, don't walk away from this dealer!  I should have brought my de-fib with me to get a pulse from salesman (Dave S). A total waste of time of energy to try and deal with them. Vehicle was overpriced and of course trade in value low. No effort to negotiate to a happy ground, just blabbing how they are the areas #1 CPO Ford dealer. They buy a lot of cars from the auction so they have no idea what they are buying... Buyer beware of the shit they trying to peddle!

Let me preface this by saying I'm not the person who complains about every little thing. I'm well aware that prices and service at airport restaraunts are not going Worst experience during our whole trip to NOLA. Bottom line don't bother if you want to leave on a good note. Fortunately we had plenty of time before our flight. 30 minutes just to get a couple bloody Mary's and a couple beers. Then we were informed of all the food on the menu that wasn't available which was easily half the menu. I felt fortunate that the gumbo and salad were available ......until they were delivered. Gumbo consisted a couple tablespoons of reaux topped with a heaping scoop of rice. Pathetic. Salad was bagged salad topped with 3 grape tomatoes, two cucumber slices and an onion slice. This wouldn't even be a complaint if it didn't cost 8.99 and they forgot the croutons that were in the description. By the time the food arrived, we were ready to cancel the food, but just when we were about to give up it arrived at the table in all it's disappointing glory. Save your time and money and avoid this place.

I'm in this Legal location 3-4 times a month. Service at breakfast today was terrible. 18 minutes after taking a seat to get a server to my table. Another 15 minutes to get food. After I finished eating the check was already on my table. I then waited 23 minutes for them to take the check and process it. The only reason I ever cashed out was because the manager walked by and I flagged him down. Pathetic service and they weren't even busy. Very disappointed!

Customer service and free vanilla soft serve cone is grand but if you don't go when they open the meats are dry and not tasty. Bread falls apart and meat is too tough. BBQ sauces are good but not on top of dry meat.

The layout is good. You walk-in, order, pay, sit and eat. Straws, drinks, ice cream, plastic ware and condiments are out for you. 

Bathrooms are clean and parking is free.

Good quality sushi, but all you can eat system was broken on recent visit.

I have been to Sakana three times now.  The first two times were rewarding experiences with fresh tasting sushi, a good selection, and decent service.  

My most recent visit was a total disaster.  I think the restaurant was short staffed and couldn't keep up with the orders but didn't let the customers know what was happening.  We had to wait one entire hour for the first round of our all you can eat sushi order to come out.  Meanwhile, a neighboring table who ordered after us were getting sushi.  It appeared that all you can eat orders were being delayed so that a la carte orders could be made first.  The whole point of all you can eat sushi is that you can keep ordering, and they will keep bringing it in a timely manner.

We had to get up and leave because it was taking too long.  The staff were barely helpful about what was going on, but did agree in the end to not charge us for the all you can eat orders.   

I am willing to chalk this up as a bad night with terrible management. I will update this review if I end up ever going to Sakana again.  However, it is completely unacceptable to make your customers wait one hour before receiving the first part of their order.  Please don't even offer all you can eat sushi if you won't fill the orders the customer is making in a timely fashion.
Beautiful historic building.  Total tourist trap.  The kitchen isn't trying because they don't have to.  Sad.  Food seriously mediocre.  Service provincial. Way overpriced.  A joke really.

My husband just took our dog here for the first time and said that the staff was very friendly. Unfortunately his experience with Dr Ginex was not the best. She walked into the room and before greeting/ introducing herself, she exclaimed "we've got an illegal dog here," as we were late to get her rabies shot. She flipped through our puppy's paperwork, and rudely noted how we have seen multiple vets as if that were a bad thing, even though we have been moving for the past several months. My husband told her we were having a baby this month and her response seemed cold hearted and judge-mental saying, "oh a new puppy and a baby, lots of new things." She was good with our pup and treated her kindly. Just disappointed in how rude she was. If you are young and this is your first dog, I recommend you don't pick this vet, as she made my husband feel like he was a bad person/ dog owner. We won't be going back.

I really wanted this place to be great. For atmosphere, styling and service it was. However those 3 attributes wont fill up my stomach and make me happy. 

For real bbq lovers this place is essentially glorified Sonny's. If you think Sonny's is real BBQ then you will love this place and you can stop reading now. 

For those of you who love real bbq this place was a let down. Hardly any decent smoke flavors. The smoke rings on the meats were minimal. The sauces were nice but should only be a compliment to good meat. The brisket while tender was mediocre and borderline dry. The nice juicy look you expect out of brisket was not there. It looked like deli meat. 
Turkey I always enjoy trying. It's a boring bbq meat but for some reason I always try it. This wasn't half bad but nothing to write home about. The sausage flavor was good but the texture was mushy. 

This place imo falls into the fast food bbq category alongside sonny's.

I go to this location almost every week. There sometime will be little problem here and there but it's nothing to dramatic until a couple days ago. I was standing and waiting for my drink while the barista served a drink without calling a name or anything about the drink. It looks just the one I normally get so I waited a minute until something happened. She just kept making drinks so I decided to turn the cup and see it if had my name on it. As I grabbed the cup she snapped at me telling me it wasn't my drink. How was I suppose to know? I felt attacked and didn't know what to do. I saw the manager come out from the back and see her snapping at me and didn't do a single thing! Just let it happen. 

I will not be returning here and will be calling Starbucks to let them know what had happened. I have never been publicly humiliated and yelled at like a five year old in a Starbucks. All I wanted was my drink and I would be on my way.

Very bad experience! Very unprofessional  staff! I did the retina exam and after asking for a copy they said tomorrow and every time I call they came with an excuse ... when we went to another doctor and needed to just get a copy for my prescription they refused to give it and the other clinic said they tried to call them several times and they were very very unprofessional!! Although their doctor was not that bad the staff was useless and they all seems to hate their job and reflect that on their costumers treatment.

We had dinner here tonight, sat in the bar area. 

Appetizer was good, not hot enough!  Ordered prime rib medium. The meat came out too rare, so I asked to send it back. Then it came out looking horrible, with hardly any red center. Had to request another serving of fries. The first batch was not cooked enough. 

Absolutely over priced meal, and lousy prime rib. My son ordered a steak, that was flavorful and quite nice. 

Wish we would have gone with our first choice down the street.   Will never come back to a Del Frisco  restaurant again. 

Very nice server, she gave us a free dessert to compensate for my poor meal. 

Go try J Alexander's food, hands down 100% better at half the price!!!

Just spent 40 minutes in the drive thru. Sat at the speaker for 11 minutes to just take order. Sat at the window for 6 minutes before they opened the window to take payment. Then spent another 6 waiting for food.
This place has been horribly run for awhile now. Shame on us for thinking it'll be different "the next time"...
Please avoid this place....

Ever come to a coffee shop to do a little work with some Wi-Fi?  Not if they turn the Wi-Fi off periodically to purge customers so they can get new ones.

Ever tried to get the good table in a coffee shop and when you finally do, you're asked to move because they want to save that table for a bigger group, even when such a group isn't present?  Fido!

We get it .. but you're a coffee shop.  Lots of new choices in Nashville though.

We had a reservation.  "We can't find your reservation".  We'd like to sit outside. "We don't have any tables outside right now."   Wait. Wait.  Wait.  Seated inside.   Told the manager we'd like to sit outside.  "I can sit you in the sun or near the doors ((away from the ocean)".  Picture attached of all the seats empty, partially covered while we baked in the sun (punishment for making a request??). 

Then overcharged $60-- had to have the bill fixed.  

They don't want your business.  Don't give it to them.

Very unprofessional service. Placed an order on 7/6/18 and received the order with two pieces of hair on the turkey club. Called immediately and spoke with Nick who was very rude and refused to refund my money. My entire organization orders from Verona's daily and I couldn't understand the awful treatment and customer service I received. If I could give 0 stars I would...

Bar! Yes the bartender was quick on the greet.Lacked in people skills. Annoyed be me asking what beer was there best seller. Didn't want to guide at all. No information on menu. Asked me to pay out because well obviously wanted a tip for the two beers and curds I got.I get it and I tipped $4.00 on the small tab. Interrupted me while I was on my phone talking . Because she was leaving. I get it but hospitality is catering to the guest. We pay there bills. New bartender didnt say hello until 20 min it her shift. Look up the definition on hospitality and teach your staff that. Were not an inconvenience we the guest pay your bills.

The food was alright, only ordered two things, but the service was extremely slow. As in, laughably slow. In total, I was there for nearly 90 minutes and was checked on three times. That's about 25 minute intervals. Probably won't go back. Everyone was friendly though...when I saw them :)

Edit in response to the owner's reply: I understand that the camera contradicts what I said, but I'm trying to convey what it felt like. Bottom line, I walked out of there feeling like I had about 3 necessary interactions about 25 minutes apart, and each one seemed unusually slow or peculiarly timed. There were two different waitpeople coming to the table, neither seemed to know what the other was doing. One waitperson asked me what I wanted to drink, disappeared for a while, then came back and asked me again as if we hadn't had the first conversation. And I don't mean "I forgot what you said you wanted to drink" -- I mean straight up repeated the entire conversation as if it had never happened. It wasn't just one thing, it was a lot of little weird things. Off night? I don't know. I'll definitely update the review if I stop in again.

Used Yelp as a reference before I picked this place. I quickly regretted it. The food was subpar. The chef LOVES salt. High blood pressure peeps beware.
Saw two patrons walk out due to not being acknowledged. What seemed like a manager sitting on the wrong side of the bar was humorous. I was witness to this being addressed with bartender from the GM. Be good to yourself. Go somewhere else.

Had a couple bad experiences one being we were told to coat our own swirl cone with candy while we drove home and a little cup full of crushed heath was shoved in my husband's hand. I called and talked to a manager she admitted training was taking quite a bit longer than they'd expected and offered free cones. My husband and I went through the drive thru and we received our free cones along with rude stares from the employees gawking out the window at us. We will be going to Dairy Queen from now on they have stellar service.

This place could not be any sloooower if they tried. What a nightmare, being locked in line with 2 screaming toddlers for 20 minutes, just for fries and drinks. I'll wait until I get to Hamilton Town area next time.

Took 15 minutes for us to be waited on after being seated and after I had to tell the hostess that no one had been by. Our waitress never came by once she took our order. Someone else brought out our food. We needed refills so I walked up to the bar where our waitress was and asked for refills. She said she would bring us some drinks out. 10 minutes later she came to the table with no drinks and finally went and refilled our drinks. Was a horrible experience and not sure if we will be back.

taco tuesdays, drink specials (bubbly mondays & wine down wednesdays), wings, and burgers....have all been on-point (only things keeping it from 1 star; refer to previous review from jan '17). however, i advise not to venture "outside" the easy stuff, not even calamari! the 1st order we got was WAY overdone and cut my gums. the 2nd order was *slightly* tender, but the calamari itself was so small! although we wound up eating only half of it b/c they didn't think of pushing back the dinner order when we sent back the app, so we got hit with our entree's at the same time & didn't want our dinner to get cold (c'mon, this is serving 101 when an app is sent back). 

my thai style noodles w/ shrimp entree was very dry and the noodles were so short (think the bottom of a box of spaghetti where all the broken pieces go to die). my bf's salmon was flavorless and overcooked as well (he never adds salt to anything, but had to do *something* to jazz it up). the owner informed us to order it 'RARE' next time (although there won't be one), but i doubt they use sushi-grade salmon where one would be safe in doing so. 

needless to say this was a super-disappointing experience, but we were so hungry by then that we just ate what we could of our meals. i made the remark that we would have had a better meal for a quarter of the price (total came to just over $100 due to 2 rounds of overpriced drinks) 2 doors down at italian express (takeout pizza joint) which i'm positive would be the case!

it's a shame b/c the service wasn't horrible and the menu itself is alluring; the kitchen just can't execute it. invest in a chef or some type of cook who knows wtf they're doing.

Gotta pass on this place. There are other places to get good Mexican around here. Godfrey. Edwardsville. The service is good and cheese dip is good, but beyond that no bueno. The fajitas lacked seasoning and flavor. The fried ice cream didn't even have cinnamon and sugar sprinkled on the fried bowl. The margarita was ok. The cheese quesadillas for the kids were ok. 

We brought it to their attention as an FYI since we have tried the other places in the nearby area. Then when I paid the bill it wasn't itemized. At that point I just paid bc I already brought to their attention my concerns but they just didn't really seem too concerned. I got an "I'm surprised."  After I left I realized that they charged me for fajitas for two but only gave the single portion, which is why the bill was heavy. 

Will not be returning here. The ceilings leaked as well. 

Please, pick another place.

We were charged more for two eggs and 2 slices of bacon than we would have been charged for an entire breakfast meal - why didn't the server tell us that? The prices are ridiculous, and for the life of me I don't understand why people rave over their biscuits - they're not even flaky! McDonald's and other fast-food places have better biscuits. Their chicken & dumplings taste like those you buy in a can at Kroger - not gross, but not homemade either. And their vegetable casseroles are too greasy. If people think the food is good I think it is because they can't cook themselves and don't really know what good home cooking tastes like. I'M NOT A FAN OF LOVELESS CAFE!
Why is the focus behind the deli counter on packaging food and never the waiting customers? One server for deli requests and 10 staff packaging prepared foods.
Not authentic at all. Tacos were unflavorful store bought shells. Chicken and meat inside tacos had no flavor and were watery. Beans were worse. Very disappointed. Will not be back.

This location's closing hour is 2AM on Friday & Saturday so I literally want to know why my boyfriend walked in at 1:20ish & got refused service cause it was "slow". Don't corporate locations close at a set time not at a random hour just because it's "slow". The staff is AWFUL by the way, "tip us & we'll serve you" is literally what was said. Aren't you paid to serve people during your shift? I'm so confused and baffled at their behavior. I would give this place zero stars if that was an option.

The only reason it gets one star is because the people are always really really nice, but they just don't get the job done, and frankly I don't think they give a darn! The last 4 or 5 times I have gone I always ask them to wipe down the back window really well...they NEVER do! This last time I asked for a certain service and when I got to the front the lady told me I should have ordered the next one up in order to get the Axxess discount...and she refused to let me upgrade for a few dollars. It was the first time I didn't tip anything. I wrote them an email asking for an explanation from the manager as to why I cannot seem to get the right service. A week has gone by, no reply. Forget the Axxess discount, I am not going back again anytime soon. I am sure there are plenty of other places that would love to have me as a customer. Apparently they just don't care. They do have the best greeting cards in town, though.

I stopped on my way to dinner to show an out of town guest. The view is nice in the evening. But if it is humid forget it. The crowd is not the same as the the ones who drive to be the beach to much work.

We wanted this place to be great.  It was recommended by our BNB hosts.  Unfortunately, our hopes were dashed beginning with drinks.  One in our party had to send their drink back for a remake. Dinner delivered, tepid is best we can say for temp on three dishes.  Sent back and returned barely warmer than before.  A disappointment = three meals out of four.  So sorry to give this review but unfortunately it is the honest truth.

Love the coffee but the employees at this location are horrible. Every time I have the misfortune of needing to stop at this location they act like they're doing you a favor by waiting on you. Terrible customer service

Here it is 4 weeks after my last review, and still no $85.00 check, how many months does it take to process and mail a check......I would wager a bet that if they were billing me, I would have received many bills in the mail......Beware, do not ever over pay diagnostic clinic...
It has been about 5 months since I called about this overpayment...

This place is just gross. Greasy walls and floors. Uncovered food. Man at counter looked and acted like he just rolled out of bed. It was getting a lot of business though. I guess people are confident with the chain. As for me, I walked out.

My husband made a 9pm reservation for a birthday celebration. We arrived 10 minutes early. SP refused to honor our reservation bc the previous diners decided to stay seated & enjoy the live music. We were told to sit at the bar, right by the band. We declined. We wanted our table reservation honored. 
The hostess called over a steroid bouncer-type guy & he said "Well, I guess you'll have to leave then." 
We asked if the people at our reserved table could be relocated to the bar and bouncer said No.
We asked for the manager & the bouncer said he would call the police if we didn't leave right then. 
I stepped outside and called Seasons 52. They said "Come right over. We'd be happy to have you."
20 minutes later we were sipping cocktails at Seasons 52 and having a great night. 
The food, I hear, is great at SP but the service is certainly lacking & the staff is beyond rude. I recommend skipping this place and heading to Seasons 52 as fast as you can!

Very disappointed. Owner canceled on the cater I ordered, literally 6 trays of food worth over $350 and he canceled the same day of my family arrangement. Never will I provide business for this place again.

nails look good but i felt like i was being talked about. i was being looked at and laughed at while they spoke in Vietnamese multiple times. it made me feel very uncomfortable and i will definitely not be going back

I have tried and tried with this salon- because it's convenient. But the truth is they don't care, are sloppy and rushing people through. I tried dip for the first time. It's uneven and lumpy. To make matters worse it's temperature sensitive so it changes to bright pink when it's cold and looks awful. Two weeks to go until I can change it again. What a total waste of time and money.

Well ordered the wet burrito, let's just say Taco Bell would have been better. The pastor added up to a table spoon in a giant flour tortilla, the rest was a smear of beans and the worst rice I've had. The green sauce was non existent, so left hungry.

My wife and I have eaten at 'Puckett's Grocery' in Franklin many times with great satisfaction with the food, the service, and the prices.  The only problem here is that, during lunch hours, there almost always is a brief wait for a table due to the popularity of the place!

 Recently, we decided to eat lunch at Puckett's Boat House for the first time, and we were very disappointed!  In fact, before going there, we were in a downtown business, where we asked the owner about the Boat House.  He told us that, although he had lived in Franklin for years, they never had eaten there because they never heard anything good about it!  We should have listened to him!!!

The food at the Boat House was merely so-so!  The gumbo was very good (the single bright point!), but everything else was mediocre (shrimp and grits hushpuppies, coconut shrimp, fries), and the french fries were so salty that they almost were inedible.  If the meal had been good, the prices still would have been too high for a lunch!  My wife and I had wanted to eat a good seafood meal, but we didn't get it, and our ticket totaled nearly $50!!  WAY too much for lunch consisting of one appetizer (that we split!), one cup (NOT each, just ONE!) of gumbo (NOT a bowl!), and one meal (that we split)!!!

Perhaps one thing we should have noted was that, although we arrived at about 12:00 noon, there were very few tables with customers!  We should have run!!

Next time in Franklin, we'll not get close to the Boat House (which should be sunk!) - and return to Puckett's Grocery for a great meal at a reasonable price!!!

This is the worst place to call and order delivery.  I called 3 times and was on hold for 5 mins first time and 7 mins the second time.  They didn't even listen to my voice and answered and said' Imos could you hold....CLICK'!  I called dominoes and got my pizza quick!  Will NEVER go to or call this place again!

This is a frustrating dealership. The service department has always been fine, but I turned in my lease in March, and I began receiving notifications from the state about the car, which I had turned in. No one at the dealership advised me that I had to contact PennDOT regarding the vehicle turn in at the time that we returned it.

When I tried to call the dealership to let them know what was going on, I left two messages with the receptionist over the course of a week, and no one returned my call. I finally got ahold of someone this morning, and he was terse and condescending. I get that you're busy, car sales bro, but so am I, and customer service is your em effing job. I'm pissed. Exton is a better dealership. Too bad it's so far away.

So, I would not recommend coming here. Be nicer if you're going to sell expensive cars. If you're not nice, then don't go into sales, for eff's sake. That's why I'm not in sales. I'm not nice.
Delivery was extremely slow and pizza was cold by the time it finally arrived. Taste was average. Disappointed.

Very selective service. My waitress didn't want to be there, neither did the manager, from other reviews it seems they prefer locals. As a person in the restaurant industry I was shocked it was like something you only hear about, it literally blew my mind how bad the service was. If you had a good experience I'm so happy for you because I really wish I did. I just downloaded Yelp today just so I can share this horrible experience so if you are from out of town I advise you to avoid this place

Everyone save your money!! That will be the best tip anyone can give you. I'm still mad at myself for paying $35 for this. This place is horrible. I feel sorry for the people that paid for the fast pass. Anyways you walk in and they check you and then you go thru the line and can get your picture taken. Then go thru the line some more and they scan your ticket. (Do not throw or delete your ticket bc it gets scanned one more time) you go thru the first one which took about 15 min, then the next one the line was alot longer and this is where you have to scan your ticket again. Another 15 min in and then you go to the next one. So not worth it at all. I can't believe this is one of the top in the nation. Again save your money. We made the most of it but still i think about what i could of spent $35 on.

We decided to eat here since we were staying here in the hotel. Prices were fair. Food was decent.  Service was SUPER BAD!!!!!! our server took our order and almost 20 minutes we got our food.  She came to our table once the whole time. And she only had 3 tables the whole time we were here. Won't be back.
how about you try answering the phone once in a while. i waited on the phone for so long that i learned all the words to your crappy country theme song. it's a MONDAY not a friday night

The food was so-so, small portions and over priced. If you are on a diet or want a kid size meal then this is the place for you. We ate at In-N-Out afterwards, it was walking distance. There was an In-N-Out bag sitting on the table by the door. The young guy serving us was more concerned about his cell phone texting than the customers. That was our first and last time to eat here. Big hint... serving sushi and Pho in the same is a big red flag. Do one well and not bomb both. If you want sushi go somewhere else. If you want pho go somewhere else. The place smelled like an elementary school cafeteria. There are much better pho places to eat. The place looked run down and the decor needed help. We should have gone to the chinese restaurant (first choice) down the street, but they were closed on Monday nights.

Mediocre Cuban. Not worth the price. And the girl at the cash register either has some mental issues or intentionally made our coffee wrong after a 5 minute back and forth about what we wanted (turns out they didn't have what I wanted and were just trying to twist my words to get me to say yes to something else...)

PRO: (1) Mexican AND American food selection for breakfast. (2) Friendly server.

CON: (1) Food was just OK, over all. (2) stuffed French toast tasted like...fish? Maybe it was cooked on a dirty griddle? (3) They wanted to charge us extra for a spare plate. (4) They charge an automatic 20% gratuity for a party of 6 - that usually only applies to 8+. 

Something is just wrong here...

We will never go back.

Omg this is has got to be the worst McDonald's ever.

When you combine my weakness for those commercials and the fact that this is the only location in downtown, you get the most resentful McDonald's goer ever. I've gone when there were 10 cars in line and when there were 2 cars. I've gone when there was snow on the ground and when it was bright and humid. I've gone during peak hours and during non-peak/senior-moment early dinner hours. No matter what, you're going to encounter rude personalities, a consistent 20-30 minute wait, and a wrong order 70% of the time. Btw, forget about UberEats...most things are the same; the wait is still long and they STILL get your order wrong.

If you're really hungry for some fast food, you're better off cooking a 5-course meal at home 'cause that's for sure faster than this McDonalds' version of fast food.

We have taken lots of wonderful cooking classes at a variety of schools across the U.S.  Unfortunately, this was not one of them.  The chef was nice enough, but the menu items were too simplistic and nothing we made tasted good.  The pieces of chicken were way too large to be used to make fried chicken.  They didn't cook through even though the chef had us keep frying until the coating was getting burned and was testing them with a probe.  The Nashville hot glaze was awful tasting (not even that spicy and had weird sweet taste; and I've had real Nashville hot chicken and what we made was not even close.  The cole slaw was sour and the biscuits were dense and tasteless.  Will not be taking another Sur La Table cooking class.

They need work here. The last couple times I have waited 45+ minutes for a couple of sandwiches and soup. I was told there were five orders ahead of me and they were "slammed" it wasn't even lunch time.  I think the staff needs training or people that work a little harder. Avoid this location.

Ordered delivery from Felipe's yesterday. The tacos were good, but I was missing 4 of the tacos I ordered and missing queso I ordered to go with the chips. Pretty disappointed, but I liked the tacos. I eat here again, but I might not.

The amount of games they have is cool. Pretty pricey but to be expected. The food from what I had was nothing short of gross. Food is very expensive and whatever sampler they have is absurdly bad. Words can't describe...

I hated this place. I was a walk-in and kindly asked if they had time for a full set, they said they did which I was glad about. However, if I would've known they were going to rush through my manicure, I would have just waited until the following day. I asked my nail tech for a full set of ombré acrylics, and she did not know what she was doing. She was talking to the other technicians asking them how to do it, while they were working on other people. They were not ombré, they were crooked, they were choppy. They showed me an example and it was exactly what I wanted, but my nails looks HORRIFIC. The nail technician even said, "look how pretty" but they were not pretty. I wish I would have taken a photo to show you all but it was too bad to even take a picture. I came home and soaked my nails with acetone to remove them. Worst $60 I ever spent. I will not be coming here again. If you decide to come here, ask for something simple or make sure your tech knows what they are doing!

Lived at their Central State Mansion property for 5 months. I'll put in simply: living here is not worth the money. It's not a horrible place to live, but it has all the same problems of your typical apartment complex, at a much higher price point. For $690 a month, you get a 10' x 10' room with scuffed concrete floors, dorm furniture, and an A/C/heat unit that is always breaking. The "cool, co-working, young professional" image they try to market for this place is untrue; don't let them fool you. It's mostly college students and transient adults who only come out of their rooms to microwave something and dart back.

The Mansion's grounds are nice, but I wouldn't walk alone outside the grounds at night. The area is only about a 10 minute bike from White River State Park, which is nice, but there's no bike paths until you reach the park.

The apartment's amenities are nice, but have their downsides. The yoga room floods, half of the exercise machines in the gym are always broken, the pool was never cleaned often enough, the "guest suite" costs over $130 a night, and the pantry lockers often had bugs. The amenities that are good are bike storage (plenty, safe), laundry (washers & dryers on every floor), parking (free for residents & guests, always enough room), and the movie theater. The communal kitchens and bathrooms can get gross at times, but a cleaning service always comes and cleans them eventually, which is nice.

It is very clear that management cares more about this place as an event venue than as a place where people are living. (Surprise! The pool is closed and the lobby is trashed because there was a wedding in your backyard.) Maintenance is hit or miss as well. Sometimes I would request repairs and they would happen in a day, sometimes they would never address them at all and never tell me why. 

One time I called the Emergency Maintenance phone line because a resident set off the fire alarm, and they didn't pick up and never called me back. It took Management over 12 hours to shut the alarm off. Residents slept outside it was so loud. They did apologize with a letter and a $50 credit towards rent, but the whole event was unsettling. How would you feel if you called emergency line and got voicemail? And if your management let your space be unlivable for 12 hours? 
But it is simply not worth the money. 

For a small room, sub-par amenities, careless management, and a dorm-like environment, you could just go live in any of the other apartment complexes that are more reasonably priced.

White Dog hosted a private party for us for 45 guests. The event was poorly managed by the staff at White Dog. The room, which was to be cleared of any earlier diners at least a half hour before our event so that the room could be set up and flowers placed ... wasn't. The restaurant manager allowed several tables to linger right up to the start time of our party. Could have easily managed this by offering those guests another coffee at any of the many open tables in the other rooms of the restaurant. Our guests stood around out front while the staff dashed around trying to get the room ready.  Confusion resulted, the arrangement of tables was off, tables not set, and misunderstandings about serving the welcoming glasses of Prosecco to the guests all ensued. Some of the staff were very kind and tried their best to set things straight... others, not so much.

I only come here because it's the closest pharmacy.  No one is ever helpful. There is ONE lady that works in the pharmacy that is nice and helpful but other than that they act like you are bothering them.  Their hours aren't great and their building is a dump with weeds, dead bushes and over grown grass. For a neighborhood that is working so hard to improve, they certainly bring the corner down.

I've attended this event for the last 3 years but after this year, I probably won't be returning. Our visit was Monday, June 4th around 7:30pm to around 9pm.

My friend and I are in line and 2 straight couples are getting in line in front of us. When one of the males walked by me, you could smell the alcohol from him; like strong. As I watched him and his party purchase tickets and head into the event, the guys were drunk; blood shot eyes, the smell and having issues walking. I notified the staff in line (who were on their phones and only looked up when I said something) about the issue and I was told they were going to tell their manager. But I was in line for a while and never saw such action. 

The biggest issue I had with this year is that, it is not a Chinese Lantern Festival without Chinese Lanterns. This year was just illuminated cloth colored animals. I mean were they going for a deep sea theme? And what was with the Game of Thrones tree? And a tarantula? And a dung beetle? The large shark was dripping some brown water from it's tail, no joke and people were walking right underneath it. I'm sorry this is not some "light show" in your friends backyard and that is what if felt like compared to even just last year. Please stop gentrifying (white washing and diluting) everything. It is bad enough how Chinatown is changing with all of its boutique looking generic restaurants.

Second issue, they allowed drinking everywhere. When in years past they had a "beer garden" area where people could drink. But this was just an awful decision on the event coordinator's part. People were noticeably drunk and even saw a staff member with full cup of beer sneaking off to behind the bathrooms. I'm not anti-alcohol but people don't know their limits so allowing them more and more events to drink at, how is that helping the situation, especially in front of their children? Events want money so allowing booze is the cheap, easy way to get it. But how many kids are left in the hands of their "tipsy" parent driving them home? People cant see past their own wants to understand the bigger picture. There were several females who were noticeably drunk and I was walked into at one point.

There was very little staff working this event and the staff that were there, were either at the front on their phones, or around the gates to make sure people didn't sneak in, on their phone. And at one point my friend and I smelled cannabis and he said it was one of the guards. I didn't see it so I don't know but I smelled it near them and no one else was around them.

The last thing, was the bathrooms by the beer garden (like 20ft away) smelled like fecal matter. It made me want to vomit. As we left, I spoke with the manager Wayne, who was in the ticket booth, and I told him everything I am stating here. He wanted me to identify the staff member drinking but I told him I didn't want to get involved. I did my part several times to get these people to pay attention to what was happening under their watch and no one cared to do anything. What bothers me the most is the children that were there...what if some over intoxicated person hurt one of them? It is a dark park with lots of little areas to hide. This is not a family friendly event at all.

This was definitely not like any of the other festivals from previous years and for the price we paid to deal with all of this and the staff not even caring? Yeah, I can give my money to other cause that deserves financial support. I didn't feel comfortable taking pictures of people (I don't want to show their faces) but I have uploaded a picture of 3 staff members not doing their job to add a little more credibility to my review. I don't give 1 stars out lightly if you look at my profile.

The only redeeming quality is the service.  We ordered the prix fixe menu of crepes, shrimp and grits, and a shitty creme brûlée.  I have never added salt and pepper to a meal in New Orleans until today.  Then had the manager try to explain to me that creole dishes have no spice. Seriously?!? I just politely explained that this was not my first time here and that he really needed to stop explaining.  The worst part is that it was our anniversary dinner.  Good news is there are tons of great places to have a evening drink and celebratory dessert!!!!

Since you don't take reservations, but you accept call ahead seating.  Take the call ahead when a customer calls in.  Don't tell me that there is no wait currently and i will be ok.  Then when I arrive you tell me it's a 45 minute wait.  This is the second time in a row that this happened.

Horrible.   Server at lunch told me when she gave me a menu "it will be a few minutes".   I then watched her stand and talk to the pizza cook for just short of five minutes.   This was at lunchtime and 10' from my table in full view.  She then came back, took my order, and went back to talking to the cook.  

The vast majority of the other patrons were over 60 (I am not).   They had The Violence by Rise Against blaring.   You couldn't hear it was so loud.    Service was pathetic, food not much better.   Huge plate, extremely small portion.   Bland food. The utensils were filthy.  They failed in just about every measure. 

Waited 10 minutes for the check, with lots of staff and only 5 tables occupied.  This is at lunch when time is critical.    An unpleasant 1+ hour experience.  

Don't waste your time.

My 21 year old daughter stayed here last November.  After a long day of travel she forgot to text to say she arrived OK.  She checked into this hotel giving all information and sign in etc.  Later on in the evening we tried to contact with her but she had fallen asleep in the hotel room and is a solid sleeper.
We called the hotel twice, 2 times, from two separate people and they said that SHE HAD NEVER CHECKED IN.   Our daughter was then officially missing, a young lady, in the most violent city in the US.  Another daughter was finally able to contact the "missing one" after way too long for anxious parents 1,500 miles away.  So we had found her.
There is no way (at least that I could find) to contact the hotel directly, via email or comment, to inform them of their illegal and dangerous lack of knowledge about who was checked into the hotel.  
I sent a message to Holiday Inn corporate who, of course, said that the incident did not follow company policy for information and security.  They said they would refer our message to the Holiday Inn Convention center, St Louis and that I would hear back from them.
Neither party has contacted me again.
This is inexcusable and illegal.
Yes, my daughter dropped the ball by not contacting us and not answering her cell phone, but this is just the kind of situation where the hotel can and should and is supposed to pick up the slack to close the communications loop.
If they ignore serious issues like this then it will certainly not get better.  This is not a safe place to stay.

First of all, from the time we arrived to the time we got seated there was a TWO HOUR WAIT.  When we finally got inside you had to wait in another line to place your order.  You would think that after standing outside for so long they would take your order with some kind of sense of urgency.  Nope.  Another 25 minutes as they leisurely operated with half a cash register.

When we did finally sit, we had high expectations for the food.  It came promptly but they forgot our Bonuts.  Oh the Bonuts, supposedly the best thing not to be missed on the menu.  It was ok but didn't blow me away.

The real serious disappointment was the Princess chicken biscuit.  It was dry, tasteless and the chicken was stringy and hard to cut.  They must have made it a few hours earlier and had it sitting under a heat lamp.

The Bill Neal was the only thing I can honestly recommend.  Cheesy shrimp and grits with bacon and mushrooms.  It was tasty.  Would I have waited TWO HOURS for it?  No.

Do yourself a favor.  Skip the ridiculous line and go elsewhere for brunch.

The employees here are rude and not good at their job. I was treated poorly for asking simple questions, the woman doing my draws has no clue what a safe draw is, and said everything in mumbles. I had to ask her to repeat every single thing she said and even then it was useless.

Go to another location. This place is awful.

Not only my worst experience in New Orleans, but the worst restaurant experience of my life. 
I've said it before in some of my previous negative reviews, the food doesn't matter if the experience is terrible, e.g., I've given an IHop in Queens 5 stars before, but if I could, I would give Willie Mae's zero stars!
For starters, we waited an hour and a half in a humid 90 degree afternoon in the Louisiana sun, and no one even bothered to come outside and take our name for the guest list. But luckily when it was our turn in the line, they let us in. 
So I keep my cool, mostly at the urging of my girlfriend. But then, the waitress that approaches us makes things even worse. Focusing her attention on the larger table of 8 that sat right before us, she throws the menus at our table without even saying 'Hello,' then tosses one pair of utensils on our table from across the room. 
But okay, I take a deep breath for the thousandth time and keep my cool, even though at this point even my girlfriend -my better half- is as angry as I am. The waiter who approaches us was nice enough, so I'm thinking: maybe I'll tip after all.
But no, it gets worse all over again, I ask the runner/busser for another pair of utensils and two glasses of water, and he's literally WALKING AWAY from me while I'm talking to him, so I have to yell across the room, and he just nods. 
So he comes around with our food, a pair of utensils, and then the water. UH OH!!! He drops my water right next to me on the table, shards of glass every where. Now I don't care, I've been a server, bartender, cook... I've made all these mistakes. I tell him it's okay, it happens, I've done it before. He cleans up, tossing his rag all over the place, and my girlfriend is worried that I might be eating glass, cuz it broke closer to my side, but I insist that it's ok. I suck it up, I start eating but my forearm is getting stabbed by shards of glass. A piece of glass gets lodged in my thumb as I grab the plate, so I ask the runner/busser to change my food please cuz I'm worried there's glass on my plate. And what does he do?! He brings me back THE SAME FOOD on a different sized plate. WHAT. THE. HELL??!!!!
I kept trying to eat but I still feel more shards of glass in my forearms. 
It takes a lot, I mean A LOT, to put me off, I have burns all over my arms from the kitchens I've worked in, and I've dealt with major assholes before, but this experience takes the cake. 
When I asked to speak to a manager, they didn't even bother, they just gave me the waiter who helped us in the beginning, and I don't even know if that was the head waiter, maybe they were too scared to give me the manager. 
Completely disrespectful and rude! I wouldn't even come back for a free meal.

They don't even deserve a one, waiting for tv delivery, 12-4,at 5:00 no delivery. I have been on hold for over two hours and no one answered the phone. I have been disconnected two times. Very frustrating

Very disappointed! I've been wanting to try the chantilly cake stuffed with the cheesecake for so long. My husband and I along with our son each got one today. Very pricey for what we actually got. The most disappointing thing to me was I got maybe 3 bites of cheesecake!! I got the Mardi Gras cup and it was basically an overpriced Snowball with fruit in it.
Was told that entire exhaust system had to be replace for 1200.   Went to Midas and they replaced a two foot section for 130.  Wow.  Just wow.

We checked into this hotel around 10:30pm and went to our room and there was a bed bug crawling across one of the two beds. We asked to change rooms and they said it was their last room. The woman was nice about it and gave us a full refund. We went to a different hotel but just a warning if you don't want bed bugs don't stay here.

And no cheese bread, cinnamon bread, brownies, or apple pizza. What did we pay for?? Oh, that's right the custom orders only. And manager just said "what you expect coming in last 20 mins?" In front of other guests. We got here around 8pm. No buffet for us and No refund. Receipt time 8:11 with a long line before us.

I don't expect Bazbeaux or Giacomo grade service. But come on.

So, like any organization you are only as good as your weakest link or in this case, your worst employee.
The front desk staff was wonderful, as were my emais with Paula and Jamie. 
After filling out the paperwork I was put in a room to wait for a 'tech'. I was told the "Tech" would review the process and expectations of the procedure my pet would be receiving.   
Here is where this company suffers greatly. The " Tech, Dr. Or Dr wanna be" (whatever this persons was), was mostly interested in up-selling me add-on items that are offered by the company. With each Item I refused, she became noticeably more and more upset.  I could only surmise that she receives a sizable portion of the proceeds she was up-selling? 
She had zero personality to begin with and by the time she was done with me she was super uptight, abrupt, demeaning, uncaring, and sarcastic. Sarcastic in a nasty kind of way, not the playful way. I think all of the Yelp readers will understand better if I just use one word to describe her. "Bitch" ( please notice the capital 'B') 
I came into their business felling very good and I left feeling pretty crappy. 
I can't help but think, If this is what we see as their 'Best face' What goes on behind the scenes?  What kind of care is our pet really getting? 
This employees poor customer service either tarnishes the reputation of the entire organization, or is a representation of the entire organization. Which one it is I will never know, because I will never return.  
Oh, and never once did the 'Tech' tell me anything about the procedure my pet was receiving. haha 
I would like to suggest this women go and get a job at the DMV in NYC or another government agency where you can treat people like crap and still keep your job.
Not very good.  Dumplings were just steamed wontons with a side of soy sauce.  Fried rice was greasy and Kung pao was very sweet.  Will not be going here.

My husband picked our late lunch spot.  Very noisy.  Table wobbles.  Had to ask for utensils.   Advertises Shell Raiser Beer.   I asked for Orange and they were out.  Asked to taste another beer but taps were down on one side.  Wasn't sure about waitress but after she had to tell us about taps, new it was frustration and not rudeness.   Food fair.  I really wanted to like this place but not sure if I'll be back.   Added note no growlers or bottles available for a very good Shell Raiser Pale Ale.

What a terrible experience. My father, who is not from the area asked about eating here for his birthday. Terrible, terrible service. What a shame. There were a few semi-redeeming moments when the manager tried to take care of us. However, we ended up leaving rather quickly after eating without even getting the dessert. We just needed out. Absolutely, do not recommend.

If I could give Comcast zero stars I would. If you value honesty DO NOT do business with Comcast. They will lie about prices and terms and conditions. Be prepared to go switch equipment at least once a month. Also be prepared to be without internet for several days. There customer service sucks over the phone. They even sent me to collections without sending me my final bill. Save yourself the hassle and go with another company.
Have no sense of line, let others just jump. Waited 25 minutes just go to dark depths. Priced higher than average store.

People say it's the best,not even near to be. Expensive for the quality. Try something else. For Mexicans the "Boneless Short Rib" is the mear you'd find on any soup. The PoBoy is less then regular. Mac & Cheese is very spicy. Lobster is good. Oisters are better in other places

As I sit here at my table. 1 hour after we have been seated and still do not have drinks. Why am I even waiting? Not sure because they sure do not care. We have been up to speak with a manager with a beard  in a purple and white checkered shirt. He could care less! I'm still not sure why I'm still here.

Miel has gone drastically downhill. It is no longer the fabulous bakery it once was. I wish I could chalk this up to an "off day", but my last few purchases have been barely edible. Stale, over baked, hard, or flavorless.. did I mention STALE? Don't bother wasting your money or calories, you will probably wind up disappointed.

This place is garbage.  The food is awful. I think its the First Chinese restaurant I've ever been to that doesn't provide steamed rice with its entrees.  Worst beef with broccoli and sesame chicken I've had in memory. Beef is somehow hard and chewy at the same time.

I drop in here from time to time to look at clearance items, especially food and kitchen gadgets. The last time I was here, I spent exactly $1 for a container of yerba mate tea on clearance. Most of the store is full of kitschy home decorations that don't appeal to me; besides, my small condo is too cluttered already. I wouldn't make a special trip to shop here, but I can walk here from Sprouts, where I do my weekly grocery shopping. So I drop in now and then; sometimes I don't buy anything, but sometimes I find something I can use at a good price.

I realize this is a very busy location but the mistakes that have occurred at this point are a concerning issue. I need to check my bag every time I leave and i regret it if I don't like tonight. When I paid for a whole sandwich, didn't check and walked out with a half. I didn't know until I got home so I am not going back.

两星纯粹是给味道，可以称之为SB地区最正宗的中餐馆。扣的三星完全是因为服务态度。桌子不擦，上菜不给餐具，问完我们喝什么又不上。这些都不是大碍，人手不足我们提醒一下都可以解决。但是最后我说分卡结账，你白我一眼是什么意思啊？要求很过分吗？

只推荐打包或外卖，在店内用餐体验极差。

Great taste, terrible service.

Absolutely horrible from the first moment we entered the door!! The first indicator of the poor quality should have been that there were very few people there at 8pm on a Saturday night. We were there on 05/26/18-first the service was the worst I have experienced in my life. The waitress approached our table after we had been seated for about 15 minutes. Then we got our drinks from someone else. Our waitress finally returned 20 minutes later to take our order. Finally 45 minutes later we got our food which was just as horrible. My oldest daughter ordered hot wings that were burnt-fear of not eating anything if she sent them back we just ate what we had been served. The manager was at the kitchen door and was fully aware of what was occurring in his restaurant so I figured there was no need to complain. I was very disappointed for my children because they had never had a Hard Rock experience and their first will be their last!

What happened?

I was worried we wouldn't get seated for Friday happy hour but was wrong. Place was empty. They totally changed the menu not for the best.  The drinks were still fine but food was less than to be desired. Our flatbread seemed to be store bought with tomatoe sauce on it.  The veggie board was ok.

If I could choose zero star I would. Terrible..this was by far the worst dining experience I've ever had. Terrible, terrible customer experience. 4 people- 3 adults 1 child. Child orders chicken fingers and fries from child's menu. Waitress charges a la carte for chicken fingers, fries and apple juice after child orders from child's menu. Asked waitress why and she said she didn't realize he ordered off the child menu and then got the manager. Manager told us we were wrong and couldn't take the charges off the bill. Asked for General Manager. General Manager pacifies us, charges us only for chicken fingers and takes off from bill the apple juice and fries. As we walked out, the General Manager takes from us our "to go" container of the left over (2) chicken fingers just to spite us. Unbelievable that a professional in the food and beverage industry thinks this behavior benefits his business or makes his customers feel welcome. I do not recommend this diner to anyone. Will never go back. I recommend Pandora or Red Lion diner instead which are just a few minutes away from this place instead.

Its a very cute place but I wouldn't go back. I got a manicure... paid for a manicure that I could have done myself. The manicurist was very nice but oddly took a FaceTime call will working on my nails. I was in the neighborhood and thought I would try it....oh well.

I contacted them on a Saturday around noon and asked if they still have a Jeep they have advertised online. They tell me they do and to come in for a test drive. When I arrived a few hours later, after searching both of their lots for over an hour, they tell me they no longer have the vehicle. They told me they sold it the day before. I get zero apologizes. Awful. They proceed to try and sell me other more expensive models that aren't even the color I asked for several times. They do not listen to what the customers want, they just try to sell the jeeps they can't move.
