Their pricing includes incentives that you most likely won't qualify for unless you're a disabled vet that received a mailer from them. They make sure they word their listing to think you're getting all of the incentives on top of the internet price. They don't even put an asterisk on the discounts. I spent several hours getting the runaround. I've been in Sales for over 20 years and I get the car salesman shtick but these guys we're shady as it gets. They had all three levels of their management come over and it got worse as it went up the ladder. I went to another dealer and bought a Jeep under an hour. They were upfront and honest and really honest (Carman Jeep, New Castle, DE). I received a nicer Jeep and actually got the price they advertised. Imagine that. Thanks, Cherry Hill Jeep for your crappy service! I would have never bought this better Jeep if you guys weren't so incompetent. Sales 101: Listen to your customers. If you don't, you lose their trust and then their business. Also, once you start lying about the sales price, you become the stereotype you try to avoid.

Summary, too expensive for mediocre food. 

Word of warning, pass on the "Chinese Pizza" aka what they call their scallion pancakes. Dough was very thick and overfried. Also the hot and sour soup was bland and was thickened with too much cornstarch.

We got two entrees, both specials. I got spicy chicken, shrimp and beef dish and it was cooked pretty well but the flavor was average. She ordered breaded shrimp and scallops. The breading was surprisingly hard instead of crispy. The snows peas were good.

Waitress was nice and attentive no issues there.

Overall better food can be had at almost any other non fast food Chinese restaurant. Food here was flavorless and forgettable.

Man is this joint in need of a remodel!!!  After parking, walked up to just a tired door. Rust where metal meets walls. UGH. Inside, again, just tired. But I was there for breakfast so we'll overlook the appearance. 
The wait staff was very pleasant and attentive. Coffee was offered immediately and delivered.  Waffle, two eggs scrambled and sausage.  I can't say a thing bad about the meal, I just can't say any good either. 
Ruby's is the definition of acceptable.  There are way better breakfast options in the area and I'm pretty sure I'll be making choices other than Ruby's.

Waited 20 minutes at a table for someone to take my drink order.  Spoke to Asst. GM Omar and he took the drink order.  35 minutes later, still no drinks.  Now have been waiting for same Asst. GM for 20 minutes.  Where is D&B Corporate to replace the awful management at this location?

The restaurant is decor is nice, the space is big. It was EMPTY, and I wondered why. I order a breakfast sandwich ..and it was almost 6$. It was very BURNT. Not worth it 
They should spend less time on how the restaurant looks and more on the actual food.

So the good part is the burger was great. A bit overpriced ($18) but very good none the less. Everything else at this newer restaurant was a hot mess!!  Many of the staff are new -- ok -- train them -- no one could explain the Tuesday Night specials -- basically a sign on the table stating $4 craft beers  -- which was completely different than the other sign that talks about happy hour from 4-7 -- so, craft beer (as generally defined as Not Budweiser) is loosely defined by the bartender as Local only -- so the "craft beer" brewed in the next town over didn't qualify??  WTF. Another waitress told us everything under $6 (so only 4 of the 20+ draft choices) and another told us all the drafts were essentially half price?

I'll be shocked to see this place still in business in 6 months!!  Unless, of course, they have a celebrity rescue from Jon Taffer or maybe Robert Irvine?!!
Had to take my boot back three times for the same issue. They said they fixed the zipper and finally on the third time back, they fixed it. Frustrating to say the least!

This subway needs to switch being the 24/7 subway with the one on N. Hills Blvd. At least the one on N. Hills Blvd is stocked and the owner is very present and welcoming there. 4th time here tonight and this location fails to keep stock. Do the area a favor and stop being the 24/7 subway.

Sold this business a 2014 paid off Subaru with 0 miles for little of nothing and bought a Volvo S40 2006 for $12,000 and the Volvo is a pile of crap and they will not help out one bit. I've driven the Volvo less than 10000 miles and I'm already $3,000 in maintenance and it is currently at the shop broken down with a potential bad cylinder. CarMax will not help out whatsoever. I talked to Greg their general manager and he told me to come in and he'll sell me another car. Screw these people.

Service is terrible.  They got my order wrong and I caught it and told me that I ordered it wrong.  Then when asking to refund the difference they gave me less then what I was owed and argued with me that I was wrong.  Finally after the manager decided to ring it up on the computer she realized I was right.  Both the cashier and the manager were very rude.  I also witnessed the cashier argue with another guest saying that they didn't tell her he wanted something.  Clearly they do not have any desire to provide excellent costumer service.  From what I see it starts with the management.

Food is okay. But there were gnats that kept landing in our food. When we notified the waitstaff, she just said, "Yes, we have a bug problem right now. All I can do is give you another plate to cover your food."

Just had our family Holiday Party at Farotto's. The size of our space great, the food great, the location disappointing!! We were in the bottom room, basically enclosed in plastic, one heater & I am here to tell you it was miserable!!! We were so cold many of us had to keep our coats on!! My cousin was wearing her gloves!!! I would invite Mr. Farotto to bring his family to that room & have dinner.....I doubt he would find it acceptable. It is a shame more heaters weren't available. If you want to keep cashing in on that space it is only right you make it more habitable.....
Zero star s. There web site *s false. Go and ask rates quoted on web site and was refuse.

My wife and I just moved to the safety Harbor area, saw an advertisement for Carmel restaurant and ordered a to go order. I ordered the short ribs. I ordered the large order which was over $18 and below you can see the photograph of three pieces of what tasted like pot roast. Certainly was not worth $18. My wife ordered the veggie rice bowl which turned out to be $13 of sparse vegetables and certainly nothing special. We were very disappointed in the quality and cost of the food.

So I'll just give my experience after one full year at Tropicana Gardens. The food lives up to the hype of being complete garbage. It lacks flavor and usually leaves your plate covered in grease. Each suite comes with a huge industrial trash can to make sure your living room smells like trash 24/7. So whoever's idea that was, I thank you. You may be lucky enough to get a room with a brand new flat screen tv and new leather couch, or you may pick a room that has yet to be updated and has a smelly couch with an older, less modern television set. The carpeting in all the suites is old, stained, and in certain areas smelly. If you're looking for college housing, I warn you to please turn away from this place. It is unclean and feels like a daycare center. There are plenty more options available at a way better value.

I've had my fair share of flight delays and "bad" customer service.... but this is, by far, takes the cake as the worst airport/airline experience I have EVER had. I've always heard mixed (mostly negative) reviews from people, but my friends and I hoped to be one of the happier stories. Let's start right at the beginning at the time of booking. When I booked my flight, Spirit charged me $15 extra for my check-in luggage. The customer service representative was very helpful, which is the only reason why Spirit Airlines deserves, at most, a 1 star.

We were on a 5:30am flight from New Orleans (LA) to New York City (NY) with a stopover in Fort Lauderdale (FL). One hour after our scheduled takeoff, we had to evacuate the plane due to an unknown issue with the plane and no clear updates until the evacuation. 

Connecting flights had to get rescheduled with only ONE gate agent to assist the passengers, so we sat near our gate to let the people with earlier connecting flights get assisted first. Nearing 9:30am (4 hours after our scheduled departure), my friends and I got on line to change our connecting flight from Fort Lauderdale to New York. The line was just as long as it was when we first got off the plane, so we decided to head out to the main desk (where check-in bags get dropped off) for assistance since there were more staff around. The staff could not look like they disliked their job more than they did this day. There was no sense of urgency to take care of the passengers. One friend was told she could ONLY get a refund for this flight and was never offered the option to have her flight rescheduled until after she already signed for the refund. At that point, it was too late and she had to look for an entirely new flight home. My other friend and I got our flights rescheduled, but the process was a mess. We were told to wait 20 minutes to hear from the supervisor... but didn't hear anything until 3 hours later. Every time my friend asked for updates, she was just given an annoyed look. While she waited for updates on our new flights, I was told to get my bag from the baggage claim since the connecting flight was going to be on a different airline. For the 3 hours I waited, I was told a bunch of excuses as to why my bag wasn't on the carousel.

When we finally heard updates on our flight, the Spirit staff member said we had to board IMMEDIATELY (as if there was no such thing as security) or else we'd miss the flight. After much frustration, I made sure the baggage claim attendant would have my bag sent directly to my house and ran to my friends. Luckily, I got through security quickly and was able to make it to the gate and on the plane. My friend almost missed the flight, but I explained the situation to the flight attendant and we were able to get her onboard.

In the end, I left New Orleans with only 1 friend and my carry-on. We got placed on different flights from Fort Lauderdale to New York, so we all made it to back at different times and at least 8 hours later than we were supposed to. Save yourself the headache and frustration. Book your flight with a more reliable airline. It'll be worth the money.

I refuse to believe the favorable reviews of this place are for real.  We moved here to Bristol almost a year ago from Bensalem where Apollo's was our "go to" place for the most largest mouthwatering 1/4 lb. cheese steak that offered the BEST for so much less in cost.  After 3 trips to Zio's we've decided it's much more worth the trip to go back to the best cheese steaks around (even Geno's & Pat's Steaks can't compare to Apollo's).  
Zio's charges $10.00 per steak sandwich offering nothing but a few slices of steak and cheese.  The roll is very slim which cuts back even more of the quality of the sandwich.  If you've never tried Apollo's do yourself a BIG favor and you'll discover the BIG difference in quality and price.  Zio's is more interested in the fanciness of the packaging and the printed labels on the egg-carton box that's much more appealing than their product.

The pizza is good most of the time, you have to call ahead and pick it up if you want it warm otherwise it's delivered almost cold and the delivery time is too long. Pizzas have gotten much smaller and more expensive, I've been going elsewhere!

Do not trust this company. Communication was poor throughout my experience. Questionable charging/quoting practices. Not actually sure if they really did anything, or just took the money and sent me pictures of a disassembled drive.

Sent a solid state drive in that was no longer detected by BIOS. They asked for $1600 up front, then $100 after the repair was done. I was able to "talk them down" (although I think they just grossly over-quoted to make me think I was getting a good deal) to $800 up front.

After I sent my drive in, they performed "diagnostics" and said there was a 90% data recovery chance. After some time, they said they had to perform more advanced methods and that this method (something about connecting the drive to some board they have) had an 80% chance of data recovery.

I received zero updates over a period of a month. I had to keep asking for status updates. Once I finally got a response, it was an email with pictures of the drive taken apart, a vague description (PDF report) of what was done to the drive, and a "Sorry, we couldn't do anything".

Following this, I asked for some sort of refund on good faith. In their agreement, there is a line stating that they can refund partial or whole amounts at their discretion. I thought since they did not actually do anything for me, this would be no problem at least getting something back (I was willing to take the new hard drive they would have sent with my recovered data and be ok). That was not the case. After being instructed to fill out a "formal complaint", I was told I would have a response in 5-14 business days. Nearly three weeks later, I emailed the person who sent me the link to the "formal request" for an update. 5 days later, I finally received a response. 

The response essentially said "We did what we were obligated to do". No hope of any good faith with customers there.

2:24pm Saturday 8/25/2018
Drive thur employee rude... taking my order, also arguing with Co workers.  Get to the window, next female employee (unknown if it was the same employee that took my initial order) she was on her phone gave me a look as if I was bothering her. 
2nd window...Order was incorrect, when corrected employee at the 2nd window becomes defensive stating, that's not what you ordered." Showed him receipt... turned and walked away, returned with correct order.  
It's sad when I am cordial because I know how it can be "working" but they still want to be RUDE. 

Rosemont Parent, trying to support surrounding restaurants.
Service at the bar was horrible, all the food is oversalted to the point that it's not edible. Many other choices in downtown that rank five stars

They have great new seats but they are so small
And tight my leg keeps pressing the buttons.  Each seat has 1 drink cup holder.  Ok but where and I supposed to put my close captioning device? The ones you offer ONLY go in the cup holder.  

Will not be back to this place anytime soon.

Unorganized. I have been three times and have been called multiple times to reschedule my appointment due to them running behind, only to comply and then get to the business to continue to wait. Trying to get seen here is an all day affair, I will not waste anymore off days trying to get an appointment. The organic theme held my interest although I'm not sure that they are actually organic. Saying that they are organic is all that they have going for themselves. Technicians are not that fantastic either, don't waste your time. Go elsewhere.

This place is horrible! It used to be a good place to eat, where customers were priority. The staff acted like we were an inconvenience. The new owners seem to be non-existent. They have run it into the ground. They might as well close the doors. The restaurant was filthy, they were out of food for lunch and they're not offering ice cream anymore. Don't waste your time or money eating here. There are much better options! The picture is showing mold in the drink machine.

All advertising, web, online, and front door say "Walk-Ins Welcome." NOT TRUE.  4pm and I was turned anyway as a walk-in   Maybe it's discrimination since all techs are female and I am a male. 
Makes one wonder.......

Good food and service. Hate the idea that you can have a straw in a beverage. If you have tooth sensitivity your screwed. They claim it is to protect the environment. Ok that's fine just provide paper straws. Oh question what they cost too much. Screw the customer for the environment.

First time: my stomach was in shambles afterwards. Shambles!

Second time: it smelled like sewerage (employees confirmed its been an ongoing issue) and I never did receive my refill. 

 Next time: there won't be a next time!

Disgusting and rude staff. First off, when a customer questions about if this is correct, don't have the person helping us to give us attitude. Secondly, the Turkey? DISGUSTING! It was not fresh and aren't y'all supposed to be "Fresh"? Never again am I coming to this place or Panera!!!!

The door they installed is good quality - it was pricey and took over the two months originally quoted even with a very early design change.  However, I asked for a re-key before I signed the contract and paid half the amount, and they didn't include it in the price.  Despite spending thousands on the door, they refused to honor a small re-key fee.  Their lack of customer service on this issue and repeated comments on how they didn't care about any referrals I would've sent their way really shows the true character of this company.  Watch out for bad customer service and refusal to acknowledge any issues on their end.

Got a burger and fries. Burger tasted too processed. Signs around restaurant indicate hand made burgers. They weren't. Good portion size and nicely presented on a steel basket.  Ordered iced tea and it isn't fresh brewed, just junk out of a 'gold peak' dispenser from concentrate.  Overall, since the food and drink isn't good, I won't be back. The inside of restaurant doesn't look clean. It looks like it is run like a small family business and they aren't keeping up with modern burger places.

I came here because I heard this was a great place. I have been reluctant to cut my hair with anyone other than my regular stylist but unfortunately I really needed a cut and she lives in Maryland. 
My appointment started out good but I was not happy with the end result. My stylist was running behind so he was trying to finish the client before me while he worked on me. Towards the end of the cut, he had to finish the other client's hair so he rushed to finish mine. He then passed me off to the apprentice, after asking if she even knew how to diffuse hair. He did not even check to see if my cut was even all around before she began blowing it out. It was my first time getting my hair diffused so I'm not sure if she did a bad job or diffusing just doesn't work for my curl pattern because my hair looked awful. He tried to fix it after I gave my honest opinion but really made it worst. When I got home I notice that my hair was longer on one side than the other. 
I would've had a much better experience if my cut had not been so rushed. It also made me uncomfortable that he would ask the apprentice if she knew how to do something before telling her to do it on me. I specifically didn't choose to get my appointment done with an apprentice because I wanted someone who had experience, especially because I have curly hair. Everyone was very nice but because of my overall experience, I will not be choosing tribeca again.

Went in with some friends after the oilers game and wasn't the best experience. Surprisingly, usually good service at this Franchise, but this time, no. Waitress was a total bitch and complained about the tip. That it wasn't enough. And that was after bringing the guys multiple shots every 5 minutes. Food was decent, but had to ask for ketchup 3 times.

Went here for lunch- when we first arrived, they could not seem to figure out who was going to be our server. It took an hour to get our food (it was clear they forgot to put in our order). The manager gave us a dismissive apology and offered us a coupon for the next time we come in, but at this point that's useless because I don't think I'll be coming back. Finally got our food and both my friends' avocado toast looked awful- the avocados were black. The people around us appeared to be having a similar experience, as many of them sent back dishes and complained of a long wait. Also the bathrooms were DISGUSTING. Will not be returning, absolutely abysmal service and basically zero compensation for the wait or the bad food.

Why one star? Mostly because I do not have the option to leave zero stars. I go to a coffee shop located inside of this apartment complex and I park in the same spot every time I go. I am a consistent customer to the shop and no stranger to the parking at Lark. I came out of the coffee shop this evening as I always do and my car was towed. There is no lawful reason as to why this happened. As a student I am disgusted that this residential housing complex is partnering with local towing companies to make money off of students who are parking to study at the coffee shop. I have never given any company a one star rating on yelp and today I make the exception. The feeling of walking outside and my vehicle being gone from a parking lot that I park at weekly is disturbing. Students should not have to worry about this unjust practice. I called the tow company and I was told that I didn't have a residential parking permit. I don't have a residential parking permit because I am not a resident, but I am a paying customer of the shop and I have parked in that exact spot and parking garage weekly since the semester started.  Shady business and you all are profiting off of hard working college students. This company is a disgrace.

Horrible! Absolutely Horrible!  Mark at 30th Street Station should be fired .  I was insulted by his actions .  Rene' in the 30th Street station LAZY, and poor Customer Service.  She will never add anything but problems for Amtrak.

The staff are racist jerks and don't spend the time to explain to new-comers what the different items are. I have witnessed this at least 3 times. This is a shame because the food is generally good and hot, but there is too many other establishments with better customer service. I'm sure they'll survive with their regulars though.

Boils down to this...Atmosphere - 10, Food - 3, Service - 2.
Waited 10 min sitting at the bar to get acknowledged by the bartender.  She was too busy replacing napkins and straws (no barback).
Ordered Coconut Crusted Mahi, when it arrived, it looked good, but after one bite, I knew the fish was not fresh.  It tasted old and fishy.
Hopefully this was due to new staff and still getting things smoothed out.   I'll wait a few months before going back.

Update, went back, even worse.   Sat at the bar, ordered mojitos, bartender was obviously out of his element.   The mojitos were flat (because he added the soda and then shook them).  When asked about it, he didn't even offer to make new ones, just told us that he makes them with sprite and club soda.  I didn't want a drink that sweet, just make it the right way.  I will not be going back here EVER!    Too bad too, as it's a nice building with a nice view.

They had issues with several things in trying to get a to-go order. Soft tacos were soggy and falling apart when I got them home as they did not do as I requested by separating hot/cold and wet/dry items on the side. The owner did reciprocate with a free meal which I had in-house. It was a very different presentation than the same order I had made to go. They have a lot of consistency issues to iron out.

Now it is several hours later. Learned that the "Free" replacement meal came with "Free" diarrhea.
Call get put on hold for 20 minutes. Then told they were closed. It was 11pm they said closed at 12am. Rude people pretty sketch not ever calling again.  Management is terrible clearly

The worst experience I have ever had in a restaurant! I am not one to complain, as this is actually the first negative review I have ever publicly given an establishment. I have heard nothing but great things about the food. However the man behind the bar who says he is the owner is an arrogant, rude individual that prevented me from tasting the food. I was going here for a business lunch when I walked in after 1 pm doing the week, there was a total of 5 tables in the main dining room. I asked for a table for two, they directed me to a corner table between two other tables against the wall. I kindly asked for another table as this would not accommodate us. The lady who I assume worked there said oh well you can take that one, the man behind the bar interjected no that's a four top. She then stated well you can just pull them apart. He told her no no I can't do that you can sit at the bar or in the corner otherwise, I can't accommodate you. Mind you there were like 5 or 6 tables still available in the main dining room, and no one at the bar. She walked off and I did too!!! I called later and asked for the general
Manger but I got the same guy. When I asked to speak with someone else, he said why? I responded because I need help and you are unable to do that. He responded well we are on the same page I can't help you and you can't help me and proceeded to hang up in my face. I will never step foot in this establishment again, although I'm sure this arrogant man would care less!! If I could give them 0 stars that would still be to much!!!

I've come here numerous times, and always had a good steak and friendly atmosphere. But It's been in a decline, and Saturday we decided we need to find another steak place. 

We went out for a celebration. The waitress was in a foul mood, and we let it slide; why let someone having a bad day ruin ours? However, my wife ordered a filet mignon cooked medium. What she received looked like a thin ribeye cooked rare. We explained our concern, and the waitress argued it was a filet mignon, and she would take it back. She returned a few minutes later with the original meat pounded flat, deep brown, and dried. It was tough, and tasted of grease.  I believe the put a $26 steak in the fry basket! We asked nicely to see a manager, and "Kathy" didn't offer to fix it, she just brought us our bill with the "filet" off and my meal 50% - I guess we were done. It's too bad they had to lose my long term business.

Overpriced ... 
plenty of nice places to stay other than here.
Stay downtown is my advice... more entertainment and everything is within walking distance

Only giving this two stars because the guacamole was good and the waitress was nice. We started off by ordering queso. When that came out, it was literally a ball of melted mozzarella in a bowl. We also ordered two quesadillas. Those were dry and didn't have much flavor as we would have expected. Another one of us ordered a taco and a tostado. Those were both flavorless and had a very small amount of meat and toppings in them. In the grand scheme of things, Taco Bell would have been much better. I wouldn't recommend unless you want boring, tasteless food.

So I came here today with an issue with my BMW knowing what the issue was just to see what they would say. I heard the techs talking about my car and sayin there was nothing wrong with the brakes. I needed a control arm which at BMW is $167. They wanna charge me $576. I got the report back and they total out everything at $1,700+. All of a sudden my rotors, pads, and sensors need to be changed. I left BMW with a full service, brakes, oil, transmission, and tuneup about two weeks ago. They also said I need new tires, which I have fairly new ones now with about 7k miles on them. I must've looked like an idiot, so now I'm returning the favor.

What a SCAM of a "business." DONT DO IT!!! About a month after ordering $80 worth of cigars we decided to order again. As I'm on the phone about a question I'm told I need to go through "age verification" because it's my first time ordering. Well if you read the above correctly you'll see that I in fact ordered one time before without this mythical "age verification." I agreed to go through "age verification" and that consisted of the very confused sounding customer service agent reading my address back to me. 

Not 3 hours later customer service calls back and tries to essentially trick me into buying a monthly box of cigars. They made it seem like something was wrong with my current order, asked me what type of cigars I liked and not 5 seconds later I was told it would be like $180 a month. The audacity!!! If I see 1 penny on my credit card bill from them that I did not authorize, they better pray they got some good lawyers on hand.

These types of people are what's wrong with this country. Tricking and scamming people into buying your product because you can't sell without it. I'm thoroughly disgusted and I wholeheartedly regret sending my money to you in the first place. When every response to a negative yelp review is "we apologize for the inconvenience we've caused you" you might want to rethink your business practices. 

I will NEVER ever ever buy cigars and accessories from here ever again and I urge you to do the same. Find somewhere reputable, because this is not it.

Not only did the busgirl/hostess take my wine away when it still had a sip or two in it, but out of the 4 things we ordered, I would say 1 had flavor - the lamb meatballs. The "crispy" gnocchi was soggy and resembled canned pork & beans. The spaghetti was slightly over cooked and lacking in taste, I actually left half behind which I never do with pasta. The grilled asparagus had to have been frozen. Possibly the kind from Trader Joe's that comes with grill marks already on it. I wanted to like this place because the location is great and the building is beautiful. But it just missed the mark for me.

I've driven by Uzbekistan countless times and I was excited to finally try it out. So disappointing. It's amazing how much bad service can affect your meal. I came with my parents and my brother on a Sunday night and we walked in and were seated pretty quickly but promptly forgot about. Ten minutes passed before someone came by and brought empty glasses - no water. Another five minutes passed before a water pitcher was placed at the end of the table. 

Ten more minutes go by and we are ready to walk out of the door in search of another restaurant when someone finally comes to take our orders. We asked for wine glasses for the wine we brought (its a BYO restaurant) and it took us asking three times to finally get some. 

The food came quickly enough, and it's unfortunate because if it weren't for the bad service, I would probably have given this place 4 stars.

Very disappointing experience. I had high expectations going in here. Upon entering, the restaurant itself is very cramped and claustrophobic. After waiting over 20 minutes to get sat, with empty tables available, my party of 3 finally got a table right in front of the door, with foot traffic everywhere. Our server, Joeswell (not entirely sure if the spelling is correct), was not helpful at all, lacked personality, and that seemed to be the theme with the entire staff. Every employee seemed robotic and unnatural in the way they spoke to other guests as well. The only thing that was halfway decent was the lemonade. Would not recommend.

Do yourself a favor and find another company to work with!
I can not even begin to explain how terrible of a company and how awful my company's experience has been with Hibu. When we working together they were displaying pictures one of our services with descriptions of other services we offer. When I called them out on it, it tooks WEEKS for them to fix it.
I managed to get through the 6 months of our contract before canceling. However, the canceling process has been an absolutely nightmare. It took 4 calls just to get someone to agree to "start the process" and even longer to complete the process. This delay of course made them attempt to charge me for another month of service. They are a flat out bad company that offers terrible service with worse support.

Ate here a recently, place is having sewage problems or something. It smelled so bad, and it was trying to be covered by cleaning chemicals. My guess is this restaurant should be torn down and built again. 

I'd recommend they exit this location it's going to ruin the brand and reputation Jack's has built. My food was okay but I would never go here again or even consider taking food to go. 

If youre worried about the money to destroy and rebuild a nice grease fire in the kitchen after everyone leaves would work!

We had been planning our visit to Adele's for a very long time. As admirers of Jonathan Waxman, we had always wanted to see if his represented restaurant lived up to his stellar reputation. 

Of course, you should order the chicken and potatoes for which he is famous. The potatoes were amazingly crisp outside, soft and creamy inside and loaded with balanced flavor.

All the times I've seen Mr. Waxman make the chicken on shows or at cooking events, there is a simple adornment of salt, pepper, lemon and herbs with the chicken. Then the herb topping I've always seen made with anchovies, capers, lemon juice seasoning - along with the herbs and olive oil. The plating has always shown a grilled lemon served along side the chicken. 

Not only was there no lemon served on the side, but I'd be hard to convince any capers and anchovies made it anywhere near the herbs used for the chicken topping, let alone seasoning. The green herb topping tasted like flat leaf parsley with olive oil. The taste was beyond bland and disappointing from what the list of ingredients should bring it to be.

The chicken itself was mealy in an overcooked style and seemed to have that odd texture brined chicken takes on, which is loathsome.

The bread and olives brought to the table was so good. We were sure the rest of the meal to follow would be everything we had built this adventure up to be. Sadly, not so much. 

Service was impeccable and the attendant was able to see that in the gratuity. Service saved this from a one star rating.

Maybe it was an off day on a not too busy Saturday but it wasn't their best day for sure.

I've shopped a lot of GC in the past and this one wasn't good. None of the drums were tuned. There were pedals all over the floor. Total trip hazard. Box of drum accessories just sitting in an aisle. No one asked if I needed help. 5 employees standing around acting like they were too cool for school. No clue how this store stays open. Very disappointing

The casino and hotel are actually lovely but the Lux Nightclub is a rip off. We are older women and not really into the club scene anymore but wanted to go and see Snoop Dogg perform. The tickets were $50 each. We asked the front desk and numerous people when Snoop was going on stage, and no one could give us a straight answer. Now we know why. We waited until about 12:30 AM and no Snoop Dogg. Just a DJ who at 11:30 PM said Snoop was on his way. Total rip off, waste of money, and false advertising.

I so wanted to like this place it has all the elements that one would want when dining. Tuscany café is convenient because it's local, serves a variety of food. the prices seem to be fair, the ambience is great, the service is friendly and it is has a relaxing decor vibe. But it just wasn't meant to be. After navigating the horrendous parking situation I was acknowledge and seated  immediately. My server was very nice although she did not give me her name but immediately bought a nice plate of homemade pastries that was very tasty. Of course the La Columbe coffee they severed was delicious. But it was downhill from there the pancakes they serve were like three biscuit frisbees, The bacon was thin sparse and almost translucent meaning mostly fat some cheap brand. The home fries look like a baked potato cut in chunks and thrown on a plate, The scramble eggs we're average nothing negative or positive there. Everything outside of the pancakes were cold, not room temperature, not lukewarm, cold!

In my estimation they take shortcuts and use inferior products the bacon served look like something purchased at a Save a Lot or Aldi's!

5 for ambience Starbucks meets lounge decor
1 for parking as it's the absolute worst
4 for service, my server was very friendly and they were prompt 
1 for food and it was served cold and very small portions

I have fond memories of Pizza Hut from when I was a kid, many years ago. It was a favorite spot for after a little league game, and I always loved the free personal pan pizzas from the Book It program at school. Well, those days are LONG GONE. Decided to give it another shot for old times sake and boy has this franchise gone downhill! Delivery was at least a half-hour late. I could already see where this was going. When the pizza finally arrived the quality was just shit. The "breadsticks" consisted of one mass of over-seasoned bread, barely perforated and had to be ripped apart to get an actual stick. Bland, soggy crust. Minimal toppings and a boring sauce sealed the deal for me. Worst $25 I've spent in a long time. I mean, it REALLY sucked. There so many other pizza places out there that are so much better. Amazes me how this company is still in existence.

This was our first time here. We had our drink order taken and were told our server would be right with us. We waited 15 minutes without having our order taken while literally every other table was attended to. Waited another 5 trying to justify the lack of service but decided 20 minutes was pretty ridiculous. I don't really enjoy spending money at places i have to request to be acknowledged. Bummed because we were actually excited to try this place. Oh well.

Came here on a Monday morning just as the cafeteria was opening. We sat down to eat when we noticed that the floor and tables around us were filthy. There was food all over the floor. We grabbed a high chair, which was also really dirty.  

We were literally the first people inside the cafeteria that morning  - shouldn't everything have been cleaned the night before or prior to opening? Shouldn't a cafeteria be cleaned daily, at minimum? I'm not a neat freak by any means, but I got grossed out by this experience.

Our salesperson Charles was REALLY nice, HE does NOT get the "1 star" review, however Eian and Thad are VERY deserving of the "1 star" review.  Upon coming back in for our 2nd visit to actually purchase the mattress we really feel in love with, Charles was off so Eian, the store manager, helped us.  Wish seemed nice enough and walked us through everything and writting up the sale.  When we got to the part for the free delivery, my wife and I BOTH made it VERY clear that we wanted our delivery to happen on a SATURDAY.  Eian told us that we couldn't do this Saturday and we we would have to wait until the following week in order to get a SATURDAY delivery, so we said we could wait the couple of weeks and we PAID IN FULL for our mattress and "NEEDED" mattress cover.  Well we are ALMOST at our exciting Saturday when I get a call to let us know that we are actually set up for a FRIDAY delivery...ummm, my wife and I work full time and waited an extra week so we could have a SATURDAY delivery.  Well it turns out that they "NEVER deliver to our area on Saturdays and we must have been mistaken because your delivery on your receipt shows for Friday the 23rd."  Ummm, I guess we should have looked at a calendar, but we took it for granted that when we asked FOR A SATURDAY that the STORE MANAGER would have given us a date for A SATURDAY, NOT A FRIDAY.  Anyway, after have a rather poor experience at another St. Louis mattress shop, Mattress Direct, and let our sales person Charles know AND the store manager Eian know, they STILL can't fess up to their mistake.  When I called and talked to Thad, the GENERAL MANAGER, he gave us options of: having it delivered on Friday  (told us to get a friend or family member to watch our house), pick it up ourselves at another location, OR he could have it delivered to us NEXT Saturday(hmmmm, he told us that they NEVER deliver to our area on Saturdays).  At which point I responded and told Thad that we would be happy to take delivery on Friday IF we could get someone to watch our house and we would like a set of Bamboo sheets as compensation...."Yeah, I am not gonna do that, we aren't allowed to do that, and your ticket says delivery for Friday, soooo."  Evidently customer service is NOT something Slumberland, Eian, OR THAD are able to provide...do whatever it takes to get our money, but not do what it takes to take care of the customer...their corporate customer service is a joke too...

When walked in, was immediately hit with smell of bad frying oil. Almost just turned around and left. But, might as well try. French toast donut cooked to death. Grease bottom. Very dry. That one needs improvement. Samoa donut actually good. Good donut flavor and consistency. Captain Crunch was ok. Cereal was stale, but donut had ok flavor . Icing good on all 3 donuts. Maybe they are still working out the kinks. They are still a new business. Will try again in a few months to give them a chance to consistently put out good tasty product.

This has to be the worst service I've received or attempted to receive from Jersey Mike's Sub. My friend and I went in there today around 1 pm for sandwiches. When we walked in there was no one behind the counter. There was a gentleman ahead of us waiting as well. We waited for about 5 minutes and no one came out. When we yelled in the back eventually 2 people surfaced then about 3 more came from the back. A girl came out and said they were in a meeting. I said that no one has been out here and anyone could have come in and taken stuff. She said 'that's okay we have cameras.' I then said we'll you lost a couple of customers bc they walked out. She said "yeah that's okay we don't care." She was very rude and assume she must have been the shift manager. I told her she is losing 2 more customers and we left and went to Zoup. Funny bc the people who left Jersey Mike's were in Zoup complaining how bad the service is which of course they love to hear. More business for them! 
What a shame this location has such poor customer service. It seems management for this location does not care given their poor ratings!

Decent job with grooming.  Does not honor their veteran discount. $5 off a service is not what you get. Bring in a dog a day you get $5 off each day/service. Bring in three dogs for three grooming on one day, still only get $5 off.  Also pricing is inconsistent, honored quoted price only after insisting.

The only reason there is a star is because it made me click on one in order to post review.  I was disappointed by the service this morning. It was my first and last attempt to patronize your business. I made an appointment on your website for 11:00 a.m. Saturday, August 25.  I was 10 minutes early. I sat there till 11:10 then I asked the lady at the desk when I would be seen, she said she didn't know and that she thought someone was ahead of me. I kindly told her that it was rude to have me wait and then not have any advice as to when I would be seen. So I left. You probably need to consider a different way of treating your customers.

Been a few years since I've been to an Arby's. It's also my last time I will go in a long time once again. Saw the advertisement for the new bourbon chicken sandwich that looked really good but what i actually got was a total disappointment and horse shit! I'm attaching a pic of what they show you the sandwich is. Also a pic of the shit they served me. Dried up thin piece of chicken and dried up cheese, 1......just 1 fucking strip of bacon ripped in half and a few onion straws. Waste of $6 and I will be contacting Arby's corporate with pics about this crap that was served to me and total false advertisement.

Wow! Just like the one in Vista, no wonder they're both empty! Their prices are RIDOCULOUS! I'd be willing to pay dollar or two higher than the NATIONALLY ADVERTISED prices of sandwiches, but seriously $8 freaking dollars for a Subway kids meal?!?! I could get a sit-down causal dining meal for my kids for $8!!!

The problem with these sort of places is they do not understand that customer service is vitally important to retaining customers. Today was my first time eating at this place. The place was small, and the food was unexceptional, average at best. As I was leaving, I handed my cup to the manager, and she threw it away, which was an honest mistake. However, I informed her that I wanted a refill of my beverage; she simply looked at me and shrugged as if to say too f$&#ing bad.
Typical franchise pizza controlled mediocrity at the peak of true mediocrity !  Nothing special nothing to rave about just mediocre! Sorry can't say more than that !
I'm not sure what to say!! Maybe I need to give them another try!!! I want to like them!! Food is salty! This food is not good for people with heart troubles!!!

Pizza was dried and over cooked. Called up to tell them, management was rude and put the cook on, he said"I personally cooked that and it good, why are you complaining for!" Very rude, won't ever go back.
Worst crawfish I've ever had. Small overcooked and not seasoned. Save your money and try a different spot.

I have been to the Lake Saint Louis Dobbs many times over the years and I completely understand that this is just a tire place (I would never recommend a more serious repair).  I just bought 4 top of the line Michelin's for our Yukon before heading to Colorado for a ski trip. 
1 - We noticed before leaving that the tire pressure was dropping in one tire, then realized we didn't know which tire because they didn't sync the tire pressure on the car.  No problem, my wife brought it up there and they said they checked the tires, no leak, synced the pressure sensors then they locked her keys in the car.
2- just before leaving again noticed air pressure dropping on the same tire, they checked again and couldn't find a leak
3- dealt with the tire that continued to lose air while driving the mountains of Colorado, upon arriving home, Dobbs stated they would put a top tech on it...okay let's do this again.  Remember, brand new top of the line tires.  After checking the third time yesterday they said they again couldn't find anything 
I just went to the garage with a spray bottle containing soapy water, found a leak in the bead in 5 minutes.  How is that possible!?!?!
- maybe they'll put their top tech on it tomorrow when I bring it back up there
I almost forgot, on the last visit we asked for an oil change (got the top of the line synthetic), they didn't tighten the filter leaving a leak and drips in our garage, I went ahead and tightened it myself, not worth them touching it again.  I wish I could fix the tire myself.

As a follow up, they were apologetic and gave me two free oil changes which was a nice gesture.  Hopefully it is finally fixed.

My wife and I were on our way to Weeki Wachi one weekend with our two daughters. We saw this place and thought it would be cool to stop and pick some berries to have for our boat ride that day. We pull in begin to get the kids out if the car and barely made it 10 steps when this older woman B-lines straight towards us telling we could not have children here and they were not allowed to pick berries. We have been to several u-pick farms and not once had an issue. These are supposed to be family outings to begin with! Doesn't surprise me to see she only has a two star rating.
